Description: APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS IN WYOMING FOR OPERATING PROJECT ADMINISTRATION PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE INTERCITY BUS STATE ADMINISTRATION OF THE PROGRAM AND RTAP FUNDING FOR TRAINING AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THIS GRANT WILL FUND THE FOLLOWING CATEGORIES OF ACTIVITIES:$3697306 - OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR RURAL PROVIDERS$1797352 - PROJECT ADMINISTRATION ASSISTANCE FOR RURAL PROVIDERS$1298347 - PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ASSISTANCE FOR RURAL PROVIDERS$1358601 - INTERCITY BUS - 15% OF THE 5311 APPORTIONMENT$905733 - STATE ADMINISTRATION - 10% OF THE 5311 APPORTIONMENT$120347 - RTAP APPORTIONMENT$9177686 - TOTAL FTA FUNDS; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS AWARD WILL ASSIST IN FUNDING PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION COSTS FOR EXISTING PROVIDERS DURING THE FFY2023 AND FFY2024 AS THEY ARE STILL RECOVERING FROM THE COVID PANDEMIC AND GETTING THEIR TRANSIT PROGRAMS BACK ON TRACK.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: AGENCY STAFF AND TRANSIT PROVIDERS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THIS GRANT WILL FUND PUBLIC TRANSIT COSTS FOR THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS: UNIVERSITY OF WYOMING EPPSON CENTER FOR SENIORS CAMPBELL COUNTY SENIOR CENTER CONVERSE COUNTY SENIORS LANDER SENIOR CITIZENS WIND RIVER TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY GOSHEN COUNTY SENIOR FRIENDSHIP CENTER BUFFALO SENIOR CITIZENS CODY COUNCIL ON AGING SHERIDAN SENIOR CITIZENS COUNCIL (GOOSE CREEK TRANSIT) SWEETWATER COUNTY TRANSIT AUTHORITY SOUTHERN TETON AREA RAPID TRANSIT POWELL SENIOR CITIZENS RIVERTON SENIOR CITIZENS CENTER SERVICES FOR SENIORS SOUTH BIG HORN SENIOR CITIZENS WASHAKIE COUNTY SENIOR CITIZENS CENTER BLACK HILLS STAGE LINES ALLTRANS INC. JEFFERSON LINES WESTERN TRAILS CHARTERS GREYHOUND LINES AND MULTIPLE STATEWIDE TRANSIT AGENCIES USING RTAP FUNDS FOR TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE OPPORTUNITIES.

PURPOSE:WYOMING DOT IS APPLYING FOR FFY2021 5311 STATEWIDE FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $7390719 (FULL APPORTIONMENT) AND FFY2021 RTAP FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $106899 (FULL APPORTIONMENT). TOTAL FEDERAL FUNDING APPLIED FOR: $7497618. THE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS IN WYOMING FOR OPERATING PROJECT ADMINISTRATION PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE INTERCITY BUS AND RTAP FUNDING FOR TRAINING TECHNICAL SUPPORT AND SUPPORT SERVICES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THIS GRANT WILL FUND THE FOLLOWING CATEGORIES OF ACTIVITIES:$3188013 - OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR RURAL PROVIDERS$1731010 - PROJECT ADMINISTRATION ASSISTANCE FOR RURAL PROVIDERS$1363089 - PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ASSISTANCE FOR RURAL PROVIDERS$1108607 - INTERCITY BUS - 15% OF THE 5311 APPORTIONMENT$106899 - RTAP APPORTIONMENT$7497618 - TOTAL FTA FUNDS EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS AWARD WILL ASSIST IN FUNDING PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION COSTS FOR EXISTING PROVIDERS IN WYOMING DURING THE FFY2022 AND FFY2023 AS THEY ARE RECOVERING FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC AND GETTING THEIR TRANSIT PROGRAMS BACK ON TRACK.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: AGENCY STAFF AND TRANSIT PASSENGERS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THIS GRANT WILL FUND PUBLIC TRANSIT COSTS FOR THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS: UNIVERSITY OF WYOMING EPPSON CENTER FOR SENIORS CAMPBELL COUNTY SENIOR CENTER CONVERSE COUNTY SENIORS LANDER SENIOR CITIZENS WIND RIVER TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY GOSHEN COUNTY SENIOR FRIENDSHIP CENTER BUFFALO SENIOR CITIZENS CODY COUNCIL ON AGING SHERIDAN SENIOR CITIZENS COUNCIL SWEETWATER COUNTY TRANSIT AUTHORITY SOUTHERN TETON AREA RAPID TRANSIT BLACK HILLS STAGE LINES ALLTRANS INC. JEFFERSON LINES WESTERN TRAILS AND CHARTERS GREYHOUND LINES AND MULTIPLE STATEWIDE TRANSIT AGENCIES USING RTAP FUNDS FOR TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE OPPORTUNITIES.OTHER INFORMATION:ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION IS ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION INCLUDING; PROGRAM OF PROJECTS AND APPROVED STIP DOCUMENTS. LOCAL MATCH FUND SOURCES FOR EACH SUBRECIPIENT ARE DOCUMENTED IN THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS.PRE-AWARD STATEMENT: WYOMING DOT IS REQUESTING PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY IN THE AMOUNT OF $7390719 TO ALLOW FOR NO LAPSING COVERAGE FOR TRANSIT PROVIDERS. ELIGIBILITY FOR ALL ALIS TO BEGIN 10/1/2021.NOTE: WYDOT ELECTS TO USE THE HIGHER MATCHING RATIO OF 56.56% FEDERAL FOR OPERATIONS AS ALLOWABLE UNDER THE APPROVED SLIDING SCALE AGREEMENT WITH FHWA IN ACCORDANCE WITH CIRCULAR 9040.1G . (AGREEMENT IS ATTACHED.)

PURPOSE:WYDOT IS APPLYING FOR $1673717 IN FFY 2021 ARPA SEC 5311 FUNDS AT A 100% FEDERAL MATCHING RATIO. THIS AMOUNT REPRESENTS THE FULL FFY2021 ARPA APPORTIONMENT. THE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO ASSIST TRANSIT AGENCIES THROUGHOUT WYOMING IN COVERING OPERATING-RELATED COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH RECOVERY FROM COVID-19 IMPACTS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THIS GRANT WILL FUND THE FOLLOWING CATEGORIES:$ 506345 - 5311 OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR ONE PROVIDER (REPRESENTS FULL APPORTIONMENT OF SEC 5311 FUNDS)$ 79311 - RTAP FUNDING FOR TRAINING (REPRESENTS FULL APPORTIONMENT OF RTAP FUNDS)$1088061 - 5311F INTERCITY BUS ASSISTANCE FOR FIVE PROVIDERS SERVICING SIX ROUTES (REPRESENTS FULL APPORTIONMENT OF ICB FUNDS)$1673717 APPLICATION TOTALALL FUNDING WILL BE AWARDED AT THE 100% MATCHING RATIO WITH NO LOCAL MATCH REQUIRED AS ALLOWED BY THE ARPA FUNDING.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THIS AWARD WILL ASSIST IN FUNDING OPERATING COSTS FOR TRANSIT-AGENCIES DURING TO ASSIST IN THE COVID-19 RECOVERY. IT WILL ALSO FUND TRAINING COSTS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE TRANSIT PATRONS AND EMPLOYEES OF THE FOLLOWING AGENCIES: UNIVERSITY OF WYOMING JEFFERSON LINES BLACK HILLS STAGE LINES WESTERN TRAILS AND CHARTERS ALLTRANS AND GREYHOUND. ALL WYOMING TRANSIT PROVIDERS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE RTAP TRAINING FUNDING THROUGH WYDOT.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THIS GRANT WILL FUND PAYROLL AND OPERATING COSTS FOR THE UNIVERSITY OF WYOMING JEFFERSON LINES BLACK HILLS STAGE LINES WESTERN TRAILS AND CHARTERS ALLTRANS AND GREYHOUND. RTAP TRAINING FUNDS WILL BENEFIT TRANSIT AGENCIES STATEWIDE.OTHER:WYDOT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY. THE RECIPIENT CERTIFIES THAT IT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS AND CONTRACTORS THAT ARE PROVIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION HAVE NOT FURLOUGHED ANY EMPLOYEES SINCE MARCH 27 2020.PRE-AWARD STATEMENT: WYDOT IS REQUESTING PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY IN THE FULL AMOUNT OF $1673717 TO ALLOW FOR NO LAPSING COVERAGE FOR PROVIDERS STARTING OCTOBER 1 2021 WHICH IS ALLOWABLE UNDER ARP.REQUIRED PROGRAM OF PROJECTS (POP) DOCUMENTATION IS ATTACHED. FOR SPECIFIC DETAILS OF EACH SELECTED SUBRECIPIENT REFER TO THE ATTACHED POP.PER THE ARP THE ACTIVITIES IN THIS APPLICATION ARE NOT REQUIRED TO BE PROGRAMMED IN THE LONG-RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLAN OR THE TIP/STIP.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS OBLIGATED FUNDING WILL BE TO PROVIDE SECTION 5311 TRANSIT PROVIDERS AN OPPORTUNITY TO RESOLVE ANY ORGANIZATIONAL HARDSHIP CAUSED BY THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE USAGE OF THIS FUNDING AT THE 100% REIMBURSABLE RATE WILL BE KEY TO SUPPORTING ANY STRUGGLING TRANSIT PROVIDERS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR EXPENSES WHICH INCLUDE WAGES AND BENEFITS INSURANCE MAINTENANCE PARTS AND SUPPLIES PPE CLEANING SERVICES AND SUPPLIES FUEL AND LUBRICANTS AND TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE THROUGH RTAP. THE APPLICATION SCOPE OF WORK INCLUDES OPERATING EXPENDITURES FOR THE PERIOD OF 4/14/2022 - 6/30/2022. THE ARPA HAS APPORTIONED $651929 IN SECTION 5311 FUNDING $106631 IN SECTION 5311(B)(3) RTAP FUNDING AND $1242142 IN SECTION 5311(F) INTERCITY BUS FUNDING TOTALING $2000702. THE PROJECTS INCLUDE $651929 IN OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR TEN (10) RURAL OPERATORS; $106631 IN RURAL TRANSIT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (RTAP) FUNDING FOR TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND $1242142 FOR THE FOLLOWING INTERCITY BUS RECIPIENTS: BARONS BUS GREYHOUND LINES INC. AND MOUNTAIN LINE TRANSIT AUTHORITY.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THE UTILIZATION OF THIS FUNDING WILL BE THE CONTINUATION OF SAFE RELIABLE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION BY TRANSIT PROVIDERS THAT HAVE STRUGGLED UNDER THE CIRCUMSTANCES OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: WVDOT TRANSIT AGENCIES AND CITIZENS IN THE RURAL AND NON-URBANIZED AREAS OF THE STATE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE FOLLOWING THIRTEEN (13) SUBRECIPIENTS ARE PROVIDERS OF RURAL TRANSIT SERVICE: BLUEFIELD AREA TRANSIT (MCDOWELL MERCER COUNTIES) BUCKWHEAT EXPRESS (PRESTON COUNTY) CENTRAL WEST VIRGINIA TRANSIT AUTHORITY (HARRISON COUNTY) RANDOLPH COUNTY COMMITTEE ON AGING INC. DBA COUNTRY ROADS TRANSIT (RANDOLPH UPSHUR COUNTIES) FAIRMONT-MARION TRANSIT AUTHORITY (MARION COUNTY) BARBOUR COUNTY SENIOR CITIZENS INC. DBA HERE AND THERE TRANSIT (BARBOUR COUNTY) LITTLE KANAWHA TRANSIT AUTHORITY (CALHOUN GILMER JACKSON AND ROANE COUNTIES) MOUNTAIN TRANSIT AUTHORITY (FAYETTE GREENBRIER NICHOLAS POCAHONTAS AND WEBSTER COUNTIES) POTOMAC VALLEY TRANSIT AUTHORITY (GRANT HAMPSHIRE HARDY MINERAL AND PENDLETON COUNTIES) AND TRIRIVER TRANSIT (BOONE LINCOLN LOGAN MASON AND WAYNE COUNTIES); AND INTERCITY OPERATORS GREYHOUND LINES INC. FUNDING FOR ELIGIBLE CAPITAL PROJECTS THROUGH SECTION 5311 FUNDS AND ALLOCATED APPALACHIAN PROGRAM FUNDS TO ASSIST WV AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER OPERATING ASSISTANCE TRAINING PURCHASE OF BUSES VANS AND SUPPORT VEHICLES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: CONTINUED SAFE AND EFFECTIVE OPERATION OF TRANSIT SERVICES FOR RURAL AREAS OF WEST VIRGINIA. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: WVDOT TRANSIT AGENCIES AND CITIZENS IN THE RURAL AND NON-URBANIZED AREAS OF THE STATE. LINE TRANSIT AUTHORITY MORGANTOWN WV; AND BARONS BUS CLEVELAND OH.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: WISCONSIN DOT (WISDOT) IS APPLYING FOR ARPA SECTION 5311 FUNDS TOTALING $4315612 TO SUPPORT PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICES THROUGHOUT WISCONSIN. THIS TOTAL INCLUDES: 1) WISCONSINS ARPA SECTION 5311 APPORTIONMENT ($1663050) 2) WISCONSINS ARPA SECTION 5311(F) (INTERCITY BUS) APPORTIONMENT ($2503019) AND 3) WISCONSINS ARPA SECTION 5311(B)(3) (RTAP) APPORTIONMENT ($149543). ADDITIONALLY WISDOT IS APPLYING FOR A PORTION OF WISCONSINS ARPA SECTION 5307 GOVERNORS APPORTIONMENT ($187287) ALLOCATED FOR JOB ACCESS REVERSE COMMUTE (JARC) PROJECTS SERVING URBANIZED AREAS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE APPLIED TOWARDS SUBRECIPIENT CY 2023 OPERATING ($1413592) INTERCITY BUS OPERATING ($2752477) AND JARC ($187287) PROJECTS AND TOWARDS SUBSEQUENT YEARS RTAP PROJECTS ($149543).; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (WISDOT) AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE VITAL MOBILITY SERVICES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE RURAL COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND VISITORS THROUGHOUT WISCONSIN WHO DEPEND ON A SAFE EFFICIENT AND INTERCONNECTED MULTI-MODAL TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM TO ACCESS EMPLOYMENT EDUCATION/TRAINING HEALTHCARE COMMERCIAL AND RECREATION SITES.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: FORTY-SEVEN SUBRECIPIENT PUBLIC TRANSIT AGENCIES WILL RECEIVE FUNDING TO SUPPORT THEIR ROUTINE SERVICE OPERATIONS. FOUR PRIVATE INTERCITY BUS SERVICE PROVIDERS WILL RECEIVE FUNDING TO OPERATE SEVEN (OF EIGHT ACTIVE) INTERCITY BUS ROUTES SPANNING THE STATE. TWO NON-PROFIT AGENCIES WILL RECEIVE FUNDING FOR MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND TRANSPORT SERVICES THAT IMPROVE JOB ACCESS FOR LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS. SEE THE ATTACHED POP FOR FURTHER DETAILS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: DEVELOP A TRANSIT STRATEGIC PLAN TO DETERMINE THE ROUTING NEEDS DIRECTION VALUES GOALS AND OBJECTIVES TO GUIDE BAD RIVERS PUBLIC TRANSITS PROGRAMMING AND PREPARE FOR FORESEEABLE CHALLENGES AND OPPORTUNITIES.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: DEVELOP A TRANSIT STRATEGIC PLAN.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PLAN WILL BE REFERRED TO FOR SERVICE DELIVERY DECISIONS POTENTIAL EXPANSION OF SERVICES AND ACTIONS TO MITIGATE CONTRIBUTION TO GREENHOUSE GASES CONTRIBUTING TO CLIMATE CHANGE.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: BAD RIVER TRANSIT AND ITS RIDERS WILL BENEFIT FROM EFFICIENT PROGRAMMING OF TRANSIT SERVICES.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS APPLICATION ALLOCATES FUNDING FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR THE FOREST COUNTY POTAWATOMI COMMUNITY TRANSIT SERVICE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: OPERATING ASSISTANCE BETWEEN JUNE 1 2023 AND MAY 31 2024.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: SUSTAINED OPERATIONS OF THE FOREST COUNTY POTAWATOMI COMMUNITY TRANSIT SERVICES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: TRANSIT RIDERS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS SERVED BY THE FOREST COUNTY POTAWATOMI COMMUNITY TRANSIT SERVICES.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR MENOMINEE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSIT SERVICES TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES ON THE MENOMINEE INDIAN RESERVATION/MENOMINEE COUNTY AND THROUGHOUT WISCONSIN. THE GRANT WILL ALSO PROVIDE FUNDS FOR THE PURCHASE OF ONE PASSENGER VAN TO REPLACE A LIKE VEHICLE THAT HAS REACHED ITS USEFUL LIFE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR INDIVIDUALS ON THE MENOMINEE INDIAN RESERVATION/MENOMINEE COUNTY AND THROUGHOUT WISCONSIN. ALL TRIPS MUST ORIGINATE OR TERMINATE ON THE MENOMINEE INDIAN RESERVATION/MENOMINEE COUNTY. ALSO WILL PURCHASE ONE VEHICLE TO REPLACE ONE FLEET VEHICLE THAT HAS REACHED USEFUL LIFE.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: TO ALLOW TRANSPORTATION ACCESS WITHIN AND TO/FROM MENOMINEE INDIAN RESERVATION/MENOMINEE COUNTY FOR RIDERS TO SATISFY MEDICAL EDUCATION EMPLOYMENT FOOD AND RECREATION NEEDS. THE REPLACEMENT VEHICLE WILL ENSURE SERVICES ARE PROVIDED IN A SAFE AND EFFICIENT MANNER BY REDUCING TIME IT IS OUT OF SERVICE FOR MAINTENANCE AND REPAIRS THAT ARE COMMON IN THOSE WITH HIGHER MILEAGE.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: RESIDENTS OF MENOMINEE INDIAN RESERVATION/MENOMINEE COUNTY AND THOSE INDIVIDUALS WHO VISIT THE RESERVATION/COUNTY FOR MEDICAL EDUCATION EMPLOYMENT OR PERSONAL NEEDS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

FOUR PRIVATE INTERCITY BUS SERVICE PROVIDERS WILL RECEIVE FUNDING TO OPERATE EIGHT INTERCITY BUS ROUTES SPANNING THE STATE AND NINE NON-PROFIT AGENCIES WILL RECEIVE FUNDING TO SUPPORT ELIGIBLE JOB ACCESS/REVERSE COMMUTE OPERATIONS AND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT SERVICES. APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE ONEIDA NATION WILL CONSTRUCT A NEW TRANSIT GARAGE THAT CONSISTS OF OFFICE SPACE VEHICLE STORAGE WASH BAY AND MEZZANINES TO ACCOMMODATE THE TRANSIT DEPARTMENT.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: CONSTRUCTION OF A TRANSIT GARAGE.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: IMPROVE EFFICIENCY REDUCE MAINTENANCE COSTS SAFETY AND SECURITY FOR OUR VEHICLES AND IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE. THIS GARAGE WILL ALSO HELP PREVENT FAILURE OF SOME MECHANICAL ELEMENTS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE EMPLOYEES OF ONEIDA PUBLIC TRANSIT THE ONEIDA COMMUNITY AND SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES WILL BENEFIT FROM A WELL-MAINTAINED VEHICLE STORAGE FACILITY.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE FUNDS WILL HELP THE FOREST COUNTY POTAWATOMI COMMUNITY (FCPC) WITH A CAPITAL EXPANSION PROJECT TO PURCHASE ELECTRIC VEHICLES TO SERVE OUR DEMAND RESPONSE TRANSIT SYSTEM AND ADD A FIXED ROUTE FOR THE YOUTH OF THE COMMUNITY CENTER ALL WHILE REDUCING THE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT OF TRANSIT SERVICES.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: WITH THE FUNDS THE FCPC WILL ACQUIRE A NEW 10 PASSENGER ELECTRIC TRANSIT VAN AND CHARGER AND A 6 PASSENGER PLUG IN HYBRID TRANSIT VAN AND CHARGER TO SERVICE THE ADDITIONAL TRANSPORTS THAT WOULD BE CREATED.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: ONCE THE NEW VANS ARE PURCHASED AND PUT INTO SERVICE WE WILL BE WELL-POSITIONED TOWARD REACHING THE GOAL OF ADDING ROUGHLY 1036 NEW DEMAND RESPONSE TRANSPORTS PER YEAR AS WELL AS 1440 TRANSPORTS FOR THE COMMUNITY CENTER YOUTH. ALL WHILE PROTECTING MOTHER EARTH WHICH IS A STANDING PRIORITY FOR THE POTAWATOMI.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PRIMARY BENEFIT OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT THE EXPANSION OF THE FCPC TRANSIT SERVICES. IN DOING SO THE TRANSIT SERVICE WILL INCORPORATE A NEW FIXED ROUTE FOR THE COMMUNITY CENTER YOUTH FROM THE WABENO AND LAONA SCHOOLS AS WELL AS INCORPORATING NEW RIDES FOR THE DEMAND RESPONSE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT FOR UTILIZING FY2022 SECTION 5311C TRIBAL TRANSIT FORMULA FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $75897 TO MAINTAIN OPERATIONS OF RED CLIFF TRANSIT WHICH IS AN ON DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE OPERATING THREE (3) MINI ADA COMPLIANT BUSES WITHIN THE SERVICE AREA OF THE RED CLIFF BAND OF LAKE SUPERIOR CHIPPEWA INDIANS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: RED CLIFF TRANSIT CURRENTLY OPERATES SIX DAYS PER WEEK AND THIRTEEN HOURS PER DAY WEEKDAYS AND 8 HOURS SATURDAYS WITH RIDERSHIP AROUND 1500 RIDERS PER MONTH. FUNDING WILL BE USED TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE ON DEMAND SERVICES FOR THE RED CLIFF AND SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES WITHIN THE TOWNS OF RUSSEL AND BAYFIELD WITHIN BAYFIELD COUNTY WISCONSIN. OPERATING ASSISTANCE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE IS BETWEEN 10/1/22 AND 8/1/23.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THE PROJECT ARE TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION FOR HEALTH EDUCATION EMPLOYMENT AND SHOPPING WHILE EMPLOYING TWO (2) FULL AND TWO (2) PART TIME DRIVERS AND ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THESE SERVICES ARE MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC BOTH LOCAL AND TRANSIENT WHO EITHER HAVE NO OTHER MEANS OF TRANSPORTATION OR WHO FIND PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION AN AFFORDABLE MEANS OF CONDUCTING THEIR DAILY ACTIVITIES.NO SUBRECIPIENTS.ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION IS THE FY22 TRIBAL TRANSIT APPORTIONMENT TABLE AND INDIRECT COST RATE AGREEMENT

THIS PROJECT WILL BE FUNDED WITH $270000 IN FY21 5311C TRIBAL TRANSIT DISCRETIONARY FUNDS AND $30000 IN FY22 5311 TRIBAL FORMULA FUNDS TO BE USED FOR THE PURCHASE OF THREE REPLACEMENT VEHICLES. THE VEHICLES BEING REPLACED HAVE REACHED THEIR USEFUL LIFE. TO COMPLETE THE VEHICLE PURCHASES FORMULA FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER REMAINING BALANCE DUE TO A COST INCREASE. THESE FUNDS ARE 100% FEDERAL SHARE AND DO NOT REQUIRE LOCAL MATCH. NO STIP REQUIRED.IN EXECUTING THIS GRANT THE MENOMINEE INDIAN TRIBE AGREES TO ABIDE BY SECTION 3011 OF THE FAST ACT (49 U.S.C. 5323(J)(2)(C) REGARDING THE PHASED INCREASE IN DOMESTIC CONTENT UNDER THE BUY AMERICA STATUTE FOR ROLLING STOCK. AS GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDES AN FTA-FUNDED TRANSIT VEHICLE PURCHASE RECIPIENT AGREES TO COMPLY WITH THE RELATED REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN 49 CFR 26.49(A). SPECIFICALLY RECIPIENT MUST ENSURE AS A CONDITION OF BEING AUTHORIZED TO BID OR PROPOSE ON FTA-ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS THAT EACH TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER CERTIFIED THAT IT COMPLIED WITH DOT REQUIREMENTS FOR SUBMITTING A DBE PROGRAM AND GOAL TO FTA PRIOR TO BIDDING. RECIPIENT IS ALSO REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE NAME OF THE SUCCESSFUL BIDDER AND THE TOTAL DOLLAR VALUE OF THE CONTRACT WITHIN 30 DAYS OF MAKING AN FTA- ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE AWARD USING THE REQUIRED FTA REPORTING TOOL. RECIPIENT UNDERSTANDS THAT FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS MAY RESULT IN FORMAL ENFORCEMENT ACTION OR APPROPRIATE SANCTION AS DETERMINED BY FTA INCLUDING REIMBURSEMENT OF FTA FUNDS USED FOR THE VEHICLE PROCUREMENT.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO ALLOW MENOMINEE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSIT SERVICES TO PURCHASE THREE VEHICLES TO REPLACE FLEET VEHICLES THAT HAVE REACHED USEFUL LIFE. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: PURCHASE OF THREE VEHICLES TO REPLACE THREE VEHICLES THAT HAVE REACHED USEFUL LIFE. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THESE REPLACEMENT VEHICLES WILL ENSURE SERVICES ARE PROVIDED IN A SAFE AND EFFICIENT MANNER BY REDUCING TIME VEHICLES ARE OUT OF SERVICE FOR MAINTENANCE AND REPAIRS THAT ARE COMMON IN THOSE WITH HIGHER MILEAGE. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: RESIDENTS OF MENOMINEE INDIAN RESERVATION/MENOMINEE COUNTY AND THOSE INDIVIDUALS WHO VISIT THE RESERVATION/COUNTY FOR MEDICAL EDUCATION EMPLOYMENT OR PERSONAL NEEDS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONEATTACHED DOCUMENTS: FY21 5311C TRIBAL TRANSIT DISCRETIONARY APPORTIONMENT TABLE FY22 5311C TRIBAL TRANSIT FORMULA APPORTIONMENT TABLE

THE LAC DU FLAMBEAU TRIBE IS LOOKING TO UTILIZE $148515 OF FY 2021 CRRSAA ACT FUNDS TO DESIGN AND CONSTRUCT AN ADDITIONAL TRIBAL TRANSIT SERVICES BUILDING. THESE FUNDS WILL INCLUDE INTERIOR MECHANICAL AND FINISHING WORK. THE PURPOSE AND NEED FOR THIS PROJECT IS TO INCREASE THE AMOUNT OF AVAILABLE SPACE ADDRESSING THE CURRENT LACK OF OPERATIONAL SPACE FOR EXISTING TRANSIT OPERATIONS. THE NEW BUILDING WOULD EXPAND THIS SPACE TEN-FOLD AND ALLOW FOR EXTRA TRAINING AND STORAGE SPACE FOR STAFF DISPATCH AND ADMINISTRATION. THIS EXPANSION WILL ALSO IMPROVE THE CAPACITY FOR SOCIAL-DISTANCING PROTECTING THE HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF STAFF AND CUSTOMERS. THE AVAILABLE GRANT FUNDS WILL BE COMBINED WITH A SEPARATE 5311(C) FORMULA GRANT (GRANT WI-2021-053) AND A SEPARATE CARES ACT GRANT (GRANT WI-2021-054) IN ORDER TO COMPLETE THE EXPANSION PROJECT. NO LOCAL MATCH IS REQUIRED FOR TRIBAL TRANSIT FORMULA FUNDS AND THIS GRANT WILL NOT INCLUDE ANY LOCAL MATCH. THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES. NO STIP REQUIRED. ENVIRONMENTAL DOCUMENTATION AND CRRSAA APPORTIONMENT TABLE ARE ATTACHED.THE RECIPIENT CERTIFIES THAT IT AND ANY SUBRECIPIENT OR CONTRACTOR THAT IS A PROVIDER OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION: (A) ARE CURRENTLY NOT FURLOUGHING ANY EMPLOYEES; (B) HAVE TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT POSSIBLE BROUGHT BACK ANY EMPLOYEES PREVIOUSLY FURLOUGHED AS A DIRECT RESULT OF FINANCIAL CHALLENGES CAUSED BY THE COVID-19 PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY; AND (C) HAVE REHIRED OR POSTED TO REHIRE ANY POSITIONS OF EMPLOYEES WHO WERE LAID OFF AS A RESULT OF FINANCIAL CHALLENGES CAUSED BY THE COVID-19 PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY.THE RECIPIENT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.

BUDGET REVISION NO. 2 TO TRANSFER $34.022 REMAINING FROM OTHER LINE ITEMS TOWARDS ARCHITECTURAL DESIGN COST FOR NEW TRANSIT OPERATIONS FACILITY. THERE IS NO CHANGE IN SCOPE AND NO FUNDING AMOUNTS ARE MODIFIED. DESIGN PROJECT WILL BE COMPLETED BY JUNE 30 2022.BUDGET REVISION#1: DUE TO COVID-19 PROJECT DELAYS AND SERVICE DISRUPTIONS PROJECTS HAVE BEEN EXTENDED BY 1 YEAR. EXPENSES WILL CONTINUE THROUGH CALENDAR YEAR 2021 FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND COMPLETION OF INTERIOR WORK FOR THE TRANSIT FACILITY. NO CHANGE IN SCOPE. NO FUNDING AMOUNTS HAVE BEEN MODIFIED. THE LAC DU FLAMBEAU PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICES PARKING AND OPERATIONS INITIATIVE IS FUNDED THROUGH SECTION 5311 FISCAL YEAR (FY) 2017 AND FISCAL YEAR (FY) 2018 TRIBAL TRANSIT PROJECTS (TTP) FORMULA FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $305397.00. (FY17 5311 TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM FORMULA FUNDS: $144001** + FY18 5311 TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM FORMULA FUNDS: $161396). **INDICATES LAPSING FUNDS. NO LOCAL MATCH IS REQUIRED FOR TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM FORMULA FUNDS. THIS PROJECT WILL EXPAND THE LAC DU FLAMBEAU TRIBES CAPACITY FOR PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICES ON AND NEAR THE RESERVATION. $200000 IN PROJECT FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COMPLETE INTERIOR WORK REMAINING FROM THE RECENT TRANSIT FACILITY EXPANSION PROJECT THROUGH THE ADDITION OF HEATING SYSTEMS ELECTRICITY PLUMBING VENTILATION AND THE COMPLETION OF THE FACILITIES INTERIOR WALLS. THIS WILL ENSURE THAT THE TRIBE HAS THE EXTRA ROOM TO PROVIDE TRANSIT VEHICLE PARKING SHELTER FROM THE HARSH ELEMENTS OF WISCONSIN WEATHER AND THE REQUIRED MAINTENANCE SERVICES NECESSARY TO KEEP THE FLEET VEHICLES IN SERVICE. THE REMAINING PROJECT FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT TRANSIT OPERATIONS THROUGH THE TRIBES CONTRACTUAL AGREEMENT WITH THE MENOMINEE PUBLIC TRANSIT AUTHORITY TO PROVIDE CONTINUED TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS WILL ALLOW THE TRIBE TO EXPAND THE PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICES CAPACITY BY ADDING TRANSIT ROUTES TO THE RHINELANDER AREA AND BY PROVIDING ADDITIONAL TRIPPER SERVICES PREVIOUSLY UNAVAILABLE THROUGHOUT THE LAC DU FLAMBEAU/LAKELAND SERVICE AREAS.ATTACHED TO THE APPLICATION INCLUDE THE FY17 AND FY18 APPORTIONMENT TABLES AS WELL AS ENVIRONMENTAL APPROVAL DOCUMENTATION FROM THE FACILITY EXPANSION PROJECT FUNDED THROUGH WI-2016-036. ALL WORK FUNDED THROUGH THIS AWARD IS INTERIOR OF THIS EXISTING FACILITY.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO: - ASSIST IN THE MAINTENANCE DEVELOPMENT IMPROVEMENT AND USE OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS IN RURAL AREAS. - ENCOURAGE AND FACILITATE THE MOST EFFICIENT USE OF ALL TRANSPORTATION FUNDS USED IN RURAL AREAS THROUGH THE COORDINATION OF PROGRAMS AND SERVICES. - CARRY OUT A PROGRAM TO DEVELOP AND SUPPORT INTERCITY BUS TRANSPORTATION IN ORDER TO MEET THE INTERCITY TRAVEL NEEDS OF RESIDENTS IN RURAL AREAS. - IMPLEMENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TRAINING AND RELATED SUPPORT SERVICES TAILORED TO MEET THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF TRANSIT OPERATORS IN RURAL AREAS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE SUSTAIN/MAINTAIN CURRENT OPERATING SERVICE LEVELS IN THE DIFFERENT RURAL AREAS ACROSS THE STATE OF WASHINGTON. SUSTAIN FIXED-ROUTE AND ON-DEMAND ADA-ACCESSIBLE PUBLIC TRANSIT COMMUTER SERVICES TO SPECIAL NEEDS RESIDENTS; PROVIDE THE CORE DEMAND RESPONSE (DIAL-A-RIDE) TRANSIT SERVICES FOR THE ELDERLY PERSONS WITH SPECIAL NEEDS LOW-INCOME AND GENERAL PUBLIC; AND CONTINUE TO OFFER A MEAN OF TRANSPORTATION TO PEOPLE TO CONTINUE TO ACCESS JOBS MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS SCHOOLS AND OTHERDESTINATIONS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE MAINTAINING AN ADEQUATE LEVEL OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE IN RURAL AREAS AND ENABLING PEOPLE TO ACCESS DESTINATIONS ESSENTIAL FOR THEIR DAILY LIVES SAFETY AND WELLBEING.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION CUSTOMERS WHO UTILIZE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES ACROSS THE STATE OF WASHINGTON INCLUDING THE ELDERLY PERSONS WITH SPECIAL NEEDS LOW-INCOME AND GENERAL PUBLIC.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE OPERATE MANAGE AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. ENSURE ADEQUATE FUNDING AND FINANCIAL PLANNING TO SUPPORT THE ANNUAL OPERATING NEEDS OF RURAL PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. PROVIDE FIXED ROUTE AND DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE FOR THE GENERAL PUBLIC AND VULNERABLE POPULATIONS IN RURAL AREAS. A PROGRAM OF PROJECTS IS ATTACHED IN THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS. RECIPIENT: WSDOT SUBRECIPIENTS:HOPESOURCETWIN TRANSITCITY OF ELLENSBURG -CENTRAL TRANSITCOLUMBIA COUNTY TRANSPORTATIONCITY OF PULLMAN THUSTON REGIONAL PLANNING COUNCIL

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS FEDERAL AWARD WILL BE USED FOR SUPPORTING INTERCITY BUS TRANSPORTATION IN ORDER TO MEET THE INTERCITY TRAVEL NEEDS OF RESIDENTS IN RURAL AREAS FILLING GAPS IN THE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION NETWORK AND MAKING TRAVEL MORE ACCESSIBLE RELIABLE AND CONVENIENT. THE FEDERAL SHARE IS 100%.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: INTERCITY BUS PROVIDERS ARE ELIGIBLE TO BE REIMBURSED FOR NET OPERATING COSTS UNDER SECTION 5311(F) INCLUDING COVID-19 SUPPLEMENTAL FUNDING ADMINISTERED UNDER SECTION 5311(F) MADE AVAILABLE UNDER THE AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN ACT OF 2021. ELIGIBLE ACTIVITIES WILL SUPPORT INTERCITY BUS SERVICE IN RURAL AREAS CONNECTING RURAL COMMUNITIES TO MAJOR TRANSPORTATION HUBS AND URBAN CENTERS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS FUNDING WILL SUPPORT NONURBANIZED AREAS WITH REGULARLY SCHEDULED FIXED-ROUTE SERVICE THAT MEETS THE INTERCITY TRAVEL NEEDS OF RESIDENTS IN RURAL AREAS AND MAKES MEANINGFUL CONNECTIONS TO THE LARGER REGIONAL AND NATIONAL INTERCITY BUS NETWORKS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION CUSTOMERS WHO UTILIZE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES IN RURAL AREAS ACROSS THE STATE OF WASHINGTON INCLUDING THE ELDERLY PERSONS WITH SPECIAL NEEDS LOW-INCOME AND GENERAL PUBLIC.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: SUBRECIPIENTS ACTIVITIES UNDER SECTION 5311(F) WILL SUPPORT INTERCITY BUS SERVICE IN RURAL AREAS ENSURE ADEQUATE FUNDING AND FINANCIAL PLANNING TO SUPPORT THE NEEDS OF RURAL PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND ENABLE GENERAL PUBLIC AND PEOPLE WITH SPECIAL NEEDS IN RURAL AREAS TO ACCESS DESTINATIONS ESSENTIAL FOR THEIR DAILY LIVES SAFETY AND WELLBEING.INTERCITY BUS SERVICES INCLUDING THE FOLLOWING AREAS: GOLDLINE - KETTLE FALLS RITZVILLE AND SPOKANE; DUNGENESS LINE - PORT ANGELES SEATTLE AND SEATAC AIRPORT; GRAPELINE - WALLA WALLA TO RICHLAND; APPLE LINE - OMAK WENATCHEE AND ELLENSBURG.

THIS GRANT INCLUDES $430660 IN CRRSAA FY 2021 SECTION 5311 TTP FORMULA FUNDS WHICH IS THE FULL AMOUNT ALLOCATED TO THE SPOKANE TRIBE OF THE SPOKANE RESERVATION. THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED AT 100% FEDERAL SHARE FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE THE PURCHASE OF APPROXIMATELY TWO (2) REPLACEMENT BUSES AND INDIRECT COSTS TO PREVENT RESPOND TO AND RECOVER FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. OPERATING ASSISTANCE COSTS INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO: DRIVER AND OTHER OPERATION WORKERS SALARIES AND BENEFITS; FUEL; ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR; SAFETY EQUIPMENT FOR VEHICLES; DISINFECTANTS EQUIPMENT SUPPLIES AND SERVICES; PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT FOR STAFF DRIVERS AND RIDERS AND ADMINISTRATIVE LEAVE.PURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE 3 YEARS OF OPERATING ASSISTANCE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE AND PROJECT ADMINISTRATION (INDIRECT COSTS) FOR THE TIME-PERIOD OF 10/1/2021 TO 9/30/2024 AND TO PURCHASE APPROXIMATELY TWO (2) REPLACEMENT BUSES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:OPERATING ASSISTANCE PROJECT ADMINISTRATION THROUGH THE USE OF A FEDERALLY APPROVED INDIRECT COST RATE AND THE PURCHASE OF APPROXIMATELY TWO (2) REPLACEMENT BUSES TO MAINTAIN SAFE AND RELIABLE OPERATIONS OF THE MOCCASIN EXPRESS TRANSIT SERVICE. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:MAINTAIN SAFE AND RELIABLE TRANSIT SERVICE WHICH INCLUDES ACCESS TO MEDICAL SERVICES SOCIAL SERVICES EDUCATION EMPLOYMENT RECREATION AND CULTURAL ACTIVITIES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:TRIBAL MEMBERS AND OTHER MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY (GENERAL PUBLIC) IN AND AROUND THE SPOKANE RESERVATION INCLUDING STEVENS LINCOLN AND SPOKANE COUNTIES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:N/ATHE RECIPIENT CERTIFIES THAT IT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS AND CONTRACTORS THAT ARE PROVIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION HAVE NOT FURLOUGHED ANY EMPLOYEES SINCE MARCH 27 2020 (THE ENACTMENT DATE OF THE CARES ACT).** SPECIAL CONDITION **THE RECIPIENT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.

START INITIAL APPLICATION (00)THIS FEDERAL AWARD APPLICATION INCLUDES $14529416 IN FY 2021 AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN ACT (ARPA) SECTION 5311 RURAL FORMULA FUNDING AND $121609 IN 5311(B)(3) RTAP FUNDING TO MAINTAIN OPERATING SERVICES IN RURAL AREAS ACROSS THE STATE IN ADDITION TO INTERCITY BUS RTAP AND PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION. SPECIAL LANGUAGE FOR FURLOUGH CERTIFICATIONTHE RECIPIENT CERTIFIES THAT IT AND ANY SUBRECIPIENT OR CONTRACTOR THAT IS A PROVIDER OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION: (A) INTEND TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT POSSIBLE TO USE OF ARPA FUNDS TO BRING BACK ANY EMPLOYEES PREVIOUSLY FURLOUGHED AS A DIRECT RESULT OF FINANCIAL DIFFICULTIES CAUSED BY THE COVID-19 PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY; (B) INTEND TO USE ARPA FUNDS TO REHIRE ANY POSITIONS OF EMPLOYEES WHO WERE LAID OFF AS A DIRECT RESULT OF FINANCIAL CHALLENGES CAUSED BY THE COVID-19 PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY; AND (C) WILL EXPLAIN HOW THEY HAVE SPENT ARPA FUNDS ON PAYROLL OPERATIONS OR PAYROLL AND EXPENSES OF PRIVATE PROVIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT POSSIBLE. SPECIAL CONDITION FOR EMERGENCY RELATED FUNDINGTHE RECIPIENT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.PURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THE GRANT IS TO ASSIST WITH ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES NECESSARY TO OPERATE MANAGE AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES WHILE RESPONDING TO COVID-19. ASSOCIATED COSTS INCLUDE DRIVER SALARIES FUEL MINOR CAPITAL ITEMS DIRECTLY RELATED TO COVID-19 AND ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR INCLUDING PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT AND CLEANING SUPPLIES. THIS FUNDING IS ALLOCATED TO THE WASHINGTON STATE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION TO SUPPORT THE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES DURING THE COVID-19 PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY.DEVELOPING AND SUPPORTING ELIGIBLE OPERATING ACTIVITIES TO HELP PREVENT RESPOND TO AND RECOVER FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. FACILITATING THE MOST EFFICIENT USE OF ALL TRANSPORTATION FUNDS USED IN RURAL AREAS THROUGH THE COORDINATION OF PROGRAMS AND SERVICES.SUPPORTING INTERCITY BUS TRANSPORTATION IN ORDER TO MEET THE INTERCITY TRAVEL NEEDS OF RESIDENTS IN RURAL AREAS.IMPLEMENTING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TRAINING AND RELATED SUPPORT SERVICES TAILORED TO MEET THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF TRANSIT OPERATORS IN RURAL AREAS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO ASSIST WITH ELIGIBLE OPERATING ACTIVITIES NECESSARY TO OPERATE MANAGE AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO HELP PREVENT RESPOND TO AND RECOVER FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC AND TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND RELATED SUPPORT TO VARIOUS TRANSPORTATION ORGANIZATIONS IN WASHINGTON STATE. OPERATING EXPENSES USUALLY INCLUDE SUCH COSTS AS DRIVER SALARIES FUEL MINOR CAPITAL ITEMS DIRECTLY RELATED TO COVID 19 AND ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR INCLUDING PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT AND CLEANING SUPPLIES. AGENCIES AS PART OF THEIR RESPONSE TO COVID 19 MAY SEEK REIMBURSEMENT FOR HIRING OF TEMPORARY WORKERS OVERTIME CLEANING/SANITIZING OF VEHICLES AND FACILITIES ADDITIONAL MATERIAL AND TELEWORK EQUIPMENT HAZARD PAY TRAINING INCREASED SECURITY AND OTHER EXPENSES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THIS FUNDING WILL HELP THE RECIPIENT AND VARIOUS SUBRECIPIENTS TO RESPOND TO AND RECOVER FROM THE EFFECTS OF COVID-19 PANDEMIC AS WELL AS MAINTAIN AN ADEQUATE LEVEL OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE IN RURAL AREAS ACROSS THE WASHINGTON STATE AND ENABLE GENERAL PUBLIC AND PEOPLE WITH SPECIAL NEEDS TO ACCESS DESTINATIONS ESSENTIAL FOR THEIR DAILY LIVES SAFETY AND WELLBEING.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION CUSTOMERS WHO UTILIZE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES IN RURAL AREAS ACROSS THE STATE OF WASHINGTON INCLUDING THE ELDERLY PERSONS WITH SPECIAL NEEDS LOW-INCOME AND GENERAL PUBLIC.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITY:OPERATE MANAGE AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. ENSURE ADEQUATE FUNDING AND FINANCIAL PLANNING TO SUPPORT THE ANNUAL OPERATING NEEDS OF RURAL PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND VARIOUS ITEMS DIRECTLY RELATED TO COVID-19 INCLUDING PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT AND CLEANING SUPPLIES. OFFER HOURLY TRANSIT SERVICES PROVIDING ACCESS TO MEDICAL RETAIL AND SOCIAL SERVICES. THIS FEDERAL AWARD APPLICATION INCLUDES $14761434 IN FY 2021 SECTION 5311 RURAL FORMULA FUNDING AND $230735 IN FY 2020 SECTION 5311(B)(3) RURAL TRANSPORTATION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (RTAP) FUNDING FOR OPERATING INTERCITY BUS RTAP AND STATE ADMINISTRATION ACTIVITIES. PURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO:- ASSIST IN THE MAINTENANCE DEVELOPMENT IMPROVEMENT AND USE OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS IN RURAL AREAS. - ENCOURAGE AND FACILITATE THE MOST EFFICIENT USE OF ALL TRANSPORTATION FUNDS USED IN RURAL AREAS THROUGH THE COORDINATION OF PROGRAMS AND SERVICES.- CARRY OUT A PROGRAM TO DEVELOP AND SUPPORT INTERCITY BUS TRANSPORTATION IN ORDER TO MEET THE INTERCITY TRAVEL NEEDS OF RESIDENTS IN RURAL AREAS.- IMPLEMENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TRAINING AND RELATED SUPPORT SERVICES TAILORED TO MEET THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF TRANSIT OPERATORS IN RURAL AREAS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:SUSTAIN/MAINTAIN CURRENT OPERATING SERVICE LEVELS IN THE DIFFERENT RURAL AREAS ACROSS THE STATE OF WASHINGTON. EXPECTED OUTCOMESMAINTAIN AN ADEQUATE LEVEL OF PUBLIC FERRYBOAT TRANSPORTATION SERVICE IN THE CONFEDERATED TRIBES OF THE COLVILLE RESERVATION AREA. ENSURE ADEQUATE FUNDING AND FINANCIAL PLANNING TO PAY FOR OPERATOR SALARIES FUEL MINOR CAPITAL ITEMS DIRECTLY RELATED TO COVID-19 RESPONSE AND ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR INCLUDING PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT AND CLEANING SUPPLIES. PURPOSE OF AWARD: THE VERMONT AGENCY OF TRANSPORTATION IS REQUESTING THE FOLLOWING SFY22 PROJECT USING FHWA CMAQ FUNDS FLEXED TO 5311 FOR ALL OF VERMONT- TOTAL $3984683 WITH $3287742 FEDERAL/ $314890 STATE/ $382051 LOCAL. ATTACHED DOCUMENTATION FOR THE TRANSFER IS INCLUDED. MATCH FOR THESE FUNDS WILL COME FROM A COMBINATION OF THE T-FUND (STATE OF VERMONT) LOCAL MUNICIPALITIES AND INSTITUTIONS AND ELIGIBLE CONTRACTS. THE FUNDS BEING USED FOR THE SFY22 FLEX ARE AS FOLLOWS AND DETAILED IN THE POP. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: * CMAQ OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR SEVERAL ROUTES WHICH ARE ELIGIBLE UNDER 23 U.S.C. 149(M)(2). NO TIME LIMITATION.* MISCELLANEOUS CAPITAL EXPENSES INCLUDING SOFTWARE FOR MVRTD AND RCT COMPUTERS FOR RCTSHOP EQUIPMENT FOR TVT AND RCT FACILITIES * LIGHTING UPGRADES FOR MVRTDS MAINTENANCE BUILDING SURVEILLANCE CAMERA AND RADIOS FOR 1 RCT BUS AND BUS TRACKERS FOR GMCN1 BUS SHELTER FOR TVTS SERVICE TO BE LOCATED AT THE MIDDLEBURY COLLEGE PR LOT.* STATE PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION FUNDS USED TO SUPPORT SALARIES AND ASSOCIATED ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES FOR STAFF WORKING ON FTA PROGRAMS. THE $500000 OF FUNDING IN THIS GRANT REPRESENTS THE FULL ALLOWABLE AMOUNT BASED ON THE $5000000 OF THE CMAQ FUNDS FLEXED FOR 5311 IN JANUARY 2022.*BUS PURCHASES FOR VTRANS SUBRECIPIENTS THROUGHOUT THE STATE. ALL VEHICLES WILL BE ADA ACCESSIBLE PROCURED FROM A CERTIFIED TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER (TVM) AND THE AGENCY WILL FOLLOW THE DISPOSITION REQUIREMENTS FOR VEHICLES BEING REPLACED PER CIRCULAR 5010.1E.* RTAP TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE* CAPITAL FUNDING FOR THE TVT BRADFORD FACILITY SUPPLEMENTING COMPANION GRANT VT-2020-009. THESE ADDITIONAL $42800 OF FEDERAL FUNDS WILL ENABLE COMPLETION OF THE PROJECT AFTER INCREASED COSTS DUE TO THE UNAVAILABILITY OF BUY AMERICA-COMPLIANCE HEAT PUMPS.* PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE FOR VEHICLES FOR VTRANS SUBRECIPIENTS* PROJECT ADMINISTRATION FOR VTRANS SUBRECIPIENTSSEE ATTACHED PROGRAM OF PROJECTS FOR DETAILED BREAKDOWN OF ALL SCOPES/ALIS EXPECTED OUTCOMES: VERMONT HAS A SPECIAL FOCUSED PROGRAM FOR EXTENSIVE SERVICE FOR THE ELDERLY AND THOSE WITH DISABILITIES (SEE ATTACHED POP FOR PROVIDERS AND AMOUNTS). THIS SPECIAL PROGRAM PROVIDES INCREASED ACCESS FOR THOSE 60 YEARS OR OLDER AND WITH DISABILITIES. CMAQ OPERATING PROVIDES THE NECESSARY FUNDING SUPPORT TO ASSIST THE TRANSIT PROVIDERS WITH ELIGIBLE OPERATING COSTS. PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ASSISTS 8 SUB-RECIPIENTS WITH ASSOCIATED CAPITAL MAINTENANCE INCLUDING EQUIPMENT TIRES TUBES AND MATERIAL PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE OF ROLLING STOCK AND THEIR ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT. THE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE INCLUDES ALL STANDARD ACTIVITIES SUPPLIES MATERIALS LABOR SERVICES AND ASSOCIATED COSTS REQUIRED TO PRESERVE OR EXTEND THE FUNCTIONALITY AND SERVICEABILITY OF THE ASSET IN A COST EFFECTIVE MANNER UP TO AND INCLUDING THE CURRENT STATE OF THE ART FOR MAINTAINING ASSETS TO A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR. VTRANS HAS RESPONSIBILITY FOR APPROXIMATELY 335 VEHICLES AND WE REQUIRE THAT THEY BE KEPT TO MANUFACTURERS RECOMMENDED PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE SCHEDULES. ADDITIONAL 11 VEHICLES WILL BE PURCHASED AS REPLACEMENTS AND EXPANSION VEHICLES MORE DETAILS ARE PROVIDED IN THEIR RESPECTIVE BUDGET DESCRIPTIONS. THE CAPITAL REQUESTS ALLOW THE TRANSIT PROVIDERS TO MAINTAIN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR WITH THEIR VEHICLES EQUIPMENT FACILITIES AND MAINTAIN SAFE AND RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS GRANT REFLECTS EVERY TYPE OF SERVICE DELIVERED ACROSS THE STATE IN EVERY REGION EACH AND EVERY RESIDENT AND VISITOR TO VERMONT HAS THE CHANCE TO ACCESS GENERAL MOBILITY WHETHER ITS FOR RECREATION WORK MEDICAL SERVICE OR PERSONAL BUSINESS. THESE SERVICES ARE PROVIDED BY A RANGE OF METHODS FROM THE HIGHEST LEVEL COMMUTER BUS TO GENERAL FIXED ROUTE TO DEMAND RESPONSE BUSES AND VOLUNTEERS IN THEIR OWN VEHICLES TRANSPORTING THEIR NEIGHBORS FRIENDS AND STRANGERS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: VTRANS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED GREEN MOUNTAIN TRANSIT RURAL COMMUNITY TRANSPORTATION SOUTHEAST VERMONT TRANSIT TRI VALLEY TRANSIT GREEN MOUNTAIN COMMUNITY NETWORK MARBLE VALLEY REGIONAL TRANSIT DISTRICT AND NATIONAL RURAL TRANSIT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM. THIS APPLICATION WILL COVER THE SERVICE TYPES LISTED ABOVE. FOR FULL DESCRIPTIONS OF SUB-RECIPIENTS AND CONTACT INFORMATION SEE ATTACHED DESCRIPTION OF SERVICES WITH SOURCE OF LOCAL MATCH.

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST SECTION 5311 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE STATE OF VERMONT IN THE AMOUNT OF $2721846 (FEDERAL) $772098 (STATE) $1038803 (LOCAL). $1961330 FEDERAL WILL COME FROM FFY20 UNOBLIGATED 5311 FORMULA FUNDS AND $53177 FROM FFY20 UNOBLIGATED 5311 FORMULA RTAP FUNDS. $676516 FEDERAL WILL COME FROM FFY21 5311 FORMULA APPORTIONMENTS AND $25000 FEDERAL FROM 5311 FORMULA APPORTIONMENT TRANSFERRED FROM NHDOT. THE TRANSFER LETTER IS ATTACHED TO THIS GRANT REQUEST. THE $25000 NHDOT 5311 FORMULA TRANSFER WILL BE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO SEVT FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE SPECIFIC TO THE HINSDALE ROUTE. $5823 FEDERAL WILL COME FROM FFY21 5311 RTAP APPORTIONMENT. THIS 5311 FORMULA GRANT REQUEST INCLUDES $666607 FEDERAL FOR INTERCITY TO SATISFY THE 15% REQUIREMENT FOR THE FFY20 APPORTIONMENT OF $4444047 THAT WAS NOT INCLUDED IN THE SFY20 POP AND IS BEING CAPTURED HERE. THIS GRANT INCLUDES AN ADDITIONAL $105227 FEDERAL FOR INTERCITY TO SATISFY THE 15% REQUIREMENT FOR THE FFY21 APPORTIONMENT OBLIGATED TO DATE.PURPOSE OF THE AWARD: THE VERMONT AGENCY OF TRANSPORTATION IS PROPOSING TO FUND OPERATING ASSISTANCE ELIGIBLE CAPITAL PROJECTS PROJECT ADMINISTRATION EXPENSES AND FOR THE RURAL TRANSIT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (RTAP). ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: -OPERATING ASSISTANCE: $803626 FEDERAL/$401813/STATE/$401813 LOCAL OF THE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE THAT WILL DIRECTLY COVER DRIVER SALARIES FUEL ETC. THESE OPERATING FUNDS ARE FOR GREEN MOUNTAIN TRANSIT - RURAL DIVISION MARBLE VALLEY REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION DISTRICT RURAL COMMUNITY TRANSPORTATION SOUTHEASTERN VERMONT TRANSPORTATION AND TRI VALLEY TRANSIT. -INTERCITY OPERATING: VERMONT TRANSLINES (PREMIER INTERCITY FUNDS) WILL USE $611516 FEDERAL FOR OPERATING EXPENSES. GREYHOUND WILL USE $160318 FEDERAL FOR OPERATING EXPENSES. TOTAL $771834 FEDERAL/$163152 STATE/$608682 LOCAL. -GO VERMONT WILL USE $35000 FEDERAL/$35000 STATE FOR VAN POOL INCENTIVES REQUIREMENT. -CAPITAL AND EQUIPMENT: $497759 FEDERAL/ $96133 STATE/ $28308 LOCAL WILL BE USED FOR ELIGIBLE CAPITAL EQUIPMENT FOR GREEN MOUNTAIN COMMUNITY NETWORK AND ADVANCE TRANSIT. PROJECTS INCLUDE A GARAGE FLOOR REFINISH OFFICE RENOVATION OVERHEAD DOOR REPAIR LIGHTING UPGRADE SIDEWALK REPAIR SOLAR BALLAST REPLACEMENT CATCH BASIN/FLOOR GRATE REPLACEMENT HVAC CONTROLS SOFTWARE PROCUREMENT ONE (1) EXPANSION LAPTOP FOR NEW ADMIN PERSON AND ONE (1) REPLACEMENT MONITOR OFFICE FURNITURE HVAC BOILER REPAIR AND MOTOR KIT EXTERNAL BED SALT SPREADER SNOWPLOW DIGITAL RADIOS. -PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION: $250627 FEDERAL NO STATE/LOCAL WILL BE USED FOR VTRANS ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES INCLUDING OVERSIGHT AND SUPPORT FOR THE VERMONT SUBRECIPIENTS AND MANAGING THE FTA FUNDS.-CONTRACT SERVICES: $304000 FEDERAL AND $76000 STATE WILL COVER COSTS FOR VTRANS THIRD PARTY CONTRACT WITH DISA DRUG INTERVENTION SERVICES OF AMERICA (DISA) THAT COVERS ADMINISTERING DRUG AND ALCOHOL TESTING SALARIES AND ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS. -RTAP: $59000 FEDERAL $0 STATE/ $0 LOCAL IS REQUESTED FOR THE RURAL TRANSIT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM THAT IS ASSOCIATED WITH CARRYING OUT FTA FUNDED PROGRAMS AND TRAINING COSTS SUCH AS ROUTE MATCH USER CONFERENCE CTAA ONLINE CTPA CERTIFICATION AND RECURRING HIPPA TRAINING. RTAP FUNDING WILL BE PROVIDED TO AT GMCN GMT RURAL MRVTD SEVT VPTA AND TVT THAT WILL FOSTER THE DEVELOPMENT OF STATE AND LOCAL CAPACITY FOR ADDRESSING THE TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE NEEDS OF THE RURAL TRANSPORTATION COMMUNITY. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THESE FUNDS WILL ALLOW CONTINUED SUPPORT FOR ALL EXISTING TRANSIT PROJECTS IN THE RURAL AREAS IN THE STATE. ALL EXCEPT THE URBAN SECTIONS OF CHITTENDEN COUNTY (SMALL URBAN) ARE CONSIDERED RURAL. THE STATE OF VERMONT IS VERY RURAL AND THIS SET OF FEDERAL FUNDING WILL ALLOW TRANSIT TO OPERATE UNINTERRUPTED SERVICE AND CONTINUE SERVE LARGE POPULATIONS OF VERMONT IN NON URBAN AREAS. ADDITIONALLY THE CAPITAL EQUIPMENT WILL ONLY STRENGTHEN THE ABILITY OF THESE RURAL PROVIDERS TO OPERATE AT FULLY CAPACITY RATHER THAN DEALING WITH MAINTENANCE ISSUES AT THEIR FACILITIES AND FAILING EQUIPMENT WHICH HINDERS OPERATIONS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THESE SERVICES ARE COMPRISED OF FIXED ROUTE DEMAND RESPONSE BY BUS AND VOLUNTEERS AND ADA PARATRANSIT. RURAL TRANSIT PROVIDERS DELIVER OVER HALF OF THE RIDES (IN A TOTAL OF 5000000) IN VERMONT AN ADMIRABLE ACCOMPLISHMENT GIVEN THE LOW-DENSITY NATURE OF THE STATES RURAL AREAS. THE PUBLIC IN THESE RURAL AREAS WILL BE CONNECTED TO MAJOR EMPLOYMENT SECTORS IN THE STATE SUCH AS BURLINGTON AND MONTPELIER WHICH ALSO HAVE MAJOR HOSPITALS AND EDUCATION CENTERS. VERMONT PAYS PARTICULAR ATTENTION TO BASIC MOBILITY FOR ALL OFTEN FOCUSING ON THE ELDERLY LOW INCOME DISABLED AND THOSE SEEKING TO IMPROVE THEIR HOUSING AND FINANCIAL SUSTAINABILITY. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THIS APPLICATION FOR SECTION 5311 FUNDS IS FOR THE VERMONT AGENCY OF TRANSPORTATION THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT. VTRANS IS CHARGED WITH MANAGING ALL MODES OF TRANSPORTATION IN VERMONT AND IS AUTHORIZED TO DO SO UNDER LEGISLATION TITLE 24 5094. (SEE ATTACHED). VTRANS HAS OVERSIGHT RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF MOTOR VEHICLES AVIATION SECTION RAIL PROGRAM AND ALL ASPECTS OF HIGHWAY AND BRIDGES. THE SERVICE AREA IS - ALL OF VERMONT WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE URBAN AREAS OF CHITTENDEN COUNTIES. THESE FUNDS ARE AWARDED ON A COMPETITIVE BASIS FOR TRANSIT PROJECTS THAT DEVELOP AND SUPPORT INTERCITY BUS TRANSPORTATION IN RURAL AREAS OF THE STATE. VTRANS RECEIVED FFY21 SECTION 5311 CRRSAA APPORTIONMENT OF $26725119. THIS APPLICATION IS REQUESTING TO USE $12135910 AT 100% FEDERAL FOR ELIGIBLE EXPENSES FOR SFY22. THE REMAINING APPORTIONMENT BALANCE OF $14589209 WILL BE APPLIED TO SFY23 ELIGIBLE PROGRAM EXPENSES IN A FUTURE GRANT APPLICATION.PURPOSE:THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES CRRSAA FUNDING TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS. THIS APPLICATION FOR SECTION 5311 CRRSAA FUNDS IS FOR THE VERMONT AGENCY OF TRANSPORTATION THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT. WE RECEIVED $13407895 MILLION OF FFY2020 SECTION 5311 CARES ACT FUNDS ALLOCATED DIRECTLY TO VERMONT FOR EXPENSES RELATED TO COVID-19 THAT WERE APPLIED BY VTRANS AND OUR SUB-RECIPIENTS TO SFY20 AND SFY21 PROGRAM COSTS. VTRANS ALSO RECEIVED $7112714 IN ARPA FUNDS THAT VTRANS IS APPLYING TO PROGRAM COSTS FOR SFY22. THE ARPA FUNDING WILL BE INSUFFICIENT TO COVER ALL SFY22 ELIGIBLE PROGRAM COSTS AND WE ARE REQUESTING TO APPLY OUR CRRSAA APPORTIONMENT TO COVER THE REMAINING PROGRAM COSTS FOR SFY22. ADDITIONALLY COVID-19 PANDEMIC CONTINUES TO NEGATIVELY AFFECT TRANSIT OPERATIONS. VERMONT SUBRECIPIENTS HAVE INCREASED DRIVER WAGES AND HIRING INCENTIVES IN AN EFFORT TO ATTRACT NEW COMMERCIAL DRIVERS INTO THE WORKFORCE. VERMONT AS IS THE CASE NATIONALLY IS EXPERIENCING CDL DRIVER SHORTAGES AS A RESULT OF THE TIGHT LABOR MARKET. VERMONT AND THE SUBRECIPIENTS CONTINUE TO MAINTAIN STRINGENT COVID-19 SAFETY MEASURES INCLUDING SAFETY BARRIERS BETWEEN SEATS AND DRIVER COMPARTMENT DEEP SANITIZATION OF CAPITAL VEHICLES AND PURCHASING PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:OPERATING EXPENSES FOR THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS: - TRI VALLEY TRANSIT (TVT) 100% FEDERAL OPERATING EXPENSES; ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES; PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE; SPECIAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION EXPENSES- ADVANCE TRANSIT (AT)- 100% FEDERAL OPERATING EXPENSES- SOUTHEAST VERMONT TRANSIT (SEVT) 100% FEDERAL OPERATING EXPENSES; ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES; PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE; SPECIAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION EXPENSES- GREEN MOUNTAIN COMMUNITY NETWORK (GMCN) 100% FEDERAL OPERATING EXPENSES; ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES; PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE; SPECIAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION EXPENSES- GREEN MOUNTAIN TRANSIT RURAL (GMT) 100% FEDERAL PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE; AND SPECIAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION EXPENSES- MARBLE VALLEY REGIONAL TRANSIT DISTRICT (MVRTD)- 100% FEDERAL PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE; SPECIAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION- REGIONAL COMMUNITY TRANSIT (RCT) 100% FEDERAL OPERATING EXPENSES; ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES; PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE; SPECIAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION EXPENSES- VERMONT PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION ASSOCIATION (VPTA) - 100% FEDERAL ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES. IN ACCORDANCE WITH FTAS CIRCULARS 9040.1G AND 9030.1E PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE AND ADMINISTRATIVE ACTIVITIES ARE CONSIDERED OPERATING COSTS. PER CRRSAA THIS GRANT REQUESTS 100% FEDERAL SHARE AND THE ACTIVITIES IN THIS APPLICATION ARE NOT REQUIRED TO BE PROGRAMMED IN THE LONG-RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLAN OR STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE CRRSAA FUNDING ALLOWS VTRANS TO FUND PROGRAM COSTS AT 100% FEDERAL REDUCING THE LOCAL MATCH BURDEN TO THE FEDERAL SUBRECIPIENTS. IT ALSO ALLOWS FOR CONTINUED SUPPORT FOR EXPENSES RELATED TO COVID-19. THE CRRSAA FUNDING WILL PROVIDE OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND SUPPORT TO PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IN RURAL AND URBANIZED AREAS WITH POPULATIONS OF LESS THAN 50000 WHERE MANY RESIDENTS OFTEN RELY ON PUBLIC TRANSIT TO REACH THEIR DESTINATIONS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE FEDERAL SUBRECIPIENTS AND THE RIDING PUBLIC. THE CRRSAA FUNDING HELPS VERMONT TO MAINTAIN SAFE RELIABLE FRIENDLY AND ACCESSIBLE PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICES FOR ALL VERMONTERS. VERMONT PROVIDERS CONTINUE TO MAINTAIN SAFETY PROTOCOLS ON THEIR BUSES TRANSIT CENTERS ADMINISTRATIVE FACILITIES BUS STOPS AND SHELTERS IN AN EFFORT TO MAINTAIN AND IMPROVE THE RIDING PUBLICS CONFIDENCE IN PUBLIC TRANSIT IN THE WAKE OF SOME DIFFICULT TIMES AS A RESULT OF THE RECENT PANDEMIC. VTRANS AND THE VERMONT TRANSIT PROVIDERS CONTINUE TO AGGRESSIVELY ADVERTISE THE BENEFITS AND SAFETY OF PUBLIC TRANSIT. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:VTRANS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS TO EXECUTE THE ACTIVITIES IN THIS GRANT - ADVANCE TRANSIT (AT) GREEN MOUNTAIN TRANSIT (GMT) MARBLE VALLEY REGIONAL TRANSIT DISTRICT (MVRTD) VERMONT PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION ASSOCIATION (VPTA) REGIONAL COMMUNITY TRANSIT (RCT) TRI VALLEY TRANSIT (TVT) GREEN MOUNTAIN COMMUNITY NETWORK (GMCN) AND SOUTHEAST VERMONT TRANSIT (SEVT). SERVICE TYPES INCLUDED FIXED ROUTE DEVIATED FIXED ROUTE COMMUTER DEMAND RESPONSE. VTRANS IS CHARGED WITH MANAGING ALL MODES OF TRANSPORTATION IN VERMONT AND IS AUTHORIZED TO DO SO UNDER LEGISLATION TITLE 25 5094. VTRANS HAS OVERSIGHT RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF MOTOR VEHICLES AVIATION SECTION RAIL PROGRAM AND ALL ASPECTS OF HIGHWAY AND BRIDGES. VTRANS AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.

THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO ASSIST IN MEETING THE TRANSPORTATION NEEDS OF RURAL TRANSIT RIDERS BY SUPPORTING CAPITAL NEEDS AND TRAINING. THE REMAINDER WILL BE APPLIED TO FUTURE AWARDS AND SUBALLOCATIONS. THE REMAINDER OF 5311 FUNDS FROM FFY2020 IS OBLIGATED IN AWARDS UT-2022-007 AND UT-2022-008. WITH THIS APPLICATION ALL 5311 FUNDS FOR FFY 2020 WILL NOW BE OBLIGATED. -----------------------------ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE GRANT SCOPE OF WORK INCLUDES PURCHASE OF ONE REPLACEMENT BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUS FIVE EXPANSION BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUSES THE PURCHASE OF TWO DEPOT CHARGERS AND ONE TRANSFORMER AND EMPLOYEE TRAINING FOR MECHANICS. THE OVERALL PERFORMANCE PERIOD FOR THIS AWARD IS THROUGH JUNE 1 2024.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE GRANT WILL ENABLE THE APPROPRIATE USE OF NEW BATTERY ELECTRIC BUS TECHNOLOGY AND BENEFIT THE GENERAL POPULATION OF THE PARK CITY TRANSIT (PCT) SERVICE AREA BY INCREASING ACCESS TO OPPORTUNITIES (E.G. IN 2021 PARK CITY TRANSFERRED FOUR VEHICLES TO HVT TITLES WERE OFFICIALLY TRANSFERRED IN 2022. ADDITIONALLY PARK CITY TRANSFERRED OWNERSHIP OF THE KIMBALL JUNCTION TRANSIT CENTER TO HVT WHICH WAS APPRAISED IN MARCH 2022. (SEE THE ATTACHED POP FOR DETAILS ON THESE TRANSFERS.)

APPLICATION PURPOSE: 5339 BBF DISCRETIONARY FUNDING WILL ENABLE THE TEXAS RURAL TRANSIT PROVIDERS TO KEEP THEIR EQUIPMENT FACILITIES AND FLEET IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FOR USE IN RURAL PORTIONS OF TEXAS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FLEET REPLACEMENT AND REHAB AND THE PURCHASE OF SURVEILLANCE/SECURITY EQUIPMENT; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: TRANSIT PROVIDERS WILL BE ABLE TO KEEP THEIR CAPITAL ITEMS IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR BY REHABILITATING AND REPLACING OLDER EQUIPMENT FLEET AND FACILITIES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PROPOSED PROJECTS WILL BENEFIT TEXANS LIVING IN RURAL AREAS RURAL COMMUNITIES TRANSIT RIDERS AND PROVIDERS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RURAL TRANSIT DISTRICTS THAT RECEIVE THESE FUNDS WILL USE THE FUNDS TO BENEFIT THE GENERAL PUBLIC BY ENSURING THE CAPITAL ITEMS THEY INTERACT WITH ARE IN A GOOD STATE OF REPAIR AND IN CONDITION TO SERVE THEIR PURPOSE.

THIS APPLICATION IS FOR 2022 FORMULA FUNDS TO THE RURAL AREAS OF TEXAS: THE RURAL TRANSIT DISTRICTS DEFINED IN THE TEXAS TRANSPORTATION CODE TITLE 43 CHAPTER 458 AND RTAP 5311(B) FUNDS. THE LOCAL MATCH WILL BE DERIVED FROM LOCAL FUNDS AND TDCS.THE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM MANAGED BY THE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION DIVISION (PTN) OF TEXAS DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (TXDOT) WAS ALLOCATED 15000000 TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDITS (TDC) FOR DISTRIBUTION TO ELIGIBLE PROJECTS BY THE TEXAS TRANSPORTATION COMMISSION (COMMISSION) IN MINUTE ORDER 116073 FOR STATE FISCAL YEAR 2022. THE TDC LETTER DATED 7/1/22 AWARDS 800000 TDC TO VARIOUS AGENCIES AS MATCH FOR CAPITAL PROJECTS FUNDED WITH FY2022 FEDERAL SECTION 5311 RURAL AREA GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS. THE FUNDS WILL BE USED BY TRANSIT AGENCIES FOR GENERAL TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND CAPITAL PURCHASES. PURPOSE OF THE AWARD: FUNDING FOR THIS 5311 RURAL AREAS GRANT WILL ENABLE TEXAS TRANSIT DISTRICTS TO PROVIDE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES IN THE RURAL AREAS OF TEXAS. FUNDING WILL ALSO ALLOW TRANSIT PROVIDERS TO CONTINUE OPERATING ESTABLISHED TRANSIT ROUTES AND TO ADD NEW SERVICES TO AID COMMUNITIES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: OPERATING ASSISTANCE PROJECT ADMINISTRATION VEHICLE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE AND REPAIRS CAPITAL PROJECTS BENEFITING THE RURAL AREA (E.G. VEHICLE PROCUREMENT HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE SOLUTIONS) STATE ADMINISTRATION AND TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: TRANSIT PROVIDERS WILL BE ABLE TO IMPLEMENT PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO CREATE AN ENVIRONMENT OF RESILIENCE FOR PASSENGERS EMPLOYEES AND COMMUNITIES IN RURAL AREAS OF THE STATE OF TEXAS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PROPOSED PROJECTS WILL BENEFIT AND SUPPORT MOBILITY FOR RURAL AREAS COMMUNITIES TRANSIT RIDERS AND TRANSIT PROVIDERS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: PASSENGER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC USING THE MOST EFFICIENT COMBINATION OF KNOWLEDGE MATERIALS RESOURCES AND TECHNOLOGY. THIS APPLICATION IS FOR 2021 FORMULA FUNDS TO THE RURAL AREAS OF TEXAS: THE RURAL TRANSIT DISTRICTS DEFINED IN THE TEXAS TRANSPORTATION CODE TITLE 43 CHAPTER 458 AND RTAP 5311(B) FUNDS. THE REQUIRED 15% FOR INTERCITY BUS WILL BE APPLIED FOR AT A LATER DATE. THE LOCAL MATCH WILL BE DERIVED FROM LOCAL FUNDS AND TDCS.LETTER ATTACHED DATE 7-7-21 THE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM MANAGED BY THE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION DIVISION (PTN) OF TEXAS DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (TXDOT) WAS ALLOCATED 15000000 TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDITS (TDC) FOR DISTRIBUTION TO ELIGIBLE PROJECTS BY THE TEXAS TRANSPORTATION COMMISSION (COMMISSION) IN MINUTE ORDER 115814 FOR STATE FISCAL YEAR 2021.THIS LETTER AWARDS 165000 TDC TO VARIOUS AGENCIES AS MATCH FOR CAPITAL PROJECTS FUNDED WITH FY2021 FEDERAL SECTION 5311 RURAL AREA GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS.THE FUNDS WILL BE USED BY TRANSIT AGENCIES FOR GENERAL TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND CAPITAL PURCHASES. PURPOSE OF THE AWARD: FUNDING FOR THIS 5311 RURAL AREAS GRANT WILL ENABLE TEXAS TRANSIT DISTRICTS TO PROVIDE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES IN THE RURAL AREAS OF TEXAS. FUNDING WILL ALSO ALLOW TRANSIT PROVIDERS TO CONTINUE OPERATING ESTABLISHED TRANSIT ROUTES AND TO ADD NEW SERVICES TO AID COMMUNITIES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: OPERATING ASSISTANCE PROJECT ADMINISTRATION VEHICLE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE AND REPAIRS CAPITAL PROJECTS BENEFITING THE RURAL AREA (E.G. VEHICLE PROCUREMENT HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE SOLUTIONS) STATE ADMINISTRATION AND TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: TRANSIT PROVIDERS WILL BE ABLE TO IMPLEMENT PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO CREATE AN ENVIRONMENT OF RESILIENCE FOR PASSENGERS EMPLOYEES AND COMMUNITIES IN RURAL AREAS OF THE STATE OF TEXAS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PROPOSED PROJECTS WILL BENEFIT AND SUPPORT MOBILITY FOR RURAL AREAS COMMUNITIES TRANSIT RIDERS AND TRANSIT PROVIDERS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: PASSENGER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC USING THE MOST EFFICIENT COMBINATION OF KNOWLEDGE MATERIALS RESOURCES AND TECHNOLOGY. APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE OPERATIONAL SUPPORT AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO TDOT SUBRECIPIENTS RECOVERING FROM THE IMPACTS OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC AS THEY PROVIDE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IN THE RURAL AREAS OF TENNESSEE; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES FOR RURAL AND NON-URBANIZED PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION. FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO TDOT AND SUBRECIPIENTS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: CONTINUED SAFE AND EFFECTIVE OPERATION OF TRANSIT SERVICES FOR RURAL AREAS OF TENNESSEE; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: STATE TRANSIT AGENCIES AND CITIZENS IN THE RURAL AND NON-URBANIZED AREAS OF THE STATE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES FOR RURAL AND NON-URBANIZED PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE RELIEF FUNDING TO SUSTAIN INTERCITY BUS SERVICE IN THE STATE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: INTERCITY BUS PROVIDERS WILL UTILIZE THESE FUNDS TO COVER NETWORK LOSSES AS THEY MAINTAIN OPERATIONS THROUGH THE STATE OF TENNESSEE.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: INTERCITY BUS PROVIDERS WILL MAINTAIN OPERATIONS THROUGH THE STATE OF TENNESSEE; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: INTERCITY BUS PROVIDERS; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: SUBRECIPIENTS WILL UTILIZE THE FUNDS FOR INTERCITY BUS SERVICES.

AWARD EXECUTIVE SUMMARYTHIS IS A FFY2022 SECTION 5311 APPLICATION IN THE FEDERAL AMOUNT OF $26607602 INCLUDING SECTION 5311 RURAL TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM AND APPALACHIAN DEVELOPMENT PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM FUNDS. THIS GRANT IS A PARTIAL OBLIGATION OF THE FFY2022 APPORTIONMENT WHICH TOTALS A FEDERAL AMOUNT OF $28426420. OF THE $26607602 OBLIGATED IN THIS GRANT TENNESSEE INCLUDED THE FULL APPALACHIAN APPORTIONMENT AMOUNT OF $1457357 AND $110000 OF THE RTAP FUNDS. OF THE REMAINING FUNDS $1398388 OF STATE ADMINISTRATION AND $331630 OF RTAP FUNDS WILL BE OBLIGATED BY TDOT IN A SEPARATE FUTURE GRANT. $88800 IN 5311 WILL BE OBLIGATED TO THIS GRANT VIA AMENDMENT AFTER TDOT AND THE SUBRECIPIENT COMPLETE THE NEPA WORK WITH FTA. TDOT WILL NOT OBLIGATE ANY OF THE FFY2022 APPORTIONMENT TO THE 5311(F) INTERCITY BUS PROGRAM. FOLLOWING THE COMPREHENSIVE INTERCITY BUS CONSULTATION COMPLETED IN JUNE 2021 THE ATTACHED GOVERNORS CERTIFICATION LETTER NOTIFIED FTA THAT INTERCITY BUS NEEDS ARE BEING ADEQUATELY MET. FIVE ELEMENTS: PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE STATE OF TENNESSEE AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS OPERATING ASSISTANCE ELIGIBLE CAPITAL PROJECTS AND FOR THE RURAL TRANSIT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (RTAP) TO ASSIST THE STATE AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS IN PROVIDING PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IN THE RURAL AND NON-URBANIZED AREAS OF TENNESSEE. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES FOR RURAL AND NON-URBANIZED PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION. FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE CAPITAL EXPENSES SUCH AS THE PURCHASE OF PASSENGER VEHICLES SUPPORT EQUIPMENT PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE AND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS. FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED FOR TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: CONTINUED SAFE AND EFFECTIVE OPERATION OF TRANSIT SERVICES FOR RURAL AREAS OF TENNESSEE INCLUDING APPALACHIAN AREAS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: STATE TRANSIT AGENCIES AND CITIZENS IN THE RURAL AND NON-URBANIZED AREAS OF THE STATE. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: FUNDS ARE ALLOCATED TO 11 PUBLIC AGENCIES IN THE FOLLOWING CATEGORIES: PROJECT ADMINISTRATION CAPITAL OPERATING AND RTAP.THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDS TO NINE (9) RURAL PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS FOR TRANSPORTATION IN NON-URBAN AREAS AND TWO (2) RURAL TRANSIT-INTENSIVE AGENCIES. THE APPALACHIAN FUNDS ARE ALLOCATED TO AGENCIES SERVING APPALACHIAN AREAS BASED ON THE 2010 CENSUS. TDOT USED THE EXISTING PERFORMANCE-BASED FORMULA FOR THE 5311 FFY2022 ALLOCATION. FACTORS FOR THE FORMULA INCLUDE THE 2010 CENSUS NON-URBANIZED POPULATION PUBLIC RIDERSHIP AND PUBLIC REVENUE MILES. THE OPERATIONAL EXPENSES REQUESTED IN THIS APPLICATION WERE DETERMINED BY SUBRECIPIENT BUDGETING PROCESSES. TDOT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS UNDERSTAND THAT THE EXPENSES REQUESTED IN THIS APPLICATION ARE SUBJECT TO REVIEW FOR THEIR REASONABLENESS AS PART OF TDOTS STATE MANAGEMENT REVIEWTHE RECIPIENT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.TDOT WILL ENSURE THAT ALL VEHICLES PURCHASED ARE ACCESSIBLE PURCHASED FROM AN FTA APPROVED TVM AND REPORTED TO FTA WITHIN 30 DAYS AFTER CONTRACT IS SIGNED. TDOT WILL CHECK THE CURRENT LISTING OF TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURERS (TVM) TO ENSURE EACH IS LISTED AS A CERTIFIED TVM IN COMPLIANCE WITH FTA REGULATIONS. TDOT WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220. 1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE).ALL SUBRECIPIENTS WILL FOLLOW USEFUL LIFE STANDARDS AS DEFINED IN THE TDOT STATE MANAGEMENT PLAN.TDOT WILL ENSURE CONTRACTORS PROCURED WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.RECIPIENTS RECEIVING GRANT AWARDS OVER $25000 FROM FTA OR ANY OTHER FEDERAL AGENCY AFTER OCTOBER 1 2010 MUST COMPLY WITH THE FEDERAL FINANCIAL ACCOUNTABILITY AND TRANSPARENCY ACT (FFATA) SUB-AWARD REPORTING REQUIREMENTS. THE FFY2022 5311 PROGRAM OF PROJECTS (POP) IS ATTACHED. FUNDS ARE ALLOCATED TO 11 PUBLIC AGENCIES IN THE FOLLOWING CATEGORIES: PROJECT ADMINISTRATION CAPITAL OPERATING AND RTAP.

THIS GRANT WILL OBLIGATE 15% OF TENNESSEES FFY2020 CARES 5311 APPORTIONMENT FOR THE 5311(F) INTERCITY BUS PROGRAM A TOTAL OF $9678503 IN FEDERAL FUNDS. THE REMAINING $55954848 IN CARES FUNDS (INCLUDING THE $1110000 APPORTIONMENT OF APPALACHIAN FUNDS) ARE ALREADY OBLIGATED IN THE TN-2020-012 GRANT. WITH THE OBLIGATION OF THIS INTERCITY BUS GRANT TDOT WILL COMPLETE THE OBLIGATION OF ALL CARES ACT FUNDING INTO ACTIVE GRANTS. TDOT CONDUCTED A SPECIAL NEEDS ASSESSMENT AND CONSULTATION PROCESS OF TENNESSEE INTERCITY BUS PROVIDERS SPECIFICALLY TO ADDRESS THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. TDOT PREVIOUSLY HAD DETERMINED THAT INTERCITY BUS NEEDS WERE MET AND THAT NO SET ASIDE WAS NEEDED OF REGULAR 5311 FUNDING. THE GOVERNOR HAD ISSUED A CERTIFICATION LETTER TO THAT EFFECT. PER GUIDANCE FOUND IN FAQS PROVIDED BY THE FTA (CA28) A STATE THAT HAD PREVIOUSLY DETERMINED TO ALLOCATE LESS THAN 15% TO INTERCITY BUS EXPENSES MUST UNDERGO A NEW CONSULTATION PROCESS SPECIFICALLY FOR CARES ACT FUNDS IF THE PRIOR CONSULTATION PROCESS CONCLUDED PRIOR TO APRIL 2 2020 WHEN THE FTA APPORTIONED THE CARES ACT FUNDS. THAT NEW CONSULTATION FOCUSED ON THE IMPACTS OF COVID-19 AND DETERMINING THE STATES INTERCITY BUS CARRIERS NEED FOR CARES ACT FUNDS TO SURVIVE THE PANDEMIC NOT TO DETERMINE UNMET INTERCITY BUS SERVICE NEEDS THAT COULD BE ADDED WITH CARES ACT FUNDS. BASED ON THIS PROCESS 15% OF THE CARES ACT FUNDS WERE DETERMINED NECESSARY TO SUSTAIN INTERCITY BUS SERVICE IN THE STATE.BASED ON THE FINDINGS OF THE ASSESSMENT TDOT SELECTED GREYHOUND AND MILLER TRANSPORTATION AS THE SUBRECIPIENTS OF THE TENNESSEE CARES 5311(F) FUNDING. ATTACHED TO THIS GRANT ARE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS RECEIVED FROM GREYHOUND AND MILLER SHOWING FINANCIAL LOSSES FOR PERIODS ENDING AFTER JANUARY 20 2020. BOTH ICB SUBRECIPIENTS WILL RECEIVE FUNDING FROM THIS GRANT USING A NETWORK LOSS ALLOCATION BILLING STRUCTURE. AS DESCRIBED IN THE ATTACHED COMMUNICATION BY GREYHOUNDS ACCOUNTING GROUP NETWORK LOSSES: THE CARES ACT ALLOWS GREYHOUND TO APPLY FOR SUBSIDY GRANTS FROM EACH STATE TO COVER CERTAIN LOST REVENUE AND EXPENSES INCURRED ON OR AFTER 20 JANUARY 2020. GREYHOUND IS TO BILL EACH STATE IN ARREARS BASED ON CALENDAR YEAR 2019 MILES USED AS A BASE TO DISTRIBUTE LOSSES INCURRED. IN GENERAL COSTS ALLOWED ARE THOSE OPERATING EXPENSES NECESSARY TO OPERATE MAINTAIN AND MANAGE A PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM. OPERATING EXPENSES USUALLY INCLUDE SUCH COSTS AS DRIVER SALARIES FUEL AND OTHER ITEMS INCLUDING PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT AND CLEANING SUPPLIES. THE NETWORK LOSSES REPRESENT ELIGIBLE LOSSES CAPTURED WITHIN THE JD EDWARDS ACCOUNTING SYSTEM. AMOUNT BILLED TO EACH STATE IS BASED ON YTD NETWORK LOSSES LESS PRIOR PERIOD(S) CARES INCOME RECOGNIZED; DISTRIBUTED TO STATE BASED ON 2019 MILES FACTOR UNTIL THE CONTRACTED AWARDS ARE DEPLETED. CONTRACT START DATE VARIES BY STATE. MILLER TRANSPORTATION UTILIZES THE SAME BILLING STRUCTURE OUTLINED BY GREYHOUND. EACH SUBRECIPIENT USES A ROUTE MILE ALLOCATION FOR TENNESSEE THAT IS BASED ON THE COMPARISON OF MILES IN TENNESSEE TO THE TOTAL SYSTEM MILES DURING A STATED PERIOD. IN EACH CASE ONLY ACTUAL MILES AND EXPENSES WILL BE CONSIDERED FOR REIMBURSEMENT. INVOICE EXAMPLES FROM BOTH GREYHOUND AND MILLER TRANSPORTATION ARE ATTACHED TO THE GRANT AS APPLICATION DOCUMENTS. THE INVOICE DOCUMENTATION AND THE NETWORK LOSS BILLING STRUCTURE WILL BE USED BY TDOT TO APPROVE PAYMENTS TO THE SUBRECIPIENTS AND WERE DEVELOPED IN COUNSEL WITH OTHER STATES THAT HAVE ALREADY BEGUN DRAWING DOWN 5311(F) FUNDS USING THIS METHODOLOGY. TDOT WILL USE THIS METHODOLOGY AND THESE INVOICES PLUS ADDITIONAL FOLLOWING AMOUNTS FOR REIMBURSEMENTS FROM THE GRANT. THE ICB GRANTEES WILL ENTER INTO CONTRACTS WITH TDOT THAT CONTAIN THE PROVISION TO MAINTAIN DOCUMENTATION FOR ALL CHARGES UNDER THIS CONTRACT AND BE SUBJECT TO MONITORING AND EVALUATION ACCORDING TO FEDERAL AND TENNESSEE STATE LAW.TDOT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS UNDERSTAND THAT THE EXPENSES REQUESTED IN THIS APPLICATION ARE SUBJECT TO REVIEW FOR THEIR REASONABLENESS AS PART OF TDOTS STATE MANAGEMENT REVIEWTHE RECIPIENT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.RECIPIENTS RECEIVING GRANT AWARDS OVER $25000 FROM FTA OR ANY OTHER FEDERAL AGENCY AFTER OCTOBER 1 2010 MUST COMPLY WITH THE FEDERAL FINANCIAL ACCOUNTABILITY AND TRANSPARENCY ACT (FFATA) SUB-AWARD REPORTING REQUIREMENTS. THE CARES ACT 5311(F) PROGRAM OF PROJECTS (POP) IS ATTACHED. FUNDS ARE ALLOCATED TO 2 INTERCITY BUS OPERATORS IN THE OPERATING EXPENSE CATEGORY.THIS GRANT ONLY INCLUDES OPERATING EXPENSES AND/OR CAPITAL EXPENSES THAT DO NOT INCLUDE SUBSTANTIAL FUNCTIONAL LOCATION OR CAPACITY CHANGES TO THE ASSET OR SYSTEM. THEREFORE NO ADDITIONAL TIP/STIP DOCUMENTATION IS NEEDED.

PROJECT DETAILSTHIS IS A FY2015 GRANT APPLICATION FOR SECTION 5311 (NON-URBANIZED AREA FORMULA PROGRAM) FOR TDOT IN THE AMOUNT OF $11300250.00 OF THE ELIGIBLE PARTIAL ALLOCATION OF $13132342 FOR SECTION 5311 RTAP AND APPALACHIAN DEVELOPMENT PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM FUNDS. THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDS TO NINE (9) RURAL PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS FOR TRANSPORTATION IN NONURBAN AREAS AND TWO (2) SMALL TRANSIT AGENCIES (PIGEON FORGE: FUN TIME TROLLEY AND GATLINBURG: GATLINBURG MASS TRANSIT) IN AREAS SERVING THE TOURIST TRADE IN EAST TENNESSEE. THE SECTION 5311 FUNDS ARE ALLOCATED TO EACH SYSTEM ON THE BASIS OF THE 2010 CENSUS NON-URBANIZED POPULATION THE NUMBER OF COUNTIES SERVED AND THE NUMBER OF VEHICLES OPERATED BY EACH SYSTEM.FUNDS ARE ALLOCATED IN THE FOLLOWING CATEGORIES: STATE ADMINISTRATION PROJECT ADMINISTRATION CAPITAL AND OPERATION.TDOT WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220. 1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE).TDOT WILL ENSURE CONTRACTORS PROCURED WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.TDOT IS CURRENTLY IN THE PROCESS OF DETERMINING INTERCITY BUS NEEDS. FIFTEEN (15) PERCENT OF THE SECTION 5311 APPORTIONMENT HAS BEEN REMOVED FROM THE GRANT APPLICATION PENDING THE OUTCOME OF THE INTERCITY BUS NEEDS ASSESSMENT.THE SECTION 5311 (B) (2) RURAL TRANSPORTATION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (RTAP) HAS BEEN ALLOCATED BY GIVING THE NINE (9) RURAL TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS $2000.00 FOR TRANSPORTATION TRAINING. THE ADDITIONAL $161406.00 WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO A TRAINING PARTNER TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND TRAINING TO THE RURAL TRANSIT PROVIDERS IN THE STATE. THE APPALACHIAN FUNDS ARE ALLOCATED TO APPALACHIAN AREAS BASED ON THE 2010 CENSUS APPALACHIAN NON-URBANIZED POPULATION THE NUMBER OF APPALACHIAN COUNTIES SERVED AND THE NUMBER OF VEHICLES OPERATED BY EACH SYSTEM IN AN APPALACHIAN AREA.RECIPIENTS RECEIVING GRANT AWARDS OVER $25000 FROM FTA OR ANY OTHER FEDERAL AGENCY AFTER OCTOBER 1 2010 MUST COMPLY WITH THE FEDERAL FINANCIAL ACCOUNTABILITY AND TRANSPARENCY ACT (FFATA) SUB-AWARD REPORTING REQUIREMENTS. APPLICATION PURPOSE: EXISTING TRANSIT SERVICE IS VITAL TO THE QUALITY OF LIVING DESIRED BY THOSE WHO CANNOT AFFORD THEIR OWN TRANSPORTATION. MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION RIDES TO WORK AND EDUCATIONAL TRANSPORTATION IS THE LIFELINE TO THE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND VITALITY OF THE COMMUNITY. REPLACING THESE VEHICLES IS CRUCIAL TO MAINTAINING AN AFFORDABLE TRANSIT SERVICE ON THE CHEYENNE RIVER SIOUX RESERVATION.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: PURCHASE OF FOUR REPLACEMENT VEHICLES AND REPLACEMENT OF GARAGE DOORS. THE ORIGINAL DISCRETIONARY AWARD ALSO INCLUDED THE REPLACEMENT OF TWO FURNACES HOWEVER THE GARAGE DOOR COSTS WERE MORE THAN ORIGINALLY ESTIMATED. CHEYENNE RIVER SIOUX TRIBE REQUESTED TO INSTEAD PURCHASE THE GARAGE DOORS WITH THE FUNDS THAT WOULD HAVE REPLACED THE FURNACES. FTA HQ APPROVAL IS PROVIDED IN APPLICATION DOCUMENTS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: NEW BUSES IMPROVE EFFICIENCY IN MANY WAYS INCLUDING LESS DOWN TIME LESS TIME AND MONEY SPENT ON REPAIRS INCREASED ON-TIME PERFORMANCE AND MORE COMFORTABLE RIDES FOR THE PASSENGERS INCREASING RIDER SATISFACTION. NEW VEHICLES RESULT IN IMPROVED OPERATIONS AND INCREASED RELIABILITY. IN ADDITION THE COMMUNITY REALIZES INCREASED ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE EDUCATION AND REALIZES ECONOMIC BENEFITS TO THE COMMUNITY WHEN RESIDENTS HAVE IMPROVED MOBILITY OPTIONS.IMPROVEMENTS TO THE BUILDING FITS RIGHT IN BY IMPROVING THE STATE OF GOOD REPAIR. BUSES STORED IN CONTROLLED TEMPERATURE IN THE WINTER LAST LONGER AND PROVIDE MORE MAINTENANCE FREE HOURS OF SERVICE.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: TRIBAL RESIDENTS AND VISITORS. THE SERVICE IS FOCUSED IN AND AROUND EAGLE BUTTE AND A FEW OF THE MORE POPULATED SMALL COMMUNITIES ON THE RESERVATION LIKE CHERRY CREEK DUPREE ISABEL LAPLANT AND TIMBER LAKE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

THE CATAWBA NATION IS APPLYING FOR FY 2020 AND 2021 APPORTIONMENT FUNDING ALLOCATED TO THE TRIBE UNDER SECTION 5311 RURAL AREA PROGRAM FUNDS FOR TRIBAL TRANSPORTATION. THE FUNDING WILL BE USED FOR CONTINUED OPERATIONS OF THE CATAWBA TRANSIT PROGRAM. THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF COMBINED FUNDING IS $860288.PURPOSE: THE CATAWBA INDIAN NATION WILL UTILIZE THIS AWARD FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND TO MAINTAIN EXISTING TRANSIT SERVICES ON OR NEAR THE CATAWBA NATION AND SURROUNDING COMMUNITY. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: BUILDING NEW TRANSIT OFFICE INCLUDING A MAINTENANCE AND WASH BAY AS WELL AS COVERED VEHICLE PARKING. THIS FACILITY WILL HELP CATAWBA TRANSIT BETTER MAINTAIN OUR VEHICLES AND KEEP THE VEHICLES CLEAN DURING THE ON-GOING PANDEMIC. THE TOTAL BUILDING COST IS $2119857. THE CIN IS COVERING THE MAJORITY OF THE COST BUT IS ASKING FTA FOR $400000 TOWARDS THE BUILDING. DESIGN PLANS AND ENVIRONMENTAL REVIEW WILL BE ATTACHED IN THE PROJECT DOCUMENTS. IN ADDITION WE WILL BUDGET FOR 3 VEHICLES (2 REPLACEMENT AND 1 EXPANSION) AT A TOTAL COST OF $175000. WE EXPECT TO USE VANS AND/OR SUVS FOR FUEL EFFICIENCY AND ARE RESEARCHING THE POSSIBILITY OF ELECTRIC VEHICLES. THE USEFUL LIKE OF THE VEHICLES WILL BE THE REMAINING $285288 WILL BE BUDGETED TOWARDS YEARLY OPERATIONAL COSTS FOR CATAWBA TRANSIT WHICH WILL COVER APPROXIMATELY 1 YEARS COST OR LESS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT CATAWBA TRANSIT TO CONTINUE TO THE SAFE AND EFFECTIVE OPERATION OF TRANSIT SERVICES FOR THE CATAWBA NATION AND SURROUNDING COMMUNITY. IN ADDITION WE HAVE NOT BEEN ABLE TO SPEND FUNDING ON CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS LATELY DUE TO THE OPERATIONAL NEEDS OF THE DEPARTMENT. THIS WILL GIVE THE PROGRAM MUCH NEEDED SPACE FOR THE STAFF TO MAINTAIN AND UPGRADE VEHICLES AND KEEP THE VEHICLES CLEAN AS WELL AS PROVIDE SOME GENERAL OPERATIONAL SUPPORT. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: TRANSIT RIDERS ON THE CATAWBA RESERVATION AND CLOSELY SURROUNDING COMMUNITY. SUBRECIPIENTS: NONE - CATAWBA TRANSIT DOES NOT HAVE SUBRECIPIENTS.

ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE FUNDS WILL ASSIST WITH THE SUBRECIPIENTS THEIR ADMINISTRATIVE OPERATIONS ADA CAPITAL AND OTHER CAPITAL CHARGES AS NEEDED. THE LIST BELOW SHOWS A FEW OF THE ACTIVITIES THAT THE SUBRECIPIENTS WILL USE THE FUNDS FOR:*ADMINISTRATIVE LINE ITEMS INCLUDE ITEMS SUCH AS SALARIES FRINGE PROFESSIONAL TECHNICAL SERVICES CONTRACT MAINTENANCE SERVICE MATERIAL AND SUPPLIES UTILITIES ETC.*OPERATIONS - OPERATING WAGES OPERATIONS OVERTIME OPERATION FRINGE BENEFITS ADVERTISING FEES PROFESSIONAL TECHNICAL SERVICES CONTRACT MAINTENANCE SERVICE MATERIAL AND SUPPLIES CUSTODIAL SERVICES FUEL LUBE TIRES TUBES OTHER MATERIAL SUPPLIES UTILITIES MISCELLANEOUS ETC.*OTHER CAPITAL CHARGES: - REPLACEMENT SERVICE VEHICLES SHOP EQUIPMENT PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE ETC.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: TO PROVIDE RELIABLE SAFE AND CLEAN SERVICE TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC OF SOUTH CAROLINA WHO DO NOT HAVE ADEQUATE TRANSPORTATION.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: AIKEN AREA COA BAMBERG COA BCD RTMA CENTRAL MIDLANDS RTA CITY OF ANDERSON CITY OF SENECA EDGEFIELD SENIORS FAIRFIELD COUNTY TRANSIT GENERATIONS UNLIMITED LANCASTER COA LOWCOUNTRY RTA MCCORMICK COUNTY TRANSIT NEWBERRY COA ORANGEBURG PEE DEE RTA SANTEE WATEREE RTA SENIOR SERVICES OF CHESTER COUNTY SPARTANBURG REGIONAL HEALTH SERVICES WACCAMAW RTA WILLIAMSBURG COUNTY TRANSIT AND YORK COUNTY COA. SUBRECIPIENTS ACTIVITIES: THE MAIN SUBRECIPIENTS ACTIVITIES INCLUDE OPERATING SALARIES OVERTIME FRINGE CONTRACT SERVICES MAINTENANCE FUEL LUBRICANTS TIRES TUBES AND OTHER MATERIALS INSURANCE AS WELL AS OTHER CAPITAL CHARGES SUCH AS PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE. ALL SUB-RECIPIENTS WILL FOLLOW THE SCDOT USEFUL LIFE STANDARDS AS DEFINED IN THE SCDOT STATE MANAGEMENT PLAN.ALL SUB-RECIPIENTS WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED BY C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE). IN ADDITION SUB-RECIPIENTS WILL ENSURE CONTRACTORS PROCURED WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.SCDOT CERTIFIES THAT FOR EVERY PROCUREMENT ACTION TO BE FUNDED WITH THIS GRANT INDEPENDENT COST ESTIMATES WILL BE PREPARED AND AVAILABLE ON FILE ALONG WITH THE CORRESPONDING COST/PRICE ANALYSIS FOR THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THE PROJECT.SCDOT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.THE OPERATIONAL EXPENSES REQUESTED IN THIS APPLICATION WERE DETERMINED BY THE 5311 BUDGET SPREADSHEET SUBMITTED BY EACH SUBRECIPIENT. THE MAIN CATEGORIES ARE OPERATING SALARIES OVERTIME FRINGE CONTRACT SERVICES MAINTENANCE FUEL LUBRICANTS TIRES TUBESAND OTHER MATERIALS INSURANCE. SCDOT UNDERSTANDS THAT THE EXPENSES REQUESTED IN THIS APPLICATION ARE SUBJECT TO REVIEW FOR THEIR REASONABLENESS AS PART OF THE AGENCYS NEXT TRIENNIAL/STATE MANAGEMENT REVIEW.SCDOT WILL CHECK THE CURRENT LISTING OF TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURERS (TVM) (HTTPS://WWW.TRANSIT.DOT.GOV/REGULATIONS-AND-GUIDANCE/CIVIL-RIGHTS-ADA/ELIGIBLE-TVMS-LIST) TO ENSURE EACH IS LISTED AS A CERTIFIED TVM IN COMPLIANCE WITH FTA REGULATIONS.SCDOT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACT GUIDANCE) .SCDOT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS WILL ENSURE THAT CONTRACTORS PROCURED WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.
