THIS IS AN FFY 2022 SECTION 5311 APPLICATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $1867843 ($1867843-FEDERAL SHARE-$373569 TDC). THE APPLICATION IS FOR THE PROPOSED SERVICE THAT CONSISTS OF A SINGLE ROUTE BETWEEN THE TRANSPORTATION HUBS IN CEIBA INCLUDING THE FERRY TERMINAL TO PROVIDE INTERCITY TRANSPORTATION TO PASSENGERS ARRIVING FROM VIEQUES AND CULEBRA TO THE LUIS MUNOZ MARIN INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT AND TO TREN URBANO WHERE THE TRAVELERS WILL HAVE ACCESS TO OTHER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND DESTINATIONS WITHIN THE CAPITAL CITY AND THE SAN JUAN METROPOLITAN AREA. THE INTERCITY BUS SERVICE ASPIRES TO CONNECT DIFFERENT TYPES OF TRANSPORTATION FACILITIES RAIL MARITIME AIR AND TRANSIT BY A SINGLE FIXED ROUTE THAT WILL SERVE TWO URBAN AREAS AND A NON-URBANIZED AREA WITH LIMITED STOPS. ACTIVITIES ARE INCLUDED IN THE STIP 2019-2022 AMENDMENT #3 (PAGE FTA-91) PROJECTS #7 #8 AND #9. PURPOSE: PROVIDE INTERCITY TRANSPORTATION TO PASSENGERS ARRIVING FROM VIEQUES AND CULEBRA TO THE LUIS MUNOZ MARIN INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT AND TO TREN URBANO WHERE THE TRAVELERS WILL HAVE ACCESS TO OTHER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND DESTINATIONS WITHIN THE CAPITAL CITY AND THE SAN JUAN METROPOLITAN AREA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:OPERATING EXPENDITURES (DIRECT COST OF OPERATION THE VEHICLE INCLUDING MAINTENANCE COST VEHICLE OPERATOR EXPENDITURE TOLL ROADS CHARGES)MANAGEMENT FEESCAPITAL INVESTMENTS MARKETINGCONTRACT ADMINISTRATIONEXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE INTERCITY BUS SERVICE ASPIRES TO CONNECT DIFFERENT TYPES OF TRANSPORTATION FACILITIES RAIL MARITIME AIR AND TRANSIT BY A SINGLE FIXED ROUTE THAT WILL SERVE TWO URBAN AREAS AND A NON-URBANIZED AREA WITH LIMITED STOPS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ALL THE USERS FROM THE VARIOUS TRANSPORTATION FACILITIES UNDER PRHTA/PRITA. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A*PRHTA IS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT OF SECTION 5311 PROGRAM FUNDS.*COST ESTIMATE WAS PREPARED BY PRITA AND IT IS INCLUDED IN THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS (CERTIFICATION OF ESTIMATED COST-PRITA)*PLEASE REFER TO THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS FOR THE OPERATION COST EVALUATION (CEIBA-SAN JUAN INTERCITY BUS)*THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT HAVE DELINQUENT FEDERAL DEBT. -PRHTA/PRITA WILL FOLLOW THIRD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F THIRD PARTY PROCUREMENT GUIDANCE IN THE PROCUREMENT PROCESS.-PRHTA/PRITA WILL ENSURE CONTRACTORS PROCURED WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST. -THIS GRANT DOES NOT REQUEST FUNDS FOR RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT AND DOES NOT APPLY INDIRECT COST ACTIVITIES.-THIS GRANT WILL COVER AT LEAST 15% OF THE ANNUAL SECTION 5311 APPORTIONMENT.

THIS IS A FY 2020 SECTION 5311 APPLICATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $496333 REPRESENTING 100% FEDERAL SHARE OF THE TOTAL ELIGIBLE AMOUNT. THE APPLICATION IS FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE STATE ADMINISTRATION AND RTAP. THE FUNDS REQUESTED IN THIS APPLICATION ARE NECESSARY TO OPERATE MAINTAIN AND MANAGE THE TRANSIT SYSTEMS OF THE MUNICIPALITIES OF JAYUYA AND VIEQUES. PURPOSETHE MUNICIPALITIES OF JAYUYA AND VIEQUES ARE CURRENTLY SUB RECIPIENTS OF PRHTA AND ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR ENSURING THE PROPER OPERATION MAINTENANCE AND FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT OF MUNICIPAL PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMEDEACH OF THESE PROJECTS ARE OPERATED BY A SUB GRANTEE AND SUPERVISED BY THE PUERTO RICO HIGHWAY AND TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY DISTRIBUTED AS FOLLOW:A) OPERATING ASSISTANCE B) PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE C) STATE ADMINISTRATION D) RTAPTRAINING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCETRANSIT RESEARCHEXPECTED OUTCOMESEXPECTED TO INCREASE ELDERLY AND HANDICAPPED PARTICIPATION IN THE USAGE OF MULTIMODAL TRANSPORTATION. TO ACHIEVE OUR GOAL WE MUST KEEP OUR VEHICLE IN OPTIMUM CONDITIONS FOR THE SAFETY OF OUR PASSENGERS. HAVING TECHNOLOGICAL EQUIPMENT CONTRIBUTES TO THE FULFILLMENT OF THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROGRAM IN THE DELIVERY OF REPORTS AT THE INDICATED TIME TO FILL REAL STATISTICS TO KEEP INFORMED THE CITIZENSHIP OF THE AVAILABLE SERVICE.THE PROJECT PROVIDES THE NEEDED CONTINUATION FOR THE MUNICIPALITY TO DEVELOP ITS PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM TO MAINTAIN THE BUSES AT OPTIMAL CONDITIONS AND PREVENT ROUTE DELAYS OR LACK OF FULL SERVICE. SUBRICIPIENT ACTIVITIESA) OPERATING ASSISTANCE B) PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE C) STATE ADMINISTRATION D) RTAPTRAINING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCETRANSIT RESEARCH1. OVERALL START DATE JULY 1 2024/ END DATE MARCH 30 2026.2. PRTHA IS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT AND DIRECT RECIPIENT OF THE SECTION 5311 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO PUERTO RICO. 3. THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES RESEARCH FUNDS.4. NO INDIRECT COSTS WILL BE CHARGED TO THIS APPLICATION.5. THE PUERTO RICO HIGHWAY AND TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE).6. THE AUTHORITY WILL ENSURE CONTRACTORS PROCURED WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.7. ALL SUB-RECIPIENTS WILL FOLLOW USEFUL LIFE STANDARDS AS DEFINED IN THE PRHTA STATE MANAGEMENT PLAN.8. THIS GRANT APPLICATION IS FOR SECTION 5311 FUNDS IN THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF $2407525 (100% FEDERAL SHARE) FOR THE PUERTO RICO MARITIME TRANSIT AUTHORITY (PRMTA) AND WILL BE FUNDED WITH CARES ACT FUNDS ALLOCATE TO HELP RESPOND TO AND RECOVER FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. REQUESTED FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR A SHORT-TERM OPERATING LEASE AGREEMENT OF ONE PASSENGER VESSEL THAT WOULD PROVIDE SERVICES TO THE PRMTA ISLAND SERVICE. THIS SHORT-TERM OPERATING LEASE WILL BE USED TO REPLACE VESSELS THAT ARE OUT OF SERVICES. IT WILL ALSO BE USED TO COVER RELATED PROJECT ADMINISTRATION EXPENSES. THE PRMTA IS THE PUBLIC FERRY OPERATOR SUB RECIPIENT UNDER THE PUERTO RICO HIGHWAY AND TRANSIT AUTHORITY (PRHTA). PRMTA PROVIDES THE ONLY PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION METHOD THAT CONNECTS THE MUNICIPAL ISLANDS OF VIEQUES AND CULEBRA WITH THE MAINLAND (ISLAND SERVICE) AS WELL AS THE METRO SERVICE WHICH CONNECTS THE CATAO TERMINAL WITH THE SAN JUAN PIER II TERMINAL. THE PRMTA OPERATES SCHEDULED FERRY SERVICES FOR CARGO AND PASSENGERS RUNNING SEVEN (7) DAYS A WEEK. DURING THE COVID- 19 EMERGENCY THE PRMTA HAS CONTINUED PROVIDING SERVICES FOR THE VIEQUES- CULEBRA- CEIBA ROUTES. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION WOULD BE INCLUDED IN PROJECT 1. THIS GRANT INCLUDES $103479 IN FY2021 SECTION 5311 TTP ARP ACT FUNDS WHICH IS THE FULL AMOUNT ALLOCATED. THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED AT 100% FEDERAL SHARE FOR OPERATING COSTS TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS. OPERATING COSTS INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:- PROVISION OF TRANSIT SERVICE INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO: DRIVERS AND OTHER OPERATIONS WORKER SALARIES FUEL AND SUPPLIES (INCLUDING PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT AND CLEANING SUPPLIES).- ADMINISTRATIVE LEAVE FOR OPERATIONS EMPLOYEES (INCLUDING EMPLOYEES PERFORMING MAINTENANCE). ADMINISTRATIVE LEAVE IS AN ADMINISTRATIVELY AUTHORIZED ABSENCE FROM DUTY WITHOUT LOSS OF PAY OR REDUCTION IN AN EMPLOYEES AVAILABLE LEAVE. IN THE CONTEXT OF THE COVID-19 PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY ADMINISTRATIVE LEAVE COULD INCLUDE BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO LEAVE FOR AN EMPLOYEE WHO IS NOT REQUIRED TO WORK DUE TO A REDUCTION IN SERVICE OR LEAVE FOR A WORKER WHO IS QUARANTINED AFTER POTENTIAL EXPOSURE TO AN INDIVIDUAL INFECTED WITH COVID-19.- OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE COSTS OR TO PAY FOR ADMINISTRATIVE LEAVE OF MAINTENANCE PERSONNEL ADMINISTRATIVE LEAVE AND SHUTDOWN AND STARTUP COSTS OPERATING COSTS DISINFECTING SUPPLIES AND ACTIVITIES AND INDIRECT COSTS USING A FEDERALLY APPROVED INDIRECT COST RATE.FURLOUGH CERTIFICATION:THE RECIPIENT CERTIFIES THAT IT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS AND CONTRACTORS THAT ARE PROVIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION HAVE NOT FURLOUGHED ANY EMPLOYEES SINCE MARCH 27 2020 (THE ENACTMENT DATE OF THE CARES ACT); *** SPECIAL CONDITION ***THE RECIPIENT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS APPLICATION FOR LAPSING FEDERAL FUNDS FROM FY-21 SECTION 5311 ALLOCATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $638699.00 TO THE CHEYENNE AND ARAPAHO TRIBES FOR CONTINUED OPERATIONS OF THE EXISTING TRANSIT SYSTEM. THE PURPOSE OF THE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS: SALARIES FUEL TRAINING MAINTENANCE AND TRAVEL. OUR TRANSIT SYSTEM COVERS A NINE (9) COUNTY AREA AND SERVES THOSE IN VERY RURAL AREAS IN AND AROUND OUR RESERVES. THE TRANSIT SYSTEM IS OPEN TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS TO BE EXPENDED ON OPERATING COSTS FOR THE TRANSIT SYSTEM TO ENSURE DELIVERY OF PROGRAM SERVICES AND TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC. FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS: SALARIES FUEL TRAINING MAINTENANCE TRAVEL AND ETC. TO ALLOW SYSTEM TO CONTINUE. FUNDS WILL ALLOW STAFF TO ATTEND REQUIRED TRAINING AND KEEP UP WITH CERTIFICATIONS. FUNDS WILL ALSO ALLOW SYSTEM TO MAINTAIN THE CURRENT FLEET WITH MAINTENANCE COSTS AND TO PAY FOR FUEL FOR VEHICLES TO SUSTAIN THE PROGRAM GOALS WITH PROVIDING SERVICES TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDS FOR OPERATING WILL ENSURE TRANSIT SYSTEM TO BE ABLE TO MEET NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITIES WE SERVE AS WELL AS THE GENERAL PUBLIC. FUNDS WILL ALLOW FOR TRAINING NEEDS TO BE MET AS WELL AS TO PAY STAFF AND ANY TRAVEL RELATED COSTS TO ALLOW PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN CURRENT SERVICES WE PROVIDE TO THE COMMUNITY AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: COMMUNITY-RIDERS AND BUSINESSES.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NOT APPLICABLE.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE NORTHEAST OKLAHOMA TRIBAL TRANSIT CONSORTIUM (NTTC) ON-DEMAND TRANSIT PROJECT OPERATED BY PELIVAN TRANSIT AND KNOWN AS NTTC ON-DEMAND SEEKS FUNDING FOR THE EXPANSION AND UPGRADING OF ON-DEMAND RURAL SHARED RIDE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR TRIBAL RESIDENTS AND ALL CITIZENS OF OTTAWA COUNTY OKLAHOMA (OK). THE PROPOSED NTTC ON-DEMAND PROJECT REFLECTS A LONGSTANDING PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN EASTERN SHAWNEE TRIBE OF OKLAHOMA (ESTOO) THE NTTC AND PELIVAN TRANSIT (OPERATED BY GRAND GATEWAY ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ASSOCIATION) AND WILL BUILD ON THE INITIAL SUCCESS OF THE PROGRAM WHICH WAS LAUNCHED WITH THE SUPPORT OF LAST YEARS (FY2021) TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM (TTP). THE FOLLOWING IS AN OVERVIEW OF SERVICES PROVIDED AND AREAS SERVED.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: AS THE FTA TTP GRANT APPLICANT ESTOO WILL CONTRACT WITH NTTC/PELIVAN TRANSIT TO EXPAND ITS ON-DEMAND SHARED RIDE PROGRAM BY ADDING UPGRADED TECHNOLOGY AND INCREASING SERVICE HOURS TO INCLUDE DAYTIME TRIPS. PELIVAN TRANSIT WILL CONTINUE TO OPERATE THESE EXPANDED SERVICES UTILIZING NTTC ON-DEMAND RESOURCES INCLUDING 4 ADA LIFT-EQUIPPED VEHICLES STAFF INNOVATIVE TECHNOLOGY AND SUPPORT SERVICES IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FTA AND ODOT POLICIES AND REGULATIONS. WITH THIS FUNDING THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL BE EQUIPPED TO BETTER PROVIDE TRANSIT SERVICES FOR TRIBAL CITIZENS IN OTTAWA COUNTY OK POPULATION 30285 INCLUDING 6147 (20.3%) NTTC TRIBAL RESIDENTS.THIS EXPANSION WILL ALSO FEATURE THE INTRODUCTION OF A BRAND NEW CLOUD-BASED PLATFORM WHICH WILL ALLOW NTTC TO SEAMLESSLY PLUG ITS ON-DEMAND TRANSIT SOFTWARE INTO THE EXISTING FLEET ENABLING NTTC TO OPERATE THE SERVICE USING PELIVAN RESOURCES INCLUDING DRIVERS VEHICLES AND LIVE SUPPORT STAFF.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: OVER THE PAST YEAR NTTC ON-DEMAND HAS BECOME HIGHLY UTILIZED BY THE COMMUNITY AND SUPPORTS INDIVIDUALS IN ACCESSING JOBS SCHOOLS HOSPITALS AND OTHER CRITICAL RESOURCES HOWEVER THE CURRENT SERVICE IS NOT EQUIPPED TO MEET DEMAND. TO MEET GROWING COMMUNITY NEEDS AND ENSURE THAT ALL INDIVIDUALS CAN EASILY ACCESS THIS SERVICE NTTC ON-DEMAND SEEKS FUNDING THROUGH THE FY2022 TTP TO CAPITALIZE ON THIS INITIAL SUCCESS ACQUIRE IMPROVED TECHNOLOGY FOR ALL 35 VEHICLES AND EXPAND SERVICE HOURS TO INCLUDE DAYTIME TRIPS. THIS WILL ENSURE THAT ALL VEHICLES ARE ABLE TO DYNAMICALLY RESPOND TO RIDE REQUESTS AND MEET GROWING DEMAND.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PROPOSED NTTC ON-DEMAND TRANSIT SERVICES WILL SERVE ALL TRIBAL AND CITIZENS ACROSS OTTAWA COUNTY OK. BORDERING THE STATES OF MISSOURI AND KANSAS OTTAWA COUNTY COVERS 485 SQUARE MILES AND IS HOME TO 30285 RESIDENTS (2020 US CENSUS) INCLUDING 6147 (20.3%) NATIVE AMERICANS 5481 (18.1%) SENIOR CITIZENS (GREATER THAN AGE 65) 4270 (14.8%) PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AND 2192 VETERANS (7.2%). FOR A SERVICE AREA MAP OF OTTAWA COUNTY SEE ATTACHMENT B. OTTAWA COUNTY HAS 2 CITIES AND 6 TOWNS INCLUDING WYANDOTTE (ESTOO HEADQUARTERS) AND MIAMI (COUNTY SEAT - LARGEST CITY IN THE COUNTY) WHICH SERVES AS THE CENTRAL ECONOMIC GENERATOR HUB AND IS HOME TO EDUCATION EMPLOYMENT HEALTHCARE SHOPPING RECREATION AND OTHER LIFE INTERESTS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

AND MOBILITY/PAYMENT TECHNOLOGIES TO DEMONSTRATE THE INNOVATIVE NATURE OF THE PROJECT. APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE TRANSPORTATION NEEDS OF THE OTOE-MISSOURIA TRIBAL COMMUNITY ARE EXACERBATED BY AN UNDERDEVELOPED SYSTEM OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION BECAUSE OF THE RURAL AREA THE TRIBAL HEADQUARTERS IS LOCATED. THE TRIBE HAS DEVELOPED A TRANSIT PLAN THAT HAS BEEN AWARDED SHOWING THE DETAILED NEED FOR A TRANSIT SYSTEM TO THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY MEMBERS THAT LIVE WITHIN A 25 MILE RADIUS OF THE HEADQUARTERS IN RED ROCK OK. THE MAIN FOCUS OF THE TRANSIT PROGRAM WILL HELP GIVE ACCESS TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS PLACE OF EMPLOYMENT AND ACCESS TO CONSUMER SERVICES TO HELP BENEFIT TRIBAL MEMBERS THAT LACK TO TRANSPORTATION NEEDS. TRIBAL MEMBERS ARE ISOLATED AND HAVE NO ACCESS TO FORMAL PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. THE TRANSIT SYSTEM WILL ALLOW FOR EXPANSIONS OF EMPLOYMENT FOR THE TRIBE AND CONSUMER REVENUE FOR OPERATIONS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE OTOE-MISSOURIA TRANSIT PROGRAM WILL CONDUCT NEEDS ASSESSMENTS RELATED TO ON-DEMAND MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND ON-DEMAND TRANSPORTATION RELATED TO EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES AT TRIBAL BUSINESSES WITHIN A FOUR COUNTY AREA. IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE ASSESSMENT PROCESS THE TRIBE WILL HIRE FULL-TIME PERSONNEL TO COORDINATED THE TRANSIT SERVICES FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS AND ADDITIONAL PART-TIME PERSONNEL TO ACT AS DRIVERS IN SUPPORT OF THE ENTIRE TRANSIT PROGRAM. ONCE PERSONNEL HAVE BEEN HIRED THE TRIBE WILL EXPAND ITS TRANSIT SYSTEM BY OFFERING VARIABLE ROUTE SERVICES. EXPANDED SERVICES ARE EXPECTED TO BEGIN IN JANUARY 2024.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE OTOE-MISSOURIA TRIBE CONDUCTED COMMUNITY MEETINGS AND MET WITH LOCAL TRIBAL AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO ASK THEIR TRANSPORTATION NEEDS. THE CONSENSUS WAS THE TRIBE NEEDS TO PROVIDE A TRANSPORTATION SERVICE FOR COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO USE FOR MEDIAL APPOINTMENTS EMPLOYMENT AND LOCAL GROCERY SHOPPING 25 MILES AWAY. THE TRANSIT SYSTEM WILL HELP THE COMMUNITY NEEDS THAT WILL SUPPORT THE TRANSIT PLAN ALONG WITH THE IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGY INCLUDING ALL THE POLICES AND PROCEDURES THAT WILL HELP EXPAND THE TRANSIT SYSTEM FOR MORE ACCOMMODATING ROUTES AND SERVICES OTHER TRIBAL MEMBERS NOT ENROLLED IN THE OTOE-MISSOURIA TRIBE BUT LIVE IN THE FOUR COUNTY AREA.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE OTOE-MISSOURIA TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM WILL BENEFIT TO TRIBAL MEMBERS ELDERS AND EMPLOYEES NEEDING TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS PLACE OF EMPLOYMENT AND ACCESS TO CONSUMER SERVICES (GROCERY SHOPPING BANKS MECHANICS ETC.) FOR BETTER LIFE STYLES. IN THE FUTURE THE OTOE-MISSOURIA TRIBE PLANS TO EXPAND THE TRANSIT SERVICES TO OUTSIDE NON-TRIBAL MEMBERS AND OTHER RELATIVE TRIBAL MEMBERS FOR BETTER ACCESS IN THE FOUR COUNTY AREA THAT IS IN A RURAL LOCATION.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

TRANSIT EMPLOYEES WILL CONTINUE TO RECEIVE COMPETITIVE WAGES AND BENEFITS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE KAW NATION CURRENTLY HAS NO TRANSIT SYSTEM. LIMITED TRANSIT IS AVAILABLE FOR THE MULTI-COUNTY AREA OF NORTHERN OKLAHOMA AND FROM PONCA CITY BUT A GAP EXISTS FOR THE KAW NATION TRIBAL MEMBERS WHO LIVE WITHIN THE RURAL COMMUNITIES. A TRANSIT SYSTEM WOULD ENABLE THE KAW NATION TO MEET TRANSPORTATION NEEDS FOR ACCESS TO JOBS OR HEALTH CARE SPECIAL NEEDS OF ELDERS OR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CARE NEEDS OF YOUTH INCOME-BASED COMMUNITY NEEDS AND OTHER MOBILITY NEEDS. THE PROPOSED PROJECT IS A CAPITAL INVESTMENT TO ESTABLISH A TRANSIT SYSTEM WITHIN THE KAW NATION SERVICE AREA. THIS TRANSIT SYSTEM REQUIRES THE CREATION OF A FULLY STAFFED TRANSIT DEPARTMENT INCLUDING OFFICES AND SUPPLIES A SCHEDULE COORDINATOR AND VEHICLE OPERATORS TRAINING AND VEHICLE OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: UPON RECEIPT OF THE FUNDS THE KAW NATION INTENDS TO PROCEED WITH THE OFFICE SET-UP PURCHASE OF VEHICLES AND THE HIRING AND TRAINING OF A TRANSIT COORDINATOR AND DRIVERS. THE COORDINATOR WOULD COLLABORATE WITH THE ADMINISTRATION COUNCIL AND TRANSPORTATION DEPARTMENT TO ADVERTISE THE TRANSIT SERVICE TO TRACK RIDERSHIP AND ENSURE TRAINING AND SAFETY. THE COORDINATOR WILL OVERSEE THE DRIVERS OF THE TRANSIT VEHICLES DISPATCH CALLS AND COORDINATE WITH DRIVERS. THE TRANSIT SERVICE WILL PROVIDE GREATER ACCESS TO HEALTHCARE EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES EDUCATION CENTERS AND OTHER RECREATION AND CULTURAL FACILITIES.PROJECT STARTADVERTISE POSITIONSHIRE PROJECT COORDINATORSET-UP TRANSIT OFFICESPURCHASE VEHICLESDRIVERS STARTADVERTISE TRANSIT SERVICESTRAIN PERSONNELBEGIN TRANSIT SERVICE; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE GOALS OF THE PROPOSED TRANSIT SYSTEM ARE TO HELP ELDERS AND TRIBAL CITIZENS HAVE BETTER ACCESS TO TRANSPORTATION FOR MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS GROCERIES PRESCRIPTIONS AND OTHER NECESSARY APPOINTMENTS AND TO ASSIST TRIBAL MEMBERS AND TRIBAL EMPLOYEES WITH BETTER TRANSPORTATION TO AND FROM WORK AND MAKE CHILDCARE EASIER. THE PROPOSED KAW NATION TRANSIT SYSTEM HAS THE POTENTIAL TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE AND RAISE THE ECONOMIC STABILITY OF THE SERVICE AREA. THE TRANSIT SYSTEM WOULD ALLOW FOR MORE RESIDENTS TO ACCESS EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES WITHIN THE COUNTY TO ASSIST FAMILIES WITH CHILDCARE AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES AND TO PROVIDE FOR THE WELFARE OF THE ELDERLY.THE KAW NATION TRANSIT SYSTEM WILL MAKE THE RURAL AREA MORE LIVABLE FOR FAMILIES AND ELDERS. THE KAW NATION VIEWS THE TRANSIT PROGRAM AS A MODERN WAY TO FULFILL ITS CULTURAL RESPONSIBILITIES. THE KAW NATION IS COMMITTED TO CARING FOR ITS ELDERS AND GUIDING ITS YOUTH BY GIVING THEM HEALTHY STABLE CHILDHOODS THAT TRANSFORM THEM INTO HEALTHY CONTRIBUTING ADULTS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: RURAL KAY COUNTY COMMUNITY KAW TRIBAL CITIZENS YOUTH AND ELDERS COMMUTERS TRIBAL EMPLOYEES; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

THIS IS AN FFY 2021 SECTION 5311 ARP FUNDING APPLICATION FOR THE CHICKASAW NATION (CN) IN THE AMOUNT OF $1031725 REPRESENTING 100 PERCENT FEDERAL SHARE OF THE TOTAL ELIGIBLE AMOUNT. THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES ARP FUNDING TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS. APPLICATION PURPOSE: TO SUPPORT THE DAY-TO-DAY OPERATIONS OF TRANSIT SYSTEMS THAT PROVIDE TRANSIT SERVICE TO THE RURAL COMMUNITIES IN THE STATE OF OHIO.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES FUEL ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE IN ORDER TO CONTINUE TRANSIT OPERATIONS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: CONTINUED SAFE AND EFFECTIVE OPERATION OF TRANSIT SERVICES FOR RURAL AREAS OF OHIO.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: FORTY-TWO PUBLIC TRANSIT SYSTEMS THAT PROVIDES RURAL TRANSIT SERVICE AS WELL AS THE CITIZENS OF OHIO WHO WILL BE ABLE TO UTILIZE SAID SERVICE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: ALL THE WORK UNDER THIS GRANT WILL BE PERFORMED BY THE VARIOUS SUB-RECIPIENTS WHO WILL BE OUTLINED IN THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: PROVIDE FUNDING TO SUPPORT RURAL PUBLIC TRANSIT FACILITIES.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: ENGINEERING DESIGN ACQUISITION CONSTRUCTION AND REHAB/RENOVATION.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: NEW AND UPDATED RURAL ADMINISTRATION AND MAINTENANCE FACILITIES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: OHIOS RURAL RESIDENTS AND RURAL 5311 SUB-RECIPIENTS; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: LOGAN COUNTY COMMISSIONERS AND RTC INDUSTRIES WILL PROVIDE PROJECT MANAGEMENT ACQUISITION OF FURNITURE AND REHAB/RENOVATION OF THE LOGAN COUNTY RTC FACILITY.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: OBLIGATE THE REMAINING ARPA DOLLARS TO FUND VEHICLES 3RD PARTY CONTRACTING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: PURCHASE SERVICE ACQUIRE VEHICLES AND PROVIDE RURAL TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: IMPROVED SERVICE.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: OHIOS 5310 AND 5311 SUB-RECIPIENTS AND THE RIDING PUBLIC.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: SUBRECIPIENTS IDENTIFIED IN THE POP WILL PURCHASE SERVICE AND ACQUIRE VEHICLES.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: TO SUPPORT THE DAY-TO-DAY OPERATIONS OF TRANSIT SYSTEMS THAT PROVIDE INTERCITY BUS OPERATIONS AND RELATED SERVICES TO THE RURAL COMMUNITIES IN THE STATE OF OHIO.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: IN THIS AWARD THERE IS ONE RURAL PUBLIC TRANSIT SYSTEM (HOCKING ATHENS PERRY COMMUNITY ACTION-HAPCAP DBA GOBUS RURAL INTERCITY BUS PROGRAM) BEING AWARDED FUNDS FOR INTERCITY OPERATING AND/OR ADMINISTRATION EXPENSES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: TRANSIT OPERATORS WILL CONTINUE THE PROVISION OF INTERCITY BUS SERVICE TO OHIO.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ONE RURAL PUBLIC TRANSIT SYSTEM HAPCAP THAT PROVIDES INTERCITY BUS SERVICE AS WELL AS THE CITIZENS OF OHIO WHO WILL BE ABLE TO UTILIZE SAID SERVICE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: ALL THE WORK UNDER THIS GRANT WILL BE PERFORMED BY THE SUB-RECIPIENT HAPCAP.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE OHIO MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM INCREASES ACCESS TO MOBILITY FOR OHIOANS BY INCREASING UNDERSTANDING AND AWARENESS OF TRANSPORTATION NEEDS COORDINATION OF TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS TO MEET NEEDS AND BUILDING SUSTAINABLE AND HEALTHY COMMUNITIES BY INTEGRATING TRANSPORTATION INTO PLANNING AND PROGRAMS FOR THE PERIOD OF JANUARY 1 2023-DECEMBER 31 2023.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE STATEWIDE MOBILITY COORDINATOR AND ODOTS ROLE IS TO ADMINISTER FUNDS TO THE SUBRECIPIENTS SERVE AS A LIAISON BETWEEN FTA AND STATE AGENCIES AND OVERSEE THE MOBILITY MANAGERS IN THE STATE TO ENSURE THEY ARE ADHERING TO THE PROGRAMS RULES AND REGULATIONS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE OUTCOMES AND GOALS OF THE OHIO MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM INCLUDE INCREASE UNDERSTANDING AND AWARENESS OF COMMUNITY TRANSPORTATION NEEDS INCREASE AWARENESS OF CURRENT COMMUNITY TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AND PROGRAMS ENSURE THAT TRANSPORTATION CONSIDERATIONS ARE INCLUDED IN LOCAL AND REGIONAL PLANNING ACTIVITIES INCREASE LOCAL CAPACITY FOR TRANSPORTATION SERVICES ASSIST INDIVIDUALS WITH ACCESSING ALL COMMUNITY TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF MOBILITY MANAGEMENT INCLUDE THE ELDERLY PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS; HOWEVER CAN ALSO SERVE THE GENERAL PUBLIC.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: ELIGIBLE SUBRECIPIENTS ARE PRIVATE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND STATE OR LOCAL GOVERNMENT AUTHORITIES. THESE SUBRECIPIENTS SERVE AS POLICY COORDINATORS OPERATIONS SERVICE BROKERS AND CUSTOMER TRAVEL NAVIGATORS. AS POLICY COORDINATORS MOBILITY MANAGERS HELP COMMUNITIES DEVELOP COORDINATION PLANS PROGRAMS AND POLICIES AND BUILD LOCAL PARTNERSHIPS TO IMPROVE THE REACH EFFICIENCY AND AFFORDABILITY OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE. A COMPLETE LIST OF ACTIVITIES CAN BE FOUND UNDER THE BUDGET NARRATIVE IN EACH PROJECT.

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST LAPSING FFY2020 SECTION 5311 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE OHIO DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (ODOT) IN THE AMOUNT OF $4429150 FOR THE OHIO RURAL ZERO EMISSION PILOT (ORZEP). THE PROJECT INCLUDES CAPITAL AND OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR THE PURCHASE OF EXPANSION BUSES BUS STOP SIGNAGE AND BRANDING BUS RADIOS SURVEILLANCE/SECURITY EQUIPMENT THE INSTALLATION OF ELECTRIC CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE FOR CHILLICOTHE TRANSIT SYSTEM (CTS) PLUS PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE AND PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION FOR PERRY COUNTY TRANSIT (PCT). THE TOTAL SECTION 5311 FUNDS AWARDED TO CTS IS $2983823 AND THE TOTAL AWARDED TO PCT IS $1445327. LOCAL SHARE IS PROVIDED BY BOTH SUBRECIPIENTS IN THE AMOUNT OF $258963 FROM CONTRACT REVENUE AND STATE FUNDS. THE AWARD WILL ALSO UTILIZE TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDIT (TDC) IN THE AMOUNT OF $760749. THE TOTAL AWARD AMOUNT IS $4688113.THE LOCAL SHARE PROVIDED BY BOTH SUBRECIPIENTS TOTALS $258963 IN LOCAL FUNDS DEPOSITED INTO THE TRANSIT RESERVE FUND FROM SOURCES WHICH CAN INCLUDE CONTRACT REVENUE AND STATE FUNDS. NO OTHER FTA GRANT FUNDS WILL BE UTILIZED FOR THIS PROJECT. THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE WILL BE JULY 31 2022 TO MARCH 30 2028.PURPOSE OF THE AWARD:THE ORZEP IS THE ODOT TRANSIT INITIATIVE TO DEMONSTRATE ZERO EMISSION VEHICLES FOR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IN THE RURAL REGIONS OF OHIO. THE PILOT INCLUDES CHILLICOTHE TRANSIT SYSTEM IN ROSS COUNTY AND PERRY COUNTY TRANSIT. THE PILOT WILL INCLUDE PROCURING ZERO EMISSION ADA ACCESSIBLE TRANSIT VEHICLES AND ASSOCIATED CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE NECESSARY FOR A MORE ENVIRONMENTALLY SUSTAINABLE OPERATION. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER CAPITAL OPERATING AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE COSTS FOR THE PURCHASE OF ELECTRIC VEHICLES FACILITY UPDATES TRAINING AND PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THIS ORZEP INITIATIVE AIMS TO IMPROVE POSITIVE HEALTH OUTCOMES DECREASE HEALTH DISPARITIES INCREASE JOB ACCESS AND WORK OPPORTUNITIES IMPROVE THE AIR QUALITY AND SUPPORT THE LOCAL ECONOMIES IN THESE COUNTIES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:CHILLICOTHE TRANSIT SYSTEM AND PERRY COUNTY TRANSIT WILL COORDINATE AND COOPERATE WITH ODOT AND THE PROJECT MANAGER/CONSULTANT TO PLAN AND IMPLEMENT THE ORZEP PROJECT. CHILLICOTHE TRANSIT SYSTEM AND PERRY COUNTY TRANSIT PROPOSE TO PILOT NINE (9) ZERO EMISSION VEHICLES THAT ARE ADA ACCESSIBLE AND INSTALL THE NECESSARY CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE AT GROUND-LEVEL FOR BOTH FIXED ROUTES AND DEMAND RESPONSE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE.IN EXECUTING THIS GRANT THE ODOT AGREES TO ABIDE BY SECTION 3011 OF THE FAST ACT (49 U.S.C. 5323(J)(2)(C) REGARDING THE PHASED INCREASE IN DOMESTIC CONTENT UNDER THE BUY AMERICA STATUTE FOR ROLLING STOCK. AS GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDES AN FTA-FUNDED TRANSIT VEHICLE PURCHASE ODOT AGREES TO COMPLY WITH THE RELATED REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN 49 CFR 26.49(A). SPECIFICALLY ODOT MUST ENSURE AS A CONDITION OF BEING AUTHORIZED TO BID OR PROPOSE ON FTA-ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS THAT EACH TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER CERTIFIED THAT IT COMPLIED WITH DOT REQUIREMENTS FOR SUBMITTING A DBE PROGRAM AND GOAL TO FTA PRIOR TO BIDDING. ODOT IS ALSO REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE NAME OF THE SUCCESSFUL BIDDER AND THE TOTAL DOLLAR VALUE OF THE CONTRACT WITHIN 30 DAYS OF MAKING AN FTA- ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE AWARD USING THE REQUIRED FTA REPORTING TOOL. ODOT UNDERSTANDS THAT FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS MAY RESULT IN FORMAL ENFORCEMENT ACTION OR APPROPRIATE SANCTION AS DETERMINED BY FTA INCLUDING REIMBURSEMENT OF FTA FUNDS USED FOR THE VEHICLE PROCUREMENT. THE ATTACHED SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS ARE:ORZEP PROGRAM OF PROJECTSORZEP TDC ODOT APPROVAL LETTERODOT TDC PROGRAM BUDGETOHIO SFY 2021-2024 STIP APPROVAL LETTEROHIO SFY 2021-2024 STIP PROJECT LISTODOT FFY 2022 DOL ASSURANCE LETTERORZEP ELECTRIC CHARGING STATION LOCATIONS

THIS APPLICATION IS FOR FFY2021 SECTION 5311 ARP ACT FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $5903510 THAT ODOT WILL AWARD FOR INTERCITY PROJECTS. ODOT IS APPORTIONED $2248166 IN FFY2021 ARP ACT 5311 FUNDING AND $3655344 IN ARP 5311(F) FUNDING SPECIFICALLY FOR INTERCITY BUS ALL OF WHICH WILL BE USED IN THIS GRANT. THESE PROJECTS WILL SUPPORT COVID-19 EMERGENCY RESPONSE AND RECOVERY AND DAY-TO-DAY OPERATIONS OF INTERCITY BUS SYSTEMS THAT PROVIDE SERVICE TO THE COMMUNITIES IN THE STATE OF OHIO. ARP ACT FUNDING IS 100% FEDERAL AND NO LOCAL MATCH IS NECESSARY TO BE PROVIDED BY THE SUB-RECIPIENTS. PURPOSE OF THE AWARD: SUPPORT THE COVID-19 EMERGENCY RESPONSE AND RECOVERY AND DAY-TO-DAY OPERATIONS OF TRANSIT SYSTEMS THAT PROVIDE CRITICAL SERVICE TO THE RURAL COMMUNITIES IN THE STATE OF OHIO. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: IN THIS AWARD THERE IS ONE RURAL PUBLIC TRANSIT SYSTEM (HOCKING ATHENS PERRY COMMUNITY ACTION-HAPCAP) BEING AWARDED FUNDS FOR INTERCITY OPERATING EXPENSES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: TRANSIT OPERATIONS WILL CONTINUE TO OPERATE THROUGH THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC AND INTERCITY BUS SERVICE WILL BE MAINTAINED. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ONE RURAL PUBLIC TRANSIT SYSTEM WHICH PROVIDES INTERCITY BUS SERVICE. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: ALL THE WORK PERFORMED UNDER THIS GRANT WILL BE BY SUB-RECIPIENTS. ODOT WILL NOT OFFER SERVICE OURSELVES. SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS ATTACHED TO THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS SECTION OF THIS GRANT APPLICATION INCLUDE: INITIAL PROGRAM OF PROJECTS DEPARTMENT OF LABOR ASSURANCE LETTERTHE RECIPIENT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.PER THE ARP ACT THE PROJECTS IN THIS APPLICATION ARE NOT REQUIRED TO BE PROGRAMMED IN THE LONG-RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLAN OR STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM AS THEY DO NOT LEAD TO A FUNCTIONAL LOCATION OR CAPACITY CHANGE. PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY EXPENSES IN THE APPROXIMATE AMOUNT OF $3800000 WERE INCURRED FROM 01/01/2021 TO 04/30/2022.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS IS AN FFY 2021 SECTION 5311 TRIBAL TRANSIT FORMULA APPLICATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $424269 REPRESENTING 100% FEDERAL SHARE OF THE TOTAL ELIGIBLE AMOUNT. THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES TRIBAL TRANSIT FORMULA FUNDS FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO COVER ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS FUEL DRIVER SALARIES AND THIRD- PARTY OPERATOR SERVICES FOR EXISTING AND CIRCULATOR SERVICES.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THIS GRANT WILL BE USED TO COVER OPERATING EXPENSES FOR FY 2024 (OPERATING YEAR 10/01/2023 - 09/30/2024). THE SALAMANCA ROUTE IS EXPECTED TO OPERATE FROM 6:00AM TO 9:30PM MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY AND FROM 9:00AM TO 12:00AM ON SATURDAYS. THERE WOULD BE NO SERVICE ON SUNDAYS. THE ROUTE WOULD EXTEND FROM THE SENECA ALLEGANY COMMUNITY CENTER ON THE WEST TO SULLIVAN HOLLOW ON THE EAST (17 MILE ROUND TRIP WITH 16 STOPS).; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE SENECA TRANSIT SYSTEM (STS) PLANS TO IMPLEMENT A CIRCULATOR SERVICE ON THE ALLEGANY TERRITORY. THE GRANT WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS FUEL DRIVER SALARIES AND THIRD-PARTY CONTRACT OPERATOR SERVICES FOR EXISTING AND CIRCULATOR SERVICES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE TRANSIT RIDERS WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM INCREASED ACCESSIBILITY TO LOCAL SHOPPING EMPLOYMENT AND HEALTHCARE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE AWARDED SUBRECIPIENTS OPERATING ASSISTANCE FUNDING TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR PEOPLE IN THE NON-URBANIZED AREAS OF THE STATE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES FUEL ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR TO CONTINUE SERVICE FOR PEOPLE WITH MOBILITY NEEDS IN THE RURAL AREAS. THIS COVID FUNDING (ARPA) IS AWARDED ALONG WITH CRRSAA FUNDING AND CORE OPERATING ASSISTANCE IN OTHER GRANTS TO SUPPORT THE PERFORMANCE OF PROVIDING OPERATING SERVICES TO ADDRESS THE IMPACTS OF THE PANDEMIC ON THESE SERVICES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT NYSDOT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SERVICE DESPITE THE LOSS IN RIDERSHIP REVENUE AND THE INCREASE COSTS OF FUEL DRIVER RETENTION AND CAPITAL ASSETS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PEOPLE WITH MOBILITY NEEDS IN NON-URBANIZED AREAS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE MAJOR PROJECT IN THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE OPERATING ASSISTANCE BASED ON THE AVAILABLE FUNDING ALLOCATED TO NEW YORK STATE. THERE ARE CURRENTLY 53 AWARDS IN THE RURAL AREA OF NEW YORK STATE. THIS INCLUDES MULTIPLE AWARDS TO SUBRECIPIENTS TO COVER EACH YEAR STARTING WITH 2021 AND USING THE FUNDING TO COVER THE ADDITIONAL COSTS DUE TO THE PANDEMIC. EACH OF THESE AWARDS WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO SUPPORT THE OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO THE SUB-RECIPIENTS TO SUPPORT THE MOBILITY AND NECESSARY SUPPORT TO THE TARGET POPULATION. THE INTERCITY PROJECT WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT TO FOLLOW UP FROM THE CARES FUNDING TO SUPPORT THE 9 INTERCITY CARRIERS IN THEIR RURAL SERVICE. THE RTAP PROJECT WILL HELP PROVIDE TRAINING AND OTHER SUPPORT WORK TO HELP MOVE PAST THE ISSUES THAT SURROUNDED THE PROGRAMS DURING THE PANDEMIC.

THE SENECA NATION SENECA TRANSIT SYSTEM IS APPLYING FOR FY2020 TTP FORMULA LAPSING FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $446717 FOR THE SOUTHERN TIER REGIONAL TRANSIT HUB AND THE ROCHESTER ST BUS GARAGE. THE SENECA TRANSIT SYSTEM (STS) WILL USE THIS GRANT AWARD TO FUND THE REMAINING COSTS OF THE FULL ENGINEERING AND DESIGN OF THE ROCHESTER ST GARAGE PROJECT IN ADDITION TO GRANT AWARD NY-2021-072-00 AS WELL AS THE SOUTHERN TIER REGIONAL TRANSIT HUB GRANT AWARD NY-2021-073-00.THE TOTAL ENGINEERING AND DESIGN COST FOR THE ROCHESTER ST BUS GARAGE PROJECT IS $484198.29.THE TOTAL ENGINEERING AND DESIGN COST FOR THE SOUTHERN TIER REGIONAL TRANSIT HUB IS $478300.PURPOSE: SENECA TRANSIT SYSTEM (STS) PLANS TO CONSTRUCT A NEW TRANSIT HUB ON THE CATTARAUGUS TERRITORY AS WELL AS A BUS STORAGE FACILITY ON THE ALLEGANY TERRITORY TO ENABLE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENTS AND EXPANSION OF TRANSIT SERVICES FOR STS AND REGIONAL PARTNERS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE FUNDING WILL BE USED FOR ARCHITECTURE ENGINEERING AND DESIGN SERVICES OF AN EXISTING BUILDING FOR THE ROCHESTER ST BUS GARAGE LOCATED ON THE ALLEGANY TERRITORY AND ARCHITECTURE ENGINEERING AND DESIGN SERVICES FOR THE SOUTHERN TIER REGIONAL TRANSIT HUB LOCATED ON THE CATTARAUGUS TERRITORY.THESE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE COMPLETION OF DESIGN SCHEMATICS AND CONSTRUCTION PLANS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE FUNDING WILL BE USED FOR DESIGN AND ENGINEERING OF THE ROCHESTER ST GARAGE AND THE SOUTHERN TIER REGIONAL TRANSIT HUB FOR PREPARATION TO OPEN BIDDING FOR CONSTRUCTION DRAWINGS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE TRANSIT RIDERS WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM REDUCED SCHEDULE IMPACTS FOR BUS REPLACEMENT DUE TO LOCAL ACCESS TO WELL MAINTAINED VEHICLES FOR PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICE.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/AREFERENCE FTA CIRCULAR C 9040.1G FOR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION ON INDIAN RESERVATIONS THERE IS NO LOCAL MATCH REQUIREMENT FOR FORMULA FUNDING.

THIS GRANT APPLICATION WILL BE USING LAPSING FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $270000.00 OF FFY 2018 DISCRETIONARY TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM FUNDING (D2018-TRTR-0023. PURPOSE: FUNDS FROM THIS GRANT APPLICATION WILL BE USED TO BUILD A NEW TRANSIT HUB/BUS STORAGE GARAGE ON THE SENECA NATIONS CATTARAUGUS TERRITORY. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE FUNDING FROM THIS APPLICATION WILL BE USE TO DEVELOP PRELIMINARY ENVIRONMENTAL SCREENING CONCEPTUAL DESIGNS ARCHITECTURAL DESIGN ENGINEERING DESIGN CONSTRUCTION DRAWINGS AND BID PACKAGE DOCUMENTS FOR THE SOUTHERN TIER REGIONAL TRANSIT HUB. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE SOUTHERN TIER REGIONAL TRANSIT HUB (STRTH) PROJECT IS TO CONSTRUCT A NEW TRANSIT HUB AND BUS STORAGE FACILITY WILL ENABLE IMPROVEMENTS TO PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROVIDED BY THE SENECA TRANSIT SYSTEM. THE STRTH WILL BE DESIGNED TO SERVE 20-30 CUSTOMERS WAITING AT ONE TIME AND APPROXIMATELY THREE BUSES ARRIVING AT THE SITE AT ANY GIVEN TIME DURING THE DAY. THE STRTH WILL INCLUDE PARKING AREAS FOR VEHICLES AND BUSES PASSENGER TICKETING FUNCTIONS AND PASSENGER AMENITIES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE SOUTHERN TIER REGIONAL TRANSIT HUB (STRTH) WILL SUPPORT THE EXPANSION OF TRANSIT SERVICES FOR THE STS AND REGIONAL PARTNERS. THE TRANSIT HUB PORTION OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL SERVE AS A TRANSFER FACILITY AT WHICH RIDERS WILL BE ABLE TO CONNECT TO BUSES THAT PROVIDE REGIONAL TRANSIT SERVICES INCLUDING; STS CHAUTAUQUA AREA REGIONAL TRANSIT SYSTEM (CARTS) NIAGARA FRONTIER TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (NFTA) COACH USA ALONG WITH CONNECTIONS TO PUBLIC AND PRIVATE TRANSIT PROVIDERS THAT VISIT THE AREA (TOUR BUSSES CASINO/BINGO HALL BUSSES). APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE PYRAMID LAKE PAIUTE TRIBE TRANSIT (PLPTT) OPERATING EXPENSES IN THE AMOUNT OF $62884 AND TO PROVIDE FOR SALARIES AND FRINGE EXPENSES IN THE AMOUNT OF $40000. THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC PLAYED A MAJOR PART IN THE ESCALATION OF FUEL AND SUPPLY PRICES INCREASED VEHICLE REPAIR/MAINTENANCE COSTS AND RISING SALARY AND FRINGE EXPENSES. THE FUNDS WILL ALLOW THE PLPTT TO RECOVER FROM THE BUDGETARY ECONOMIC AND FINANCIAL IMPACTS OF THE PANDEMIC.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE FUNDS THAT ARE CURRENTLY AVAILABLE FOR THE PLPTT WILL BE BUDGETED TO OPERATE TWO (2) TRANSIT BUSES ON AND OFF THE RESERVATION BOUNDARIES. ON AVERAGE THE BUSES DRIVE 156883 MILES A YEAR WITH AN AVERAGE ANNUAL COST OF REPAIR AND MAINTENANCE OF $20000. THE FUNDING WILL ALLOW THE TWO (2) BUSES TO KEEP TO REGULARLY SCHEDULED PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE SCHEDULES AND ADDRESS ANY UNEXPECTED AND NEEDED REPAIRS IN A TIMELY MANNER. THE AVERAGE ANNUAL FUEL COST OF A SINGLE BUS IN OPERATION IS $35000. THE FUNDING WILL ASSIST IN PURCHASING FUEL. SINCE THE PANDEMIC THE INCREASED COST OF LIVING AND JOB COMPETITION WITH LOCAL WAREHOUSE POSITIONS IN WASHOE LYON AND STOREY COUNTIES HAVE CAUSED THE PYRAMID LAKE PAIUTE TRIBE TRANSIT (PLPTT) TO RECLASSIFY AND INCREASE THE PAY OF THE TRANSIT STAFF IN ORDER TO RETAIN TRAINED AND EXPERIENCED STAFF. THE PLPTT CURRENT SALARY AND FRINGE BENEFITS TOTAL $285539 A YEAR. THE FUNDING WILL ASSIST IN PAYING FOR SALARY AND FRINGE BENEFITS TO TRANSIT EMPLOYEES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE EXPECTED OUTCOME OF THE PROJECT IS TO ASSIST THE PLPTT TO FULLY RECOVER FROM THE PANDEMIC EXPAND THE USE OF THE TWO (2) BUSES MITIGATE THE TRANSMISSION OF COVID-19 AND TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE COMPETITIVE SALARY AND FRINGE BENEFITS TO EXISTING EXPERIENCED AND TRAINED TRANSIT OPERATORS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PLPTTS CURRENT AND POTENTIAL FUTURE RIDERSHIP WILL BENEFIT FROM THE CRRSAA ACT FUNDS BY ALLOWING THE PROGRAM TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE CONSISTENT AND RELIABLE SERVICES DUE TO WELL MAINTAINED AND TIMELY REPAIRED VEHICLES. THE PLPTT AND ITS EMPLOYEES WILL BENEFIT FROM THE CRRSAA ACT FUNDS BY BEING ABLE TO PROVIDE COMPETITIVE SALARY AND FRINGE FOR THEIR TRANSIT EMPLOYEES. BOTH THE PLPTT EMPLOYEES AND RIDERSHIP WILL BENEFIT FROM THE CRRSAA ACT FUNDS BY PROVIDING CLEANING SUPPLIES TO AID IN THE MITIGATION OF COVID-19.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.

THIS APPLICATION TO REQUEST FY2021 SECTION 5311-TRIBAL TRANSIT COMPETITIVE PROGRAM OPERATING ASSISTANCE APPOINTED TO FALLON PAIUTE SHOSHONE TRIBE NEVADA IN THE AMOUNT OF $244747.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS APPLICATION IS TO ASSIST WITH OPERATING COSTS FOR ONE-YEAR. THE ESTIMATED START DATE IS 02/01/2022 AND END DATE IS 01/30/2023. TTP FUNDING WILL ASSIST THE PROGRAM TO CONTINUE THE OPERATING COSTS UTILIZING ITS TWO TRIBAL TRANSIT BUSSES. OPERATING COST INCLUDE; PERSONNEL FRINGE BENEFITS TRAVEL TRAINING SUPPLIES AND OTHER COSTS. THE TTPS CURRENT OFFICE HOURS ARE 8:00A.M. 5:00P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. THE TTP WOULD LIKE TO EXPAND ITS HOURS OF OPERATION TO 6:00A.M. 6:00P.M. MON. THROUGH FRI. TO ACCOMMODATE TRANSIT NEEDS. THE CURRENT TRANSIT RIDERS ARE REQUESTING THE PROGRAM MEET THESE HOURS OF OPERATION FOR WORK AND MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS. MANY OF THESE PEOPLE ARE RELYING SOLELY ON THE TTP FOR RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION TO AND FROM WORK. BY EMPLOYING ONE MORE TRANSIT DRIVER THE ROUTE WILL BE DOUBLED AND MEET THE NEEDS OF THE RIDERSHIP. A KEY COMPONENT OF THE TRIBAL TRANSIT SYSTEM IS THE CONNECTING SERVICE TO THE CHURCHILL AREA REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION (CART) BUS SYSTEM THAT SERVES THE GREATER FALLON METROPOLITAN AREA. CART IS A LOCAL PARTNER OPERATES 10 CITY BUSES AND PROVIDES PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION TO MOST AREAS IN FALLON (CHURCHILL COUNTY). CART HOURS OF OPERATION ARE MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY 7:00AM 5:00PM. THE TTP WILL UTILIZES THEIR TWO 14-PASSENGER CUTAWAY VEHICLES TO OPERATE THEIR DEVIATED FIXED ROUTE/COMMUTER SERVICE. THE BUSSES WILL CONTINUES TO PROVIDE TRIBAL MEMBERS ACCESS TO TRIBAL PROGRAMS AND TO LOCAL AREAS WITHIN THE CITY OF FALLON FOR WORK SHOPPING HEALTH AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES AND MEDICAL RELATED APPOINTMENTS. THE TRIBES JURISDICTION INCLUDES THE RESERVATION (8500+ACRES) THE INDIAN COLONY (60 ACRES) AND FOX PEAK BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT SITES (40 ACRES). CURRENTLY THERE ARE 1446 PEOPLE LIVING ON THE RESERVATION AND 125 PEOPLE LIVING ON THE INDIAN COLONY WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM THE CONTINUATION OF THE TTP. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: COMPLETE NEW FTA APPLICATION IN TRAMS BY FEB. 1 2022COMPLETE TRAVEL ARRANGEMENTS TO ATTEND THE SWTA/TTA WORKSHOP BY FEB. 1 2022HIRE ONE FULL-TIME BUS DRIVE BY MARCH 20 2022 COMPLETE TRAVEL ARRANGEMENTS TO ATTEND STIP GRANT WORKSHOP BY TBDUPDATE FOUR (4) POLICY PROCEDURES HANDBOOK BY MAY 1 2022HIRE CONSULTANT TO COMPLETE LONG RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLAN BY MAY 20 2022APPLY FOR THE FTA BUS BUSSES FACILITIES GRANT BY JUNE 1 2022 BEGIN CLOSEOUT OF THE FTA TTP GRANT BY JAN. 30 2023 EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE OUTCOMES OF HAVING THIS GRANT APPLICATION APPROVED WILL BE TO IMPROVE THE TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM BY RETAINING CURRENT EMPLOYEES IMPROVE SERVICES BY HIRING ANOTHER TRANSIT DRIVER EXPANDING HOURS OF OPERATION FROM 8:00A.M. 5:00P.M. TO 6:00A.M. 6:00P.M. MON. THROUGH FRI. TO ACCOMMODATE CURRENT TRANSIT NEEDS. ATTEND THE SWA/TTA WORKSHOP TO HELP IMPROVE SERVICES. UPDATE THE POLICY AND PROCEDURES HANDBOOK TO REFLECT FTA AND TRIBAL TTP CURRENT RULES AND REGULATIONS. COORDINATE WITH THE TRIBES BUREAU OF INDIAN AFFAIRS ROADS DEPARTMENT TO DEVELOP THE TRIBES LONG-RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLAN BY PROJECT END. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFITS OF THIS GRANT AWARD WILL IMPROVE THE TTP BY RETAINING ITS EMPLOYEES AND EXPAND THE HOURS OF THE WEEKDAY ROUND-TRIPS TO ACCOMMODATE RIDERSHIP TO AND FROM WORK MEDICAL AND OTHER APPOINTMENTS RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES AS WELL AS SHOPPING IN FALLON. A DEVIATED FIXED ROUTE WILL OFFER FLEXIBILITY TO SERVE MORE PATRONS ON THE FIXED ROUTE AND EXPANDS THE SERVICE COVERAGE OF THE TRIBAL TRANSIT SYSTEM. AN ON-DEMAND SERVICE WOULD ALLOW SCHEDULING OF FLEXIBLE TRIPS FOR THOSE INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE NOT ABLE TO RIDE THE NORMAL BUS SCHEDULE. SINCE THE TTP HAD EXPANDED ITS TRANSIT SERVICES BY PURCHASING A NEW BUS IN FY2021 THE PROGRAM HAS IMPROVED ITS TRANSIT SERVICES BY MORE THAN 50%. THE TTP INTENDED BENEFITS INCLUDE EXPANDING HOURS OF OPERATION BY THREE HOURS TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE PEOPLE USING TRIBAL TRANSIT BUSSES. MANY RESIDENTS CURRENTLY COMMUTE DAILY FROM THE RESERVATION TO WORK TO THE TRIBAL ADMINISTRATIVE COMPLEX AS WELL AS TO THE FALLON TRIBAL HEALTH CLINIC WHICH IS LOCATED NEAR THE TRIBAL ADMINISTRATION FACILITY THEREFORE REDUCING GAS EMISSION. WITH DEPENDABLE COURTEOUS TRANSIT SERVICE MOST EMPLOYEES NOW HAVE THE OPTION OF COMMUTING ON THE PUBLIC TRANSIT SYSTEM CUTTING THEIR TRANSPORTATION COSTS. THE TRIBES NEW HEALTH WELLNESS CENTER HAS BEEN OPEN FOR A YEAR AND IS LOCATED ON THE RESERVATION. THE FALLON BUSINESS COUNCIL HAS APPROVED STAFF TO LEAVE 1 HOURS DURING LUNCH TO USE THIS FACILITY TO BECOME HEALTHIER. THOSE EMPLOYEES WHO DO NOT HAVE TRANSPORTATION ARE ABLE TO RIDE THE TRANSIT BUSSES TO THIS LOCATION EFFORTLESSLY TO AND FROM THEIR WORKSITES. THE TRIBAL PROGRAMS THAT CURRENTLY PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICE TO TRIBAL MEMBERS ARE THE TRIBAL HEALTH CLINIC SENIOR CENTER YOUTH FAMILY SERVICES AND THE COMMUNITY LEARNING CENTER. THESE PROGRAMS MET IN FY 2020 AND CONSOLIDATED THEIR CURRENT TRANSPORTATION SERVICES NEEDS WITH THE TTP. THE CONSOLIDATION OF TRANSPORTATION NEEDS HAVE HELPED AVOID DUPLICATION OF SERVICES WHILE MAINTAINING THE CURRENT DEGREE OF SERVICES TO PEOPLE. IN 2020 ALL OF THE TRIBAL PROGRAMS HAVE HAD TO ADJUST TO NEW MEDICAL NEEDS DURING COVID-19. MANY TRIBAL MEMBERS WERE HOMEBOUND ISOLATED AND NEEDING ASSISTANCE. AS SOON AS THE FALLON BUSINESS COUNCIL GAVE THE TTP THE GO AHEAD IN FEB. 2021 TO RESTART THE TTP BUS SERVICE UP AGAIN THEY HAVE CONTINUED TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO OUR RURAL RESERVATION. IT IS VITAL THAT THE TTP CONTINUE TO PROVIDE OPERATING TRANSIT SERVICES TO PEOPLE WHO ARE IN NEED OF THIS PROGRAM. THIS APPLICATION IS FOR FY2021 TRIBAL FORMULA FOR CONSTRUCTION OF A ADMIN/STORAGE FACILITY FOR $112145 ADDITIONAL FUNDS TO GO TOWARDS THE FY2017 5339(B) BUS AND BUS FACILITIES CAPITAL CONSTRUCTION ADMIN/MAINTENANCE/STORAGE FACILITY. THE TRANSIT FACILITY WHICH WILL MEET TRANSIT NEEDS OVER AT LEAST A 20-YEAR LIFE PERIOD TO AVOID PUBLIC INVESTMENT IN A FACILITY THAT QUICKLY BECOMES OBSOLETE OR INSUFFICIENT. PROJECT CONSTRUCTION WILL BE IMPLEMENTED UPON AWARD IN JANUARY 2018 AND WILL BE COMPLETED BY SEPTEMBER 1 2023. THERE IS NO REQUIRED MATCH FOR THIS GRANT.THE PYRAMID LAKE PAIUTE TRIBE IS LOCATED THIRTY FIVE MILES NORTHEAST OF RENO NEVADA IN A REMOTE DESERT AREA LOCATED IN THREE COUNTIES: WASHOE LYON AND STOREY. THE AREA OF THE RESERVATION CONTAINS 475000 ACRES OR 742.2 SQUARE MILES. OUT OF THIS ACREAGE APPROXIMATELY 112000 ACRES COVER THE SURFACE OF A TERMINAL DESERT LAKE PYRAMID LAKE. PYRAMID LAKE IS ONE OF THE MOST VALUABLE ASSETS OF THE TRIBE AND IS ENTIRELY ENCLOSED WITHIN THE BOUNDARIES OF THE RESERVATION. AS OF FEBRUARY 2017 LIVING ON THE RESERVATION WERE 1300 INDIVIDUALS 634 MALES AND 666 FEMALES. APPROXIMATE NUMBERS INCLUDE 32.69% RESIDING IN NIXON 10% RESIDING IN SUTCLIFFE AND 57.31% RESIDING IN WADSWORTH. THE PYRAMID LAKE PAIUTE TRIBE HAS APPROXIMATELY 2288 ENROLLED MEMBERS. THE MAJORITY OF ENROLLED TRIBAL MEMBERS RESIDE ON THE RESERVATION WITH APPROXIMATELY 12% OF THIS MEMBERSHIP RESIDING IN OTHER AREAS THROUGHOUT THE WESTERN UNITED STATES. THE PYRAMID LAKE PAIUTE TRIBE HAS A 56% EMPLOYMENT RATE AND A 44% UNEMPLOYMENT RATE. THE MAJORITY OF THE RESERVATION RESIDENT POPULATION ARE YOUNG COMPRISED OF INDIVIDUALS UNDER THE AGE OF THIRTY-FIVE (35) YEARS. THE MEDIAN AGE IS TWENTY-TWO (22) YEARS. THE PYRAMID LAKE PAIUTE TRIBE OPERATES THE TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM. SERVICES ARE OPERATED MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY EXCEPT ON TRIBAL HOLIDAYS. TWO ROUTES ARE OPERATED. THE NIXON/WADSWORTH/SUTCLIFFE/FERNLEY ROUTE OPERATES BETWEEN 5:20 AM AND 7:00 PM. THIS ROUTE STARTS IN NIXON HEADING FIRST TO WADSWORTH AND THEN OPERATES BACK AND FORTH BETWEEN WADSWORTH AND SUTCLIFFE (VIA NIXON) BEFORE ENDING THE SERVICE DAY IN NIXON ON A RETURN TRIP FROM WADSWORTH. A TOTAL OF FOUR DAILY ROUND-TRIPS ARE OPERATED BETWEEN NIXON AND WADSWORTH ALONG WITH THREE DAILY ROUND-TRIPS BETWEEN NIXON AND SUTCLIFFE. THE WADSWORTH/RENO ROUTE OPERATES BETWEEN WADSWORTH SPARKS RENO AND FERNLEY IN THE SPARKS/RENO AREA; THIS ROUTE SERVES THE SPARKS CITICENTER (WHERE TRANSFERS ARE POSSIBLE TO MANY WASHOE RTC CITIFARE ROUTES) AS WELL AS THE RENO-SPARKS INDIAN COLONY THE ITCN/WELFARE DWSS CENTER IN SPARKS AND THE LEGENDS COMMERCIAL CENTER. THE TWO ROUTES ARE SCHEDULED TO PROVIDE DIRECT BUS-TO-BUS TRANSFERS IN WADSWORTH (AT THE WADSWORTH COMMUNITY BUILDING) SIX TIMES OVER THE COURSE OF THE DAY.THE PROGRAM PROVIDES A TOTAL OF 4416 PASSENGER-TRIPS PER YEAR OR AN AVERAGE OF APPROXIMATELY 18 TRIPS PER DAY. THIS REPRESENTS A CONTINUING INCREASE SINCE THE INCEPTION OF THE SERVICE. OF TOTAL RIDERSHIP 84% CONSISTS OF NON-ELDERLY ADULTS 13% ARE CHILDREN AND 4% ARE ELDERS. LESS THAN 1% BOARD USING A WHEELCHAIR.THE SERVICE TRAVELS 113500 MILES PER YEAR ON THE RENO/WADSWORTH ROUTE AND 103500 MILES PER YEAR ON THE NIXON/WADSWORTH ROUTE FOR A TOTAL OF 217000 VEHICLE-MILES PER YEAR. THE BASE FARE IS $1.00 PER ONE-WAY TRIP WITH A MONTHLY PASS AVAILABLE FOR $45.00. ELDERS (AGE 60 AND UP) CHILDREN AGES 6 - 17 AND STUDENTS CAN RIDE FOR HALF-FARE.THE TRANSIT PROGRAM IS PART OF THE TRIBAL TRANSPORTATION PLANNING DEPARTMENT. THE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING DEPARTMENT CONSISTS OF TWO STAFF MEMBERS: A TRANSPORTATION PLANNER AND AN ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT. IN ADDITION TO THE TRANSIT PROGRAM THIS DEPARTMENT WORKS TO IMPLEMENT TRANSPORTATION PROJECTS ACROSS THE RESERVATION COORDINATES FUNDING FOR IMPROVEMENTS CONDUCTS TRANSPORTATION STUDIES AND ALSO MANAGES PROGRAMS PROMOTING CHILD CAR SEATS AND PEDESTRIAN SAFETY. THE TRANSIT STAFF CONSISTS OF THE TRANSIT MANAGER A TRANSIT DISPATCH SPECIALIST AND FOUR DRIVERS AND 2-3 ON-CALL OPERATORS.THE TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM HAS BEEN FULLY FUNCTIONAL/IN OPERATION AS OF MAY 18 2015. THE PROPOSED PYRAMID LAKE PAIUTE TRIBAL TRANSIT FACILITY PROJECT IS DESIGNED TO MAXIMIZE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF THE TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM WITH A TRANSIT FACILITY FOR ADMINISTRATION AND OPERATION TO MEET THE FUTURE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITIES AND THE AREAS TO BE SERVED AND TO ENHANCE THE MOBILITY OF TRIBAL MEMBERS BY PROVIDING INCREASED ACCESS TO VITAL SERVICES WITHIN THE AREAS TO BE SERVED.NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES APPLIED.

ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE PUEBLO OF ZUNI A:SHIWI TRANSIT UTILIZING $185921.00 FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE WHICH ARE EXPENSES DIRECTLY RELATED TO SYSTEM OPERATIONS AT A MINIMUM THIS INCLUDES SALARIES AND FRINGE BENEFITS FOR DRIVERS DISPATCHERS TRANSIT SUPERVISORS FUEL OIL LICENSES FACILITIES NEEDS AND VEHICLE MAINTENANCE.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: OUR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM IS DESIGNED TO ASSIST RIDERS BY IMPROVING ACCESS TO COMMUNITY HEALTH EMPLOYMENT EDUCATIONAL AND RECREATIONAL FACILITIES WITHING THE SERVICE AREA. PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS CREATE THE FOUNDATION ON WHICH OUR AREA CAN BECOME MORE LIVABLE AND PROSPEROUS IN A VARIETY OF WAYS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: OUR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION OPERATIONS WILL PROVIDE THE MEMBERS OF THE PUEBLO OF ZUNI AND THE SURROUNDING AREA WITH SAFE AND RELIABLE SERVICE TO ACCESS DESTINATIONS TO HEALTH CARE FACILITIES SHOPPING EDUCATION RECREATION PUBLIC SERVICE AND EMPLOYMENT ENTITIES.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE PUEBLO OF ZUNI A:SHIWI TRANSIT COORDINATES PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES WITH OTHER PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROGRAMS WITHIN SOUTHWEST NEW MEXICO. THESE PARTNERS ARE THE GALLUP EXPRESS NAVAJO TRANSIT SYSTEM TOGETHER WE OFFER A COMPREHENSIVE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION OPTION TO ACCESS EDUCATIONAL EMPLOYMENT AND LEISURE OPPORTUNITIES OUTSIDE OF OUR SERVICES AREAS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: FUNDS EXPENDED FOR CONTRACTUAL TRANSIT SERVICES FROM THE CRRSAA PROGRAM TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE A DEMAND RESPONSE TRANSIT SERVICE AND THE ALBUQUERQUE TRANSIT CENTER ROUTE 208 TO BE OPERATED FOR THE BENEFIT OF PUEBLO OF ISLETA COMMUNITY MEMBERS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: A DEMAND RESPONSE TRANSIT SERVICE AND THE ALBUQUERQUE TRANSIT CENTER ROUTE 208 TO BE OPERATED FOR THE BENEFIT OF PUEBLO OF ISLETA COMMUNITY MEMBERS. THE SERVICES WILL PROVIDED BY RIO METRO REGIONAL TRANSIT DISTRICT (RMRTD) BY MEANS OF A MEMORANDUM OF AGREEMENT (MOA) BETWEEN PUEBLO OF ISLETA AND RMRTD.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: CONTINUED DEMAND RESPONSE TRANSIT SERVICE AND THE ALBUQUERQUE TRANSIT CENTER ROUTE 208 PROVIDED BY RIO METRO REGIONAL TRANSIT DISTRICT (RMRTD) BY MEANS OF A MEMORANDUM OF AGREEMENT (MOA) BETWEEN PUEBLO OF ISLETA AND RMRTD. TO CONTINUE THE RIO METRO REGIONAL TRANSIT DISTRICT DIAL-A-RIDE SERVICE WITHIN THE PUEBLO OF ISLETA AND TO NEARBY DESTINATIONS AS A RESERVATION-ONLY SERVICE THAT OPERATES ON WEEKDAYS AND IS AVAILABLE TO PEOPLE TRAVELING WITHIN THE PUEBLO OF ISLETA INCLUDING TRIPS TO THE ABQ RIDE ROUTE 53 BUS STOP ON NM 314 AND ANY DESTINATION WITHIN THE LIMITS OF LOS LUNAS BOSQUE FARMS AND PERALTA. TO CONTINUE BUS ROUTE 208 WHICH PROVIDES THREE NORTHBOUND AND THREE SOUTHBOUND TRIPS MORNING/MIDDAY BETWEEN VALENCIA COUNTY THE PUEBLO OF ISLETA AND DOWNTOWN ALBUQUERQUE WHEN THE RAIL RUNNER DOES NOT OPERATE.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE DEMAND RESPONSE TRANSIT SERVICE AND THE ALBUQUERQUE TRANSIT CENTER ROUTE 208 ARE OPERATED FOR THE BENEFIT OF PUEBLO OF ISLETA COMMUNITY TO PROVIDE MOBILITY ACCESSIBILITY AND A HIGHER QUALITY OF LIFE FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

FY 2021 MESCALERO APACHE TRIBE -TRIBAL TRANSIT DISCRETIONARY ARP GRANT D2022-RPTC-012 - OPERATING ASSISTANCETHIS IS AN FFY 2021 SECTION 5311-10B ARP OPERATING ASSISTANCE FUNDING APPLICATION FOR THE MESCALERO APACHE TRIBE IN THE AMOUNT OF $294647 REPRESENTING 100% FEDERAL SHARE OF THE TOTAL ELIGIBLE AMOUNT. THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES ARP FUNDING TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS. THE APPLICATION SCOPE OF WORK INCLUDES OPERATING ASSISTANCE.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO ASSIST WITH OPERATING EXPENSES ON BEHALF TO THE MESCALERO APACHE TRIBE FOR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: IT WILL PROVIDE OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO INCLUDE EXPENDITURES SUCH AS DRIVERS OPERATIONAL AND ROUTE SUPERVISOR DISPATCHERS TRAINER/MAINTAINER JANITOR SALARIES BENEFITS FUEL OIL LUBE TIRES VEHICLE MAINTENANCE VEHICLE INSURANCE AND GPS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: OPERATIONAL FUNDING WILL HELP SUPPLEMENT THE (638) ROADS FUND THAT THE TRIBE HAS BEEN CURRENTLY USING TO PAY THE SUBSIDY FOR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR FUNDING TO BE PUT BACK INTO THE ROADS FUND FOR MAINTENANCE AND REPAIRS OF ROADS ON THE RESERVATION.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE ARP GRANT WILL BE THE MESCALERO APACHE TRIBE. THIS PANDEMIC HAS HIT THE MESCALERO APACHE TRIBE VERY HARD ECONOMICALLY THE OPERATIONAL FUNDING WILL BENEFIT THE ENTIRE TRIBE AS A WHOLE.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE MESCALRO APACHE TRIBE IS THE DIRECT RECIPIENT THERE ARE NO SUB RECIPIENTS. WE CERTIFY THAT THE MAT OR ZTRANS OUR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROVIDER HAS NOT FURLOUGHED ANY EMPLOYEES AT ALL DURING THIS PANDEMIC.PER ARP OPERATING ASSISTANCE IN THIS APPLICATION IS NOT REQUIRED TO BE PROGRAMMED IN THE LONG-RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLAN STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION PLAN OR STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM .THE MAT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THE GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.

FY 2021 MESCALERO APACHE TRIBE -TRIBAL TRANSIT DISCRETIONARY GRANT D2022-TRTR-024. THE TOTAL DISCRETIONARY GRANT AWARD IS $276421 FOR PASSENGER SHELTERS AND SUPPORT MAINTENANCE VEHICLE. THE ELIGIBLE FEDERAL SHARE FOR THIS GRANT IS 100% THERE IS NO LOCAL MATCH REQUIRED. PURPOSE: THE MESCALERO APACHE TRIBE APPLIED AND WAS AWARDED THIS DISCRETIONARY GRANT FOR SUPPORT MAINTENANCE VEHICLES AND BUS STOP SHELTERS. THE SUPPORT MAINTENANCE VEHICLES INCLUDE A KUBOTA M6-141DTC-F TRACTOR MOWER AND LAYMOR SWEEPER TO MOW AND SWEEP THE RIGHTS OF WAY OF ROADS. TEN (10) TOLAR PASSENGER BUS STOP SHELTERS TO PROTECT TRIBAL MEMBERS WHILE WAITING FOR THE BUS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE TRIBE WILL PURCHASE A NEW MOWER AND SWEEPER. WE WILL PURCHASE 10 NEW PASSENGER BUS STOP SHELTERS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE MOWER AND SWEEPER WILL BE PURCHASED AND USED TO ALLOW SAFER ACCESS FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS AT BUS STOP SITES AND WILL INCREASE TRAFFIC VISIBILITY ON THE ROADWAYS. DILAPIDATED SHELTERS THAT WERE GIVEN TO THE TRIBE YEARS AGO NEED TO BE REPLACED. THEY ARE LOCATED ON THE RIGHT OF WAYS THE NEW SHELTERS WILL REPLACE THE OLD ONES. SOME STOPS DO NOT EVEN HAVE A SHELTER. BECAUSE OF THE HARSH CLIMATE ELEMENTS RAIN SNOW AND HEAT IN RURAL NEW MEXICO MOUNTAINS THE SHELTERS WILL MAKE IT BEARABLE FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS TO WAIT SAFELY AND COMFORTABLY FOR THE NEXT BUS. THIS GRANT WILL ALLOW THE PURCHASE OF THE NEW BUS STOP SHELTERS TO REPLACE THE OLD ONES. THE MESCALERO APACHE TRIBE ROADS DEPARTMENT WILL TAKE CARE OF THE REMOVAL OF THE OLD SHELTERS AND THE INSTALLATION OF THE NEW SHELTERS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE GRANT WILL BE THE MESCALERO APACHE TRIBAL MEMBERS. BY HAVING NEW BUS STOP SHELTERS TRIBAL MEMBERS CAN WAIT SAFELY AND COMFORTABLY FOR THE NEXT BUS. THE RIGHTS OF WAY WILL BE MOWED AND GROOMED SO THAT THE TRIBAL MEMBERS ARE SAFE FROM SNAKES AND OTHER WILD ANIMALS. TRIBAL MEMBERS DONT HAVE TO WORRY ABOUT THE BUS OR OTHER ON-COMING TRAFFIC NOT SEEING THEM AS THEY WALK ON THE SHOULDER AND WAIT FOR THE BUS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVTIES: THE MESCALERO APACHE TRIBE IS THE DIRECT RECIPIENT THERE ARE NO SUB RECIPIENTS.PROJECT 1: THE BREAKDOWN BY ALI IS AS FOLLOWS:BUDGET ACTIVITY LINE ITEM 11.42.11: PURCHASE A KABOTA M6-141 DTC-F TRACTOR MOWER AND LAMOR SM450-ST SWEEPER ($186721) START DATE: 8-1-2022 GET UPDATED QUOTES/BIDS - PURCHASE DATE: 9-1-2022 ISSUE PURCHASE ORDER - END DATE: 12-1-2022 PICK UP EQUIPMENT - FINAL REPORT: 3-31-2023. ACCORDING TO THE WEBSITE THE MESCALERO POPULATION IS 5130. OF THOSE THE ETHNICITY CONSISTS OF AMERICAN INDIAN 95% AND HISPANIC OR LATINO 5%. APPROXIMATELY 31% OF TRIBAL MEMBERS LIVE BELOW THE FEDERAL POVERTY LINE. PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IS AN ESSENTIAL SERVICE TO TRIBAL MEMBERS AND IS PROVIDED TO THE MESCALERO APACHE TRIBE BY ZTRANS THE LOCAL PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROVIDER. PURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT THE TRIBES PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION ENDEAVORS DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THIS WILL BE DONE THROUGH FINANCIALLY SUPPORTING PART OF THE MESCALERO APACHE TRIBES SHARE OF OPERATING EXPENDIUTRES. THIS FUNDING WAS ALLOCATED TO THE MESCALERO APACHE TRIBE THROUGH ARPA FORMULA FUNDS MARCH 11 2021. THE ARPA AS PART OF THE SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS IS ALLOCATED TO SUPPORT THE TRANSIT INDUSTRY DURING THE COVID-19 PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION FOR THE MESCALERO APACHE TRIBE WILL BE PROVIDED MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY FROM 6AM TO 7:30PM EXCEPT ON LISTED HOLIDAYS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:BY USING THE ARPA GRANT FUNDING FOR EXPENDITURES IT WILL REDUCE THE (638) ROAD FUND WHICH MESCLAERO IS HAVING TO USE AS THEIR SUBSIDY FOR THE SERVICE. THIS WILL ENABLE THE TRIBE TO UTILIZE THE (638) ROAD FUND ON THEIR ROADS. THE ARPA FUNDING WILL BE USED FOR TRANSPORTATION OPERATING EXPENDIUTURES BEGINNING OCTOBER 1 2021. THE ARPA FUNDING WILL HELP THE MESCALERO APACHE TRIBE SUBSIDIZE THEIR TRANSPORTATION SERVICE. TRANSPORTATION IS PROVIDED THROUGH THE LOCAL TRANSPORTATION PROVIDER ZIA THERAPY CENTER INC. (ZTRANS). ZIA THERAPY CENTER INC. IS ALSO MESCALERO APACHE TRIBES REP TO DESIGNATED/DIRECT RECIPIENT.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: MESCALERO APACHE TRIBAL MEMBERS WILL REAP THE BENEFITS BY HAVING ACCESS TO PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION FOR EMPLOYMENT MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS GROCERY SHOPPING TRANSPORTATION TO SECONDARY EDUCATION AT NMSU-A IN ALAMOGORDO AND NMSU IN LAS CRUCES NEW MEXICO. ADDITIONALLY THE TRIBES INFASTRUCTURE WILL BENEFIT AS THE ARPA GRANT WILL ALLEVIATE THE USE OF A PORTION OF THE (638) ROAD FUND FOR THE RESERVATIONS MUCH NEEDED ROAD IMPROVEMENTS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.ARPA OPERATING DATES IN THIS APPLICATION DO NOT OVERLAP WITH PREVIOUS AWARDS.

THE PUEBLO OF LAGUNA HAS BEEN AWARDED FY13 $109689 AND FY14 $94301 MAP-21 FORMULA FUNDS. A TOTAL OF $203990.THIS PROJECT IS AN OPERATIONAL ENHANCEMENTREQUEST FOR THE CURRENT PUEBLO OF LAGUNA SHAASRKA TRANSIT PUBLIC 5311 PROGRAM OPERATIONS. THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL ENHANCE THE CURRENT TRANSIT SYSTEM BY PROVIDING A FTE MANAGER TO SUPPORT THE OPERATIONS-MANAGEMENT FUNCTIONS OF THE TRANSIT SYSTEM AND A FTE CERTIFIED MECHANIC TO SUPPORT THE FLEET OPERATIONS-MAINTENANCE AND REPAIR FUNCTION OF THE TRANSIT SYSTEM. THE FTE STAFF REQUESTED WILL BE PLACED ORGANIZATIONALLY WITHIN THE TRANSIT PROGRAM TO PROVIDE DIRECT DAY TO DAY OVERSIGHT SUPPORT MANAGEMENT AND OVERSIGHT TO KEY FUNCTIONS OF THE SYSTEM. THE PROPOSED ENHANCEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE OVERALL TRANSIT SYSTEM BY ENSURING ON-GOING CONSISTENT MANAGERIAL SUPPORT OF THE PROGRAM OPERATIONS IS AVAILABLE. THE CURRENT PHASE OF THE TRANSIT SYSTEM IS INCREASING IN COMPLEXITY RIDERSHIP NUMBERS VEHICLE OPTION TYPES AND USER ABILITY; THE FUTURE PLANS OF THE TRANSIT ALLOW INCLUDE THE EXPANSION OF TRANSIT.OVERALL THIS SYSTEM OPERATIONAL ENHANCEMENT WILL ALLOW THE TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAMS TO BEGIN TO WORK STRATEGICALLY TOWARDS EXPANSION OF THE CURRENT SERVICES AND ROUTES WITHIN THE NEXT 1 TO 3 YEARS. THE INCLUSION OF A FTE MANAGER WILL AID THE LONG TERM STRATEGIC DEVELOPMENT OF THE NEXT PHASE OF THE TRIBAL TRANSIT PLAN. THE INCLUSION OF THE FTE CERTIFIED MECHANIC WILL ENHANCE THE SYSTEM BY ENSURING READILY ACCESSIBLE QUALITY REPAIRS AND MAINTENANCE IS AVAILABLE FOR THE TRANSIT VEHICLES.

NJ TRANSIT IS REQUESTING $4587171.00 FOR RURAL PROGRAMS WHICH INCLUDES $4455014.00 FOR FY 2020 SECTION 5311 NON-URBANIZED AREA FORMULA PROGRAM AND $132157.00 FOR FY 2020 5311(B)(3) RURAL TRANSIT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (RTAP). THIS GRANT WILL BE MATCHED WITH $1002379 LOCAL FUNDS BRINGING THE GRANT TOTAL TO $5589550. THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT THE PURCHASE OF 26 ACCESSIBLE VEHICLE FOR ELEVEN (11) RURAL SUBRECIPIENTS. ALSO INCLUDED ARE FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $148230 FOR FORCE ACCOUNT ROLLING STOCK INSPECTIONS AT THE ASSEMBLY PLANT AND FINAL BUY-OFF $445500FOR STATE ADMINISTRATION AND $132157 RTAP FUNDING FOR TRAINING. VEHICLES PURCHASES WILL HELP SUPPORT ELEVEN (11) SUB-RECIPIENTS OPERATIONS IN RURAL AREAS OF NEW JERSEY. ALL SUB-RECIPIENTS INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT HAVE MET ALL THE FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS (CATEGORY A). AFTER FTA APPROVES THIS GRANT APPLICATION NJ TRANSIT WILL FUND THE PURCHASE OF ACCESSIBLE VEHICLES TO BE USED IN THE SUBRECIPIENTS SERVICES AS OUTLINED IN THIS APPLICATION. SUB-RECIPIENTS RECEIVING EXPANSION VEHICLES CAN HOUSE AND MAINTAIN THE NEW VEHICLES. HOUSING THE VEHICLES DOES NOT MEAN THE VEHICLE IS INSIDE A GARAGE. IN MOST CASES THE VEHICLE IS STORED ON COUNTY/MUNICIPALITY PROPERTY IN AN OUTSIDE LOT ADJACENT TO A MAINTENANCE FACILITY. NJ TRANSIT WILL PURCHASE THE VEHICLES FOR THE SUB-RECIPIENTS. NJ TRANSIT WILL CONDUCT PRE-AWARD AND POST-DELIVERY AUDITS.TITLES TO THE VEHICLES WILL BE IN THE NAME OF THE SUB-RECIPIENT WITH NJ TRANSIT LISTED AS THE FIRST LIEN HOLDER AND PHYSICALLY HOLDING THE TITLE. WHEN THE FEDERAL INTEREST HAS EXPIRED THE LIENS WILL BE RELEASED AND TITLES WILL BE TURNED OVER TO THE SUBRECIPIENT. IN ACCORDANCE WITH FTA REGULATIONS NJ TRANSIT WILL RELEASE THE LIEN ON THE TITLE WHEN A VEHICLE MEETS ITS DEFINED USEFUL LIFE AND IS THEREFORE NO LONGER AN ASSET WITH FEDERAL INTEREST.SATISFACTORY CONTINUING CONTROL NJ TRANSIT WILL MAINTAIN THE REQUIRED SATISFACTORY CONTINUING CONTROL OVER THE VEHICLE AWARDS THROUGH PROJECT ADMINISTRATION REGULAR ON-SITE VEHICLE INSPECTIONS AND PROGRAM AUDITS. NJ TRANSIT WILL ALSO MAINTAIN AN INVENTORY OF ALL FEDERALLY FUNDED VEHICLES AND ENSURE THAT ALL REQUIREMENTS ARE IDENTIFIED IN THE SUB-RECIPIENTS CONTRACT. WHEN THE FEDERAL INTEREST HAS EXPIRED ON VEHICLES THE LIEN WILL BE RELEASED AND THE TITLE WILL BE TURNED OVER TO THE SUB-RECIPIENTS.RTAP PROGRAM WILL FUND THE DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROJECTS TO MEET THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF SUB-RECIPIENTS IN RURAL AREAS OF THE STATE.STATE ADMINISTRATION FOR NJ TRANSIT STAFF TO OVERSEE DAY-TO-DAY MANAGEMENT OF ACTIVITIES INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO FEDERAL OVERSIGHT AND COMPLIANCE FTA AND NTD REPORTING REQUIREMENTS GRANT APPLICATION AND AGREEMENT DEVELOPMENT FINANCE REIMBURSEMENTS GRANT CLOSEOUTS ON-SITE REVIEWS AND PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO THE SUB-RECIPIENTS AS NEEDED.COORDINATIONALL COUNTIES HAVE DEVELOPED AND SUBMITTED PUBLIC TRANSIT HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION COORDINATION PLANS AND THESE PROJECTS ARE DERIVED FROM THOSE LOCALLY DEVELOPED PLANS. RESERVATION AND SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES IN THE KNOX COUNTY AREAS.FUNDING:FFY 2019: $14432 FFY 2020: $29108TOTAL BUDGETED AMOUNT: $43540THE TTP FORMULA PROGRAM IS 100% FEDERALLY FUNDED; THERE IS NO LOCAL MATCH REQUIREMENT FOR SECTION 5311 TTP FORMULA FUNDS FTA CIRC. 9040.1G PAGE X-3 #8 MATCHING REQUIREMENTS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ALL ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER WAGES FRINGE BENEFITS FUEL MAINTENANCE ETC. TO CONTINUE TRANSIT OPERATIONS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:FUNDING WILL PERMIT THE S.S.N. TO CONTINUE PROVIDING TRANSIT OPERATIONS THAT WOULD OTHERWISE HAVE TO BE CUT DUE TO LACK OF FUNDING.THE TRANSIT PROGRAM PROVIDES TRANSPORTATION FOR LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS OF THE VILLAGE OF SANTEE AND GENERAL PUBLIC WHO CURRENTLY HAVE NO MEANS OF TRANSPORTATION TO GET TO THEIR EMPLOYMENT. TRANSPORTATION WILL BE PROVIDED BY THE SSN TO SUCH AREAS AS NIOBRARA CENTER CREIGHTON BLOOMFIELD WINNETOON NEBRASKA AND YANKTON SD.THIS SERVICE WILL PROVIDE ACCESS TO JOBS HEALTH/MEDICAL SERVICES COLLEGE AND OTHER MAJOR SERVICES. WITH THE SSN EXPANDING MORE TRIBAL BUSINESSES THIS CREATE MORE EMPLOYMENT FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS AND NEBRASKA INDIAN COMMUNITY COLLEGE OFFERING AND ADDING MORE CLASSES STUDENT ENROLLMENT HAD A BIG INCREASE FOR THIS YEAR. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: S.S.N. TRANSIT PERSONNEL AND ULTIMATELY TRANSIT RIDERS. THE TRANSIT SYSTEM PROVIDES TRANSPORTATION FOR LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS OF THE SSN RESERVATION AND NEARBY COMMUNITIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:N/ATHERE IS NO STIP REQUIREMENT FOR SECTION 5311 TTP FORMULA FUNDS FTA CIRC. 9040.1G PAGE X-3 #10. STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (STIP) AND/OR TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (TIP) REQUIREMENT

PURPOSE - INTERCITY BUS (ICB);TO PROVIDE FUNDS TO CONTINUE AND POSSIBLY EXPAND ICB OPERATIONS AND ROUTES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED - ICB:- SUPPORT THE CONNECTION BETWEEN NONURBANIZED AREAS AND THE LARGER REGIONAL AND NATIONAL SYSTEM OF ICB SERVICE.- SUPPORT SERVICE TO MEET THE INTERCITY TRAVEL NEEDS OF RESIDENTS IN NONURBANIZED AREAS.- SUPPORT THE INFRASTRUCTURE OF THE ICB NETWORK THROUGH PLANNING AND MARKETING ASSISTANCE AND CAPITAL INVESTMENT IN FACILITIES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES - ICB:FTA ENCOURAGES STATES TO USE THIS FUNDING (UNDER U.S.C. 5311(F)) TO SUPPORT THESE NATIONAL OBJECTIVES AS WELL AS PRIORITIES DETERMINED BY THE STATES. GIVEN THE AVAILABLE FUNDING IT IS EXPECTED THAT ICB OPERATIONS IN NEBRASKA IS AND WILL BE OPTIMIZED. THIS IS AN EXPECTED OUTCOME. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES - ICB:THE PRIMARY BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF NONURBANIZED AREAS TRAVELING TO URBANIZED AREAS. ALSO RESIDENTS OF URBANIZED MAY MORE EASILY TRAVEL TO NONURBANIZED AREAS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES - ICB:TO CONTINUE TO OPERATE EXISTING ICB ROUTES AND PERHAPS EXPAND ICB ROUTES OR ADD NEW ONES.ICB FUNDING: NDOTS FY2019 ANNUAL 5311 APPORTIONMENT AMOUNTED TO $8879328. INTERCITY BUS ACTIVITIES IN THE AMOUNT OF $916303 WERE PROGRAMMED IN NE-2019-013. THIS GRANT WILL PROGRAM $836288 FOR INTERCITY BUS ACTIVITIES WHICH EXCEEDS THE 15% REQUIREMENT (19.74% TOTAL PROGRAMMED FOR FY19). SEE THE UPLOADED POP FOR MORE DETAILS ABOUT FUNDING. NEBRASKAS GOVERNOR CERTIFIES THAT THE ICB SERVICE NEEDS OF THE STATE ARE BEING ADEQUATELY MET FOR FY2021-23. (SEE UPLOADED LETTER OF CERTIFICATION.)PURPOSE - RURAL TRANSIT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (RTAP):RTAP (UNDER 49 U.S.C. 5311 (B)(3)) PROVIDES A SOURCE OF FUNDING TO ASSIST IN THE DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROJECTS AND OTHER SUPPORT SERVICES TAILORED TO MEET THE NEEDS OF TRANSIT IN NONURBANIZED AREAS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED - RTAP:CONDUCT TRAINING PROGRAMS AND PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE. EXPECTED OUTCOMES - RTAP:SUBRECIPIENTS STAFF MEMBERS WILL CONTINUE TO BE TRAINED AND LEARN THE SKILLS NEEDED FOR TRANSIT OPERATIONS. TECHNOLOGICAL ADVANCES IN TRANSIT WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE TOO.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES - RTAP:DIRECT BENEFICIARIES WILL BE THE SUBRECIPIENTS HAVING THEIR STAFF MEMBERS TRAINED AND HAVE ACCESS TO TECHNOLOGICAL ASSISTANCE. INDIRECT BENEFICIARIES WILL BE THE RIDERSHIP OF RURAL TRANSIT AGENCIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES - RTAP:STAFF OF SUBRECIPIENTS WILL PARTICIPATE IN THE TRAINING THAT IS NEEDED. ALSO SUBRECIPIENTS WILL CONTINUE TO ACCESS TECHNOLOGICAL ASSISTANCE.FUNDING FOR THIS RTAP COMES APPORTIONMENTS OF FY 2020 FOR $148125 AND FY 2021 OF $148125. TOTAL FEDERAL FUNDS FOR THIS GRANT TOTAL $1132538. SEE THE POP FOR MORE DETAILS ON THIS FUNDING.LOCAL MATCH FOR LOCAL GOVERNMENTS OR NONPROFITS IS PAID BY THE STATE OF NEBRASKA (ICB ONLY). LOCAL MATCH OF FOR PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS WILL COME FROM THEIR OWN WORKING CAPITAL. THE MOST RECENT STIP HAS BEEN UPLOADED ALONG WITH ITS ONEDOT APPROVAL LETTER. NEBRASKAS LONG RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLAN VISION 2032 HAS BEEN UPLOADED AS WELL.PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY IS NEEDED FOR INTERCITY BUS BUT NOT RTAP FUNDS.CERTIFICATIONS AND ASSURANCES FOR NDOT ARE ON FILE WITH THE FTA.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: NDDOT APPLIES FFY2022 5311 RURAL APPORTIONMENT IN THE PARTIAL AMOUNT OF $7296401. NDDOT HAS SUBALLOCATED $53766 TO TURTLE MOUNTAIN TO COME IN DIRECTLY TO FTA (SUBALLOCATION LETTER ATTACHED UNDER APPLICATION DOCUMENTS). THIS AWARD ALSO INCLUDES THE FULL FY2022 SECTION 5311 RTAP FUNDS FOR NDDOT IN THE AMOUNT OF $117492 (FEDERAL). LOCAL MATCH FUNDING SOURCES ARE STATE AID TRIBAL FUNDS MILL LEVY AND FUNDRAISING.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: PROJECT 1: STATE OR PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION FOR TRANSIT STAFF SALARIES TRAINING BLACKCAT SOFTWARE CONTRACT DRUG ALCOHOL CONSULTANT AND VEHICLE/FACILITY INSPECTION CONSULTANT. PROJECT 2: RTAP FOR TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOR RURAL TRANSIT AGENCIES PROJECT 3: OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR RURAL TRANSIT AGENCIES PROJECT 4: PROJECT ADMINISTRATION FOR RURAL TRANSIT AGENCIES PROJECT 5: INTERCITY BUS - OPERATING ASSISTANCE PROJECT ADMINISTRATION/PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE PROJECT 6: PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE/CAPITAL FOR RURAL TRANSIT AGENCIES; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING TO PROVIDE OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO RURAL AND INTERCITY BUS TRANSIT AGENCIES WHO PROVIDE AND COORDINATE WITH NEIGHBORING TRANSIT AGENCIES TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION IN THEIR COMMUNITIES. THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER GENERAL ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSE SUCH SALARIES MARKETING EXPENSES INSURANCE PREMIUMS OR PAYMENTS OFFICE SUPPLIES FACILITIES AND EQUIPMENT RENTAL STANDARD OVERHEAD RATES AND COST OF ADMINISTERING DRUG AND ALCOHOL TESTING. FUNDING WILL ALSO PROVIDE FOR INTERCITY BUS PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE. FUNDING WILL BE PROVIDED FOR RURAL TRANSIT AGENCIES TO ATTEND IN-STATE AND OUT-OF-STATE TRAINING. THIS REQUEST WILL ALSO FUND THE DAKOTA TRANSIT ASSOCIATION FOR PLANNING AND HOSTING THE ANNUAL CONFERENCE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO TRANSIT AGENCIES WEBSITE DEVELOPMENT TRAINING AND BOARD MEMBER TRAVEL AND ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS. FUNDING REQUESTED IS FOR TRANSIT STAFF SALARIES TRAINING BLACKCAT SOFTWARE CONTRACT A DRUG ALCOHOL CONSULTANT THE VEHICLE/FACILITIES INSPECTION CONSULTANT.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: RURAL AND INTERCITY BUS TRANSIT AGENCIES STAFF AND RURAL TRANSIT RIDERS THROUGHOUT NORTH DAKOTA.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: RURAL AND INTERCITY BUS TRANSIT AGENCIES THROUGHOUT NORTH DAKOTA WILL RECEIVE FUNDS FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE PROJECT ADMINISTRATION EXPENSES PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE AND TRAINING.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: FFY 2021 5311 TTP FORMULA FUNDS ARE TO OPERATE AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICES ON AND NEAR THE STANDING ROCK INDIAN RESERVATION DURING THE PERIOD OF JANUARY 1 2024 TO DECEMBER 31 2024.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE ELIGIBLE OPERATING AND PROJECT ADMINISTRATION EXPENSES.1) OPERATING ASSISTANCE - INCLUDES DRIVER AND DISPATCHER SALARIES FUEL PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR AND OTHER EXPENSES NECESSARY TO CONTINUE TRANSIT SERVICES.2) PROJECT ADMINISTRATION TO COVER INDIRECT COSTS AT A RATE OF 20.5%.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL ALLOW THE STANDING ROCK PUBLIC TRANSIT PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN TRANSIT SERVICES ON AND NEAR THE STANDING ROCK RESERVATION IN NORTH-CENTRAL SOUTH DAKOTA AND SOUTH-CENTRAL NORTH DAKOTA.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE RESIDENTS ON AND NEAR THE STANDING ROCK INDIAN RESERVATION.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST FFY 2020 SECTION 5311 TTP FUNDS APPORTIONED TO STANDING ROCK TRIBE (NORTH DAKOTA UZA 380000) IN THE AMOUNT OF $479789 (FULL APPORTIONMENT) REPRESENTING 100% FEDERAL SHARE OF THE TOTAL ELIGIBLE AMOUNT. THESE ARE LAPSING FUNDS. PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY HAS BEEN SELECTED. PURPOSE: FFY 2020 5311 TTP FORMULA FUNDS ARE TO OPERATE AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICES ON AND NEAR THE STANDING ROCK INDIAN RESERVATION DURING THE PERIOD OF JULY 1 2022 TO SEPTEMBER 30 2023.THE APPLICATION SCOPE OF WORK INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING PROJECTS:1) OPERATING ASSISTANCE - ADDITIONAL COSTS FOR FUEL - PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY IS BEING USED STARTING JULY 1 THROUGH THE EXECUTION OF GRANT OF APPROXIMATELY $3000.2) PROJECT ADMINISTRATION - HIRING EXECUTIVE ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT UTILITY COSTS AND INDIRECT COSTS. PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY IS BEING USED STARTING JULY 1 THROUGH THE EXECUTION OF GRANT OF APPROXIMATELY $1000.3) CAPITAL - PURCHASE OF FOUR (4) 14-PASSENGER WHEELCHAIR CUTAWAY VEHICLES - PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY IS BEING USED STARTING AUGUST 1 2022 THROUGH THE EXECUTION OF GRANT TO BEGIN PURCHASING PROCESS BUT NO FUNDS HAVE BEEN EXPENDED.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDING WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE OPERATING PROJECT ADMINISTRATION AND CAPITAL EXPENSES TO INCLUDE HIRING ONE FULL-TIME EXECUTIVE ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT/DATA CLERK INCREASED COSTS FOR FUEL AND UTILITY EXPENSES FOR EXISTING SERVICES AND TO PURCHASE FOUR 14-PASSENGER WHEELCHAIR CUTAWAYS. (FUEL AND UTILITY EXPENSES ON THIS APPLICATION ARE SUPPLEMENTARY EXPENSES NOT INCLUDED ON THE CRRSSA GRANT - FAIN ND-2021-008-00 (JAN 1 2022 - DEC 31 2022) AND ARP GRANT - FAIN: ND-2022-005-00 (JAN 1 2023 - DEC 31 2023)). EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL ENABLE THE STANDING ROCK PUBLIC TRANSIT PROGRAM TO PAY FOR HIGHER FUEL COSTS IMPROVE THEIR DATA COLLECTION REPORTING AND PLANNING CAPABILITIES AND TO REPLACE FOUR VEHICLES TO PROVIDE SAFE AND EFFECTIVE TRANSIT SERVICES FOR THE STANDING ROCK INDIAN RESERVATION.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: RESIDENTS ON AND NEAR THE STANDING ROCK INDIAN RESERVATION IN NORTH DAKOTA AND SOUTH DAKOTA WILL BENEFIT FROM THESE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES.

TRIBAL TRANSIT FUNDING WILL BE USED TO PURCHASE THREE (3) ACCESSIBLE MINI-VANS FOR REPLACEMENT OF THREE (3) EXISTING NON-EMERGENCY MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION VEHICLES THAT HAVE MET THEIR USEFUL LIFE OF 4 YEARS. NEMT TRANSPORTATION IN OUR GEOGRAPHICAL AREA OFTEN REQUIRES THE USE OF SMALLER VEHICLES TO GAIN ACCESS TO PASSENGER PICK-UP AND DROP OFF LOCATIONS AS LTVS CANNOT ACCESS THESE AREAS. USEFUL LIFE FOR THE SMALLER REPLACEMENT VAN IS 4 YEARS OR 100000 MILES. REPLACEMENT OF THESE VEHICLES IS ALSO AN EFFORT TO MEET AND MAINTAIN STATE OF GOOD REPAIR. THE START DATE FOR THIS FUNDING WILL BE 10/1/2020 AND END DATE IS 9/30/2023.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR THE COMMONWEALTH OFFICE OF TRANSIT AUTHORITY (COTA) IN ORDER TO CONTINUE ITS EXISTING PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR THE COMMONWEALTH OF THE NORTHERN MARIANA ISLANDS (CNMI). FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED WITH THIS GRANT ARE TO CONTINUE TO EXECUTE THE DEMAND-RESPONSIVE SHARED-RIDE SERVICE WHILE ALSO RESURRECTING THE FIXED-FLEX ROUTE ON THE ISLAND OF SAIPAN CNMI. OTHER ACTIVITIES INCLUDE RESPONDING TO CORONAVIRUS SUCH AS VACCINATION TRANSPORTS QUARANTINE TRANSPORTS ETC.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE TO PROVIDE ALTERNATE FORMS OF TRANSPORTATION AND PROVIDE ACCESSIBILITY INTO OUR COMMUNITY - MOST ESPECIALLY FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES THE ELDERLY AND PEOPLE WITH MEDICAL CONDITIONS AND REDUCE THE SPREAD OF CORONAVIRUS IN THE CNMI COMMUNITY.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE CNMI COMMUNITY; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: COTA DOES NOT HAVE ANY SUB-RECIPIENTS AND DOES NOT INTEND TO SUB-AWARD FUNDS.

RURAL AREA FORMULA PROGRAM (49 U.S.C. 5311) OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR FISCAL YEAR 2013 (10/1/12 TO 9/30/2013) FROM THE FEDERAL REGISTER OF OCTOBER 16 2012 PROVIDES APPORTIONMENTS FOR FTA FORMULA PROGRAMS IN FULL AMOUNTS OF THE FUNDING LEVELS UNDER CONTINUING RESOLUTION 2013 (CR) (PUB. L. 112-175). THE GRANT APPLICATION ALSO INCLUDES A NON-ADD SCOPE REFLECTING AN ESTIMATE OF THE REMAINING 50 PERCENT OF THE FISCAL YEAR FUNDING FROM 49 U.S.C. 5311. THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO ALLOW COTA TO CONTINUE WITH ITS PLAN TO LAUNCH ITS FIRST OF ITS KIND FIXED-FLEX ROUTE AND PARA-TRANSIT SERVICE AND TO MEET CHANGES IN DEMAND INCLUDING BUS AND BUS FACILITIES CONSTRUCTION OF ITS MAINTENANCE REPAIR STORAGE FACILITY. THIS WILL ALSO ALLOW COTA TO PLAN PROPERLY AND PROVIDE SAFE EFFICIENT EFFECTIVE FLEXIBLE AND RESPONSIVE TRANSIT SERVICES THAT MEET THE PUBLIC TRANSIT DEMAND BUT MOST ESPECIALLY THOSE WITH DISABILITIES AND THE ELDERLY REQUIRING SPECIALIZED SERVICES FROM A PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM.CONSOLIDATED GRANT APPLICATION INCLUDE $291706.00 FOR SECTION 5311 FUNDS FOR NON-URBANIZED AREA FORMULA ASSISTANCE PROGRAM; $14295.00 FOR SECTION 5311(B)(3); $11057.00 FOR SECTION 5310; AND $499000.00 FOR SECTION 5339 FOR A TOTAL OF $816058.00 TO SECTION 5311 GRANT PROGRAM.FTA CIRCULAR 9040. 1F CHAPTER 111-5 SECTION 1E AND 48 U.S.C. 5311 - EMERGENCY RELIEF FUNDS FOR COVID 19 THIS APPLICATION IS APPLYING FOR $500000 OF FY2019 5311 FUNDS THAT WERE DE-OBLIGATED FROM FORMULA 5311 FUNDING IN GRANT MO-2019-024. WE REQUESTED TO TRANSFER THE $500000 FROM THE REGULAR 5311 TO 5311 EMERGENCY RELIEF FUNDING AT 100% FEDERAL PARTICIPATION. THE EMERGENCY RELIEF FUNDS FOR COVID 19 OPERATING EXPENSES WILL COVER A PERIOD THAT BEGAN AFTER JANUARY 20 2020. THESE FUNDS WILL ONLY BE USED FOR EXPENSES DIRECTLY RELATED TO COVID 19 EMERGENCY RELIEF. PURPOSE OF AWARD:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE EXTRA OPERATING FUNDING TO OUR 5311 RURAL PROVIDERS FOR 100% - COVID-19 ER RESPONSE FUNDING. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO TRANSIT BUS DRIVER BARRIERS THAT HAVE BEEN OR WILL BE INSTALLED ON CUTAWAY BUSES PPE (FACEMASKS GLOVES) ENHANCED CLEANING AND SANITIZING SUPPLIES STAFF WAGES OUTSIDE CONTRACT SERVICES FUEL EQUIPMENT AND PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT SERVICE CHANGES SPECIFICALLY RELATED TO EMERGENCY RESPONSE.OUTCOMES:THE OUTCOMES WILL BE CLEANER BUSES AND A SAFER ENVIRONMENT FOR ALL THE PASSENGERS. BENEFICIARIES:THE BENEFICIARIES WOULD BE TRANSIT RIDERS THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF MISSOURI. THESE FUNDS WILL HELP INCREASE RIDERSHIP AND PROMOTE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IN THE STATE OF MISSOURI. MODOT HAS INVOICES TO PAY FOR SEVERAL SUB RECIPIENTS INCLUDING SMTS $300000 OATS $150000 AND CAPE GIRARDEAU COUNTY TRANSIT $50000 FOR ER OPERATING ACTIVITIES. MISSOURI DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.
