APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE LEECH LAKE TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM (LLTP) WILL USE THE TOTAL FY21 SECTION 5311(C) ARPA APPORTIONMENT OF $103660 TO CONTINUE OPERATING PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES ON THE LEECH LAKE INDIAN RESERVATION FROM JULY 1 2023 TO JUNE 30 2024. RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES ARE INTEGRAL FOR THE COMMUNITY TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS BY PROVIDING INCREASED ACCESS TO HEALTH AND WELLNESS CENTERS DAILY NUTRITION AND HOUSEHOLD SANITATION SUPPLIES.OPERATING ASSISTANCE WILL BE USED PRIMARILY TO FUND DRIVER WAGES FRINGE BENEFITS FUEL AND APPLICABLE INDIRECT COSTS. THE TOTAL COST OF THIS PROJECT IS $103660. THE FEDERAL SHARE IS 100%.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: LLTP WILL PROVIDE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION TO DESTINATIONS WITHIN THE LEECH LAKE INDIAN RESERVATION AND UP TO 25 MILES BEYOND THE EXTERIOR BOUNDARIES.LLTP WILL OPERATE TWO DEVIATED ROUTES TO DESTINATIONS BEYOND THE EXTERIOR BOUNDARIES OF THE RESERVATION. ONE ROUTE WILL TRAVEL FROM THE INTERIOR OF THE RESERVATION TO THE CITY OF BEMIDJI (MN). THE OTHER TRAVELS FROM THE INTERIOR OF THE RESERVATION TO THE CITY OF GRAND RAPIDS (MN). BOTH DESTINATIONS ARE CONSIDERED REGIONAL ACTIVITY CENTERS WHERE RESERVATION CITIZENS CAN ACCESS SPECIALTY SERVICES MUNICIPAL OFFICES AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES THAT ARE NOT AVAILABLE IN THEIR LOCAL COMMUNITIES. THE DEVIATED SERVICE IS PROVIDED MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY BETWEEN THE HOURS OF 7:00 AM AND 5:00 PM. EACH ROUTE OFFERS A MORNING AND AFTERNOON DEPARTURE. ADDITIONALLY LLTP WILL OPERATE SEVEN DIRECT RESPONSE ROUTES (DIAL-A-RIDE) TO DESTINATIONS WITHIN THE EXTERIOR BOUNDARIES OF THE RESERVATION AND UP TO 25 MILES BEYOND. THE DIRECT RESPONSE SERVICE IS PROVIDED MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY BETWEEN THE HOURS OF 5:00 AM AND 9:00 PM. LLTP SHALL MAINTAIN AND REPORT SERVICE DATA SPECIFIC TO EACH MODE TO THE NATIONAL TRANSIT DATABASE (NTD): UNLINKED PASSENGER TRIPS (UPTS) VEHICLE REVENUE HOURS (VRHS) VEHICLE REVENUE MILES (VRMS) AND VEHICLES OPERATED IN MAXIMUM SERVICE (VOMS).LLTP SHALL SUBMIT IN TRAMS THE REQUIRED MILESTONE PROGRESS REPORTS (MPRS) AND FEDERAL FINANCIAL REPORTS (FFRS) FOR THIS AWARD WHEN DUE.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WILL HELP INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES REDUCE TRANSPORTATION BARRIERS AND ACHIEVE THE FOLLOWING BENEFITS:IMPROVED ACCESS TO HIGH QUALITY FOOD AND NUTRITIONEXPANDED EMPLOYMENT AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIESENHANCED PARTICIPATION IN HEALTH AND WELLNESS PROGRAMSINCREASED ACCESS TO GOODS AND SPECIALTY SERVICES EXTENDED CONTACT WITH FAMILY AND SOCIAL GROUPSPARTICIPATION IN CULTURAL AND RELIGIOUS ACTIVITIES ADDITIONALLY THIS PROJECT WILL HELP THE COMMUNITY PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS BY ASSURING REGULAR ACCESS TO THE BENEFITS LISTED ABOVE.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT RESIDENTS AND FAMILIES THAT LIVE ON THE LEECH LAKE INDIAN RESERVATION. AS OF THE 2020 DECENNIAL CENSUS APPROXIMATELY 11400 PEOPLE RESIDE ON THE LEECH LAKE RESERVATION. ACCORDING TO THE U.S. CENSUS BUREAUS 2021 AMERICAN COMMUNITY SURVEY 5-YEAR ESTIMATES RESERVATION FAMILIES CONSIST OF 4400 HOUSEHOLDS.THE MEDIAN AGE OF THE RESERVATION POPULATION IS 38.4 YEARS. CHILDREN UNDER 18 REPRESENT 28.3% OF THE TOTAL POPULATION. 19.9% OF THE POPULATION IS OVER 65. THE RESERVATIONS AVERAGE FAMILY SIZE IS 3.36 AND THE MEDIAN HOUSEHOLD INCOME IS JUST UNDER $56000 COMPARED TO $70000 IN THE U.S. OVERALL. 18.8% OF THE RESERVATION POPULATION IS AT OR BELOW THE POVERTY THE LEVEL AND 41.7% PERCENT OF HOUSEHOLDS WITH CHILDREN IN THE HOME ARE LOW INCOME. ACCORDING THE LLTP 2020 TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT PLAN 44% OF TRANSIT USERS HAVE NO ACCESS TO VEHICLES 35% CANNOT OR DO NOT DRIVE AND 25% USE THE TRANSIT SERVICE TO SAVE MONEY.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.

PURPOSE: IMPLEMENTATION OF COMPUTER AIDED DISPATCH SYSTEM AND MOBILE INFORMATION UNITS IN THE BUSES ALONG WITH RADIO COMMUNICATION SYSTEM WITH RADIOS IN EACH BUS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE BOIS FORTE BAND OF CHIPPEWA WILL UTILIZE $318000 IN FY21 5311 TRIBAL TRANSIT COMPETITIVE FUNDING TO INSTALL A NEW RADIO COMMUNICATIONS SYSTEM. THE PROJECT INVOLVES THE IMPLEMENTATION OF COMPUTER AIDED DISPATCH AND MOBILE INFORMATION UNITS ON ALL BUSES AND THE PURCHASE OF NEW RADIO EQUIPMENT. NO LOCAL SHARE IS REQUIRED UNDER THE FY21 TRIBAL TRANSIT COMPETITIVE PROGRAM. EQUIPMENT AND SOFTWARE WILL HAVE A USEFUL LIFE OF 4 YEARS. THIS PROJECT FROM IMPLEMENTATION TO COMPLETION SHOULD BE ABLE TO BE DONE WITHIN A TWELVE-MONTH PERIOD PLUS THE SUPPORT SERVICES WILL GO FOR THREE YEARS WITH TRAINING AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE ACQUISITION OF RADIO COMMUNICATIONS BETWEEN THE BUSES AND A BASE STATION IN DISPATCH WILL GREATLY ENHANCE THE TRANSIT SERVICES BOTH DURING REGULAR SERVICE HOURS AND DURING AN EVACUATION EVENT. THE ABILITY TO COMMUNICATE WITH THE DRIVER DURING A ROUTE FOR UP TO DATE CHANGES IN CUSTOMER SERVICE LAST MINUTE PASSENGER PICKUPS AND DROP OFFS AND MID-ROUTE RIDER RESPONSE WILL ENHANCE OUR SERVICES WE PROVIDE.WHEN THERE IS AN EVACUATION ALL RESPONDING PERSONNEL RESPONDING INCLUDING BIG WOODS TRANSIT EVACUATION BUSES WILL BE ON THE 800MHZ RADIOS ON THE WORKING CHANNEL ASSIGNED TO THE INCIDENT BY THE STATE OF MINNESOTA WHICH WOULD INCREASE COMMUNICATION EFFICIENCY AND CLARITY FOR EVERYONE INVOLVED.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: GREATER SAFETY AND SECURITY FOR DRIVERS AND RIDERS ABILITY TO UNDERTAKE TRANSIT RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE BOIS FORTE EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT PLAN INCREASED SERVICE RESPONSIVENESS AND RELIABILITY FOR RIDERS LOWER COSTS AND DECREASED WASTE FROM GOING PAPERLESS AND INCREASED CAPACITY OF BIG WOODS TRANSIT TO RESPOND TO DEMAND FOR SERVICES.NO SUBRECIPIENTS.ATTACHMENTS TO THIS APPLICATION INCLUDE FY21 PROJECT SELECTION DOCUMENTATION

PURPOSE: THIS GRANT UTILIZES $373435 IN FY2021 5311 TRIBAL TRANSIT COMPETITIVE PROGRAM FUNDS TO UNDERTAKE THE SELECTED PROJECT PROPOSAL. THIS PROJECT IS FUNDED 100% FEDERAL SHARE. NO LOCAL SHARE REQUIRED. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE TRANSIT SERVICE WILL PURCHASE FIVE NEW BUSES TO REPLACE RETIRED BUSES. NEW BUSES WILL IMPROVE THE FLEET RELIABILITY AND REDUCE OVERALL COSTS FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL YEARS OF OPERATING THE PROGRAM.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS GRANT WILL ENSURE FLEET IS IN GOOD REPAIR. THIS PROJECT ENSURES CONTINUED RELIABLE DEMAND-RESPONSE WEEKDAY SERVICE ON THE FOND DU LAC RESERVATIONINTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE FOND DU LAC RESERVATION AND THE RIDING PUBLIC. NEW PURCHASES WILL ENSURE ACCESSIBILITY FOR RIDERSHIP. NEW PURCHASES WILL ENSURE HANDICAPPED ACCESSIBILITY BY HAVING HANDICAPPED LIFTS INSTALLED IN EACH BUS PURCHASED. NO SUBRECIPIENTS.IN EXECUTING THIS GRANT THE FOND DU LAC RESERVATION AGREES TO ABIDE BY SECTION 3011 OF THE FAST ACT (49 U.S.C. 5323(J)(2)(C) REGARDING THE PHASED INCREASE IN DOMESTIC CONTENT UNDER THE BUY AMERICA STATUTE FOR ROLLING STOCK.AS GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDES AN FTA-FUNDED TRANSIT VEHICLE PURCHASE RECIPIENT AGREES TO COMPLY WITH THE RELATED REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN 49 CFR 26.49(A). SPECIFICALLY RECIPIENT MUST ENSURE AS A CONDITION OF BEING AUTHORIZED TO BID OR PROPOSE ON FTA-ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS THAT EACH TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER CERTIFIED THAT IT COMPLIED WITH DOT REQUIREMENTS FOR SUBMITTING A DBE PROGRAM AND GOAL TO FTA PRIOR TO BIDDING. RECIPIENT IS ALSO REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE NAME OF THE SUCCESSFUL BIDDER AND THE TOTAL DOLLAR VALUE OF THE CONTRACT WITHIN 30 DAYS OF MAKING AN FTA- ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE AWARD USING THE REQUIRED FTA REPORTING TOOL. RECIPIENT UNDERSTANDS THAT FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS MAY RESULT IN FORMAL ENFORCEMENT ACTION OR APPROPRIATE SANCTION AS DETERMINED BY FTA INCLUDING REIMBURSEMENT OF FTA FUNDS USED FOR THE VEHICLE PROCUREMENT.ATTACHMENTS TO THIS APPLICATION INCLUDE THE FY21 TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM PROJECT SELECTION NOTICE

BUDGET REVISION #1:THIS REVISION WILL REMOVE THE PURCHASE OF ONE (1) BATTERY ELECTRIC BUS FOR ARROWHEAD TRANSIT AND INCREASE THE COST OF THE REMAINING BUS; TRANSFER FUNDS FROM THE ARROWHEAD TRANSIT PROJECT TO THE CITY OF MORRIS PROJECT TO ALLOW FOR THE PURCHASE OF ONE (1) ADDITIONAL CHARGING STATION WITH ASSOCIATED FACILITY ELECTRICAL UPGRADES FOR ARROWHEAD TRANSIT THAT WAS NOT INCLUDED IN THE ORIGINAL APPLICATION; AND INCREASE THE LOCAL MATCH FOR ARROWHEAD TRANSIT PROJECTS FROM 20% TO 35% AND INCORPORATE ADDITIONAL REQUIRED PROJECT MATCH THAT WAS NOT REFLECTED IN THE ORIGINAL PROJECT APPLICATION. THIS REVISION WILL ALSO EXTEND THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE END DATE TO 03/30/2028 TO ALLOW ONE ADDITIONAL YEAR FOR THE DELIVERY OF THE BUSES DUE TO NATIONWIDE INDUSTRY MANUFACTURING DELAYS.ORIGINAL APPLICATION: THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE $625472 OF FFY2022 SURFACE TRANSPORTATION BLOCK GRANT PROGRAM (STBGP) FUNDS TO PURCHASE THREE (3) SMALL (LESS THAN 30 FT.) BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES CHARGING STATIONS AND INDOOR FACILITY ELECTRICAL UPGRADES FOR MORRIS TRANSIT AND ARROWHEAD TRANSIT IN RURAL MINNESOTA. LOCAL MATCHING FUNDS WILL BE PROVIDED BY THE STATE OF MINNESOTA; AND TRANSIT SYSTEM RESERVE FUNDS. IN EXECUTING THIS GRANT THE MNDOT AGREES TO ABIDE BY SECTION 3011 OF THE FAST ACT (49 U.S.C. 5323(J)(2)(C) REGARDING THE PHASED INCREASE IN DOMESTIC CONTENT UNDER THE BUY AMERICA STATUTE FOR ROLLING STOCK.AS GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDES AN FTA-FUNDED TRANSIT VEHICLE PURCHASE RECIPIENT AGREES TO COMPLY WITH THE RELATED REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN 49 CFR 26.49(A). SPECIFICALLY RECIPIENT MUST ENSURE AS A CONDITION OF BEING AUTHORIZED TO BID OR PROPOSE ON FTA-ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS THAT EACH TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER CERTIFIED THAT IT COMPLIED WITH DOT REQUIREMENTS FOR SUBMITTING A DBE PROGRAM AND GOAL TO FTA PRIOR TO BIDDING. RECIPIENT IS ALSO REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE NAME OF THE SUCCESSFUL BIDDER AND THE TOTAL DOLLAR VALUE OF THE CONTRACT WITHIN 30 DAYS OF MAKING AN FTA- ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE AWARD USING THE REQUIRED FTA REPORTING TOOL. RECIPIENT UNDERSTANDS THAT FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS MAY RESULT IN FORMAL ENFORCEMENT ACTION OR APPROPRIATE SANCTION AS DETERMINED BY FTA INCLUDING REIMBURSEMENT OF FTA FUNDS USED FOR THE VEHICLE PROCUREMENT.-PURPOSE: THE STBPG FUNDS WERE AWARDED FOR PROJECT APPLICATIONS SUBMITTED TO THE MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (MNDOT) OFFICE OF SUSTAINABILITYS CLEAN TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM WHICH PROVIDES GRANTS TO PILOT TEST AND INCREASE ADOPTION OF CLEAN TRANSPORTATION TECHNOLOGIES ESPECIALLY WHERE COST IS A BARRIER TO IMPLEMENTATION. THE OVERALL PROGRAM GOAL IS TO DEMONSTRATE THE POTENTIAL OF INNOVATIVE CLEAN TRANSPORTATION TECHNOLOGIES TO REDUCE GREENHOUSE GAS (GHG) EMISSIONS FROM THE TRANSPORTATION SECTOR IN MINNESOTA AND HELP THE STATE MEET OUR STATUTORY GHG REDUCTION GOALS IN THE NEXT GENERATION ENERGY ACT. -ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: PURCHASE OF THREE LESS THAN 30 FT. BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES AND THREE CHARGING STATIONS. INSTALLATION OF ADDITIONAL ELECTRICAL INFRASTRUCTURE INSIDE OF EXISTING TRANSIT FACILITIES TO RETROFIT THE FACILITIES CURRENT ELECTRICAL DESIGN TO BE COMPATIBLE WITH THE CHARGING STATION NEEDS.-EXPECTED OUTCOMES: SUCCESSFUL PROJECTS WILL INCORPORATE RESILIENT DESIGN FEATURES; BE RESPONSIVE TO ECONOMIC DISRUPTIONS; EXPAND ACCESS TO CLEAN TRANSPORTATION TECHNOLOGIES ESPECIALLY IN SMALLER AND/OR RURAL COMMUNITIES; AND BRING EQUITY IN USER BENEFITS ESPECIALLY FOR COMMUNITIES OF COLOR AND LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS.-INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: TRANSIT RIDERS AND CITIZENS IN THE COMMUNITIES OF NORTHEASTERN MINNESOTA AND THE CITY OF MORRIS MINNESOTA WILL BEGIN THE RECOGNIZE THE BENEFITS OF CLEAN TRANSPORTATION. THE STATE OF MINNESOTA WILL BENEFIT FROM A REDUCTION OF GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS.-SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE SUBRECIPIENTS OF FUNDS FOR THIS GRANT WILL WORK WITH MNDOT AND CONSULTANTS TO PURCHASE SMALL ELECTRIC BUSES AND INSTALL CHARGING STATIONS IN EXISTING FACILITIES.

THIS IS AN FFY 2021 SECTION 5311 AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN ACT (ARPA) APPLICATION BY THE STATE OF MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (MNDOT) IN THE AMOUNT OF $9357149. THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES ARPA FUNDING TO ASSIST IN THE PREVENTION OF PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS AND SUBSEQUENT ECONOMIC RECOVERY. THE APPLICATION SCOPE OF WORK INCLUDES RURAL OPERATING EXPENSES STATE PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION AND RURAL TRANSIT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (RTAP). $9357149 REPRESENTS A REQUEST FOR 100% OF THE STATES NON-INTERCITY BUS OPERATING FUNDS 83% OF THE STATE PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION AND 100% OF THE RTAP APPORTIONMENT. MNDOT ANTICIPATES THE BALANCE OF INTERCITY BUS RELATED ARPA APPORTIONMENTS TO BE REQUESTED IN A FUTURE GRANT AMENDMENT APPLICATION. MNDOT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY. NO STIP OR LOCAL MATCH IS REQUIRED. A COMPLETE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS HAS BEEN ADDED TO THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS.

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST SECTION 5311 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE STATE OF MAINE IN THE AMOUNT OF $8830583 THROUGH THE AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN ACT OF 2021 (ARP). ON MARCH 11 2021 PRESIDENT BIDEN SIGNED THE ARP TO SUPPORT PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS AS THEY CONTINUE TO RESPOND TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.SECTION 5311 ARP FUNDING WILL BE OBLIGATED FROM THE FOLLOWING:- SECTION 5311 ARP RURAL FUNDING $7593515 WHICH INCLUDES 15% OR $1139027 FOR INTERCITY OPERATIONS.- SECTION 5311(F) INTERCITY FUNDING $1139099- SECTION 5311 (B)(2) RTAP FUNDING $97969TOTAL REQUEST: $8830583 PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE STATE OF MAINE AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS WITH TWO YEARS OF OPERATING ASSISTANCE AT 100% FEDERAL SHARE FOR GENERAL PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION AND INTERCITY BUS SERVICE AND FOR THE RURAL TRANSIT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (RTAP).ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES PERFORMED BY SUBRECIPIENTS INTERCITY BUS OPERATIONS AND ELIGIBLE RTAP ACTIVITIES SUCH AS TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: CONTINUED SAFE AND EFFECTIVE OPERATION OF TRANSIT SERVICES FOR RURAL AREAS OF MAINE.INTENDED BENEFECIARIES: FIFTEEN GENERAL PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SUBRECIPIENTS ALONG WITH FOUR INTERCITY BUS PROVIDERS. THE AROOSTOOK MICMAC TRIBAL GOVERNMENT WAS AWARDED AN FFY2013 TRIBAL DISCRETIONARY GRANT (ME-18-X057-00) THAT PROVIDED FUNDING TO CONTRACT A CONSULTANT IN ORDER CONDUCT A TRANSIT PLANNING STUDY TRANSIT DEVELOPMENT PROJECT. THAT STUDYS RESULTS (ATTACHED) YIELDED A PATH FORWARD FOR THE TRIBE TO ENROLL IN FTAS NTD REPORTING PROGRAM AND START RECEIVING REGULAR FORMULA FUNDING. THIS GRANT IS THE RESULT OF THAT THE STUDY AND THUS WILL REQUEST 5311 TRIBAL TRANSPORTATION FORMULA FUNDING FROM:-FFY19: $15229-FFY20: $30349-FFY21: $14546TOTAL: $60124BUDGET BREAKDOWN:-OPERATING (SALARY FUEL): $48124-CAPITAL (PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE): $12000THESE FUNDS WILL BE FOR OPERATIONAL TRANSIT START UP COSTS AS WELL AS ANY ASSOCIATED PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE. WHILE THE TRIBE DOES NOT HAVE ANY VEHICLES OF ITS OWN IT WILL PARTNER WITH THE ELDERS INDIAN HEALTH SERVICES OFFICE ON THIS TRANSIT PROJECT TO BORROW THEIR VEHICLES. THESE FUNDS WILL GO DIRECTLY TO HIRING A DRIVER AND FUEL IN ORDER TO PROVIDE TRIPS 2-3 TIMES PER WEEK THAT TRAVELS FROM THE HEALTH CLINIC GOVERNMENT OFFICE AND MAJOR SHOPPING CENTERS. THIS SERVICE WILL BE AVAILABLE TO ALL TRIBAL MEMBERS BUT GREATLY BENEFIT THE ELDERLY POPULATION THAT RELIES ON TRANSIT TO REACH MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND THOSE MEMBERS WITHOUT A CAR. BOTH GROUPS NEED TRANSIT TO MAINTAIN VITAL CONNECTIONS IN A RURAL COMMUNITY SUCH AS PRESQUE ISLE. THESE FUNDS WILL ALSO ALLOW THE TRIBE TO DETERMINE WHETHER THEY SHOULD MOVE FORWARD WITH THE PURCHASE OF THEIR OWN VEHICLE. INDIRECT COSTS WILL BE APPLIED AT APPROVED RATE OF 38.97% PER THE ATTACHED DOCUMENTATION.PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: DATE OF AWARD TO SEPTEMBER 30 2023AROOSTOOK MICMAC COUNCIL EXECUTED ITS FFY21 CERTIFICATIONS AND ASSURANCES IN TRAMS ON 8/17/2021FTA PLANNING REQUIREMENTS TRIBES ARE NOT SUBJECT TO FEDERAL PLANNING REQUIREMENTS AND THE FTA WILL NOT REQUIRE TRIBES TO ATTACH TRIBAL TRANSPORTATION PLANS TO A STIP (STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM). LOCAL SHARE REQUIREMENT THE FTA DOES NOT REQUIRE A NON-FEDERAL MATCHING SHARE FOR TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM GRANTS. FEDERAL LABOR PROTECTIONS BECAUSE DIRECT GRANTS FROM THE FTA TO TRIBES DO NOT INVOLVE A STATE-RECIPIENT RELATIONSHIP THE LABOR PROTECTIVE PROVISIONS OF 49 U.S.C. 5333 (B) DO NOT APPLY TO THIS PROGRAM.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT FUNDING WILL BE TO ASSIST WITH OPERATING AND ONGOING MAINTENANCE FOR THE TRIBAL TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM OF THE MASHPEE WAMPANOAG TRIBE. THE FUNDS ARE ESSENTIAL TO SUPPORT THE CONTINUED OPERATIONS AND TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR THE PROGRAM.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE FUNDING WILL BE USED IN THE TRIBAL TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM OF THE MASHPEE WAMPANOAG TRIBE TO CONTINUE OPERATING BY COVERING PARTIAL DRIVER SALARY AS WELL AS PAY FOR VEHICLE MAINTENANCE SUCH AS PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE REPAIRS PARTS GPS AND FUEL COSTS FOR THE TRANSIT VEHICLES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF THIS FORMULA FUNDING THE MASHPEE WAMPANOAG TRIBE WILL BE ABLE TO OFFER TRIBAL CITIZENS A FREE RIDE TO APPOINTMENTS AND SOCIAL GATHERINGS AND MAINTAIN OUR TRIBAL TRANSIT VEHICLES IN ORDER TO HAVE RELIABLE AND SAFE TRANSPORTATION AVAILABLE FOR OUR MEMBERSHIP.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE FUNDING WILL BE SPENT SPECIFICALLY ON VEHICLE MAINTENANCE REPAIRS AND SUPPLIES WITH SOME FUNDS GOING TO PAY FOR PARTIAL SALARY OF ONE OF OUR DRIVERS. THIS COMBINATION WILL ENSURE THE CONTINUED OPERATION OF OUR TRIBAL TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM AND HELP KEEP OUR TRIBAL VEHICLES IN THE BEST POSSIBLE SHAPE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE STBG FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $800000 TO BE MATCHED BY $200000 IN MASSDOT REGIONAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY CAPITAL FUNDING (RTACAP) TO INSTALL SOLAR PANELS AT THE FRTAS NEW BUS MAINTENANCE AND OPERATIONS FACILITY ON SANDY LANE VILLAGE OF TURNER FALLS MONTAGUE MA. THE NEW FACILITY WILL BE APPROXIMATELY 27700 SQUARE FEET ON A 5.05 ACRE PARCEL. THE STBG FUNDING IS A TRANSFER TO THE 5311 PROGRAM (CAPITAL) AND THE PROJECT WILL BE FUNDED AS A SECTION 5311 GRANT. THE NEW FACILITY CONSTRUCTION PROJECT IS UNDERWAY AND EXPECTED TO BE COMPLETED IN LATE SPRING 2023. THE FACILITY CONSTRUCTION PROJECT HAS BEEN FUNDED WITH FTA 5339 (A ) AND 5339 (B) FUNDING UNDER FTA PROJECTS MA-34-0014 AND MA-34-0015. THIS STBG FUNDING WILL BE SOLELY USED FOR THE INSTALLATION OF THE SOLAR PANELS ON THE ROOF OF THE FACILITY. THE PROJECT WILL UTILIZE EXISTING CONDUIT BOXES ALREADY INSTALLED DURING CONSTRUCTION OF THE FACILITY AND THE EQUIPMENT WILL BE INSTALLED ON THE ROOF. THE INSTALLATION OF THE SOLAR PANELS WILL TAKE PLACE IN THE FOOTPRINT OF THE NEW FACILITY AND WILL NOT HAVE ANY ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS AT THE SITE. THEREFORE THE INSTALLATION IS COVERED UNDER THE CATEGORICAL EXCLUSION (CE) FOR THE FACILITY PROJECT APPROVED BY FTA ON 6/16/2021.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE STBG FUNDING FOR THE INSTALLATION OF SOLAR PANELS AND ASSOCIATED DESIGN AND PROJECT MANAGEMENT COSTS AT THE FRTAS NEW MAINTENANCE AND OPERATIONS FACILITY LOCATED AT 3 SANDY LANE VILLAGE OF TURNER FALLS MONTAGUE MA.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE INSTALLATION OF SOLAR PANELS AT THE FRTAS NEW BUS MAINTENANCE AND OPERATIONS FACILITY WILL PROVIDE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS BY ENABLING THE FRTA TO UTILIZE SOLAR ENERGY TO HEAT AND COOL ITS BUILDING AND REDUCE OPERATING COSTS. HAVING A SOLAR ENERGY OPTION AT THE NEW FACILITY WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE COMMONWEALTH OF MAS CLEAN ENERGY GOALS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INSTALLATION OF SOLAR PANELS AT THE FRTAS NEW BUS MAINTENANCE AND OPERATIONS FACILITY WILL PROVIDE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS BY ENABLING THE FRTA TO UTILIZE SOLAR ENERGY TO HEAT AND COOL ITS BUILDING AND REDUCE OPERATING COSTS. HAVING A SOLAR ENERGY OPTION AT THE NEW FACILITY WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE COMMONWEALTH OF MAS CLEAN ENERGY GOALS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST SECTION 5311 NATIONAL RURAL TRANSIT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM FUNDS ALLOCATED TO NEPONSET VALLEY TMA IN THE STATE OF MASSACHUSETTS FOR THE NATIONAL RURAL TRANSIT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (NRTAP) IN THE AMOUNT OF $2625869. THIS IS FOR YEAR 4 OF OUR NATIONAL RTAP COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT. IT IS SET TO RUN JANUARY 1 2023 THROUGH DECEMBER 31 2023. THE MISSION OF NATIONAL RTAP IS TO ASSIST TRANSIT PROGRAMS THROUGH THE DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROJECTS AND OTHER SUPPORT SERVICES TAILORED TO MEET THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF RURAL AND TRIBAL TRANSIT OPERATORS AND SUPPORT FTAS FORMULA GRANTS FOR RURAL AREAS PROGRAM.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE EXPENSES SUCH AS STAFF SALARIES AND DIRECT COSTS; HIRE SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS TO DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT TRAINING PRODUCTS AND WEB APPLICATIONS; AND PROVIDE DIRECT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND OTHER SUPPORT SERVICES TAILORED TO MEET THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF RURAL AND TRIBAL TRANSIT OPERATORS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: NRTAP ASSISTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS THROUGH THE DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROJECTS AND OTHER SUPPORT SERVICES TAILORED TO MEET THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF RURAL AND TRIBAL TRANSIT OPERATORS. WORKING CLOSELY WITH STATE DEPARTMENTS OF TRANSPORTATION AND TRIBAL AND RURAL OPERATORS NRTAP PROVIDES A FORUM FOR IDENTIFYING ISSUES AND SUPPORTING COORDINATED RESPONSES BETWEEN STATE PROGRAMS TRIBAL ENTITIES AND RURAL AND TRIBAL OPERATORS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: NRTAP AND ITS PARTNERS SHARE GOALS OF MAXIMIZING ACCESS AND MOBILITY IN RURAL AND TRIBAL AREAS AND SUPPORTING FEDERAL PROGRAM COMPLIANCE WITH BEST PRACTICES AND TRAINING MATERIALS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST SECTION 5311 (NON-URBANIZED AREA FORMULA GRANT (CFDA #20.509) FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE STATE OF MASSACHUSETTS IN THE AMOUNT OF $5392847. MASSACHUSETTS DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (MASSDOT) REQUESTS $5392846 OF FFY22 SECTION 5311-MASSACHUSETTS $5245256 AND SECTION 5311(B)(3) IN THE AMOUNT OF $147591.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE STATE OF MASSACHUSETTS AND ITS SUB-RECIPIENTS OPERATING ASSISTANCE RURAL TRANSIT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (RTAP) AND ADMINISTRATION INITIATIVES FOR THE STATE AND ITS SUB-RECIPIENTS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES FUEL ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE IN ORDER TO CONTINUE TRANSIT OPERATIONS. FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED FOR TRAINING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND STATE ADMINISTRATION. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: CONTINUED SAFE AND EFFECTIVE OPERATING OF TRANSIT SERVICES FOR RURAL AREAS OF MASSACHUSETTS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: MASSACHUSETTS TRANSIT AGENCIES AND CITIZENS IN THE RURAL AND NON-URBANIZED AREAS OF THE STATE. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS WILL RECEIVE OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO MAINTAIN SERVICES: BERKSHIRE REGIONAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY (BRTA) FRANKLIN REGIONAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY (FRTA) MARTHAS VINEYARD TRANSIT AUTHORITY (FTA) NANTUCKET REGIONAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY (NRTA) PETER PAN BUS LINES INC AND GREYHOUND LINES INC.

NATIONAL RURAL TRANSIT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (NRTAP) ASSISTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS THROUGH THE DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROJECTS AND OTHER SUPPORT SERVICES TAILORED TO MEET THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF RURAL AND TRIBAL TRANSIT OPERATORS. WORKING CLOSELY WITH STATE DEPARTMENTS OF TRANSPORTATION AND TRIBAL AND RURAL OPERATORS NRTAP PROVIDES A FORUM FOR IDENTIFYING ISSUES AND SUPPORTING COORDINATED RESPONSES BETWEEN STATE PROGRAMS TRIBAL ENTITIES AND RURAL AND TRIBAL OPERATORS. NRTAP AND ITS PARTNERS SHARE GOALS OF MAXIMIZING ACCESS AND MOBILITY IN RURAL AND TRIBAL AREAS AND SUPPORTING FEDERAL PROGRAM COMPLIANCE WITH BEST PRACTICES AND TRAINING MATERIALS.

THE WAMPANOAG TRIBE OF GAY HEAD IS REQUESTING TO USE $250000 FY17 5311 TRIBAL DISCRETIONARY GRANT (DISCRETIONARY ID: D2017-TRTR-016) FUNDS FOR THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:-$100000 (FEDERAL): OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO FORMALLY START A TRANSIT SERVICE FOR THE TRIBE TO INCLUDE DRIVER SALARIES FRINGE BENEFITS AND FUEL.-$90000 (FEDERAL): PROCUREMENT OF 1 LOW OR NO EMISSION TRANSIT VEHICLE- $5000 (FEDERAL): PROCUREMENT OF ASSOCIATED CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE -$55000 (FEDERAL): PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE FUNDING TO MAINTAIN THE VEHICLE AND CHARGING STATION IN A STATE OF GEED REPAIR TOTAL: $250000 (FEDERAL)THE TRIBE WILL PROVIDE AN IN-KIND LOCAL MATCH OF 10% OR $27780 WHICH STEMS FROM ITS GENERAL OPERATING BUDGET. DOCUMENTATION OF THE MATCH IS ATTACHED.THESE FUNDS WILL GO TOWARDS START UP OPERATING COSTS SUCH AS DRIVERS VEHICLES AND PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE. FOR CONTEXT TRIBAL LANDS AND TRIBAL HOUSING (OUR RESERVATION) ARE LOCATED IN AQUINNAH AT THE FURTHEST WESTERN END OF THE MARTHAS VINEYARD ISLAND. THE TOWN OF AQUINNAH HAS THE SMALLEST POPULATION OF ALL THE TOWNS ON THE ISLAND. CURRENT TRANSIT SERVICE TO AQUINNAH IS INFREQUENT MOST OF THE YEAR THE ROUTES END TOO EARLY FOR OUR TRIBAL MEMBERS AND OUR STUDENTS TO BE ABLE TO FULLY PARTICIPATE IN AFTER SCHOOL EXTRA-CURRICULAR ACTIVITIES OR WORK LATER SHIFTS OR VISIT OR PARTICIPATE IN SOCIAL EVENTS OR ACTIVITIES IN THE EVENINGS. THE START UP OF THIS SERVICE WILL GREATLY BENEFIT THE PUBLIC AND THE TRIBE BY CREATING A VITAL TRANSIT LINK TO THE REST OF THE ISLAND. THE SHIFT TOWARDS LOW OR NO EMISSION VEHICLES WILL ALSO REDUCE THE CARBON FOOTPRINT ON THE ISLAND AND CREATE A HEALTHIER ENVIRONMENT FOR THE TRIBE AND SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES. THIS WILL ALSO ALLOW THE TRIBE TO BECOME A DIRECT RECIPIENT AND START RECEIVING REGULAR 5311 TTP FORMULA FUNDING PROVIDING A SUSTAINABLE SOURCE OF TRANSIT SERVICE FOR THE TRIBE AND NEIGHBORING AREAS. SECTION 106 WAS COMPLETED ON THE CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE. A DETERMINATION OF NO POTENTIAL TO CAUSE EFFECT WAS MADE.INDIRECT COSTS WILL BE APPLIED AT DE-MINIMUS RATE OF 10%PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: DATE OF AWARD TO SEPTEMBER 30 2024FTA PLANNING REQUIREMENTS TRIBES ARE NOT SUBJECT TO FEDERAL PLANNING REQUIREMENTS AND THE FTA WILL NOT REQUIRE TRIBES TO ATTACH TRIBAL TRANSPORTATION PLANS TO A STIP (STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM). FEDERAL LABOR PROTECTIONS BECAUSE DIRECT GRANTS FROM THE FTA TO TRIBES DO NOT INVOLVE A STATE-RECIPIENT RELATIONSHIP THE LABOR PROTECTIVE PROVISIONS OF 49 U.S.C. 5333 (B) DO NOT APPLY TO THIS PROGRAM.

THE MASSACHUSETTS DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (MASSDOT) REQUESTS A TOTAL OF $3830380 OF FFY2021 SECTION 5311 AMERICAN RESCUE ACT (ARP) FUNDS. THIS AMOUNT CONSTITUTES 100% OF ARP 5311 FUNDS AND ARP 5311(F) INTERCITY FUNDS ALLOCATED TO MASSACHUSETTS. THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES ARP FUNDING TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS. PER THE ARP ACT THE GRANT REQUESTS 100% FEDERAL SHARE AND THE ACTIVITIES IN THIS APPLICATION ARE NOT REQUIRED TO BE PROGRAMMED IN THE LONG-RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLAN OR STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM. PROJECTS INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT ARE:1) OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO (3) RURAL TRANSIT AUTHORITIES (FRTA VTA NRTA) AND (1) PARTIALLY RURAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY (BRTA). APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST SECTION 5311 NATIONAL RURAL TRANSIT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM FUNDS ALLOCATED TO NEPONSET VALLEY TMA IN THE STATE OF MASSACHUSETTS FOR THE NATIONAL RURAL TRANSIT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (NRTAP) IN THE AMOUNT OF $4237865. THIS IS FOR YEAR 4 OF OUR NATIONAL RTAP COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT. IT IS SET TO RUN FROM NOVEMBER 1 2020 UNTIL MARCH 31 2023.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE EXPENSES SUCH AS STAFF SALARIES AND DIRECT COSTS; MANAGE A COMMUNITY RIDES GRANT PROGRAM HIRE SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS TO DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT TRAINING PRODUCTS AND WEB APPLICATIONS AND PROVIDE DIRECT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND OTHER SUPPORT SERVICES TAILORED TO MEET THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF RURAL AND TRIBAL OPERATORS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: NATIONAL RURAL TRANSIT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (NRTAP) ASSISTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS THROUGH THE DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROJECTS AND OTHER SUPPORT SERVICES TAILORED TO MEET THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF RURAL AND TRIBAL TRANSIT OPERATORS. WORKING CLOSELY WITH STATE DOTS AND TRIBAL AND RURAL OPERATORS NRTAP PROVIDES A FORUM FOR IDENTIFYING ISSUES AND SUPPORTING COORDINATED RESPONSES BETWEEN STATE PROGRAMS TRIBAL ENTITIES AND RURAL AND TRIBAL OPERATORS. NRTAP AND ITS PARTNERS SHARE GOALS OF MAXIMIZING ACCESS AND MOBILITY IN RURAL AND TRIBAL AREAS AND SUPPORTING FEDERAL PROGRAM COMPLIANCE WITH BEST PRACTICES AND TRAINING MATERIALS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: NRTAP AND ITS PARTNERS SHARE GOALS OF MAXIMIZING ACCESS AND MOBILITY IN RURAL AND TRIBAL AREAS AND SUPPORTING FEDERAL PROGRAM COMPLIANCE WITH BEST PRACTICES AND TRAINING MATERIALS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE COMMUNITY RIDES GRANT PROGRAM RECIPIENTS WILL IMPLEMENT PROJECTS THAT SUPPORT TRANSPORTATION PARTNERSHIPS THAT IMPROVE SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH IN RURAL AND TRIBAL COMMUNITIES. PROJECTS WILL IMPROVE ACCESS TO CRITICAL NEEDS LIKE EMPLOYMENT HEALTHCARE EDUCATION HEALTHY FOOD AND SOCIAL SERVICES AS WELL AS BUILD THE CAPACITY OF TRANSIT PROGRAMS.

THE TUNICA-BILOXI TRIBE IS SEEKING FEDERAL FUNDING ASSISTANCE IN THE AMOUNT OF $25000 FROM SECTION 5311 TTP DISCRETIONARY PROGRAM (D2020-TRTR-015) TO CONDUCT A FEASIBILITY STUDY. THIS PROJECT IS 100% FEDERALLY FUNDED. PURPOSE: THE FEASIBILITY STUDY IS TO DETERMINE NEEDS OF PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICE FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS WHO ARE UNABLE TO TRANSPORT THEMSELVES OR DO NOT HAVE TRANSPORTATION TO TRAVEL TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS WORK AND/OR EDUCATIONAL/VOCATIONAL TRAINING. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: A COMPREHENSIVE TRANSIT FEASIBILITY STUDY WILL BE CONDUCTED TO DETERMINE NEEDS GAPS AND ORIGIN/DESTINATION FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS. THE STUDY WILL INCLUDE ROBUST PUBLIC PARTICIPATION INCLUDING PUBLIC MEETINGS SURVEYS AND ONE-ON-ONE MEETINGS. COORDINATION WITH THE AVOYELLES PARISH COUNCIL ON AGING AND ALEXANDRIA-PINEVILLE METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION WILL TAKE PLACE TO ENSURE THAT THERE IS NO DUPLICATION OF SERVICES AND HOW THIS SERVICE CAN RELIEVE ANY TRANSIT ISSUES WITH THE AVOYELLES PARISH COUNCIL ON AGING AND COMPLEMENT THEIR SERVICE. THIS PLANNING STUDY WILL ALSO DETERMINE IF THERE IS OPPORTUNITY TO LINK WITH ATRANS (ALEXANDRIA PUBLIC TRANSIT SYSTEM). THE STUDY WILL EXAMINE ORIGINS AND DESTINATIONS AND GET AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE TYPES OF TRIPS THAT ARE NEEDED. THE TRIBE CURRENTLY KNOWS THERE IS A DEMAND BUT THE FEASIBILITY STUDY IS NEEDED TO UNDERSTAND THESE TRIPS AND ENSURE THAT AS MANY RESIDENTS CAN BE SERVED. BY COORDINATING THIS STUDY WITH THE TWO TRANSIT PROVIDERS THERE WILL ALSO BE A MUCH BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE TRIPS TO AND FROM THE TRIBAL AND SURROUNDING AREAS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED WILL ALLOW TRIBAL MEMBERS ACCESS TO JOB-TRAINING AND JOBS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: TRIBAL RESIDENTS BUSINESSES SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/ANO STIP REQUIRED.

THIS SINGLE VEHICLE PURCHASE WILL UTILIZE 100% OF THE FY 2019/2020/2021 FUNDS WITH A TOTAL OF THOSE 3 YEARS OF FORMULA FUNDS TOTALING $44830. THESE TTP FORMULA AWARDS ALLOW FOR 100% FEDERAL GRANT FUNDED PROJECTS WHICH IS WHAT IS PROPOSED HERE.FEDERAL FUNDING:FY 2019: $11991FY 2020: $18555FY 2021: $14284TOTAL FEDERAL AMOUNT: $44830*NO LOCAL MATCH IS REQUIRED FOR THE FORMULA PROGRAM.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:REPLACING OUR CURRENT 2016 CHRYSLER MINI-VAN WITH A NEW 2022 MINI-VAN (THIS TIME MOVING UP TO AN ALL-WHEEL DRIVE AWD (PER STAFF RECOMMENDATIONS DUE TO PAST IMPASSABLE ROAD CONDITIONS DURING INCLEMENT WEATHER ROAD CONDITIONS WHEN IT IS RAINING/ICING/SNOWING).INITIAL INVESTIGATION INDICATES THAT SUPPLY CHAIN DELAYS MAY RESULT IN A 4-TO-6 MONTH DELIVERY CYCLE ON A NEW 2022 VAN. ON OR ABOUT JUNE 16 2022 WE WILL START FORMAL PROCUREMENT PROCESS FOR A NEW 2022 AWD VAN THE SAME SIZE/UPGRADED TO AWD AS THE TOWN COUNTRY / NON-RAMP VAN THAT WE WILL BE RETIRING. IN THAT PROCUREMENT PROCESS WE WILL LIKELY ALSO INCLUDE THE OPPORTUNITY FOR A BID ALTERNATE FOR A 7 PASSENGER CHEVROLET TRAVERSE/BUICK ARCADIA. OUR PROCUREMENT POLICIES ARE SUCH THAT IT IS TYPICALLY A 4-TO-5 WEEK PROCESS TO FORMALLY SEEK/SECURE QUOTATIONS AND AWARD THE PURCHASE ORDER/CONTRACT.RETIRING THE 2016 VAN WHICH IS WELL PAST ITS USEFUL LIFE OF 4 YEARS AND HAS MORE THAN 140000 MILES AND REPLACING IT WITH A NEW 2022 AWD VAN WILL HELP ENSURE A SAFE RELIABLE AND TROUBLE FREE RIDE FOR OUR TRANSIT CLIENTS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:FUNDING WILL PERMIT THE SAC FOX NATION TO CONTINUE TO MAINTAIN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR OF ITS VEHICLE(S) AND CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SAFE EFFICIENT AND RELIABLE TRANSIT SERVICE TO TRIBAL RURAL AREAS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:SAC AND FOX NATION OF MISSOURI IN KANSAS NEBRASKA TRANSIT RIDERS.SUBRECIPIENTS:THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES INVOLVED WITH THIS PURCHASE OF A REPLACEMENT VAN.

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST SECTION 5311 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE STATE OF INDIANA IN THE AMOUNT OF $22157364 AND SECTION 5339 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE STATE OF INDIANA IN THE AMOUNT OF $949853. PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE SUBRECIPIENTS OPERATING ASSISTANCE ELIGIBLE CAPITAL PROJECTS AND FOR THE RURAL TRANSIT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (RTAP) FOR THE STATE AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ALL ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES FUEL ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR TO CONTINUE TRANSIT OPERATIONS. FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE CAPITAL EXPENSES FOR THE PURCHASE OF 20 TRANSIT VEHICLES. FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED FOR TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: CONTINUED SAFE AND EFFECTIVE OPERATION OF TRANSIT SERVICES FOR RURAL AREAS OF INDIANA.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: 41 STATE TRANSIT AGENCIES AND CITIZENS IN THE RURAL AND NON-URBANIZED AREAS OF THE STATE. THIS GRANT TO THE ILLINOIS DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (IDOT) WILL UTILIZE CORONAVIRUS RESPONSE AND RELIEF SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS ACT OF 2021 (CRRSAA) FUNDING. IDOT WILL ALLOCATE 100% OF ITS $21175341.00 OF CRRSAA APPORTIONMENT FOR REIMBURSEMENTS OF ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES TO SUB-RECIPIENTS RESPONDING TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC AND TO MEET ITS INTERCITY BUS SET ASIDE REQUIREMENT. PROJECTS UNDER THIS GRANT INCLUDE RURAL SUB-RECIPIENT OPERATING AND ICB OPERATING COSTS FOR THE PERFORMANCE PERIOD OF 3/1/2020 THROUGH 06/30/2024. TO ENCOURAGE RURAL SUB-RECIPIENTS TO FULLY USE CRRSAA ACT FUNDS FOR THEIR CONGRESSIONAL INTENT IDOT WILL BE ALLOWING OPERATORS TO BILL FOR COVID-RELATED EXPENSES BACK TO 3/1/2020. THE DECISION TO MAKE FUNDS UNDER THIS GRANT AVAILABLE SOLELY FOR OPERATING EXPENSES WILL FURTHER PRIORITIZE UTILIZATION FOR COVID-19 RELATED RESPONSE AND HOPEFULLY MAKE TRACKING AND REPORTING MORE EXPEDIENT. THE GRANT IS ORGANIZED BY GENERAL ACTIVITIES/ALI AND SPLIT INTO TWO PROJECTS. PROJECT ONE COVERS GENERAL PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION OPERATING ASSISTANCE WHILE THE SECOND PROJECT WHICH IS LABELED P4 IS FOR INTERCITY BUS OPERATING ASSISTANCE. PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY IS BEING USED FOR THIS GRANT. AS OUTLINED BY FTA GUIDANCE FOR CRRSAA ACT FUNDS A MATCH IS NOT REQUIRED; AND IDOT DOES NOT INTEND TO MAKE SUB-AWARDS WHERE CRRSAA ACT MONIES ARE FURTHER LEVERAGED WITH LOCAL MATCH. *THE RECIPIENT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY. IDOTS OFFICE OF INTERMODAL PROJECT IMPLEMENTATION (OIPI) IS THE GOVERNORS DESIGNATED RECIPIENT OF THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATIONS SECTION 5311 FORMULA FUNDS FOR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES IN RURAL AND SMALL URBAN AREAS IN ILLINOIS. HISTORICALLY GRANT RECIPIENTS SUBMIT ANNUAL APPLICATIONS FOR FUNDING TO THE DEPARTMENT BUT IN THE INTEREST OF PROVIDING FUNDING STABILITY IT IS NOT A COMPETITIVE PROCESS. INSTEAD THE DEPARTMENT FUNDS ITS APPROVED ELIGIBLE SUB-RECIPIENTS EACH YEAR BASED UPON THE STATES AVAILABLE SECTION 5311 ALLOCATION. THE SAME ALLOCATION PROCESS WILL BE FOLLOWED FOR THE CRRSAA ACT SECTION 5311 FUNDING. IDOT INTENDS TO FOLD THE CRRSAA ACT FUNDING INTO THE CARES STATE CONTRACT IN PART TO REDUCE ADMINISTRATIVE BURDEN. *AS INDICATED BY THE EMERGENCY NATURE OF THESE RESPONSE ACTIVITIES CRRSAA ACT PROJECTS ARE NOT INCLUDED IN ILLINOIS STIP. THE DEPARTMENT HAS SET ASIDE 15% OF ITS CRRSSA ACT SECTION 5311 ALLOCATION APPORTIONMENTS FOR INTERCITY BUS. THE PERFORMANCE PERIOD FOR THIS GRANT OVERLAPS WITH IDOTS OTHER EMERGENCY FUNDING UNDER IL-2020-034-00 (CARES) AND 1177-2021-5 (ARP). THE REASON FOR THIS OVERLAP IS TO SUFFICIENTLY COVER EXPENSES THE INDIVIDUAL GRANTS WOULD BE UNABLE TO ACHIEVE ON THEIR OWN.

PLEASE SEE ATTACHED POP FOR A MORE DETAILED LISTING OF PROJECTS TO BE FUNDED UNDER THIS GRANT. PROJECTS ARE LISTED IN THE TABLE ATTACHED TO THE STIP AMENDMENT REQUEST OF JUNE 29 2015 AND APPROVED BY FTA ON JUNE 302015. IDOTS DIVISION OF PUBLIC AND INTERMODAL TRANSPORTATION (DPIT) IS THE GOVERNORS DESIGNATED RECIPIENT OF THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATIONS SECTION 5311 FORMULA FUNDS FOR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES IN RURAL AND SMALL URBAN AREAS IN ILLINOIS. HISTORICALLY GRANT RECIPIENTS SUBMIT ANNUAL APPLICATIONS FOR FUNDING TO THE DEPARTMENT BUT IN THE INTEREST OF PROVIDING FUNDING STABILITY IT IS NOT A COMPETITIVE PROCESS. INSTEAD THE DEPARTMENT FUNDS ITS APPROVED ELIGIBLE SUB-RECIPIENTS EACH YEAR BASED UPON THE STATES AVAILABLE SECTION 5311 ALLOCATION. THE DEPARTMENT HAS SET ASIDE 15% OF THE FFY15 SECTION 5311 ALLOCATION INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION FOR INTERCITY BUS ACTIVITIES WHICH WILL BE AMENDED INTO THE GRANT AT A LATER DATE. THE DEPARTMENT HAS INCLUDED ITS 5311(B) ALLOCATION OF $166547 IN THIS APPLICATION.ATTACHMENTS: STIP AMENDMENT APPROVAL LETTER (FTA REGION 5)POP IL-18-X032 (6-30-15)TDC REQUEST IL-18-X032DOL DOCUMENTATION SUBMITTED BY IDOT FY2015 SECTION 5311 FUNDS LAPSE AFTER 9/30/2017.

FFY12 SECTION 5311 FLEX FUNDING (STP)IA-85-X032-04DECEMBER 2011THE IOWA DOT RESPECTFULLY SUBMITS THIS APPLICATION FOR $244769 FOR STP FUNDING FOR SEVERAL CAPITAL PROJECTS FOR FOUR DIFFERENT TRANSIT SYSTEMS. THE FUNDS FOR ALL OF THESE PROJECTS WILL BE TRANSFERRED FROM FHWA TO FTA. A COPY OF THE TRANSFER REQUESTS IS ATTACHED TO THIS GRANT APPLICATION. PROJECTS IN THIS APPLICATION INCLUDE THE PURCHASE OF LIGHT-DUTY VEHICLES FOR REGION 14 15 AND 16 AND THE PURCHASE OF MINIVANS FOR REGION 10. EACH OF THESE TRANSIT SYSTEMS IS A PUBLIC BODY. THEY ALL HAVE BEEN DETERMINED TO BE SERVING MINORITY POPULATIONS BASED ON 2000 CENSUS DATA. CUMULATIVE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS ATTACHED LOCAL FUNDING COMES FROM GENERAL FUND LEVIES AND SOMETIMES FROM TRUST AND AGENCY LEVIES. EACH TRANSIT SYSTEM HAS CERTIFIED THAT LOCAL SHARES FOR THEIR PROJECTS ARE AVAILABLE. CERTIFICATION AND ASSURANCES: INDIVIDUAL SUBRECIPIENT CERTIFICATIONS AND ASSURANCES ARE A REQUIRED PART OF THE SUBRECIPIENTS CONSOLIDATED FUNDING APPLICATION MATERIALS SUBMITTED TO THE IOWA DOT ANNUALLY. THIS DOCUMENTATION IS ON FILE AT THE DOT AND IS AVAILABLE FOR FTA INSPECTION AT ANY TIME.PLANNING/PROGRAMMING: THE IOWA DOT REQUIRES ALL TRANSIT PROJECTS INCLUDING THOSE USING FLEX FUNDING TO BE INCLUDED IN THE STATE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (STIP) APPROVED BY FTA OCTOBER 1 2011. PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT: IOWA REQUIRES A PUBLIC HEARING FOR EACH TRANSIT PROJECT PROGRAMMED IN THE STIP. THE PUBLIC HEARING MAY BE COMBINED WITH ANOTHER HEARING. A PUBLIC HEARING NOTICE IS REQUIRED TO BE PUBLISHED APPROXIMATELY 30 DAYS IN ADVANCE OF THE HEARING IN A NEWSPAPER OF GENERAL CIRCULATION SERVING THE PROJECT AREA. THE NOTICE IS ALSO SUBMITTED TO THE OFFICE OF PUBLIC TRANSIT FOR INCLUSION IN THE PRIVATE SECTOR CLEARINGHOUSE MAILING. AN AFFIDAVIT OF PUBLICATION IS REQUIRED. THE PROPOSED QC - MUSCATINE RECIPROCAL EMPLOYEE COMMUTER SHUTTLE EXPANSION MAY BE SEEN AS THE LOGICAL NEXT STEP OF A TIMELY PROJECT. IT PROVIDES A DESIRED TRANSPORTATION OPTION TO COMMUTERS IN TWO URBAN AREAS PROVIDING GREATER CHOICE AND OPPORTUNITY FOR BOTH EMPLOYEES AND EMPLOYERS. ADDING THE MUSCATINE WORKER/QC EMPLOYER COMPONENT SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASES THIS PROJECTS CURRENT CONTRIBUTION TO THE ICAAP GOALS OF MAXIMIZED TRANSPORTATION EFFICIENCY FEWER VEHICLES ON THE ROAD REDUCED EMISSIONS RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND HEALTHY AIR QUALITY AWARENESS/BEHAVIORS ALL VERY NEEDED IN A REGION STRUGGLING TO MAINTAIN NON-ATTAINMENT STATUS.BECAUSE THIS PROJECT BUILDS UPON AN EXISTING PROJECT PREVIOUSLY APPROVED IN AN FTA GRANT MANY OF THE PROJECT DETAILS ALREADY IN PLACE WILL REMAIN THE SAME: 10 ROUND TRIPS WOULD STILL BE MADE BETWEEN PARKING SITES IN DAVENPORT TO EMPLOYMENT SITES IN MUSCATINE. THEN INCORPORATED INTO THIS FOR THE RETURN TRIPS WOULD BE PICKUPS AT MUSCATINE-BASED PARK-AND-RIDE LOT(S) OF RIDERS FOR THE COMMUTE TO THEIR QC JOB SITE. THE LEASE ON THE FOUR 25-PASSENGER GASOLINE FUELED LIGHT DUTY BUSES WOULD BE RENEWED FOR THIS PROJECT AS LEASING REMAINS A MORE COST EFFICIENT AND FLEXIBLE FLEET MANAGEMENT OPTION THAN ACQUIRING THE CAPITAL OUTLAY NECESSARY TO PURCHASE THE SAME. WITH RUNS BEING MADE AT VARIOUS TIMES DURING THE DAY TO ACCOMMODATE BEGINNING AND END OF SHIFTS TEN ROUND TRIPS CAN BE ACCOMPLISHED USING JUST FOUR VEHICLES. EACH ROUND TRIP WOULD TAKE APPROXIMATELY TWO HOURS OF DRIVER TIME WHICH INCLUDES THE TIME NECESSARY FOR PASSENGERS TO BOTH BOARD AND DEPART AT BOTH ENDS OF THE ROUTE. THE ROUND TRIP MILEAGE IS ESTIMATED TO BE 70 MILES WITH A TOTAL MILEAGE FOR ALL 10 ROUND TRIPS CALCULATING TO 700 SERVICE MILES DAILY. ADDITIONAL DEADHEAD MILES TO COVER ALL FOUR BUSES ARE ESTIMATED AT 70 MILES PER DAY TOTAL. THE DAILY SERVICE TIME WOULD BE APPROXIMATELY 20 HOURS PER DAY WITH ACTUAL DRIVER TIME EXTENDED TO 23 HOURS PER DAY AS THIS MUST INCLUDE COMMUTE TIME FROM RIVER BEND TRANSIT OFFICE TO INITIAL PICK UP SITES THE END-OF-RUN RETURN MAINTENANCE NEEDS AND SUCH RELATED STANDARD PROCEDURES THAT DRIVERS PERFORM.EXACT HOURS OF SERVICE WILL BE SCHEDULED TO BEST ACCOMMODATE THE GREATEST NUMBER OF COMMUTERS MOST EFFICIENTLY AND RIVER BEND TRANSIT WILL COORDINATE WITH EMPLOYERS AS TO THE DICTATES OF SHIFT SCHEDULES; FIRST SHIFT WORKER SCHEDULES HOWEVER ARE THIS PROJECTS PRIMARY SERVICE TARGET WITH SECOND SHIFT SCHEDULE ACCOMMODATION THE SECONDARY SERVICE TARGET. PROJECT PARAMETERS ARE DESIGNED TO PROVIDE SERVICE FOR 253 DAYS RUNNING MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY FOR THE DURATION OF ONE YEAR. MAXIMUM RIDERSHIP CAPACITY FOR A FULLY UTILIZED RECIPROCAL SERVICE ARE: 25 RIDERS/ BUS 20 ONE-WAY (OR 10 ROUND TRIPS) RUNS/DAY EQUALS 500 RIDES PER DAY 2500 RIDES PER WORK WEEK. THE 20% LOCAL MATCH WILL BE COLLECTED VIA CONTRACTS WITH THE EMPLOYERS SIGNING ON FOR THE SERVICE AND IT WILL BE UP TO THEM IF THEY WISH TO COLLECT A FEE FROM EMPLOYEES VIA PAYROLL DEDUCTION OF SOME NATURE OR OFFER THE TRANSPORTATION SERVICE AS A COMPANY BENEFIT.BY AUGMENTING THIS SERVICE TO ADDITIONALLY TARGET MUSCATINE-BASED EMPLOYEES CURRENTLY COMMUTING DAILY TO THE QUAD CITIES FOR WORK THIS PROJECT CAN MAKE SIGNIFICANT STRIDES TOWARD REACHING THE GOAL OF MAXIMUM RIDERSHIP CAPACITY PARK RIDE LOCATION(S) IN MUSCATINE WILL BE SELECTED WITH PREFERENCE GIVEN TO THOSE WHICH ARE SITUATED ADJACENT TO EXISTING MUSCATINES FIXED ROUTE SERVICE FOR OPTIMUM COMMUTER CONVENIENCE.THOUGH TERMED AN EMPLOYEE COMMUTER SHUTTLE SERVICE IT IS IMPORTANT TO EMPHASIZE THAT THERE IS ALSO A MODEST DEMAND WITHIN THE GENERAL PUBLIC FOR QC-MUSCATINE RECIPROCAL SERVICE. IN ORDER TO INFORM THE PUBLIC OF THIS SERVICE GENERAL PUBLIC ACCESS INFORMATION WILL BE INCLUDED IN THE PROMOTIONAL LITERATURE FARE AND TIME SCHEDULES WILL BE PRINTED FOR DISTRIBUTION AND INFORMATION WILL BE POSTED ON THE RIVER BEND TRANSIT WEBSITE. SINCE PARK AND RIDE LOT LOCATIONS WILL BE PROXIMAL TO ESTABLISHED FIXED ROUTES (MUSCABUS IN MUSCATINE/DAVENPORT CITIBUS AND BETTENDORF TRANSIT IN THE QUAD CITIES) THE SHUTTLE SERVICE CAN BE PROMOTED THROUGH THE FIXED ROUTE SYSTEMS MATERIALS AS WELL.REGION 12WESTERN IOWA TRANSIT SYSTEMS (REGION 12) PROPOSES TO INITIATE A REGIONAL VAN POOL PROJECT TO PROVIDE COMMUTER TRANSPORTATION SERVICE FOR ITS REGIONAL SERVICE AREA. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO INTRODUCE ALTERNATIVE COMMUTER TRANSPORTATION MODES TO REDUCE SINGLE OCCUPANT VEHICLE TRIPS ALLEVIATE TRAFFIC CONGESTION AND IMPROVE AIR QUALITY CONDITIONS IN THE AREA. TRENDS IN TRAVEL PATTERNS INDICATE LONGER COMMUTES AND THE WILLINGNESS OF EMPLOYEES TO TRAVEL LONGER DISTANCES TO AND FROM EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES. THESE FACTORS MAKE VAN POOLING MORE FEASIBLE. THE WITS VANPOOL PROGRAMS IS AIMED AT: 1) REDUCING THE NUMBER OF SINGLE-OCCUPANT VEHICLES ON ROADWAYS; 2) IMPROVING THE ENVIRONMENT; 3) ALLOWING EMPLOYEES TO LIVE OUTSIDE URBAN AREAS; 4) AND PROVIDING A LARGER HIRING AREA FOR EMPLOYERS. WHILE THE WITS VAN POOL PROGRAM WILL HOPEFULLY GROW TO A REGION WIDE SERVICE THIS PROJECT WILL CONCENTRATE ON THE LARGER SCALE EMPLOYMENT CENTERS IN CARROLL CRAWFORD AND GREENE COUNTIES. INITIALLY MARKETING AND PLANNING EFFORTS WILL BE FOCUSED ON VANPOOLING. VANPOOLS REQUIRE A MORE FORMAL COMMITMENT THAN CARPOOLS BUT ALSO HAVE GREATER EFFECTIVENESS IN IMPROVING AIR QUALITY AND MITIGATING TRAFFIC CONGESTION. THE INITIAL PROJECT WILL REQUIRE 5 EXPANSION VEHICLES. WITS WILL UTILIZE EXISTING PARATRANSIT VEHICLES FOR EMPLOYEES WITH SPECIAL NEEDS AND TO PROVIDE ADA ACCESSIBILITY WHEN NECESSARY.REGION 12 WILL ALSO RECRUIT QUALIFIED DRIVERS TO OPERATE EACH VANPOOL. THE VOLUNTEER DRIVERS WILL RECEIVE THE BENEFIT OF NO-COST TRANSPORTATION TO AND FROM WORK FOR OPERATING THE VANPOOL. THEY WILL MARKET THE PROJECT TO EMPLOYEES WORKING AT LARGE MULTI-SHIFT EMPLOYERS SUCH AS PELLA CORPORATION FARMLAND AND FARNER BOCKEN WHO DRAW EMPLOYEES FROM OUTSIDE THEIR LOCAL COMMUNITY OR COUNTY. THESE COMMUTERS WILL BENEFIT FROM A RURAL COMMUTER VAN POOL BY PROVIDING COST SAVINGS FOR INDIVIDUAL COMMUTER TRIPS REDUCE EMISSIONS FROM MULTIPLE VEHICLES TRIPS WHILE PROVIDING RIDES AND REVENUE FOR WITS. GUARANTEED RIDES HOME WILL ALSO BE A COMPONENT OF THIS PROJECT. PROGRAM GUIDELINES MARKETING AND TRAINING MATERIALS WILL ALSO BE DEVELOP WITH THIS PROJECT. **********************************************************************************************************************FY08 SECTION 5311 FLEX FUNDING AMENDMENT3RD AMENDMENTIA-85-X030-03FEBRUARY 2008PROJECT DETAILS:THIS GRANT AMENDMENT INCLUDES $1146200 IN FFY08 STP FUNDING FLEXED TO THE FTA SECTION 5311 PROGRAM. FUNDING IN THIS AMENDMENT WILL ALLOW FOR THE PURCHASE ELEVEN REVENUE VEHICLES AND THREE FACILITY PROJECTS. ALL VEHICLES IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION WILL BE VANS/LIGHT DUTY BUSES. FOUR OF THE REVENUE VEHICLES ARE AN EXPANSION PROJECT AND THE REMAINDER ARE REPLACEMENT PROJECTS. ALL VEHICLES ARE ADA ACCESSIBLE AND WILL BE PURCHASED AT 83% FEDERAL PARTICIPATION/17% LOCAL MATCH. ONE OF THE VEHICLES WILL BE PURCHASED WITH SECURITY CAMERAS. THE CAMERAS WOULD BE USED TO PROVIDE SECURITY FOR THE DRIVER AND MONITORING FOR PROBLEMS THAT ARISE SUCH AS VANDALISM UNRULY BEHAVIOR AND CRIMINAL ACTIVITY. THESE CAMERAS WILL DETER THIS TYPE OF BEHAVIOR ALONG WITH PROVIDING THE PROOF OF INCIDENTS AND EVIDENTIARY MATERIAL FOR LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT IF NEEDED. REGION 14 IS THE ONLY TRANSIT SYSTEM REQUESTING SURVEILLANCE CAMERAS ON THEIR REPLACEMENT VEHICLE. THESE SECURITY CAMERAS ARE NOT PART OF ANY ITS PROJECT AND WILL NOT BE TIED TO ANY ITS PROJECT IN THE FUTURE. FACILITY PROJECTS IN THIS APPLICATION INCLUDE CONSTRUCTION OF A FOUR-COUNTY MAINTENANCE AND STORAGE FACILITY FOR REGION 3 CONSTRUCTION OF AN ADMINISTRATION BUILDING FOR REGION 6 AND A FACILITY EXPANSION PROJECT FOR REGION 12. REGION 3S PROJECT INCLUDES ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO BUILD A FOUR-COUNTY MAINTENANCE AND STORAGE FACILITY IN SHELDON IOWA. THIS FACILITY WOULD BE LOCATED AT 16TH CYLINDER AVENUE IN SHELDON. THIS FACILITY WILL HOUSE A DISPATCH OFFICE AND PROVIDE INDOOR STORAGE AND AN AREA TO PERFORM LIGHT MAINTENANCE. LAND PURCHASE FOR THIS PROJECT IS CONTAINED IN AMENDMENT NO. 2. THE LAND WILL NOT BE USED AS PART OF THE LOCAL MATCH FOR THIS PROJECT. COST ALLOCATION DATA HAS BEEN SUBMITTED TO FTA FOR REVIEW. THIS PROJECT WAS ORIGINALLY APPROVED BY FTA IN IA-85-X030 AS A CATEGORY B PROJECT AS THE ARCHEOLOGICAL SURVEY AND ENVIRONMENTAL DOCUMENTATION/FINDINGS WILL NOT BE COMPLETED UNTIL SUMMER OF 2008. IMPLEMENTATION FOR THIS PROJECT IS CONTINGENT ON FTAS APPROVAL OF A DOCUMENTED CATEGORICAL EXCLUSION AND SUBSEQUENT RELEASE OF FEDERAL FUNDING - LAND ACQUISITION AND ARCHITECTURAL SERVICE PROCUREMENT 1-3 MONTHS AFTER GRANT APPROVAL; DESIGN AND BIDDING PROCESS MONTHS 4-5; CONSTRUCTION MONTHS 6-9 AND PROJECT CLOSEOUT PROJECTED TO BE 10 MONTHS AFTER AWARD. DESIGN PLANS WILL BE SUBMITTED TO FTA AT SIGNIFICANT STAGES. REGION 6 IS PROPOSING TO BUILD AN ADMINISTRATIVE BUILDING NORTH OF THEIR CURRENTLY LEASED FACILITY IN MARSHALLTOWN IOWA WHICH WAS ORIGINALLY FUNDED IN 2000 UNDER FTA GRANT IA-03-0087. THE ADDRESS OF THE NEW FACILITY WILL BE EITHER 901 OR 903 EAST MAIN STREET MARSHALLTOWN IOWA. THIS NEW ADMINISTRATIVE BUILDING WILL BE A SHARED USE FACILITY WITH THE REGION 6 PLANNING COMMISSION. THE PURPOSE OF THE NEW FACILITY WILL BE ADMINISTRATIVE AND DISPATCH USES FOR PUBLIC TRANSIT TRANSPORTATION PLANNING AND ECONOMIC AND COMMUNITY PLANNING FUNCTIONS. THE TRANSIT PORTION OF THIS PROJECT IS 53% ACCORDING TO THE REGION 6 FEASIBILITY STUDY. COST ALLOCATION INFORMATION HAS BEEN SUBMITTED REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY FTA AND IS CURRENTLY UNDER REVIEW. LAND CONTRIBUTION WILL NOT BE USED AS PART OF THE MATCH FOR THIS PROJECT. AT THIS TIME THE FINAL DESIGN IS ABOUT 70% COMPLETED AND THE FOLLOWING IMPLEMENTATION SCHEDULE WILL BE FOLLOWED: ADVERTISE AND REQUEST BIDS 1-2 MONTHS AFTER STATE AND FEDERAL FUNDING IS RELEASED 3-4 MONTHS REQUEST BIDS 5-6 MONTHS CONSTRUCTION CONTRACTS EXECUTED AND CONSTRUCTION BEGINS; PROJECT CLOSED OUT PROJECTS TO BE 15-18 MONTHS AFTER AWARD. DESIGN PLANS WILL BE SUBMITTED TO FTA AT SIGNIFICANT STAGES. REGION 12S PROPOSES A FACILITY EXPANSION TO THEIR FACILITY IN CARROLL IOWA. THE BUILDING IS LOCATED AT 1009 EAST ANTHONY IN CARROLL IOWA. THE EXPANSION WOULD BE USED FOR VEHICLE MAINTENANCE VEHICLE STORAGE A LARGER WASH BAY AND A DRIVER TRAINING ROOM AND OFFICE. LAND WILL NOT BE USED AS LOCAL MATCH FOR THIS PROJECT. A COST ALLOCATION HAS BEEN SUBMITTED TO FTA AND IS CURRENTLY UNDER REVIEW. IMPLEMENTATION FOR THIS PROJECT IS CONTINGENT ON RELEASE OF STATE AND FEDERAL FUNDING - LAND ACQUISITION 1-3 MONTHS AFTER GRANT APPROVAL; DESIGN AND BIDDING PROCESS MONTHS 4-8; CONSTRUCTION MONTHS 9-15 AND PROJECT CLOSEOUT PROJECTED TO BE 16 MONTHS AFTER AWARD. DESIGN PLANS WILL BE SUBMITTED TO FTA AT SIGNIFICANT STAGES. THE ORIGINAL BUILDING WAS FUNDED UNDER FTA GRANT IA-03-0066. A PORTION OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE FUNDED WITH STATE FUNDS. THE ENVIRONMENTAL DOCUMENTATION FOR THE FACILITY EXPANSION WAS ELECTRONICALLY SUBMITTED TO FTA AND IS ATTACHED TO THIS GRANT APPLICATION. THE FACILITY IS A SHARED USE FACILITY WITH THE REGION XII COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS. THE TRANSIT PORTION OF THIS PROJECT IS 76.35%.FEASIBILITY STUDIES AND ENVIRONMENTATION DOCUMENTATION FOR EACH FACILITY PROJECT IN THIS GRANT AMENDMENT HAVE BEEN FORWARDED TO MARK BECHTEL WITH THE REGION 7 FTA OFFICE IN KANSAS CITY MO. HE HAS BEEN WORKING WITH EACH TRANSIT PROPERTY ON THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL DOCUMENTATION.PROGRAM OF PROJECTS ATTACHED (GRANT AMENDMENT PROJECTS ARE IN GREEN)ON OCTOBER 29 2007 FH

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE GOAL OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL FUNDING SUPPORT TO HELP METROPOLITAN AND REGIONAL PLANNING AGENCIES COMPLETE THEIR RESPONSIBILITIES OF A METROPOLITAN OR REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION PLANNING PROCESS (WHILE CONSIDERING PLANNING FACTORS AND PLANNING EMPHASIS AREAS TO ADVANCE NATIONAL GOALS) AS THEY WORK ON THE AGENCYS TRANSPORTATION PLANNING PRIORITIES AND ACTIVITIES IDENTIFIED IN THEIR RESPECTIVE WORK PROGRAMS OVER THE NEXT ONE-YEAR PERIOD.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE FHWA STBG TRANSFERRED FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING ACTIVITY EXPENSES AS OUTLINED IN THE MPO AND RPA WORK PROGRAMS. ACTIVITIES AMONG THE METROPOLITAN AND REGIONAL PLANNING AGENCIES WILL GENERALLY BE ATTRIBUTED ADDRESSING PRIORITIES IDENTIFIED THROUGHOUT THE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING PROCESS SUCH AS SHORT-RANGE AND LONG-RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING THROUGH DATA COLLECTION STUDIES PLANS GENERAL SUPPORT OF PROGRAM AND ADMINISTRATIVE OPERATIONS AT THE AGENCIES AND CARRYING OUT SIMILAR TRANSPORTATION PLANNING ACTIVITIES AS PART OF THEIR TRANSPORTATION PLANNING PROCESS FOUND IN UNITED STATES CODE.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE FUNDING WILL ALLOW THESE METROPOLITAN AND REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION PLANNING AGENCIES TO CARRY OUT THE REQUIREMENTS OF A CONTINUING COOPERATIVE AND COMPREHENSIVE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING PROCESS FOR THEIR REGIONAL PLANNING AREA WHILE PERFORMING TRANSPORTATION-RELATED PLANNING AND PROGRAMMING ACTIVITIES FOR FEDERALLY FUNDED HIGHWAY AND TRANSIT PROJECTS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: POPULACE (RESIDENTS OF METROPOLITAN AND NON-METROPOLITAN AREAS SUCH LARGE AND SMALL CITIES COUNTIES) OF TWO MPO AND 10 RPA PLANNING AREAS (STATE OF IOWA).; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE 12 SUBRECIPIENTS HAVE CHOSEN TO UTILIZE FHWA STBG FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING PROCESS IN ACCORDANCE WITH UNITED STATES CODE WHICH ARE IDENTIFIED AS TRANSPORTATION PLANNING ACTIVITIES DESCRIBED WITHIN THEIR INDIVIDUAL MPO AND RPA PLANNING WORK PROGRAMS. THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL GENERALLY INCLUDE WORK RELATED TO LONG RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING SHORT RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND MONITORING GENERAL AND COMPREHENSIVE PLANNING PROGRAM SUPPORT AND ADMINISTRATIVE ITEMS AND VARIOUS OTHER STUDIES AND PLAN ACTIVITIES.

TO PROVIDE SERVICES IN ALL 99 COUNTIES IN IOWA PROVIDE LOCAL TRANSIT AGENCIES TRAINING FELLOWSHIPS OPPORTUNITIES AND FUNDING FOR SHORT TERM PLANNING ACTIVITIES; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE APPLICATION SCOPE OF WORK INCLUDES OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR ELIGIBLE 5311 SUBRECIPIENTS. THE FELLOWSHIPS PAY 100 PERCENT OF THE COST FOR IOWAS SMALL URBAN AND REGIONAL TRANSIT SYSTEMS AND THEIR PLANNERS TO ATTEND IOWA DOT SPONSORED SEMINARS AS WELL AS TRANSIT-RELATED COURSES CONFERENCES OR IN-HOUSE TRAINING AND ALSO INCLUDE A PORTION OF STATEWIDE TRAINING SEMINARS AND A STATEWIDE ANNUAL DRIVER ROADEO.PLANNING FUNDS IN THIS APPLICATION WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION PLANNING ACTIVITIES THAT ARE LISTED IN EACH OF THE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING WORK PROGRAMS (TPWPS) THAT EACH AGENCY IS REQUIRED TO PREPARE AND IS APPROVED BY IOWA DOT. SOME OF THESE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PASSENGER TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT PLANNING (PTDP-COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICE PLANNING) AND GENERAL TRANSIT/TRANSPORTATION PLANNING. ; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE EXPECTED OUTCOME IS EFFICIENT AND TIMELY OPERATING OF TRANSPORTATION SERVICES IN THE RURAL AREAS ACROSS IOWA TRAINING AND CONFERENCE OPPORTUNITIES FOR TRANSIT SYSTEMS AND SHORT TERM PLANNING ACTIVITIES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE CITIZENS ACROSS RURAL COUNTIES IN THE STATE OF IOWA.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE APPLICATION SCOPE OF WORK INCLUDES SERVICE OPERATIONS FOR ELIGIBLE 5311 SUBRECIPIENTS TO PROVIDE SERVICES. SUBRECIPIENTS IN THIS APPLICATION COVER SIXTEEN (16) REGIONAL AREAS SEVEN (7) SMALL CITIES (POPULATIONS UNDER 50000) AND ONE (1) RURAL PORTION OF AN URBAN AREA.

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST SECTION 5311 RURAL FORMULA FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE STATE OF HAWAII (UZA 150000) IN THE AMOUNTS OF $1743512 (FFY2020) $1632099 (FFY2021) AND $2002292 (FFY2022). THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF FEDERAL FUNDS REQUESTED IS $5377903 (A BREAKDOWN IS PROVIDED BELOW).PURPOSE: THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES SECTION 5311 RURAL FORMULA FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE COUNTY TRANSIT AGENCIES THAT SERVE RURAL AREAS WITHIN THE STATE OF HAWAII.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: OPERATING ASSISTANCE WILL BE PROVIDED TO THE COUNTY TRANSIT AGENCIES FOR THEM TO CONTINUE PROVIDING SERVICE TO RURAL AREAS OF HAWAII. HDOT WILL ADMINISTER THE GRANT PROVIDE OVERSIGHT AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND MANAGE FUNDING FOR RTAP ACTIVITIES.EXPECTED OUTCOME: FEDERAL ASSISTANCE WILL ENABLE THE COUNTY TRANSIT AGENCIES TO SUSTAIN THE SERVICES THEY PROVIDE TO THE LOCAL COMMUNITIES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: HMTA SERVES THE ISLAND OF HAWAII CKTA SERVES RESIDENTS OF THE ISLAND OF KAUAI AND MDOT SERVES RESIDENTS IN THE RURAL AREAS OF MAUI. RTAP FUNDS WILL BENEFIT ALL THREE AGENCIES IN ADDITION TO HDOT. RIDERS IN EACH COUNTY THAT RELY ON THE BUS TO TRAVEL FOR MEDICAL EMPLOYMENT EDUCATION AND OTHER NEEDS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE CONTINUED SERVICE THE TRANSIT AGENCIES PROVIDE.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE COUNTY TRANSIT AGENCIES WILL RECEIVE OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO CONTINUE PROVIDING SERVICE TO RURAL AREAS HAWAII THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE. HMTA ALSO PLANS TO USE FUNDING ON THIS GRANT TO CARRY OUT PROJECT ADMINISTRATIVE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES.ADDITIONAL NOTES:1) INTERCITY BUS SERVICE NEEDS ARE ADEQUATELY MET (REFER TO PARAGRAPH REGARDING THE ARCHIPELAGIC MAKE-UP OF HAWAII ON THE LETTER SIGNED BY GOV. DAVID IGE ATTACHED IN TRAMS).2) PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY WAS REQUESTED FOR HMTA TO BEGIN THEIR ACTIVITIES FROM 07/01/2022.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE STATE OF GEORGIA AND ITS SUB-RECIPIENTS FUNDING FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE ELIGIBLE CAPITAL PROJECTS AND THE RURAL TRANSIT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (RTAP) FOR THE STATE AND ITS SUB-RECIPIENTS. ADDITIONALLY THE AWARD PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE STATE OF GEORGIAS INTERCITY BUS PROGRAM (ICB).; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: SECTION 5311 RESOURCES WILL BE USED TO FUND CAPITAL OPERATING AND ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES FOR THE RURAL PUBLIC TRANSIT SYSTEMS WHICH PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO 114 COUNTIES IN THE STATE OF GEORGIA. SECTION 5311 RTAP RESOURCES WILL BE USED TO FUND TRAINING FOR STAFF AND SUB-RECIPIENTS ON FTA COMPLIANCE GUIDELINES AS WELL AS MANAGING TRANSIT-RELATED PROJECTS. 5311(F) INTERCITY BUS PROGRAM RESOURCES WILL BE USED TO FUND ELIGIBLE ICB PROJECTS CURRENTLY UNDER REVIEW. 5339 RESOURCES WILL BE USED TO FUND REPLACEMENT AND EXPANSION VEHICLES FOR SUB-RECIPIENTS OPERATING RURAL TRANSIT SYSTEMS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: CONTINUED SAFE AND EFFECTIVE OPERATION OF TRANSIT SERVICES FOR RURAL AND ICB IN GEORGIA.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: TRANSIT AGENCIES ICB OPERATORS AND TRANSIT RIDERS IN THE STATE OF GEORGIA.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: FUNDING FOR OPERATIONS ADMINISTRATIVE CAPITAL PROJECTS WILL BE RECEIVED BY THE AGENCIES IN THE SFY 2024 PROGRAM OF PROJECTS (POP) UPLOADED TO THIS APPLICATION AS WELL AS THE ICB OPERATORS AWARDED FUNDING FROM THE CALL FOR PROJECTS APPLICATION REVIEW. SUB-RECIPIENT ACTIVITIES ARE OUTLINED IN THE PROJECTS MILESTONES.

ORIGINAL APPLICATIONTHIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST AS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT ARP FUNDING FOR THE GEORGIA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (GDOT) SECTION 5311(F) INTERCITY BUS ARP 5311 RTAP ARP 5311 ARP AND SECTION 5307 ARP FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE SMALL UZAS IN GEORGIA. THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS (PROGRAM OF PROJECTS) ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION WILL PROVIDE A FULL LIST OF ALL OF THE ITEMS AND ACTIVITIES TO BE PROVIDED UNDER THIS PROJECT. GDOT AGREES THAT IF WE RECEIVE FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT GDOT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.GDOT CERTIFIES THAT GDOT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS AND CONTRACTORS THAT ARE PROVIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION HAVE NOT FURLOUGHED ANY EMPLOYEES SINCE MARCH 27 2020. GDOT CERTIFIES THE PROJECTS IN THIS APPLICATION ARE NOT REQUIRED TO BE PROGRAMMED IN THE LONG-RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLAN STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION PLAN OR STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM. THE PROJECTS IN THIS APPLICATION DO NOT LEAD TO A FUNCTIONAL LOCATION OR CAPACITY CHANGE.

FPC04 SCOPE 634 ALI 30.09.08 ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE RESOURCES IN THIS PROJECT WILL BE USED FOR COSTS RELATED TO OPERATIONS PERSONNEL CLEANING AND SANITIZATION COMBATING THE SPREAD OF PATHOGENS ON TRANSIT SYSTEMS AND DEBT SERVICE PAYMENTS INCURRED TO MAINTAIN OPERATIONS AND AVOID LAYOFFS AND FURLOUGHS FOR THE SOUTHEASTERN STAGES INTERCITY BUS SERVICE. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: INTERCITY BUS RIDERS ACROSS THE STATE OF GEORGIASUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: FUNDS IN THIS PROJECT WILL BE USED FOR OPERATING COSTS BY SOUTHEASTERN STAGES. _____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ORIGINAL APPLICATION: GEORGIA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION IS A DESIGNATED RECIPIENT OF THE SECTION 5311 FUNDS. THIS IS AN FFY 2020 SECTION 5311(F) CARES ACT APPLICATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $11164328. THE TOTAL APPORTION TO GEORGIA IS $74428850 5311 $ 592000 APPALACHIAN. THE REMAINING FUNDS WILL BE APPLIED FOR IN ANOTHER APPLICATION. PER THE CARES ACT THE GRANT REQUESTS 100% FEDERAL SHARE. THE APPLICATION SCOPE OF WORK WILL SUBSIDIZE OPERATING LOSS DUE TO COVID-19. BOTH GREYHOUND AND SOUTHEASTERN STAGES ARE AUTHORIZED INTERCITY BUS PROVIDER FOR THE STATE OF GEORGIA. GREYHOUND IS CONTINUING TO OPERATE SERVICE IN GEORGIA AT A MUCH REDUCED FREQUENCY (NATIONWIDE ABOUT 35% OF PRIOR YEAR MILES AT ABOUT 20% OF PRIOR YEAR REVENUE - IN GEORGIA GREYHOUND IS CURRENTLY OPERATING ABOUT 50% OF THE PRIOR YEAR MILES) IN ORDER TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE ESSENTIAL TRANSPORTATION SERVICES WHILE REDUCING OPERATING COSTS AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE. AS OF MARCH 27 2020 SOUTHEASTERN STAGES HAD TEMPORARILY SUSPENDED ALL OPERATIONS UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE. GREYHOUND IS REQUESTING $13079662 IN PROJECTED LOSS AND SOUTHEASTERN STAGES IS REQUESTING $2375202 IN PROJECTED LOSS DUE TO COVID -19 . TOTAL REQUEST IS $15454864. IN THIS APPLICATION SE STAGES WILL RECEIVE $2375202 AND GREYHOUND $8789126. IN TOTAL PROJECT 1 - GDOT WILL BE REQUESTING $11164328 FROM THE FY 2020 CARES ACT FUNDING FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE. THE LOSS IN OPERATIONAL EXPENSES REQUESTED IN THIS APPLICATION WERE DETERMINED BY THE SUPPORTING DOCUMENTATION ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION FROM BOTH GREYHOUND AND SOUTHEASTERN STAGES TO SUPPORT ELIGIBLE OPERATING LOSSES. GREYHOUND DETERMINED THEIR OPERATING COST TO THEIR 2019 STATE OPERATING MILES AND THEIR 2019 TOTAL OPERATING MILES. THAT PERCENTAGE WAS APPLIED TO THEIR TOTAL LOSSES IN ORDER TO DETERMINE THE STATES SHARE OF THEIR TOTAL LOSSES. THE STATE OF GEORGIA REPRESENTED APPROXIMATELY 3.4% OF THE TOTAL MILES GREYHOUND OPERATED IN 2019. THIS PERCENTAGE IS APPLIED TO THE PERIOD JANUARY 20 2020 JUNE 30 2021. SOUTHEASTERN STAGES COMPARED THEIR 2019 STATE OPERATING MILES TO THEIR 2019 TOTAL OPERATING MILES. THAT PERCENTAGE WAS APPLIED TO THEIR TOTAL LOSSES IN ORDER TO DETERMINE THAT THE STATE OF GA REPRESENTED 31% OF THE TOTAL MILES SOUTHEASTERN STAGES OPERATED IN 2019. THIS PERCENTAGE IS APPLIED TO THE PERIOD JANUARY 20 2020 JUNE 30 2021. GDOT UNDERSTANDS THAT THE EXPENSES REQUESTED IN THIS APPLICATION ARE SUBJECT TO REVIEW AS PART OF THE AGENCYS NEXT TRIENNIAL/STATE MANAGEMENT REVIEW.GDOT AGREES THAT IF EITHER GREYHOUND OR SOUTHEASTERN STAGES RECEIVE FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATIONS TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.GDOT WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE. GDOT WILL ENSURE CONTRACTORS PROCURED WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS IS A FEDERAL FISCAL YEAR 2021 (FFY21) SECTION 5311 STATEWIDE AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN (ARP) ACT RURAL AREA APPLICATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $16698428. PER THE ARP ACT THE GRANT REQUESTS 100% FEDERAL SHARE. THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES ARP ACT FUNDING TO HELP RESPOND TO AND RECOVER FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FDOT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS CAPITAL AND OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO SUPPORT PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IN RURAL AREAS WITH POPULATIONS OF LESS THAN 50000 WHERE MANY RESIDENTS OFTEN RELY ON PUBLIC TRANSIT TO REACH THEIR DESTINATIONS. ARP ACT FUNDING ACTIVITIES WILL HELP RESPOND TO AND RECOVER FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. ARP ACT FUNDING WILL PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO THE ELDERLY DISADVANTAGED AND GENERAL POPULATIONS THAT OFTEN RELY ON PUBLIC TRANSIT FOR ACCESS TO EMPLOYMENT MEDICAL EDUCATION AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES. ARP ACT FUNDING ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE SUPPORT VEHICLES ACQUISITION; BUS REPLACEMENT UNDER 30; PROMOTE SUPPORT PROVIDE AND COORDINATE MOBILITY PLANNING AND MANAGEMENT; MISCELLANEOUS EQUIPMENT ACQUISITION; SALARIES AND FRINGE BENEFITS; SAFETY EQUIPMENT; FUEL; PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT; AND OFFICE SUPPLIES AND EXPENSES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT FDOT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS TO CONTINUE TO RESPOND TO AND RECOVER FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC AND SUPPORT PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IN RURAL AREAS WITH POPULATIONS OF LESS THAN 50000 WHERE MANY RESIDENTS OFTEN RELY ON PUBLIC TRANSIT TO REACH THEIR DESTINATIONS. FUNDING WILL ENHANCE ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE EDUCATION EMPLOYMENT AND OTHER ESSENTIAL SERVICES WITHIN THE STATE OF FLORIDA.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: STATE OF FLORIDA RESIDENTS IN RURAL AREAS WITH POPULATIONS OF LESS THAN 50000.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: A TOTAL OF 24 ORGANIZATIONS WILL RECEIVE FUNDING FOR CAPITAL AND OPERATING ASSISTANCE.

ALL OF THESE ELIGIBLE RECIPIENTS ARE USING THEIR SECTION 5311 ALLOCATIONS TO OFFSET OPERATIONAL EXPENSES OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE.THE GRANT IS FOR THE FOLLOWING: CAPITAL MOBILITY MANAGEMENT FOR A COST OF $384000 IN FTA FUNDS (ALI CODE 11.7L.00); STATE ADMINISTRATION FOR A COST OF $1880749 IN FTA FUNDS (ALI CODE 11.80.00); OPERATING ASSISTANCE IN THE AMOUNT OF $29069452 IN FTA FUNDS (ALI CODE 30.09.01); OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR INTERCITY BUS FOR A TOTAL COST OF $5047753 IN FTA FUNDS (ALI CODE 30.90.01); RTAP TRAINING FOR A COST OF $90000 IN FTA FUNDS (ALI CODE 43.50.01); RTAP TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOR A COST OF $300000 IN FTA FUNDS (ALI CODE 43.50.02); RTAP RELATED SUPPORT SERVICES FOR A COST OF $198768 IN FTA FUNDS (ALI CODE 43.50.04); AND STATIONS/TERMINALS FOR INTERCITY BUS SERVICES FOR A COST OF $481813 IN FTA FUNDS (ALI CODE 11.33.11).THE STATE ADMINISTRATION AMOUNT OF $1880749 EQUALS 4.5% OF THE SECTION 5311 ALLOCATION OF $36863767 FOR FFY19 AND FFY20 COMBINED. EACH SUBRECIPIENT WILL SIGN A JOINT PARTICIPATION AGREEMENT WITH THE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION. THIS AGREEMENT WILL ENSURE THAT ALL FEDERAL GRANT REQUIREMENTS ARE MET BY THE SUBRECIPIENT. THIS SHALL INCLUDE THE SUBRECIPIENT PROVIDING A CASH MATCH FOR ITS AWARD IN THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS. FDOT SHALL ENSURE THAT SUBRECIPIENTS HAVE ADEQUATE FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS. IN ADDITION THE FDOT SHALL ENSURE SUBRECIPIENTS HAVE SUFFICIENT FUNDS TO PROVIDE THE LOCAL SHARE AS WELL AS TO OPERATION AND MAINTAIN VEHICLES. NO TOLL REVENUE CREDITS ARE BEING USED.ALL PROJECTS HAVE BEEN APPROVED AND FULLY FUNDED IN THE STIP. APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE STATE OF DELAWARE OPERATING ASSISTANCE ELIGIBLE CAPITAL PROJECTS AND THE RURAL TRANSIT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (RTAP) TO ASSIST THE STATE IN RECOVERING FROM COVID-19 PANDEMIC DURING FY23 FY24.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ALL ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER/MAINTENANCE SALARIES FUEL PURCHASED TRANSPORTATION AND PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE EXPENSES IN ORDER TO CONTINUE TRANSIT OPERATION. FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE CAPITAL EXPENSES SUCH AS THE PURCHASE OF VALIDATORS STATEWIDE PARATRANSIT FLEETS DYNAMIC PASSENGER INFORMATION SYSTEMS FOR FIXED-ROUTE BUSES COMPREHENSIVE REVIEW OF TRANSIT ROUTES POST COVID-19 PANDEMIC IMPACT AND REPLACEMENT OF EXISTING CLOTH SEATS TO PROVIDE A SAFER ENVIRONMENT TO THE PASSENGERS. FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED FOR TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT DART DTC TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE OPERATIONS THAT WOULD OTHERWISE HAVE TO BE CUT DUE TO LACK OF FUNDING AND TO PROVIDE SAFE AND EFFECTIVE OPERATION OF TRANSIT SERVICES IN RURAL AREAS OF SUSSEX COUNTY.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: INTENDED BENEFICIARIES WOULD BE SUSSEX COUNTY CITIZENS IN THE RURAL AND NON-URBANIZED AREAS OF THE STATE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

PURPOSE: THE CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION IS REQUESTING FFY 2020 2021 SECTION 5311 PROGRAM FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $7034027 (FEDERAL FY 20-$3508399 AND FY 21-$3525628) $11729560 (TOTAL) FOR CAPITAL OPERATING ASSISTANCE ADMINISTRATION PLANNING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND RTAP IN SUPPORT OF THE RURAL TRANSIT PROGRAM IN THE STATE OF CONNECTICUT. THE LOCAL FUNDING MATCH AND SOURCE IS FROM THE STATE OF CONNECTICUT LEGISLATIVE APPROPRIATION. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:FUNDS ARE NECESSARY TO CONTINUE PROVIDING TRANSIT SERVICES TO GENERAL PUBLIC IN THE SECTION 5311 SUBRECIPIENTS NONURBANIZED AREAS. THOSE SERVICES WHICH PRIMARILY INCLUDE DEVIATED FIXED ROUTES DIAL A RIDE SERVICES AND JOB ACCESS AND REVERSE COMMUTE SERVICES ARE DESIGNED TO MAXIMIZE USAGE BY MEMBERS OF THE GENERAL PUBLIC AND ESPECIALLY THOSE WHO ARE TRANSPORTATION DISADVANTAGED PERSONS INCLUDING ELDERLY PERSONS PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES MINORITIES AND LOW INCOME WHO OFTEN DO NOT HAVE ANY OTHER TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS. MAJORITY OF OPERATING ASSISTANCE FUNDS ARE USED FOR DRIVERS WAGES AND MAINTENANCE AND FUEL OF THE VEHICLES. WITHOUT THESE FUNDS THOSE SERVICES WOULD CEASE TO EXIST.CAPITAL PROJECTS INCLUDE THE PURCHASE OF THIRTEEN (13) SMALL BUSES SECURITY CAMERAS COMPUTER HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE BUS SHELTERS AND OTHER MISCELLANEOUS SUPPORT EQUIPMENT.FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED FOR COMPREHENSIVE TRANSIT PLANNING ACTIVITIES AS IDENTIFIED IN THE ATTACHED UNIFIED PLANNING WORK PROGRAMS.THE RTAP PROGRAM PROVIDES VARIOUS COURSES AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AT NO-COST TO DRIVERS AND SUB-RECIPIENTS OF 5311 FUNDING. THESE FUNDS ARE TO ASSIST IN THE DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROJECTS AND OTHER SUPPORT SERVICES TAILORED TO MEET THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF TRANSIT OPERATORS IN NONURBANIZED AREAS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THESE PROJECTS SUPPORT THE RURAL TRANSIT PROGRAM IN THE STATE OF CONNECTICUT AND PROVIDE CONTINUED SERVICE TO THE STATES RESIDENTS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:FIVE RURAL TRANSIT DISTRICTS AND TWO MPOS WILL RECEIVE FUNDS THAT WILL BENEFIT RESIDENTS LIVING IN RURAL AREAS OF CONNECTICUT.- ESTUARY TRANSIT DISTRICT - CHESTER CLINTON DEEP RIVER DURHAM ESSEX EAST HADDAM HADDAM KILLINGWORTH LYME OLD LYME OLD SAYBROOK AND WESTBROOK- MIDDLETOWN AREA TRANSIT DISTRICT EAST HAMPTON AND PORTLAND- NORTHEASTERN CT TRANSIT DISTRICT - BROOKLYN CANTERBURY KILLINGLY PUTNAM THOMPSON EASTFORD PLAINFIELD POMFRET WOODSTOCK AND UNION- NORTHWESTERN CT TRANSIT DISTRICT - TORRINGTON WINSTED AND LITCHFIELD BARKHAMSTED CANAAN FALLS VILLAGE SHARON SALISBURY COLEBROOK CORNWALL - GOSHEN HARWINTON KENT WARREN LITCHFIELD MORRIS NEW HARTFORD NORFOLK TORRINGTON WINCHESTER WINSTED- WINDHAM REGION TRANSIT DISTRICT ASHFORD CHAPLIN COLUMBIA COVENTRY LEBANON MANSFIELD SCOTLAND WILLINGTON AND WINDHAM - NORTHEASTERN CONNECTICUT COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (NECCOG)- NORTHWEST HILLS COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (NHCOG)SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:- ESTUARY TRANSIT DISTRICT - THREE (3) SMALL BUSES MISCELLANEOUS SUPPORT EQUIPMENT OPERATING ASSISTANCE- MIDDLETOWN AREA TRANSIT DISTRICT OPERATING ASSISTANCE- NORTHEASTERN CT TRANSIT DISTRICT - SIX (6) SMALL BUSES MISCELLANEOUS SUPPORT EQUIPMENT OPERATING ASSISTANCE- NORTHWESTERN CT TRANSIT DISTRICT - TWO (2) SMALL BUSES MISCELLANEOUS SUPPORT EQUIPMENT OPERATING ASSISTANCE- WINDHAM REGION TRANSIT DISTRICT TWO (2) SMALL BUSES MISCELLANEOUS SUPPORT EQUIPMENT OPERATING ASSISTANCE- NORTHEASTERN CONNECTICUT COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (NECCOG) - COMPREHENSIVE TRANSIT PLANNING- NORTHWEST HILLS COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (NHCOG) - COMPREHENSIVE TRANSIT PLANNINGTHE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS FILE IS ATTACHED IN THE PROJECT INFORMATION SECTION OF THIS APPLICATION. ALL PROJECTS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS GRANT ARE INCLUDED ON PAGES 12 13 OF THE 2022 STIP UNDER FEDERAL AID CODE (FA CODE) 5311 WHICH WAS MOST RECENTLY CHANGED VIA STIP ADMINISTRATIVE AMENDMENT 4/13/2022. CTDOT IS CURRENT WITH CIVIL RIGHTS REQUIREMENTS MILESTONE PROGRESS REPORTS AND FINANCIAL STATUS REPORTS.

PER CARES/CRRSAA/ARP THE GRANT REQUESTS 100% FEDERAL SHARE AND THE ACTIVITIES IN THIS APPLICATIONMASHANTUCKET PEQUOT TRIBAL NATION AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.INDIRECT COSTS WILL BE APPLIED AT APPROVED RATE OF 41.34% PER THE ATTACHED DOCUMENTATION. EXECUTIVE SUMMARYMPTN IS REQUESTING $267290 IN FY19 5311 FORMULA FUNDS FOR ITS COMMUNITY BUSING DEPARTMENT FOR1. OPERATING SERVICE - $181652 FOR FY22 AND $80765 FOR FY23A. THESE FUNDS WILL ALLOW THE MPTN TO CONTINUE PROVIDING VITAL TRANSIT SERVICE THROUGHOUT THE RESERVATION. THIS SERVICE PROVIDES TRANSPORTATION FOR THE ELDERLY TRIBAL MEMBERS WHO NEED TO REACH MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AT THE TRIBAL HEALTH SERVICES CLINIC OR NEED TO REACH THEIR JOBS AT THE GRAND PEQUOT TOWER THIS IS ESPECIALLY IMPORTANT FOR RESIDENTS WITHOUT PRIVATELY OWNED VEHICLES. THE BREAKDOWN OF FEDERAL FUNDING GOES TOWARDS SALARIES FOR A MOBILITY MANAGER DRIVER SALARIES FRINGE BENEFITS AND FUEL. THERE IS A GAP IN FUNDING FOR FY23 BUT THIS WILL BE COVERED IN A FUTURE GRANT.2. REPAIRS TO THE MASHANTUCKET PEQUOT MAINTENANCE FACILITY - $4873A. THERE ARE CONTINUED REPAIRS THAT ARE REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN THE TRIBES PRIMARY MAINTENANCE FACILITY IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR. THE FACILITY IS VITAL TO PROVIDING UNINTERRUPTED TRANSIT SERVICE BECAUSE IT SERVES AS THE LOCATION FOR TRANSIT VEHICLE MAINTENANCE. EXPENSES WILL INCLUDE PARTS AND LABOR FOR CONCRETE REPAIRS AROUND THE GARAGE DOORS. B. THESE REPAIRS WERE STARTED IN FTA CT-2020-001 WHICH FOCUSED ON THE PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION OF LIGHTING AND GENERAL REPAIRS TO THE GARAGE DOORS FOR A TOTAL OF $19212. TOTAL FEDERAL INVESTMENT AT THIS FACILITY IS $24085.INDIRECT COSTS WILL BE APPLIED AT APPROVED RATE OF 41.34% PER THE ATTACHED DOCUMENTATION.PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: DATE OF AWARD TO SEPTEMBER 30 2024MASHANTUCKET PEQUOT TRIBAL NATION EXECUTED ITS FFY21 CERTIFICATIONS AND ASSURANCES IN TRAMS ON 8/12/2021 FTA PLANNING REQUIREMENTS TRIBES ARE NOT SUBJECT TO FEDERAL PLANNING REQUIREMENTS AND THE FTA WILL NOT REQUIRE TRIBES TO ATTACH TRIBAL TRANSPORTATION PLANS TO A STIP (STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM). LOCAL SHARE REQUIREMENT THE FTA DOES NOT REQUIRE A NON-FEDERAL MATCHING SHARE FOR TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM GRANTS. FEDERAL LABOR PROTECTIONS BECAUSE DIRECT GRANTS FROM THE FTA TO TRIBES DO NOT INVOLVE A STATE-RECIPIENT RELATIONSHIP THE LABOR PROTECTIVE PROVISIONS OF 49 U.S.C. 5333 (B) DO NOT APPLY TO THIS PROGRAM.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS APPLICATION IS TO ASSIST WITH OPERATIONAL FUNDS FOR UPGRADING RECLASSIFYING AND RETAINING TRANSIT EMPLOYEES. OPERATIONAL FUNDS WILL INCLUDE EXPENSES NEEDED FOR FUEL COSTS FOR THE REMAINING YEAR OF FY22 FY23. LASTLY OPERATIONAL FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR ADMINISTRATION SUPPLIES/EQUIPMENT FOR THE TRANSIT FACILITY AND ASSISTANCE WITH THE TRANSIT ADMINISTRATIONS OPERATIONS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITIES THAT WILL BE PERFORMED IS TO UTILIZE TOWARDS STAFF WAGES FUEL MAINTENANCE COSTS AND ITEMS HAVING A USELESS LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE OUTCOMES OF HAVING THIS GRANT APPLICATION APPROVED WILL BE TO IMPROVE THE TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM BY RETAINING EMPLOYEES AND ATTRACTING QUALIFIED JOB APPLICANTS FOR OPEN TRANSIT POSITIONS. THE INFLATED FUEL RATES HAVE TREMENDOUSLY AFFECTED THE TRIBE AS THE MONTHLY FUEL BILL HAS DOUBLED IN COSTS FROM BEING $4.61 A GALLON IN 2021 TO $6.59 A GALLON IN 2022.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFITS OF THIS GRANT AWARD WILL IMPROVE THE TRIBE TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM BY RETAINING EMPLOYEES AND ATTRACTING QUALIFIED JOB APPLICANTS FOR OPEN TRANSIT POSITIONS. THE CURRENT WAGES THAT ARE IN PLACE ARE NOT COMPETITIVE WITH JOBS IN THIS RURAL AREA. THE COMMUNITIES OF KLAMATH TOWNSITE KLAMATH GLEN REQUA HILL HUNTER CREEK CONNECTS TO CRESCENT CITY AND HUMBOLDT COUNTY TO INCLUDE WEITCHPEC MARTINS FERRY KENEK CAPPEL NOTCHKO METTAH PECWAN WAUTEC AND HOOPA WILL BENEFIT FROM TRANSIT SERVICES FOR ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE AND BASIC NEEDS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

THE ADA COMPLIANT TRANSIT SERVICE WILL INCREASE ELDERLY AND DISABLED PERSONS MOBILITY.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: KLAMATH SERVICE AREA TO INCLUDE THE KLAMATH TOWNSITE KLAMATH GLEN REQUA HILL HUNTER CREEK CONNECTS TO CRESCENT CITY AND HUMBOLDT COUNTY TO INCLUDE WEITCHPEC MARTINS FERRY KENEK CAPPEL NOTCHKO METTAH PECWAN WAUTEC AND HOOPA.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.
