APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE FUNDING IN THIS APPLICATION WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT OPERATIONS OF NORTH FORK RANCHERIA TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM RELATED TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE ALL RELATED OPERATING COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE NORTH FORK RANCHERIA TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM. COSTS INCLUDE PAYROLL AND BENEFITS OF THE TRANSPORTATION SERVICE MANAGER AND DRIVERS OFFICE EXPENSES PHONES FUEL AND RELATED MAINTENANCE COSTS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: NFRTTP HAS THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES AND BENEFITS:IMPROVE MOBILITY AND ACCESS: MOBILITY AND ACCESS BETWEEN NORTH FORK AND THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES INCLUDING MADERA CHOWCHILLA AND FRESNO IS LIMITED. THERE ARE ONLY TWO MAJOR ROADWAYS THROUGH NORTH FORK THAT PROVIDE ACCESS TO OTHER PARTS OF THE COUNTY AND TRANSIT SERVICES ARE LIMITED FOR PEOPLE LIVING IN REMOTE AREAS. THE NFRTTP WILL ADDRESS THESE ISSUES BY DEVELOPING A SET OF TRANSPORTATION ALTERNATIVES THAT ENHANCE THE EXISTING TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM BY PROVIDING MORE TRAVEL CHOICES AND BETTER CONNECTIVITY.STIMULATE THE ECONOMY: THE UNEMPLOYMENT RATE IN THE PROJECT AREA IS HIGHER THAN THE NATIONAL AVERAGE WITH MANY RESIDENTS LIVING IN SURROUNDING AREAS COMMUTING UP TO 40-50 MILES EACH WAY FOR WORK IN THE CITIES OF MADERA CHOWCHILLA AND FRESNO. THE NFRTTP WILL ADDRESS THIS ISSUE BY IMPROVING THE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AND NETWORK CONNECTIVITY. ADDITIONALLY THE TRIBE HAS PROPOSED A CASINO PENDING FEDERAL APPROVAL; IT IS EXPECTED TO STIMULATE THE ECONOMY FOR THE TRIBE AND ENTIRE REGION BY PROVIDING MORE JOBS INVESTMENT AND OPPORTUNITIES. FUTURE TRANSIT PLANS INCLUDE A FIXED ROUTE SERVICE FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS TO EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES AT THE PROPOSED CASINO AND OTHER EMPLOYMENT DESTINATIONS. ENHANCE PUBLIC SAFETY AND SECURITY: ENHANCED TRANSIT OPERATIONS AND OTHER TRANSPORTATION MODES WILL ENSURE THE SAFETY AND SECURITY OF TRAVEL FOR PEOPLE GOODS SERVICES AND INFORMATION. REFLECT COMMUNITY VALUES: TRIBAL MEMBERS HAVE STRONG COMMUNITY VALUES AND A RICH CULTURAL HISTORY THAT IS DEEPLY EMBEDDED IN THE AREA. IT IS ESSENTIAL THAT TRANSIT SERVICE BALANCE AND INTEGRATE TRIBAL VALUES THROUGH PUBLIC OUTREACH EFFORTS AND COORDINATION WITH TRIBAL MEMBERS.ENHANCE THE ENVIRONMENT: A UNIQUE CHARACTERISTIC OF THE PROJECT AREA IS ITS ENVIRONMENTAL FEATURES IT IS ESSENTIAL THAT THE GROWTH AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT OF THE REGION DOES NOT AFFECT THE ENVIRONMENT. THE TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM WILL PROMOTE SUSTAINABLE TRANSPORTATION ALTERNATIVES THAT MEET THE NEEDS OF THE RESIDENTS AS WELL AS THE ENVIRONMENT.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE TRIBES INVESTMENT IN TRANSIT HAS AIDED IN SERVING MOBILITY TO HEALTHCARE AND OTHER ESSENTIAL SERVICES. OVERALL NFRTTPS SERVICE HAS ENHANCED THE COMMUNITYS VIABILITY BY PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION TO ESSENTIAL SERVICES IMPROVING SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR THE COMMUNITY MEMBERS. THE SERVICE HAS IMPROVED ACCESS AND FILLED GAPS TO IMPORTANT DESTINATIONS AND SERVICES THAT WERE NOT PREVIOUSLY SERVED BY ANY OTHER PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE. NFRTTP ALSO ALLOWS FOR CONNECTION TO OTHER REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. THE COMBINATION AIMS TO INCREASE ACCESS TO JOBS EDUCATION HEALTH CARE AND OTHER ESSENTIAL SERVICES. THE REQUESTED FUNDS WILL MAINTAIN SERVICES THAT HAVE BEEN VERY IMPACTFUL FOR THE TRIBE. THE SERVICE TARGETS QUALITATIVE BENEFITS OF INCREASED INCOME HEALTH MOBILITY AND ACCESS TO ESSENTIAL SERVICES WITH AN ANCILLARY POSITIVE OUTCOME SUCH AS DECREASED SUBSTANCE ABUSE IMPROVED CHILD WELFARE INCREASED SELF-SUFFICIENCY FOR FAMILIES AND AN OVERALL IMPROVED QUALITY OF LIFE.THE NORTH FORK RANCHERIA TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM (NFRTTP) SERVES THE NORTH FORK RANCHERIA COMMUNITY. NFRTTP PROVIDES SERVICE TO ELIGIBLE COMMUNITY MEMBERS LIVING WITHIN A FIFTY (50) MILE RADIUS OF THE NORTH FORK RANCHERIA TRIBAL GOVERNMENT OFFICE AND WILL TRANSPORT TO DESTINATIONS WITHIN A 50 MILE RADIUS OF THE NORTH FORK RANCHERIA TRIBAL GOVERNMENT OFFICE. THIS SERVICE EXTENDS INTO FRESNO MADERA AND MARIPOSA COUNTIES. NFRTTP ALSO SERVICES ALL PERSONS RESIDING ON TRIBAL TRUST LAND AND PUBLIC DOMAIN ALLOTMENTS IN THE NORTH FORK AREA WHICH WERE NOT PREVIOUSLY SERVED BY ANY PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE. DESTINATIONS EXCEEDING THE FIFTY (50) MILE SERVICE RADIUS MAY BE APPROVED BY THE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES MANAGER AND WILL BE GRANTED BASED ON THE PRIORITY OF THE TRIP AND ON SERVICE AVAILABILITY.THE CURRENT AREAS SERVED CONSISTS OF THE LAND OWNED BY THE NORTH FORK RANCHERIA OF MONO INDIANS OF CALIFORNIA AND SURROUNDING AREAS WHERE TRIBAL MEMBERS LIVE AND WORK INCLUDING THE ROADWAYS THAT LEAD IN AND OUT OF TRIBAL AND NON-TRIBAL TRUST LAND.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.

THE NFRTTP WILL ADDRESS THIS ISSUE BY IMPROVING THE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AND NETWORK CONNECTIVITY. ADDITIONALLY THE TRIBE HAS PROPOSED A CASINO PENDING FEDERAL APPROVAL; IT IS EXPECTED TO STIMULATE THE ECONOMY FOR THE TRIBE AND ENTIRE REGION BY PROVIDING MORE JOBS INVESTMENT AND OPPORTUNITIES. FUTURE TRANSIT PLANS INCLUDE A FIXED ROUTE SERVICE FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS TO EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES AT THE PROPOSED CASINO AND OTHER EMPLOYMENT DESTINATIONS. ENHANCE PUBLIC SAFETY AND SECURITY: ENHANCED TRANSIT OPERATIONS AND OTHER TRANSPORTATION MODES WILL ENSURE THE SAFETY AND SECURITY OF TRAVEL FOR PEOPLE GOODS SERVICES AND INFORMATION. REFLECT COMMUNITY VALUES: TRIBAL MEMBERS HAVE STRONG COMMUNITY VALUES AND A RICH CULTURAL HISTORY THAT IS DEEPLY EMBEDDED IN THE AREA. IT IS ESSENTIAL THAT TRANSIT SERVICE BALANCE AND INTEGRATE TRIBAL VALUES THROUGH PUBLIC OUTREACH EFFORTS AND COORDINATION WITH TRIBAL MEMBERS.ENHANCE THE ENVIRONMENT: A UNIQUE CHARACTERISTIC OF THE PROJECT AREA IS ITS ENVIRONMENTAL FEATURES IT IS ESSENTIAL THAT THE GROWTH AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT OF THE REGION DOES NOT AFFECT THE ENVIRONMENT. THE TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM WILL PROMOTE SUSTAINABLE TRANSPORTATION ALTERNATIVES THAT MEET THE NEEDS OF THE RESIDENTS AS WELL AS THE ENVIRONMENT.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE TRIBES INVESTMENT IN TRANSIT HAS AIDED IN SERVING MOBILITY TO HEALTHCARE AND OTHER ESSENTIAL SERVICES. OVERALL NFRTTPS SERVICE HAS ENHANCED THE COMMUNITYS VIABILITY BY PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION TO ESSENTIAL SERVICES IMPROVING SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR THE COMMUNITY MEMBERS. THE SERVICE HAS IMPROVED ACCESS AND FILLED GAPS TO IMPORTANT DESTINATIONS AND SERVICES THAT WERE NOT PREVIOUSLY SERVED BY ANY OTHER PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE. NFRTTP ALSO ALLOWS FOR CONNECTION TO OTHER REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. THE COMBINATION AIMS TO INCREASE ACCESS TO JOBS EDUCATION HEALTH CARE AND OTHER ESSENTIAL SERVICES. THE REQUESTED FUNDS WILL MAINTAIN SERVICES THAT HAVE BEEN VERY IMPACTFUL FOR THE TRIBE. THE SERVICE TARGETS QUALITATIVE BENEFITS OF INCREASED INCOME HEALTH MOBILITY AND ACCESS TO ESSENTIAL SERVICES WITH AN ANCILLARY POSITIVE OUTCOME SUCH AS DECREASED SUBSTANCE ABUSE IMPROVED CHILD WELFARE INCREASED SELF-SUFFICIENCY FOR FAMILIES AND AN OVERALL IMPROVED QUALITY OF LIFE.THE NORTH FORK RANCHERIA TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM (NFRTTP) SERVES THE NORTH FORK RANCHERIA COMMUNITY. NFRTTP PROVIDES SERVICE TO ELIGIBLE COMMUNITY MEMBERS LIVING WITHIN A FIFTY (50) MILE RADIUS OF THE NORTH FORK RANCHERIA TRIBAL GOVERNMENT OFFICE AND WILL TRANSPORT TO DESTINATIONS WITHIN A 50 MILE RADIUS OF THE NORTH FORK RANCHERIA TRIBAL GOVERNMENT OFFICE. THIS SERVICE EXTENDS INTO FRESNO MADERA AND MARIPOSA COUNTIES. NFRTTP ALSO SERVICES ALL PERSONS RESIDING ON TRIBAL TRUST LAND AND PUBLIC DOMAIN ALLOTMENTS IN THE NORTH FORK AREA WHICH WERE NOT PREVIOUSLY SERVED BY ANY PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE. DESTINATIONS EXCEEDING THE FIFTY (50) MILE SERVICE RADIUS MAY BE APPROVED BY THE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES MANAGER AND WILL BE GRANTED BASED ON THE PRIORITY OF THE TRIP AND ON SERVICE AVAILABILITY.THE CURRENT AREAS SERVED CONSISTS OF THE LAND OWNED BY THE NORTH FORK RANCHERIA OF MONO INDIANS OF CALIFORNIA AND SURROUNDING AREAS WHERE TRIBAL MEMBERS LIVE AND WORK INCLUDING THE ROADWAYS THAT LEAD IN AND OUT OF TRIBAL AND NON-TRIBAL TRUST LAND.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST FY2019 SECTION 5311 TRIBAL TRANSIT COMPETITIVE FUNDING APPOINTED TO BLUE LAKE RANCHERIA CALIFORNIA IN THE AMOUNT OF $25000. THE AWARDS WERE ANNOUNCED IN 2020 AND THUS DO NOT LAPSE UNTIL 2022.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS APPLICATION IS TO ASSIST WITH UPDATING THE BLUE LAKE RANCHERIAS 2011 TRANSPORTATION PLAN. IT IS OUTDATED AND IN VITAL NEED OF BEING UPDATED. THE FUNDING WILL BE UTILIZED BY HIRING A CONSULTANT/CONTRACTOR TO WORK ON UPDATING THE TRIBES TRANSPORTATION PLAN. IT HAS BEEN ELEVEN (11) YEARS SINCE THE PLAN WAS LAST UPDATED FROM THE 1997 PLAN. THE TRANSPORTATION NETWORK ON THE RANCHERIA HAS CHANGED CONSIDERABLY SINCE 2011. ITEMS NEEDING SERIES UPDATES ARE; DEMOGRAPHICS INCOME HOUSING DATE COMMUTE PATTERNS BUSINESS OPERATIONS CURRENT LAND USE ACCESS OF SERVICES COLLISION DATA AND FUTURE LAND USE. ALL OF THE LISTED ITEMS IN NEED OF UPDATING ARE HIGHLY IMPORTANT TO THE COMMUNITY AS IT LOOKS TO ITS FUTURE. THIS WILL BE A LONG RANGE PLAN AS DETERMINED BY THE TRIBE ON A TEN-YEAR CYCLE. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITY THAT WILL BE PERFORMED DURING THIS GRANT PERFORMANCE PERIOD IS THE UPDATE OF THE TRIBES 2011 TRANSPORTATION PLAN. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE OUTCOME OF HAVING THIS GRANT APPLICATION APPROVED WILL BE TO HAVE AN UPDATED TRANSPORTATION PLAN. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFITS OF THIS GRANT AWARD WILL IMPROVE THE CURRENT TRANSPORTATION PLAN. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE. THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST FY 2022 SECTION 5311 TRIBAL TRANSIT FORMULA FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE QUECHAN INDIAN TRIBE OF THE FORT YUMA INDIAN RESERVATION ARIZONA AND CALIFORNIA IN THE AMOUNT OF $34411. PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS APPLICATION IS TO ASSIST WITH OPERATIONAL FUNDS TO CONTINUE THE EXISTING TRANSIT SERVICE IN THE YUMA ARIZONA REGION FROM JULY 1 2022 TO JUNE 30 2023. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITIES WILL COVER THE OPERATING EXPENSES OF OUR CONTINUING PROJECT WITH TRANSIT SERVICES PROVIDED BY THE YUMA COUNTY INTERGOVERNMENTAL PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (YCIPTA) UNDER A MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING BETWEEN YCIPTA AND THE TRIBE. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE OUTCOMES OF HAVING THIS GRANT APPLICATION APPROVED WILL BE TO CONTINUE THE EXISTING TRANSIT SERVICE SERVING THE QUECHAN INDIAN TRIBE AND CONSISTING OF A LOCAL CIRCULATOR THE BLUE ROUTE 5 SERVING RESIDENTS OF THE FORT YUMA INDIAN RESERVATION AND WINTERHAVEN CALIFORNIA AS WELL AS EMPLOYEES OF THE QUECHAN CASINO RESORT AND PARADISE CASINO. THE SERVICE ALSO CONSISTS OF A REGIONAL CONNECTOR THE TURQUOISE ROUTE 10 CONNECTING THE RESERVATION AND WINTERHAVEN CALIFORNIA RESIDENTS WITH THE IMPERIAL COUNTY SEAT EL CENTRO CALIFORNIA. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFITS OF THIS GRANT AWARD WILL IMPROVE THE QUECHAN INDIAN TRIBES TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM BY CONTINUING TO PROVIDE RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION SERVICE TO AREA TRANSIT RIDERS THAT CONNECT THEM TO EMPLOYMENT SHOPPING MEDICAL; AND OTHER TRANSIT SYSTEMS IN YUMA AND THE IMPERIAL COUNTY SEAT IN EL CENTRO CALIFORNIA. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE. THE FOLLOWING IS A BREAKDOWN OF COSTS THAT WILL BE USED WITH THIS AWARD: THIS FY 2022 TTP FORMULA FUNDS WILL BE USED TO CONTINUE AN EXISTING CONTRACT FOR TRIBAL SERVICES FOR LOCAL (YCAT BLUE 5) AND REGIONAL (YCAT TURQUOISE 10) ROUTES.FEDERAL FUNDS: FY2022 5311 TRIBAL TRANSIT FORMULA OPERATING ASSISTANCE FUNDS FROM QUECHAN INDIAN TRIBE (AZ CA) FOR $34411 LOCAL MATCH: $0 LOCAL SALES TAX TOTAL PROJECT COSTS: $34411

PURPOSE:THIS GRANT PROVIDES $2000000 IN FY 22 STP-CRRSAA FUNDING TO BE TRANSFERRED FROM FHWA TO FTA AND $863000 IN LOCAL MATCH FUNDS. THE TIP ID FOR THIS PROJECT IS ALA210016 APPROVED ON JULY 16 2021.THE FUNDING FOR THE PROJECT IS:$260000 FOR ENGINEERING AND DESIGN$182000 FTA (70%)$78000 LOCAL MATCH (30%)$2603000 FOR CONSTRUCTION INCLUDING ACQUISITION AND INSTALLATION OF PASSENGER FACILITIES AND EQUIPMENT$1818000 FTA (70%)$785000 LOCAL MATCH (30%)THE PROJECT IS ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE REGIONAL STP FUNDING PROGRAMMED BY THE METROPOLITAN TRANSPORTATION COMMISSION AND ALLOCATED BY THE CALIFORNIA TRANSPORTATION COMMISSION FOR TRANSIT CAPITAL PROJECTS INCLUDING TRANSIT PASSENGER FACILITIES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:LAVTAS PASSENGER FACILITIES ENHANCEMENTS PROJECT WILL SIGNIFICANTLY IMPROVE PASSENGER AMENITIES AT THREE HIGH-RIDERSHIP STOPS IN THE RAPID NETWORK. IMPROVEMENTS WILL INCLUDE DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF CUSTOM RAPID-BRANDED PASSENGER SHELTERS AND SIGNAGE REAL-TIME TRANSIT INFORMATION DISPLAYS BIKE RACKS WASTE RECEPTACLES AND PLACEMAKING ELEMENTS.EXPECTED OUTCOMESTHE PROJECT IS INTENDED TO BRING WORLD-CLASS TRANSIT AMENITIES TO HIGH-RIDERSHIP LOCATIONS IN LAVTAS SERVICE AREA NOT ALREADY SLATED FOR IMPROVEMENTS. IMPROVEMENTS ARE AIMED AT CREATING ATTRACTIVE AND SEAMLESS (TIMED) FIRST/LAST MILE CONNECTIONS TO LOCAL BUSINESS AND SHOPPING ACTIVITY CENTERS AS WELL AS REGIONAL TRANSIT. LAVTA WILL INCORPORATE MAINTENANCE OF THE NEW FACILITIES INTO ITS EXISTING BUS SHELTER MAINTENANCE PROGRAM.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:PROJECT WILL SUPPORT BOTH CHOICE/COMMUTE RIDERS TO PROMOTE REGIONAL SUSTAINABILITY GOALS AS WELL AS FOCUSING ON EQUITY BY IMPROVING THE EXPERIENCE OF RIDERS WHO DONT TRAVEL BY CAR. PROJECTS WILL BE HIGH-PROFILE VISIBLE AND ACCESSIBLE TO ALL SYSTEM USERS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS FOR THIS AWARD.THE RECIPIENT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.

AWARDS WERE ANNOUNCED ON JANUARY 8 2013 IN THE FEDERAL REGISTER HERE: HTTP://WWW.GPO.GOV/FDSYS/PKG/FR-2013-01-08/PDF/2013-00167.PDFTHE TRIBE WILL USE THESE FUNDS TO OPERATE EXISTING DEMAND RESPONSIVE ROUTE TRANSIT SERVICE ON AND NEAR THE YUROK RESERVATION. THE GRANT AMOUNT OF $265000 WILL BE USED FOR CONTINUING OPERATING SERVICE(DEL NORTE COUNTY) AND THE PURCHASE OF A NEW TRANSIT VAN (HUMBOLDT COUNTY).YUROK TRIBAL TRANSIT SERVICE WILL PROVIDE TRANSIT SERVICE TO RIDERS FROM THE COMMUNITIES IN AND AROUND THE KLAMATH AREA ON THE YUROK RESERVATION DEL NORTE COUNTY. THE OPERATING SERVICE WILL TRANSPORT RIDERS FROM KLAMATH TO CRESCENT CITY FIVE DAYS A WEEK. THE OPERATING ASSISTANCE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO EMPLOY OUR CURRENT BUS DRIVER AND DISPATCHER FOR THE OPERATION OF A YUROK TRANSIT SERVICE. ALSO THE OPERATING ASSISTANCE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR THE TRAINING OF DRIVERS BUS EQUIPMENT AND DISPATCH SUPPLIES. PURCHASE OF NEW TRANSIT VAN WILL BE USED FOR DAILY TRANSIT SERVICE WITHIN ORLEANS WEITCHPEC AND WAUTEC AREAS ON THE YUROK RESERVATION. RIDERSHIP IS PROJECTED TO BE ABOUT 2500 PER YEAR.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS APPLICATION IS TO ASSIST WITH OPERATIONAL FUNDS FOR UPGRADING RECLASSIFYING AND RETAINING TRANSIT EMPLOYEES. OPERATIONAL FUNDS WILL INCLUDE EXPENSES NEEDED FOR FUEL COST FOR THE REMAINING YEAR OF FY22 TO FY 2027. LASTLY OPERATIONAL FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR ADMINISTRATION SUPPLIES/MATERIAL FOR THE NEWLY CONSTRUCTED TRANSIT FACILITY AND ASSISTANCE WITH THE TRANSIT ADMINISTRATIONS OPERATIONS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITIES THAT WILL BE PERFORMED IS TO UPGRADE AND RECLASSIFY THE CURRENT TRANSIT DISPATCHER AND TRANSIT OPERATOR POSITIONS WITHIN THE TRIBE AS WELL AS UPGRADE THE GPS SYSTEMS AND SOFTWARE SYSTEMS FOR THE TRANSIT PROGRAM.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE OUTCOMES OF HAVING THIS GRANT APPLICATION APPROVED WILL BE TO IMPROVE THE TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM BY RETAINING EMPLOYEES AND ATTRACTING QUALIFIED JOB APPLICATIONS FOR OPEN TRANSIT POSITIONS. THE CURRENT WAGES THAT ARE IN PLACE ARE NOT COMPETITIVE WITH JOBS IN THIS RURAL AREA. THE JOB MARKET WITH WAREHOUSE WORK OR OTHER RURAL TRANSIT AGENCIES PAY HIGHER WAGES THIS MAKING IT DIFFICULT TO RECRUIT QUALIFIED DRIVERS AND DISPATCHERS. THE INFLATED FUEL RATES HAVE TREMENDOUSLY AFFECTED THE TRIBE AS THE MONTHLY FUEL BILL HAS DOUBLED IN COSTS FROM BEING $6000.00 PER MONTH IN 2021 TO $8000.00 IN THE MONTH OF MAY 2022.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFITS OF THIS GRANT AWARD WILL IMPROVE THE TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM BY RETAINING EMPLOYEES AND ATTRACTING QUALIFIED JOB APPLICANTS FOR OPEN TRANSIT POSITIONS. THE CURRENT WAGES THAT ARE IN PLACE ARE NOT COMPETITIVE WITH JOBS IN THIS RURAL AREA. THE JOB MARKET WITH WAREHOUSE WORK OR OTHER RURAL TRANSIT AGENCIES PAY HIGHER WAGES THUS MAKING IT DIFFICULT TO RECRUIT QUALIFIED DRIVERS AND DISPATCHERS. THE SALARIES FOR THE CURRENT TRANSIT DISPATCHER AND TRANSIT OPERATORS WILL BE PAY FOR 25% INCREASE UPON APPROVAL OF THE JOB RECLASSIFICATION BY THE TRIBE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO PROVIDE ADMINISTRATIVE OPERATING AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE FUNDS FOR THE PERIOD OF OCTOBER 1 2022 THROUGH SEPTEMBER 30 2024.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL COVER ADMINISTRATIVE AND OPERATING SALARIES AND FRINGE AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE EXPENSES SUCH AS CONTRACTED LABOR AND PARTS. ANY ITEMS PURCHASED HAVE A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL ALLOW THE CONTINUED OPERATION OF TRANSIT SERVICES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: POPULATION OF THE SAN CARLOS APACHE TRIBE SERVICE AREA AND AREA TRANSIT RIDERS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: PURPOSE OF THIS APPLICATION IS TO ASSIST WITH CONTINUED OPERATION OF THE YAVAPAI-APACHE NATION TRANSIT SYSTEM. THE YAVAPAI-APACHE NATION WILL USE 2023 FORMULA FUNDS TO CONTINUE AND IMPROVE PUBLIC TRANSIT SYSTEM. THE YAVAPAI-APACHE NATION IS IN THE PROCESS OF EXPANDING THE PUBLIC TRANSIT SYSTEM BY EXPANDING ROUTES FROM THE VERDE VALLEY TO YAVAPAI COUNTY SEAT OF PRESCOTT AZ. FUNDS FROM THIS APPLICATION WILL ASSIST THE EXPANSION OPERATION FOR MAINTENANCE SALARIES BENEFITS SUPPLIES AND FUEL COVERING THE CURRENT COST FOR SALARIES BENEFITS SAFETY AND MAINTENANCE. THIS GRANT APPLIES FOR $57074 IN SECTION 5311 FUNDS FOR YAVAPAI APACHE NATION TO SUPPORT COSTS SUCH AS OPERATORS SALARIES BENEFITS VEHICLE MAINTENANCE FUEL AND OTHER OPERATING EXPENSES.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES THAT WILL BE PERFORMED WILL BE REVIEW CURRENT OPERATIONS INCLUDING OPERATOR COMPENSATION AND ADJUST AS NEEDED. REGULAR VEHICLE MAINTENANCE FOR ROUTINE MAINTENANCE WILL BE SCHEDULED AND SAFETY REVIEW WILL BE COMPLETED.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: OUTCOMES EXPECTED FROM THIS APPLICATION WILL BE CONTINUED IMPROVED TRANSIT OPERATION AS OPERATORS ARE RETAINED AND SAFETY MODIFICATIONS MADE AS REQUIRED. OUT COME EXPECTED WILL BE SUPPORT FOR THE CONTINUATION AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE EXPANDED ROUTES TO PRESCOTT.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: BENEFICIARIES FOR THE CONTINUATION OF THE CURRENT OPERATION AND EXPANDED ROUTES WILL INCLUDE MEMBERS OF THE YAVAPAI-APACHE NATION AND OTHER RESIDENTS OF THE VERDE VALLEY IN AZ AS THEY WILL EXPERIENCE GREATER ACCESS TO EMPLOYMENT MEDICAL FACILITIES INCLUDING PRESCOTT VETERANS HOSPITAL EDUCATION AND RETAIL OPPORTUNITIES. ROUTES WILL ALSO ALLOW PRESCOTT RESIDENTS TO VISIT FAMILY AND FRIENDS IN THE VERDE VALLEY AS ROUTES WILL PROVIDE ROUNDTRIP SERVICE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE HOPI TRIBE WILL USE $485376 IN FY2021 ARP FUNDS TO SUPPORT CAPITAL OPERATING AND OTHER EXPENSES INCURRED BEGINNING ON JANUARY 20 2020 TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO COVID-19 THROUGH AUGUST 31 2029.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: ARP FUNDS WILL BE USED TO EXPAND EXISTING TRANSIT ROUTES IN AREAS ON THE HOPI AND NAVAJO RESERVATIONS WITHOUT TRANSIT SERVICE. SERVICE WILL BE PROVIDED FOR THE GENERAL PUBLIC TO TRAVEL TO A NEW TRIBAL WORK SITE PRESENTLY WITHOUT TRANSIT SERVICE AND TO THE NEW DILKON MEDICAL FACILITY USING A ROUTE THAT WILL SERVE UNSERVED AREAS.FUNDING WILL BE PROVIDED AT A 100-PERCENT FEDERAL SHARE WITH NO LOCAL MATCH REQUIRED AND WILL BE AVAILABLE TO SUPPORT CAPITAL OPERATING AND OTHER EXPENSES GENERALLY ELIGIBLE UNDER SECTION 5311 TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO COVID-19.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: EXPANDED ROUTES AND INCREASED TRANSIT SERVICES WILL INCREASE THE QUALITY AND FREQUENCY OF SERVICE AND WILL MAKE OUR SERVICES MORE RELIABLE TO THE HOPI RESERVATION AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC. TO SUPPORT CAPITAL OPERATING AND OTHER EXPENSES GENERALLY ELIGIBLE UNDER SECTION 5311 TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO COVID-19. THIS INCLUDES ECONOMIC OR OTHER CONDITIONS CAUSED BY COVID-19 AND ARE THUS ELIGIBLE UNDER THE ARP ACT.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: INTENDED BENEFICIARIES WILL BE THE RESIDENTS OF THE HOPI RESERVATION A REMOTE FEDERALLY-RECOGNIZED NATIVE AMERICAN TRIBE AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC OF SURROUNDING AREAS WILL BENEFIT FROM EXPANDED ROUTES AND INCREASED TRANSIT SERVICES FOR EMPLOYMENTS HEALTH CARE EDUCATION SHOPPING AND ESSENTIAL AND RECREATIONAL TRAVEL.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE HOPI TRIBE WILL USE $450558 IN CRRSAA FUNDS TO SUPPORT OPERATING EXPENSES OF ALL FIVE HOPI SENOM TRANSIT ROUTES (KEAMS CANYON ROUTE FLAGSTAFF ROUTE WINSLOW ROUTE TUBA CITY/MOENCOPI ROUTE AND THE MIDDAY ROUTE) FOR EXPENSES INCURRED BEGINNING ON JANUARY 20 2020 TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO COVID-19 THROUGH DECEMBER 31 2029. THE NOVEMBER 2019 CLOSURE OF THE NAVAJO GENERATING STATION POWER PLANT HAS RESULTED IN THE LOSS OF AN ESTIMATED 85 PERCENT OF THE HOPI TRIBES SOURCE OF INCOME FROM COAL SALES FROM THE PEABODY MINE. WITH THE TRIBE NOW FOCUSING ON ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT DUE TO THE MINE CLOSURE AND THE EFFECTS OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC HOPI SENOM TRANSIT IS AN EXTREMELY VALUABLE RESOURCE AND IMPORTANT PART OF THE TRIBES ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT EFFORT BY PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION FOR EMPLOYMENT SEEKING JOB OPPORTUNITIES JOB TRAINING AND EDUCATION AS WELL AS MEDICAL SERVICES SOCIAL SERVICES AND ESSENTIAL SHOPPING. ; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE HOPI TRIBE WILL USE $450558 IN CRRSAA FUNDS TO OPERATE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES ON THE HOPI RESERVATION AND SURROUNDING AREAS TO INCLUDE OPERATING AND ADMINISTRATIVE WAGES SALARIES AND FRINGE BENEFITS WAGES AND SALARIES FOR TEMPORARY EMPLOYEES FUEL AND OTHER NEEDED VEHICLE FLUIDS TIRES PARTS UNIFORMS PPE OFFICE SUPPLIES ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPLIES PROMOTIONAL ITEMS MARKETING MATERIALS AND COSTS POSTAGE PRINTING PHONES INTERNET GENERAL LIABILITY INSURANCE DRUG ALCOHOL PROGRAM EXPENSES NECESSARY AND REQUIRED TRAVEL FOR TRAINING CONFERENCES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: TO MAINTAIN PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICE AT A CRITICAL TIME FOR THE HOPI TRIBE ON ALL FIVE HOPI SENOM TRANSIT ROUTES BY SUPPORTING OPERATING EXPENSES ELIGIBLE UNDER SECTION 5311 AND TO REBUILD OUR RIDERSHIP BASE THAT WENT TO ZERO AS HOPI SENOM TRANSIT WAS SHUT DOWN FOR 16 MONTHS DUE TO THE PANDEMIC. THIS INCLUDES REBUILDING OUR STAFFING WITH DRIVER RECRUITMENT MECHANIC RECRUITMENT INCREASING WAGES AND SALARIES TO RETAIN AND RECRUIT QUALIFIED DRUG-FREE EMPLOYEES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: AS PER THE HOPIT POTSKWANIAT THE HOPI TRIBAL CONSOLIDATED STRATEGIC PLAN AREA OF TRANSPORTATION HOPI SENOM TRANSITS WILL PROVIDE SAFE EFFICIENT AND DEPENDABLE TRANSPORTATION AND PUBLIC ROAD ACCESS TO AND WITHIN HOPI LANDS TO RESIDENTS OF THE 12 HOPI AND TEWA VILLAGES COMMUNITY MEMBERS VISITORS RECREATIONAL USERS AND OTHERS WHILE CONTRIBUTING TO ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT SELF-DETERMINATION AND EMPLOYMENT ON HOPI LANDS. AS PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE NAVAJO NATION TRIBAL MEMBERS AND MEMBERS OF THE GENERAL PUBLIC.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR THE PERIOD OF JANUARY 1 2022 TO SEPTEMBER 30 2025.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE SUCH AS PERSONNEL SALARIES SUPPLIES STAFF DEVELOPMENT FUEL UNIFORMS UTILITY COSTS TRAVEL EXPENSES PHONES INDIRECT COST EXPENSE AND OTHER EXPENSES RELATING TO THE OPERATION OF THE TRANSIT DEPARTMENT DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL ALLOW THE CONTINUED OPERATION OF TRANSIT SERVICES AND PROVIDE MUCH NEEDED SERVICES TO THE POPULATION OF OUR SERVICE AREA; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF OUR TRANSIT SERVICES ARE THE POPULATION OF NAVAJO TRANSIT SYSTEM SERVICE AREA WHICH CONSIST OF THE NAVAJO INDIAN RESERVATION AND SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE OPERATING ASSISTANCE FROM OCTOBER 1 2025 THROUGH SEPTEMBER 30 2027. GILA RIVER INDIAN COMMUNITY AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THE GRANT AGREEMENT PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING. ; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: REQUESTED CRRSAA SECTION 5311-9B FORMULA FUNDS WILL COVER OPERATING EXPENSES AS WE WORK TO RETURN SERVICE FROM COVD-19 SUSPENSIONS.REQUESTED CRRSAA SECTION 5311-9B FORMULA FUNDS WILL COVER OPERATING EXPENSES INCLUDING TRANSPORTATION MANAGER SALARY AND FRINGE (APPROX. $70407) DRIVER SALARIES AND FRINGE (APPROX. $121416) AND TRANSIT DISPATCH SUPERVISOR SALARY AND FRINGE (APPROX.. $19106). BUDGET DETAIL BY SCOPE ITEM IS ESTIMATED BASED ON CURRENT STAFF COSTS WITH 3% ANNUAL ESCALATIONS FOR DIRECT LABOR RATES. FRINGE IS APPLIED BASED ON A FOUR-YEAR AVERAGE. IT IS IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT ACTUAL STAFF AND FRINGE RATES WILL VARY FROM BUDGETED DEPENDING ON ACTUAL COSTS OF BENEFITS AND TRIBAL COMMUNITY COUNCIL POLICIES ON STAFF SALARIES. ; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL ALLOW THE CONTINUED OPERATION OF GILA RIVER TRANSIT AS WE WORK TO RECOVER FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. DUE TO COVID-19 THERE WAS NO TRANSIT SERVICE BETWEEN MARCH 24 2020 AND MAY 31 2021 AND AGAIN BETWEEN JANUARY 11 2022 AND FEBRUARY 25 2022. TRIBES HAD A DISPROPORTIONATE IMPACT FROM COVID-19 THAN OTHER COMMUNITIES DUE TO RISK FACTORS (AGE AND UNDERLYING HEALTH CONDITIONS) AND CULTURAL IMPORTANCE OF SOCIAL INTERACTION. GILA RIVER TRANSIT HAS STRUGGLED WITH RIDERSHIP RECOVERY POST COVID-19 SIMILAR TO OTHER TRANSIT AGENCIES. WHILE RIDERSHIP IS SLOWLY INCREASING RIDERSHIP IS STILL LESS THAN HALF WHAT IT WAS PRE-PANDEMIC.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF THE GILA RIVER INDIAN COMMUNITY. THE GILA RIVER INDIAN COMMUNITY A FEDERALLY-RECOGNIZED TRIBE ESTABLISHED IN 1859 IS LOCATED IN SOUTH-CENTRAL ARIZONA BORDERING BOTH MARICOPA AND PINAL COUNTIES. WITH CLOSE TO 21300 ENROLLED MEMBERS THE COMMUNITY IS HOME TO TWO TRIBESTHE AKIMEL OODHAM AND PEE POSH. THE RESERVATION HAS A LAND AREA OF 584 SQUARE MILES AND A 2020 CENSUS POPULATION OF 14260. THE COMMUNITY INCLUDES SEVEN DISTRICTS ALONG THE GILA RIVER AND ITS LARGEST COMMUNITIES ARE SACATON KOMATKE SANTAN AND BLACKWATER. GILA RIVER TRANSIT OPERATES DEVIATED FIXED ROUTE PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICE FOR THE GILA RIVER INDIAN COMMUNITY. WE OPERATE FOUR ROUTES. SACATON SHUTTLE (DISTRICT 3) AND WEST END SHUTTLE (DISTRICTS 6 AND 7) STARTED IN 2016. THE EAST SIDE SHUTTLE (DISTRICTS 1 2 AND 3) AND THE CENTRAL SHUTTLE (DISTRICTS 3 4 AND 5) STARTED IN APRIL 2019.TRANSIT PROVIDE VITAL CONNECTIVITY WITHIN A TRIBAL COMMUNITY WHICH LIKE ALL RESERVATIONS HAS BEEN DISENFRANCHISED AND HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED BY PUBLIC INVESTMENT. GILA RIVER TRANSIT PROVIDES CONNECTIONS TO COMMUNITY DESTINATIONS SUCH AS THE GOVERNANCE CENTER HUHUKAM HOSPITAL AND OTHER MEDICAL FACILITIES RESIDENTIAL AND SHOPPING AREAS LIBRARY AND DISTRICT SERVICE CENTERS. NEARLY ALL GILA RIVER TRANSIT RIDERS ARE TRIBAL MEMBERS AND MANY ARE ELDERLY. ACCORDING TO THE SPRING 2023 ONBOARD SURVEY NEARLY ALL RESPONDENTS HAVE A HOUSEHOLD INCOME OF $24999 OR LESS. MOST (66.7%) HAVE NO OPERABLE VEHICLE IN THE HOUSEHOLD. THOSE WHO COMPLETED THE ONBOARD SURVEY USE TRANSIT (55.8%) OR WALK (32.7%) AS THEIR MAIN FORM OF TRANSPORTATION. MOST USE GILA RIVER TRANSIT FOR MEDICAL (57.1%) OR SHOPPING (46.9%) TRIPS. APPROXIMATELY ONE-THIRD (31.5%) USE TRANSIT THREE TO FIVE DAYS PER WEEK. MOST (56.0%) RESPONDED THAT GILA RIVER TRANSIT DOES NOT HAVE SUFFICIENT TRANSIT SERVICE AND MOST RATE THE TRANSIT SYSTEM AS EXCELLENT (53.6%) OR GOOD (23.2%). WHEN ASKED TO SUGGEST IMPROVEMENTS MOST REQUESTED MORE FREQUENT SERVICE (59.1%) FOLLOWED BY LONGER HOURS OF SERVICE (38.6%).; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

THE GILA RIVER INDIAN COMMUNITY A FEDERALLY-RECOGNIZED TRIBE ESTABLISHED IN 1859 IS LOCATED IN SOUTH-CENTRAL ARIZONA BORDERING BOTH MARICOPA AND PINAL COUNTIES. WITH CLOSE TO 21300 ENROLLED MEMBERS THE COMMUNITY IS HOME TO TWO TRIBESTHE AKIMEL OODHAM AND PEE POSH. THE RESERVATION HAS A LAND AREA OF 584 SQUARE MILES AND A 2020 CENSUS POPULATION OF 14260. THE COMMUNITY INCLUDES SEVEN DISTRICTS ALONG THE GILA RIVER AND ITS LARGEST COMMUNITIES ARE SACATON KOMATKE SANTAN AND BLACKWATER. GILA RIVER TRANSIT OPERATES DEVIATED FIXED ROUTE PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICE FOR THE GILA RIVER INDIAN COMMUNITY. WE OPERATE FOUR ROUTES. SACATON SHUTTLE (DISTRICT 3) AND WEST END SHUTTLE (DISTRICTS 6 AND 7) STARTED IN 2016. THE EAST SIDE SHUTTLE (DISTRICTS 1 2 AND 3) AND THE CENTRAL SHUTTLE (DISTRICTS 3 4 AND 5) STARTED IN APRIL 2019.TRANSIT PROVIDE VITAL CONNECTIVITY WITHIN A TRIBAL COMMUNITY WHICH LIKE ALL RESERVATIONS HAS BEEN DISENFRANCHISED AND HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED BY PUBLIC INVESTMENT. GILA RIVER TRANSIT PROVIDES CONNECTIONS TO COMMUNITY DESTINATIONS SUCH AS THE GOVERNANCE CENTER HUHUKAM HOSPITAL AND OTHER MEDICAL FACILITIES RESIDENTIAL AND SHOPPING AREAS LIBRARY AND DISTRICT SERVICE CENTERS. NEARLY ALL GILA RIVER TRANSIT RIDERS ARE TRIBAL MEMBERS AND MANY ARE ELDERLY. ACCORDING TO THE SPRING 2023 ONBOARD SURVEY NEARLY ALL RESPONDENTS HAVE A HOUSEHOLD INCOME OF $24999 OR LESS. MOST (66.7%) HAVE NO OPERABLE VEHICLE IN THE HOUSEHOLD. THOSE WHO COMPLETED THE ONBOARD SURVEY USE TRANSIT (55.8%) OR WALK (32.7%) AS THEIR MAIN FORM OF TRANSPORTATION. MOST USE GILA RIVER TRANSIT FOR MEDICAL (57.1%) OR SHOPPING (46.9%) TRIPS. APPROXIMATELY ONE-THIRD (31.5%) USE TRANSIT THREE TO FIVE DAYS PER WEEK. MOST (56.0%) RESPONDED THAT GILA RIVER TRANSIT DOES NOT HAVE SUFFICIENT TRANSIT SERVICE AND MOST RATE THE TRANSIT SYSTEM AS EXCELLENT (53.6%) OR GOOD (23.2%). WHEN ASKED TO SUGGEST IMPROVEMENTS MOST REQUESTED MORE FREQUENT SERVICE (59.1%) FOLLOWED BY LONGER HOURS OF SERVICE (38.6%).; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS APPLICATION IS TO ASSIST WITH OPERATIONAL FUNDS FOR UPGRADING RECLASSIFYING AND RETAINING TRANSIT EMPLOYEES. OPERATIONAL FUNDS WILL INCLUDE EXPENSES NEEDED FOR FUEL COSTS FOR THE REMAINING YEAR OF FY23 FY24. LASTLY OPERATIONAL FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR ADMINISTRATION SUPPLIES AND EQUIPMENT THE TRANSIT ADMINISTRATIONS OPERATIONS. FUNDS WILL BE USED TO ACQUIRE LARGER CAPACITY VEHICLES TO BE USED DURING HEAVY RIDERSHIP PERIODS AND FOR ROUTES WITH LARGER RIDERSHIP TO INSURE PHYSICAL DISTANCING AND CONSOLIDATE EQUIPMENT AND PERSONNEL. THE HUALAPAI TRIBAL COUNCIL WILL UTILIZE THIS ARPA AWARD TO MAINTAIN EXISTING TRANSIT SERVICES ON THE RESERVATION AND ASSIST IN RESPONDING TO AND RECOVERING FROM COVID-19.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITIES THAT WILL BE PERFORMED IS TO UPGRADE AND RECLASSIFY THE CURRENT TRANSIT SPECIALIST/DISPATCHER AND TRANSIT OPERATOR POSITIONS WITHIN THE TRIBE. FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES FUEL ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR ETC. IN ORDER TO CONTINUE TRANSIT OPERATIONS AND TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE OUTCOMES OF HAVING THIS GRANT APPLICATION APPROVED WILL BE TO IMPROVE THE TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM BY RETAINING EMPLOYEES AND ATTRACTING QUALIFIED JOB APPLICANTS FOR OPEN TRANSIT POSITIONS. THE CURRENT WAGES THAT ARE IN PLACE ARE NOT COMPETITIVE WITH JOBS IN THIS RURAL AREA. THE JOB MARKET WITH WAREHOUSE WORK OR OTHER RURAL TRANSIT AGENCIES PAY HIGHER WAGES THUS MAKING IT DIFFICULT TO RECRUIT QUALIFIED DRIVERS AND DISPATCHERS. THE INFLATED FUEL RATES HAVE TREMENDOUSLY AFFECTED THE TRIBE AS THE MONTHLY FUEL BILL HAS INCREASED SIGNIFICANTLY. FUNDING WILL PERMIT THE HUALAPAI TRIBE TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SERVICE THAT WOULD OTHERWISE HAVE TO BE CUT DUE TO LACK OF FUNDING AND PROVIDE FOR EXTRA CLEANING AND DISINFECTANT SUPPLIES EQUIPMENT AND HOURS NEEDED TO ENSURE A CLEAN SANITIZED AND SAFE ENVIRONMENT FOR DRIVERS AND PASSENGERS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFITS OF THIS GRANT AWARD WILL IMPROVE THE TRIBE TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM BY RETAINING EMPLOYEES AND ATTRACTING QUALIFIED JOB APPLICANTS FOR OPEN TRANSIT POSITIONS. THE CURRENT WAGES THAT ARE IN PLACE ARE NOT COMPETITIVE WITH JOBS IN THIS RURAL AREA. THE JOB MARKET WITH WAREHOUSE WORK OR OTHER RURAL TRANSIT AGENCIES PAY HIGHER WAGES THUS MAKING IT DIFFICULT TO RECRUIT QUALIFIED DRIVERS AND DISPATCHERS. THE SALARIES FOR THE CURRENT TRANSIT SPECIALIST/DISPATCHER AND TRANSIT OPERATORS WILL BE PAY FOR A 25% INCREASE UPON APPROVAL OF THE JOB RECLASSIFICATION BY THE TRIBE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

THIS BUS WILL NOT REPLACE ANY BUS CURRENTLY IN SERVICE BUT WILL EXPAND SERVICES TO FLAGSTAFF ARIZONA. AS WITH MANY TRANSIT AGENCIES HOPI SENOM TRANSIT HAS BEEN IMPACTED BY LINGERING THIS AMOUNT WILL BE USED FOR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION COSTS OPERATING AND MAINTENANCE COSTS OF TRANSIT VEHICLES EQUIPMENT AND FACILITY AND ENHANCEMENT OF EXISTING SERVICES.SCOPE 1 FEDERAL FUNDS: FY2020 5311 TRIBAL TRANSIT FORMULA CAPITAL/BUS PURCHASE FUNDS FROM HOPI TRIBE ARIZONA IN THE AMOUNT OF $264004.LOCAL MATCH: $0 LOCAL SALES TAX (THE HOPI TRIBE IS EXEMPT FROM LOCAL SALES TAX)TOTAL PROJECT COST: $264004SCOPE 2 FEDERAL FUNDS: FY2020 5311 TRIBAL TRANSIT FORMULA OPERATING ASSISTANCE FUNDS FROM HOPI TRIBE ARIZONA IN THE AMOUNT OF $230483.LOCAL MATCH: $0 LOCAL SALES TAX (THE HOPI TRIBE IS EXEMPT FROM LOCAL SALES TAX)TOTAL PROJECT COST: $230483PERFORMANCE START DATE: 10/01/2022PERFORMANCE END DATE: 9/30/2025

IN RESPONSE TO THIS A GREY ROUTE WAS ESTABLISHED IN MARCH OF 2005. THE GREY ROUTE ONLY CONNECTED THE EAST AND WEST PARTS OF THE RESERVATION TO THE YUMA BUSINESS AND RECREATIONAL COMMUNITIES. AS A RESULT OF THE INTRODUCTION OF THE GREY ROUTE (MARCH 2005) RIDERSHIP INCREASED SIGNIFICANTLY FROM TWENTY-FIVE (25) PASSENGERS (PER TRIP PER DAY) TO ONE-HUNDRED AND FORTY-FIVE (145) PASSENGERS (PER TRIP PER DAY). THE GREY ROUTE WAS RE-DESIGNATED AS THE VIOLET ROUTE IN JANUARY OF 2012 AND SERVICE WAS INCREASED WITH HOURLY HEADWAYS ALL DAY MONDAY-FRIDAY. DUE TO THE SUCCESSFUL USE OF THE CURRENT ROUTE THE COCOPAH INDIAN TRIBE (CIT) PARTNERED WITH THE YUMA INTERGOVERNMENTAL PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (YCIPTA) AS A RESULT THE VIOLET ROUTE WAS RE-DESIGNATED AS THE NEW AND CURRENT PURPLE ROUTE 6/6A - PROVIDING SERVICE TO EAST WEST AND NORTH RESERVATION TO INCLUDE A SIGNIFICANT PORTION WITH NEIGHBORING COMMUNITIES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE OUTCOMES OF HAVING THIS GRANT APPLICATION APPROVED WILL BE TO IMPROVE THE TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM BY RETAINING EMPLOYEES AND ATTRACTING QUALIFIED JOB APPLICANTS. THIS TRANSPORT SYSTEM CONTRIBUTES TO THE WHOLE OF GOVERNMENT AND COMMUNITY. IN ECONOMIC TERMS IT RELATES TO THE EFFICIENT MOVEMENT OF PEOPLE TO SUPPORT THE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT OF THE TRIBE. IN SOCIAL TERMS IT PROVIDES A SAFE TRANSPORT SYSTEM AND PROVIDES ACCESSIBILITY AND MOBILITY TO MANY OF THE TRIBAL MEMBERS THAT HAVE DISABILITIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT REDUCES NOISE POLLUTION AND OTHER POLLUTANTS TO NEIGHBORING FARMS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFITS OF THIS GRANT AWARD WILL IMPROVE THE TRIBE TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM BY RETAINING EMPLOYEES AND ATTRACTING QUALIFIED JOB APPLICANTS. THE OUTCOMES OF HAVING THIS GRANT APPLICATION APPROVED WILL BE TO IMPROVE THE TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM BY RETAINING EMPLOYEE AND ATTRACTING A QUALIFIED POOL OF EMPLOYEES THAT DO NOT HAVE THE AVAILABLE MEANS OF PRIMARY TRANSPORTATION. AWARDING THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE A RELIABLE AND TIMELY MODE OF TRANSPORT FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS TO HAVE FREEDOM OF MOVEMENT SAFELY ACROSS THE RESERVATION AND PROVIDES AN AVAILABLE PLATFORM FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS TO HAVE ACCESS TO; MEDICAL/DENTAL FACILITIES BUSINESS AND LEISURE ACTIVITIES SCHOOLS (PRIMARY AND COLLEGES) TRIBAL ENTERPRISES AND SOCIAL EVENTS. AWARDING THIS GRANT WILL ALSO PROVIDE ACCESS FOR THE COMMUNITY TO HAVE DOOR-TO-DOOR ACCESS TO THE TRIBAL ENTERPRISES WHICH WILL GENERATE ECONOMIC GROWTH AND DEVELOPMENT. THIS APPLICATION TO REQUEST FY2021 SECTION 5311 TRIBAL TRANSIT COMPETITIVE APPOINTED TO AK-CHIN INDIAN COMMUNITY ARIZONA IN THE AMOUNT OF $157700. WITH THE 2021 TRIBAL TRANSIT FUNDING AK-CHIN TRIBAL TRANSIT WILL REPLACE NECESSARY AND ESSENTIAL EQUIPMENT SUCH AS MOBILE AND STATIONARY RADIO COMMUNICATION EQUIPMENT AND SEVENTEEN BULLETIN BOARDS THAT ARE LOCATED AT BUS SHELTERS AROUND THE COMMUNITY. IN ADDITION AK-CHIN TRIBAL TRANSIT IS ADVANCING TO PROTECT OUR CURRENT ASSETS EXPAND OUR SERVICES AND INCREASE RIDERSHIP WITH THE PURCHASE AND IMPLEMENTATION OF A LOW LINE PASSENGER BUS CIRCULAR ROUTE SIGNAGE AND A SHADE STRUCTURE FOR THE FLEET.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS TRIBAL TRANSIT FUNDING IS TO REPLACE ESSENTIAL EQUIPMENT AND ACQUIRE ASSETS THAT WILL SET THE FOUNDATION FOR GROWTH AND EXPANSION IN OUR CURRENT OPERATIONS. WITH THE 2022 FUNDING AK-CHIN TRIBAL TRANSIT WILL REPLACE NECESSARY AND ESSENTIAL EQUIPMENT SUCH AS MOBILE AND STATIONARY RADIO COMMUNICATION EQUIPMENT AND SEVENTEEN BULLETIN BOARDS THAT ARE LOCATED AT BUS SHELTERS AROUND THE COMMUNITY. IN ADDITION AK-CHIN TRIBAL TRANSIT IS ADVANCING TO PROTECT OUR CURRENT ASSETS EXPAND OUR SERVICES AND INCREASE RIDERSHIP WITH THE PURCHASE AND IMPLEMENTATION OF A LOW LINE PASSENGER BUS CIRCULAR ROUTE SIGNAGE AND A SHADE STRUCTURE FOR THE FLEET.PROJECT STATEMENT OF WORK: AK-CHIN TRIBAL TRANSIT WAS ESTABLISHED IN 2016. UPON STARTUP A TRANSIT MANGER AND DRIVERS WERE HIRED AND TRANSIT POLICIES AND PROCEDURES WERE CREATED APPROVED AND IMPLEMENTED. AK-CHIN TRIBAL TRANSIT HAS BEEN OFFERING A FIXED CIRCULAR ROUTE FOR RESIDENTS THAT PROVIDES TRANSPORTATION WITHIN AK-CHIN AND THE NEIGHBORING COMMUNITY OF MARICOPA. IN ADDITION WE ALSO PROVIDE ON-DEMAND CURB TO CURB SERVICES AS WELL.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: LOW LINE BUS - AK-CHIN TRIBAL TRANSIT CURRENTLY HAS A FLEET OF SIX FOURTEEN-PASSENGER BUSES AND DOES NOT HAVE A PASSENGER BUS CAPABLE OF PROVIDING APPROPRIATE AND SAFE MOBILE SERVICES TO PASSENGERS THAT ARE SEMI-AMBULATORY. OUR FLEET CAN ACCOMMODATE AMBULATORY AND NON-AMBULATORY PASSENGERS. WE ARE IN CRITICAL NEED FOR A PASSENGER VEHICLE THAT CAN ACCOMMODATE OUR SENIOR CITIZENS AND THOSE WITH LIMITED PHYSICAL MOBILITY WHICH IS FOCUSING ON OUR SEMI-AMBULATORY POPULATION. OUR SEMI AMBULATORY POPULATION IS 21% WE CURRENTLY TRANSPORT 3-4%. TRANSIT WOULD LIKE TO PURCHASE A LOW LINE MOBILITY BUS. THE FRONT OF THE BUS WILL HAVE A RAMP FOR SAFE ACCESSIBILITY FOR PASSENGERS THAT CANNOT ASCEND OR DESCEND STAIRS. THIS BUS WILL BE INCORPORATED INTO OUR CURRENT OPERATING STRUCTURE WITH THE REST OF OUR TRANSIT FLEET AND COMPLEMENT AND ENHANCE OUR CURRENT SERVICES. A LOW LINE BUS IS ESSENTIAL IN OUR COMMUNITY. MOST OF OUR ELDERLY POPULATION IN THE COMMUNITY FALL UNDER THE CATEGORY OF LOW TO MODERATE INCOME. TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS ARE LIMITED AND THE CURRENT CLOSEST BUSINESS THAT PROVIDES THIS SERVICE IS IN EXCESS OF THIRTY MILES AWAY ONE WAY. ROUTE SIGNAGE - AK-CHIN TRIBAL TRANSIT WAS INCORPORATED IN 2016. FIXED ROUTES IN ADDITION TO ON-DEMAND SERVICES ARE OFFERED TO AK-CHIN INDIAN COMMUNITY AND THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITY OF MARICOPA. AFTER CAREFUL REVIEW OF SURVEYS AND COMMUNITY FEEDBACK WE HAVE RECOGNIZED OUR PRESENCE AT MANY LOCATIONS IS CONFUSING TO OUR COMMUNITY AND UNCLEAR. AK-CHIN TRIBAL TRANSIT IS CURRENTLY VISITING STOPS AT LOCATIONS THAT HAVE NO SIGNAGE DESIGNATION OR NUMBERS ASSOCIATED WITH THEM. AK-CHIN TRIBAL TRANSIT WOULD LIKE TO INSTALL THIRTY-THREE SIGNS PLACED AROUND THE COMMUNITY TO REMEDY THESE CONCERNS AND ENCOURAGE RIDERSHIP TO THRIVE. RADIO EQUIPMENT- OUR MOBILE AND STATIONARY EQUIPMENT IS IN FAIR OPERATING CONDITION AND NEEDS TO BE REPLACED. OF THE FIVE REMAINING FUNCTIONING UNITS TWO ARE AT LIMITED LIFE REMAINING DUE TO EXTENSIVE USE AND THOSE BATTERIES FUNCTION AT APPROXIMATELY 25% OF LIFE. OUR MODEL RADIOS HAVE BEEN PHASED OUT AND REPLACEMENT EQUIPMENT IS UNOBTAINABLE. TWO OTHER UNITS IN THE BUSES ALSO SHOW SIGNS OF WEAR AND ARE IN FAIR CONDITION DUE TO USE AND BEING MOUNTED IN FULL SUN. WE EXPERIENCE INTERMITTENT RADIO TRANSMISSIONS AND LONG WAIT TIMES BEFORE A SIGNAL PICKS UP AGAIN TO ALLOW US TO TRANSMIT. AFTER EVERY TRANSMISSION WE MUST WAIT 8-15 SECONDS BEFORE THE RADIO CAN BE TRANSMITTED ON. CONTINUOUS TRANSMISSIONS ARE DIFFICULT TO ACCOMPLISH. FULL SUPPORT FROM OUR COMMUNITY COUNCIL WAS OBTAINED TO MOVE FORWARD IN RECTIFYING OUR CURRENT TRANSIT COMMUNICATION SETBACKS. OUR CURRENT SETBACKS INCLUDE LIMITED HANDHELD RADIO EQUIPMENT TO EFFICIENTLY PROVIDE SERVICES. THE TRANSIT DEPARTMENT IS CURRENTLY OPERATING AT 50% DUE TO A MOBILE RADIO SHORTAGE. OF SIX BUSES FOUR BUSES CURRENTLY DO NOT HAVE RADIO COMMUNICATIONS EQUIPMENT. TRANSIT UTILIZES MOBILE RADIOS IN THESE VEHICLES AND AS A RESULT OF THE SHORTAGE DRIVERS ARE USING MOBILE PHONES WHEN STOPPED AND IN A SAFE LOCATION. PENDING FULL REPLACEMENT TRANSIT HAS COORDINATED WITH LOCAL DEPARTMENTS FOR TEMPORARY ASSISTANCE AND USE OF THEIR EQUIPMENT. THEIR PARTICIPATION HAS LED TO PROLONGING THE LIFE OF OUR EQUIPMENT. BULLETIN BOARDS - FIVE YEARS AGO BUS STOP SHELTERS WERE CONSTRUCTED IN SEVENTEEN LOCATIONS IN THE COMMUNITY. ONE OF THE AMENITIES PROVIDED AT THE SHELTER WAS A CLEAR SWING-FRAME BULLETIN BOARD. THE REPLACEMENT OF THESE BOARDS IS IDEAL FOR THE CONTINUED SUPPORT TO THOSE WHO HAVE NO ACCESS TO TECHNOLOGY. WITHOUT REPLACEMENT TRANSIT IS UNABLE TO CONVEY TO THE PUBLIC ROUTE INFORMATION EVENTS SERVICES MEETINGS AND CDC GUIDANCE. BUS SHADE STRUCTURES - AK-CHIN TRIBAL TRANSIT -CHIN TRIBAL TRANSIT IS SEEKING A SHADE STRUCTURE FOR OUR FLEET OF VEHICLES. THIS SHADE WILL SERVE SEVERAL PURPOSES IN OUR ARIZONA DESERT CLIMATE. IT WILL PROTECT OUR ASSETS HELP TO SLOW THE PREMATURE AGING OF BUS EQUIPMENT AND PROVIDE COMFORT FOR STAFF AND PASSENGERS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: LOW LINE BUS - UPON RECEIPT OF FUNDING AK-CHIN TRIBAL TRANSIT WILL START THE PURCHASING PROCESS. THIS BUS WILL BE EQUIPPED SPECIFIC TO OUR NEEDS. BUS SHALL BE OBTAINED AND PLACED INTO SERVICE WITHIN SIX TO EIGHT WEEKS AFTER PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION OF OPERATING EQUIPMENT.ROUTE SIGNAGE - CULTURAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL CLEARANCES HAVE TAKEN PLACE AND ARE ALMOST COMPLETE. AK-CHIN GIS DEPARTMENT CREATED MAPS OF THE CLEARANCES. COUNCIL AND DEPARTMENT MEETINGS HAVE BEEN HELD AND INFORMATION GATHERED SPECIFICALLY REGARDING PHYSICAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT TO THE COMMUNITY. SURVEY OF THE RESIDENTS LOCATED NEAR THE RESIDENTIAL ZONES HAVE TAKEN PLACE. UPON FUNDING MATERIALS AND SIGNS WILL BE ORDERED. INSTALLATION OF 33 ROUTE SIGNS WILL BE COMPLETE WITHIN THREE TO FOUR MONTHS. RADIO EQUIPMENT - RADIO EQUIPMENT SHALL BE REPLACED IMMEDIATELY UPON RECEIPT OF FUNDING. TRANSIT SHOULD RECEIVE EQUIPMENT WITHIN 20 BUSINESS DAYS. INSTALLATION WILL TAKE PLACE BY THE EQUIPMENT PROVIDER AND COORDINATE WITH AK-CHIN INFORMATION SYSTEMS DEPARTMENT FOR INSTALL OF ALL STATIONARY AND MOBILE FLEET EQUIPMENT. CORE SYSTEM SETUP WILL ALSO TAKE PLACE BY AK-CHIN INFORMATION SYSTEMS DEPARTMENT. BULLETIN BOARDS - THESE BOARDS WILL SERVE AS A REPLACEMENT ON AN EXISTING APPROVED STRUCTURE. TRANSIT WILL FOLLOW A REPLACEMENT SCHEDULE UPON ARRIVAL OF THE BOARDS. TRANSIT WILL COORDINATE WITH AK-CHIN PUBLIC WORKS TO INSTALL THESE BULLETIN BOARDS. THE ESTIMATED TIME OF ARRIVAL OF THE BOARDS IS 45 BUSINESS DAYS. COMPLETION OF INSTALL WOULD BE COMPLETED UPON 15 DAYS FOLLOWING ARRIVAL. BUS SHADE STRUCTURES -AK-CHIN TRIBAL TRANSIT -CHIN TRIBAL TRANSIT IS COORDINATED WITH AK-CHIN CAPITAL PROJECTS DEPARTMENT AS WELL AS THE CULTURAL RESOURCES DEPARTMENT TO ENSURE A COMPLETE ENVIRONMENTAL ANALYSIS IS PERFORMED ONCE FUNDS ARE RECEIVED. STRUCTURAL BUILDING ASSISTANCE CAN BE PERFORMED WITHIN THE AK-CHIN INDIAN COMMUNITY UTILIZING THE PUBLIC WORKS DEPARTMENT. BUILDING MATERIALS ARE TWENTY BUSINESS DAYS TO ARRIVAL AND THE PROJECTED COMPLETION IF PROJECT IS EIGHT TO TEN WEEKS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: LOW LINE BUS - THE ADDITION OF THIS VEHICLE WILL ALLOW AK-CHIN TRIBAL TRANSIT TO PROVIDE SERVICES OTHERWISE NOT PROVIDED TO OUR RESIDENTS WITH LIMITED MOBILITY. THIS BUS WILL IMPACT THE QUALITY OF LIFE IN THE COMMUNITY BY ENCOURAGING INDEPENDENCE IN OUR LIMITED MOBILITY POPULATION. TRANSIT IS ANTICIPATING RIDERSHIP TO GROW WITH THE ADDITION OF FOUR PEOPLE AT MINIMUM A DAY UTILIZING THIS SERVICE FOR SHORT DISTANCE TRAVEL AND TWO PEOPLE MINIMUM PER DAY FOR LONG RANGE TRAVEL. THESE SERVICES ARE CURRENTLY BEING PROVIDED BY AN OUTSIDE SOURCE AND THE ADDITION OF THIS VEHICLE TO OUR FLEET WILL ALLOW TRANSIT TO OFFER THOSE SERVICES. THIS VEHICLE WILL OPEN UP OPPORTUNITIES FOR TRAVEL DESTINATIONS CURRENTLY NOT OFFERED TO LIMITED MOBILITY PASSENGERS SUCH AS HEALTHCARE SHOPPING AND OTHER ESSENTIAL SERVICES NEEDED FOR DAY TO DAY LIFE INSIDE AND OUTSIDE THE COMMUNING AND ADJACENT CITY. ROUTE SIGNAGE - THE INSTALLATION OF SIGNAGE WE PREDICT WILL OPEN UP THE OPPORTUNITY FOR INCREASED RIDERSHIP AND ATTENDANCE ON THE ROUTES DUE TO FOOT TRAFFIC AT IDENTIFIED LOCATIONS. UNDERSTANDING OF KNOWN LOCATIONS WILL ASSIST THE PASSENGERS IN KNOWING THEY ARE WAITING IN THE APPROPRIATE LOCATION. ROUTE STOPS CAN THEN BE IDENTIFIED WITH A NUMBER. THIS IDENTIFICATION WILL EASE THE COMMUNICATION CONCERNS BETWEEN STAFF TO STAFF AND STAFF TO PASSENGERS. AK-CHIN TRIBAL TRANSIT IS EXPECTING TO HAVE AN INCREASE OF RIDERSHIP BY 5-10% WITHIN THE FIRST THREE MONTHS AFTER THE INSTALLATION OF BUS STOP SIGNAGE. OUR CURRENT POPULATION IS 1119 RESIDENTS. THE PANDEMIC HAS AFFECTED OUR RIDERSHIP DUE TO CDC GUIDELINES AND SOCIAL DISTANCING HOWEVER OUR ANNUAL RIDERSHIP FROM JULY OF 2020 TO JULY 2021 WAS 5275 PASSENGERS. SOME RESIDENTS INFORM US OF THEIR INTENT TO BOARD AT A SPECIFIC LOCATION FOR THE ROUTE AND UPON ARRIVAL THE PASSENGER IS NOT THERE. WE FEEL THAT SIGNAGE WILL HELP TO ELIMINATE THESE EVENTS.RADIO EQUIPMENT - THE REPLACEMENT OF EQUIPMENT WILL IMPROVE OUR SERVICE OPERATIONS. TIMELY TRANSMISSION VIA RADIO REGARDING CURRENT AND POTENTIAL PASSENGERS WILL BE MORE EFFICIENT FOR OUR SERVICE OPERATIONS. DRIVER-TO-DIVER COMMUNICATION AS WELL AS CUSTOMER SERVICE WOULD BOTH BE GREATLY IMPROVED WITH AN UPDATED COMMUNICATION SYSTEM. DISPATCH WOULD NOT HAVE TO WAIT ON DRIVERS THAT HAVE DE-BOARDED ALL THE PASSENGERS FIND A SAFE LOCATION TO PULL OVER EXIT THE VEHICLE AND UTILIZE A MOBILE TELEPHONE. COMMUNICATION WILL BE IMMEDIATE AND TRANSIT SERVICES RENDERED WE ARE FORECASTING WILL INCREASE AS A RESULT.BULLETIN BOARDS - AWARENESS AND CURRENT DEVELOPMENTS CAN BE BROUGHT TO THE COMMUNITY THROUGH THE UTILIZATION OF THESE BOARDS AS WELL AS GUIDANCE CIRCULAR ROUTE INFO SHELTER IDENTIFICATION AND INFO ON PUBLIC MEETINGS WILL ALL BE DISPLAYED AND AVAILABLE TO OUR COMMUNITY. INCREASED INFO AT SHELTERS WILL IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR BOTH RESIDENTS AND NON-RESIDENTS ENSURING 24-HOUR ACCESS TO VITAL COMMUNITY INFO. INDIVIDUALS FROM SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES CAN ALSO BENEFIT FROM THIS IMPORTANT INFO. BUS SHADE STRUCTURES - ACHIEVE BENEFITS WOULD INCLUDE EXTENDED LIFE OF EXTERIOR VEHICLE COMPONENTS INCLUDING WRAP TIRES LENS COVERS WIPERS TOP AIR CONDITIONING UNITS TO NAME A FEW. TRANSIT WOULD LIKE TO OFFER ENHANCED INTERIOR COMFORT ON THE BUS UPON ARRIVAL TO BOARD PASSENGERS. THE SEAT AND GRAB-RAIL TEMPERATURES WOULD BE SUBSTANTIALLY REDUCED AND NO LONGER PROVE TO BE A SAFETY HAZARD CONCERNING SENIOR CITIZENS AND OTHER RESIDENTS WHO WOULD NEED TO UTILIZE ASSISTANCE FEATURES TO BOARD THE VEHICLE. SEAT BELTS WOULD REMAIN A SAFE TEMPERATURE AS WELL. BEING ABLE TO PROVIDE COMFORTABLE TRANSIT VEHICLES TO THE COMMUNITY WOULD PROMOTE RIDERSHIP AND SERVE TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE TO THOSE UTILIZING OUR SERVICES. ALL RESIDENTS AND THOSE WITH MOBILITY CONCERNS WOULD NO LONGER FEEL THE NEED TO REFUSE OR SETTLE FOR UNCOMFORTABLE TRANSPORTATION. IN THE YEAR 2020 THE SUMMER MONTHS RESULTED IN A 47% DECREASE OF PASSENGERS COMPARED TO THE WINTER MONTHS. AK-CHIN TRIBAL TRANSIT CURRENTLY OPERATES ON AN ANNUAL BUDGET OF 259555.00. THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST FY 2020 SECTION 5311 TRIBAL TRANSIT FORMULA CARES FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE GILA RIVER INDIAN COMMUNITY STATE OF ARIZONA IN THE AMOUNT OF $210929. PER THE CARES ACT THE GRANT REQUESTS 100% FEDERAL SHARE.THIS APPLICATION SEEKS CARES FUNDS TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS. GILA RIVER INDIAN COMMUNITY HAS NOT FURLOUGHED ANY STAFF DUE TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.PURPOSETHE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND CAPITAL/PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE IN FFY 2023 THE PERIOD OF OCTOBER 1 2022 THROUGH SEPTEMBER 30 2023.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMEDFUNDS WILL COVER OPERATING EXPENSES INCLUDING: TRANSPORTATION MANAGER SALARY AND FRINGE (APPROX.$45401); DRIVER SALARIES AND FRINGE (APPROX. $112536); FUEL FOR TRANSIT BUSES (APPROX. $27552); OPERATING SUPPLIES (SUCH AS CLEANING SUPPLIES AND OTHER ITEMS USED ON BUSES) (APPROX. $1200); EXPENSES FOR RADIO AND GPS TRACKING SOFTWARE FOR TRANSIT BUSES (APPROX. $4200); AND PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE (APPROX. $16335) TO ENSURE SAFE TRANSIT OPERATIONS. INDIRECT COSTS ($3428) WILL BE APPLIED PER THE MOST RECENT INDIAN ORGANIZATION INDIRECT COST NEGOTIATION AGREEMENT APPROVED IN APRIL 2021 BY THE US DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR BUREAU OF INDIAN AFFAIRS WITH THE 10% FTA 5311 TRIBAL INDIRECT COST LIMIT APPLIED.BUDGET DETAIL BY SCOPE ITEM IS ESTIMATED BASED ON CURRENT STAFF COSTS WITH 3% ANNUAL ESCALATIONS FOR DIRECT LABOR RATES. FRINGE IS APPLIED BASED ON A THREE-YEAR AVERAGE. NOTE THAT A COMMUNITY COMPENSATION STUDY IS UNDERWAY WHICH MAY AFFECT ACTUAL LABOR COSTS.EXPECTED OUTCOMESFUNDING WILL ALLOW THE CONTINUED OPERATION OF GILA RIVER TRANSIT.INTENDED BENEFICIARIESINTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF THE GILA RIVER INDIAN COMMUNITY. THE GILA RIVER INDIAN COMMUNITY A FEDERALLY-RECOGNIZED TRIBE ESTABLISHED IN 1859 IS LOCATED IN SOUTH-CENTRAL ARIZONA BORDERING BOTH MARICOPA AND PINAL COUNTIES. WITH CLOSE TO 21300 ENROLLED MEMBERS THE COMMUNITY IS HOME TO TWO TRIBES THE AKIMEL OODHAM AND PEE POSH. THE RESERVATION HAS A LAND AREA OF 584 SQUARE MILES AND A 2000 CENSUS POPULATION OF 11257. THE COMMUNITY INCLUDES SEVEN DISTRICTS ALONG THE GILA RIVER AND ITS LARGEST COMMUNITIES ARE SACATON KOMATKE SANTAN AND BLACKWATER.GILA RIVER TRANSIT OPERATES DEVIATED FIXED ROUTE PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICE FOR THE GILA RIVER INDIAN COMMUNITY. WE OPERATE FOUR ROUTES. SACATON SHUTTLE (SERVES DISTRICT 3) AND WEST END SHUTTLE (SERVES DISTRICTS 6 AND 7) STARTED IN 2016. THE EAST SIDE SHUTTLE (DISTRICTS 1 2 AND 3) AND THE CENTRAL SHUTTLE (DISTRICTS 3 4 AND 5) STARTED IN APRIL 2019.TRANSIT PROVIDE VITAL CONNECTIVITY WITHIN A TRIBAL COMMUNITY WHICH LIKE ALL RESERVATIONS HAS BEEN DISENFRANCHISED AND HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED BY PUBLIC INVESTMENT. GILA RIVER TRANSIT PROVIDES CONNECTIONS TO COMMUNITY DESTINATIONS SUCH AS THE GOVERNANCE CENTER HUHUKAM HOSPITAL AND OTHER MEDICAL FACILITIES RESIDENTIAL AND SHOPPING AREAS LIBRARY AND DISTRICT SERVICE CENTERS. NEARLY ALL GILA RIVER TRANSIT RIDERS ARE TRIBAL MEMBERS AND MANY ARE ELDERLY. MOST HAVE LIMITED ACCESS TO VEHICLES. AS PART OF A 2020 TRANSIT NEEDS STUDY ONBOARD SURVEYS WERE DISTRIBUTED AMONG ALL FOUR TRANSIT ROUTES. MOST WHO TOOK THE ONBOARD SURVEY USE TRANSIT (72%) OR WALK (22%) AS THEIR MAIN FORM OF TRANSPORTATION. MORE THAN 71% OF TRANSIT TRIPS ARE FOR MEDICAL PURPOSES; 36% ARE FOR SHOPPING AND ANOTHER 27% ARE FOR RECREATIONAL PURPOSES. NEARLY 43% USE TRANSIT THREE TO FIVE DAYS PER WEEK. OF THE 67 PEOPLE WHO RESPONDED WHEN ASKED 56 (84%) HAD ONE OR FEWER VEHICLES IN THEIR HOME WITH AN AVERAGE HOUSEHOLD SIZE OF 5.6 PERSONS. MOST RESPONDENTS EXPRESSED SUPPORT FOR SERVICE THAT IS MORE FREQUENT LONGER SERVICE HOURS AND ADDITIONAL STOPS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES NONE.GILA RIVER INDIAN COMMUNITY AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THE GRANT AGREEMENT PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING.

ADMINISTRATION FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR ADMINISTRATION SUPPLIES/EQUIPMENT SALARIES FOR THE PROJECT DIRECTOR TRANSIT MANAGER AND THE ADMINISTRATIVE CLERK. MARKETING EXPENSES INSURANCE PREMIUMS OR PAYMENTS TO A SELF-INSURANCE RESERVE OFFICE SUPPLIES EQUIPMENT RENTAL AND DRUG EMPLOYEE PHYSICALS AND ALCOHOL TEST ADMINISTRATION. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITIES THAT WILL BE PERFORMED IS TO SUSTAIN THE CURRENT TRANSIT EMPLOYEE POSITIONS CONTINUE TRANSIT OPERATIONS AND MAINTAIN EQUIPMENT.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE OUTCOMES OF HAVING THIS GRANT APPLICATION APPROVED WILL BE TO IMPROVE THE TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM BY RETAINING EMPLOYEES AND ATTRACTING QUALIFIED JOB APPLICANTS FOR OPEN TRANSIT POSITIONS. THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST FY2020 SECTION 5311 TRIBAL TRIBAL FORMULA FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE YAVAPAI-APACHE NATION ARIZONA IN THE AMOUNT OF $120034. PURPOSE: PURPOSE OF THIS APPLICATION IS TO ASSIST WITH THE CONTINUED OPERATION OF THE YAVAPAI-APACHE TRANSIT SYSTEM. THE YAVAPAI-APACHE NATION WILL USE 2020 FORMULA FUNDS TO CONTINUE AND IMPROVE PUBLIC TRANSIT SYSTEM. THE YAVAPAI-APACHE NATION HAS COMPLETED THE PROCESS OF EXPANDING THE PUBLIC TRANSIT SYSTEM BY ADDING ADDITIONAL ROUTES AND TIMES. FUNDS FROM THIS APPLICATION WILL BE USED IN THIS EXPANDED OPERATION FOR MAINTENANCE SALARIES AND SUPPLIES AND TRAVEL. FUNDS WILL BE USED IN UPGRADING EMPLOYEE COMPENSATION ADDING ADDITIONAL TRANSIT OPERATORS AND CONTINUED SAFETY TRAINING AND OTHER TRAININGS AS AVAILABLE FOR ALL OPERATORS AND SUPPORT STAFF. REMAINING FUNDS WILL USED TO COVER FUEL COSTS OPERATIONAL SUPPLIES AND VEHICLE MAINTENANCE. THIS GRANT APPLIES FOR $120034 IN SECTION 5311 FUNDS FOR THE YAVAPAI-APACHE NATION TO SUPPORT COSTS SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES BENEFITS VEHICLE MAINTENANCE FUEL OPERATING SUPPLIES AND TRAVEL TO ANNUAL CONFERENCES. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES THAT WILL BE PERFORMED WILL BE A REVIEW OF CURRENT EMPLOYEE STATUS AND ADJUST SALARY BENEFITS AS NEEDED WHILE ADDING ADDITIONAL OPERATORS TO COVER EXPANDED SERVICES. ADDITIONAL ACTIVITY WILL BE THE SCHEDULING TRANSIT VEHICLES FOR ROUTINE MAINTENANCE SCHEDULING TRAINING FOR EMPLOYEES AND ENSURING ALL VEHICLES HAVE ADEQUATE SAFETY COVID-19 AND PASSENGER SERVICES SUPPLIES AN BOARD AT ALL TIMES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: OUTCOMES EXPECTED FROM THIS APPLICATION FUNDING WILL BE TO IMPROVE YAVAPAI-APACHE TRANSIT BY RETAINING AND ADDING EMPLOYEES ENSURE OPERATORS ARE PROPERLY TRAINED AND VEHICLES ARE SAFE TO OPERATE OVER THE EXPANDED RURAL ROUTES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: FIRST BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE MEMBERS OF THE YAVAPAI-APACHE NATION AND OTHER RESIDENTS OF THE RURAL VERDE VALLEY OF CENTRAL ARIZONA. YAVAPAI-APACHE NATION HAS SUCCESSFULLY OPERATED A PUBLIC TRANSIT SYSTEM LOCATED IN THE VERDE VALLEY OF CENTRAL ARIZONA. THE SYSTEM COVERS 3 TOWNS A RURAL AREAS ADJACENT TO YAVAPAI-APACHE NATION. YAVAPAI-APACHE TRANSIT COORDINATES WITH OTHER LOCAL TRANSIT SYSTEMS TO MAXIMIZE COVERAGE AND PROVIDE BEST POSSIBLE SERVICE TO TRANSIT USERS. FUNDING WILL ALLOW THESE SERVICES TO CONTINUE!SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONEOPERATING ASSISTANCE BREAKDOWN COST: SALARY $50000; BENEFITS $10034; FUEL $20000; MAINTENANCE $35000; TRAVEL/TRAINING $5000. THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST FY2021 SECTION 5311 TRIBAL FORMULA ARP ACT FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE PASCUA YAQUI TRIBE (PYT) ARIZONA IN THE AMOUNT OF $66425. THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT FOR $66425 IN SECTION 5311 ARP ACT FOR THE PASCUA YAQUI TRIBE IS TO PROVIDE OPERATING FUNDS FOR ITS CONTRACT WITH THE CITY OF TUCSON SUN TRAN BUS SERVICES IN THE GREATER TUCSON AREA FOR THE PERIOD OF JULY 1 2023 THROUGH DECEMBER 31 2023. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT CONTRACTED BUS SERVICES PROVIDED BY SUN TRAN FOR BUS ROUTE NUMBER 29 FROM CASINO DEL SOL THROUGH THE PASCUA PUEBLO TO DOWNTOWN TUCSON.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THIS TRANSIT SERVICE WILL BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 6000 TRIBAL COMMUNITY MEMBERS ON THE REMOTE RESERVATION OF THE PASCUA YAQUI TRIBE (MOST OF WHOM ARE LOW-INCOME) PROVIDING THEM ACCESS TO EMPLOYMENT MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS EDUCATIONAL TRAINING AND OTHER IMPORTANT MEETINGS AND TASKS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM WILL HELP THE TRIBES COMMUNITY MEMBER WHO ARE DEPENDENT ON PUBLIC ASSISTANCE. CURRENTLY THE FOOD STAMP RECIPIENT RATE FOR THE TRIBE IS 32.4% ALMOST THREE TIMES HIGHER THAN THE STATE OF ARIZONA AT 11.2%. IN ADDITION 43% OF TRIBAL MEMBERS LIVE BELOW 100% OF THE FEDERAL POVERTY LINE WHICH IS MORE THAN TWICE AS HIGH AS THE OVERALL POVERTY RATE FOR ARIZONA AT 16%. MOREOVER ALMOST 71% OF TRIBAL MEMBER LIVE BELOW 200% OF THE FEDERAL POVERTY LINE WHICH IS APPROXIMATELY THREE TIMES HIGHER THAN THE OVERALL POVERTY RATE FOR ARIZONA AT 24%. CONSEQUENTLY A LARGE PROPORTION OF THE TRIBES POPULATION HAS NO OTHER TRANSPORTATION SERVICE EXCEPT THE SUN TRAN BUS LINE TO GO TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS EMPLOYMENT EDUCATIONAL TRAINING OR OTHER IMPORTANT ERRANDS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:NONETHE PASCUA YAQUI TRIBE AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT FOR $64118 IN SECTION 5311 CARES ACT FOR THE PASCUA YAQUI TRIBE IS TO PROVIDE OPERATING FUNDS FOR ITS CONTRACT WITH THE CITY OF TUCSON SUN TRAN BUS SERVICES IN THE GREATER TUCSON AREA FOR THE PERIOD OF JANUARY 20 2020 THROUGH OCTOBER 30 2022. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT CONTRACTED BUS SERVICES PROVIDED BY SUN TRAN FOR BUS ROUTE NUMBER 29 FROM CASINO DEL SOL THROUGH THE PASCUA PUEBLO TO DOWNTOWN TUCSON.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THIS TRANSIT SERVICE WILL BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 6000 TRIBAL COMMUNITY MEMBERS ON THE REMOTE RESERVATION OF THE PASCUA YAQUI TRIBE (MOST OF WHOM ARE LOW-INCOME) PROVIDING THEM ACCESS TO EMPLOYMENT MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS EDUCATIONAL TRAINING AND OTHER IMPORTANT MEETINGS AND TASKS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM WILL HELP THE TRIBES COMMUNITY MEMBER WHO ARE DEPENDENT ON PUBLIC ASSISTANCE. CURRENTLY THE FOOD STAMP RECIPIENT RATE FOR THE TRIBE IS 32.4% ALMOST THREE TIMES HIGHER THAN THE STATE OF ARIZONA AT 11.2%. IN ADDITION 43% OF TRIBAL MEMBERS LIVE BELOW 100% OF THE FEDERAL POVERTY LINE WHICH IS MORE THAN TWICE AS HIGH AS THE OVERALL POVERTY RATE FOR ARIZONA AT 16%. MOREOVER ALMOST 71% OF TRIBAL MEMBER LIVE BELOW 200% OF THE FEDERAL POVERTY LINE WHICH IS APPROXIMATELY THREE TIMES HIGHER THAN THE OVERALL POVERTY RATE FOR ARIZONA AT 24%. CONSEQUENTLY A LARGE PROPORTION OF THE TRIBES POPULATION HAS NO OTHER TRANSPORTATION SERVICE EXCEPT THE SUN TRAN BUS LINE TO GO TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS EMPLOYMENT EDUCATIONAL TRAINING OR OTHER IMPORTANT ERRANDS.THE PASCUA YAQUI TRIBE AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING.FEDERAL FUND OPERATING ASSISTANCE FY 2020 5311 TRIBAL FORMULA CARES ACT FUNDS FROM THE PASCUA YAQUI TRIBE ARIZONA IN THE AMOUNT OF $64118 LOCAL MATCH: NO LOCAL MATCH/LOCAL SALES TAX TOTAL PROJECT COST: $64118

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST FY2020 SECTION 5311 TRIBAL FORMULA FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE SALT RIVER PIMA-MARICOPA INDIAN COMMUNITY ARIZONA IN THE AMOUNT OF $196867.FEDERAL FUNDS: FY 2020 5311 TRIBAL FORMULA OPERATING ASSISTANCE FROM THE SALT RIVER PIMA-MARICOPA INDIAN COMMUNITY ARIZONA IN THE AMOUNT OF $111867.LOCAL MATCH: $0 LOCAL MATCHTOTAL PROJECT COST: $111867FEDERAL FUNDS: FY 2020 5311 TRIBAL FORMULA CAPITAL FUNDS FOR THE PURCHASE OF A VEHICLE FOR THE SALT RIVER PIMA-MARICOPA INDIAN COMMUNITY ARIZONA IN THE AMOUNT OF $85000.LOCAL MATCH: $0 LOCAL MATCHTOTAL PROJECT COST: $85000PURPOSETHE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE OPERATING ASSISTANCE FUNDS FOR THE PERIOD OF JULY 1 2022 THROUGH JULY 1 2025. THE FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO PURCHASE A REPLACEMENT VEHICLE FOR A VEHICLE THAT HAS REACHED THE END OF ITS USEFUL LIFE.ACTIVITIESTHE AWARD WILL COVER OPERATING EXPENSES RELATED TO THE PROVISION OF PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICES SUCH AS SALARIES FUEL SUPPLIES ETC. ADDITIONALLY SRPMIC WILL PURCHASE A REPLACEMENT VEHICLE FOR A VEHICLE THAT HAS REACHED THE END OF ITS USEFUL LIFE.EXPECTED OUTCOMESTHIS FUNDING WILL ALLOW FOR THE CONTINUED OPERATION OF PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICES WITHIN THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY.INTENDED BENEFICIARIESTHE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE SRPMIC COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND GENERAL PUBLIC TRANSIT RIDERS WHO TRAVEL WITHIN THE SALT RIVER TRANSIT SERVICE AREA.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIESNONE.SRPMIC WILL ALSO PURCHASE A NEW REPLACEMENT VAN TO REPLACE A VAN - VEHICLE #20-0237 VIN #1FBZX2CM4FKA63469 A FRONTLINE 2015 FORD TRANSIT VAN WITH A CURRENT MILEAGE OF 147968 - THAT WILL HAVE REACHED THE END OF ITS USEFUL LIFE CYCLE. THE VAN WILL BE A 2024 GASOLINE POWERED TRANSIT WORKS - 8 PASSENGER VAN EQUIPPED WITH A WHEELCHAIR LIFT. THE VAN WILL BE EQUIPPED WITH A TWO-WAY RADIO GPS SYSTEM ROUTEMATCH DISPATCH SYSTEM EQUIPMENT AND VINYL BARRIER TO PREVENT THE SPREAD OF CORONAVIRUS. ONCE THE NEW VEHICLE IS PLACED INTO REVENUE SERVICE THE VEHICLE THAT IS BEING REPLACED WILL BE DISPOSED OF THROUGH AUCTION.

THIS APPLICATION REQUESTS FFY 2020 SECTION 5311 TRIBAL TRANSIT FORMULA FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE GILA RIVER INDIAN COMMUNITY STATE OF ARIZONA IN THE AMOUNT OF $237776. PURPOSETHE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE OPERATING ASSISTANCE FROM OCTOBER 1 2022 THROUGH SEPTEMBER 30 2024. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMEDREQUESTED SECTION 5311 TRIBAL TRANSIT FORMULA FUNDS WILL COVER OPERATING EXPENSES INCLUDING TRANSPORTATION MANAGER SALARY AND FRINGE (APPROX. $46763) DRIVER SALARIES AND FRINGE (APPROX. $144890); AND DISPATCH SUPERVISOR SALARY AND FRINGE (APPROX. $46123). BUDGET DETAIL BY SCOPE ITEM IS ESTIMATED BASED ON CURRENT STAFF COSTS WITH 3% ANNUAL ESCALATIONS FOR DIRECT LABOR RATES. FRINGE IS APPLIED BASED ON A THREE-YEAR AVERAGE. NOTE THAT A COMMUNITY COMPENSATION STUDY IS UNDERWAY WHICH MAY AFFECT ACTUAL LABOR COSTS. IT IS IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT ACTUAL STAFF AND FRINGE RATES WILL VARY FROM BUDGETED DEPENDING ON ACTUAL COSTS OF BENEFITS AND TRIBAL COMMUNITY COUNCIL POLICIES ON STAFF SALARY ADJUSTMENTS. EXPECTED OUTCOMESFUNDING WILL ALLOW THE CONTINUED OPERATION OF GILA RIVER TRANSIT. FUNDING WILL SUSTAIN CURRENT SERVICE AND ALLOW FOR INCREASED SERVICE HOURS AND OPERATING DAYS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIESINTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF THE GILA RIVER INDIAN COMMUNITY. THE GILA RIVER INDIAN COMMUNITY A FEDERALLY-RECOGNIZED TRIBE ESTABLISHED IN 1859 IS LOCATED IN SOUTH-CENTRAL ARIZONA BORDERING BOTH MARICOPA AND PINAL COUNTIES. WITH CLOSE TO 21300 ENROLLED MEMBERS THE COMMUNITY IS HOME TO TWO TRIBESTHE AKIMEL OODHAM AND PEE POSH. THE RESERVATION HAS A LAND AREA OF 584 SQUARE MILES AND A 2000 CENSUS POPULATION OF 11257. THE COMMUNITY INCLUDES SEVEN DISTRICTS ALONG THE GILA RIVER AND ITS LARGEST COMMUNITIES ARE SACATON KOMATKE SANTAN AND BLACKWATER. GILA RIVER TRANSIT OPERATES DEVIATED FIXED ROUTE PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICE FOR THE GILA RIVER INDIAN COMMUNITY. WE OPERATE FOUR ROUTES. SACATON SHUTTLE (SERVES DISTRICT 3) AND WEST END SHUTTLE (SERVES DISTRICTS 6 AND 7) STARTED IN 2016. THE EAST SIDE SHUTTLE (DISTRICTS 1 2 AND 3) AND THE CENTRAL SHUTTLE (DISTRICTS 3 4 AND 5) STARTED IN APRIL 2019.TRANSIT PROVIDE VITAL CONNECTIVITY WITHIN A TRIBAL COMMUNITY WHICH LIKE ALL RESERVATIONS HAS BEEN DISENFRANCHISED AND HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED BY PUBLIC INVESTMENT. GILA RIVER TRANSIT PROVIDES CONNECTIONS TO COMMUNITY DESTINATIONS SUCH AS THE GOVERNANCE CENTER HUHUKAM HOSPITAL AND OTHER MEDICAL FACILITIES RESIDENTIAL AND SHOPPING AREAS LIBRARY AND DISTRICT SERVICE CENTERS. NEARLY ALL GILA RIVER TRANSIT RIDERS ARE TRIBAL MEMBERS AND MANY ARE ELDERLY. MOST HAVE LIMITED ACCESS TO VEHICLES. AS PART OF A 2020 TRANSIT NEEDS STUDY ONBOARD SURVEYS WERE DISTRIBUTED AMONG ALL FOUR TRANSIT ROUTES. MOST WHO TOOK THE ONBOARD SURVEY USE TRANSIT (72%) OR WALK (22%) AS THEIR MAIN FORM OF TRANSPORTATION. MORE THAN 71% OF TRANSIT TRIPS ARE FOR MEDICAL PURPOSES; 36% ARE FOR SHOPPING AND ANOTHER 27% ARE FOR RECREATIONAL PURPOSES. NEARLY 43% USE TRANSIT THREE TO FIVE DAYS PER WEEK. OF THE 67 PEOPLE WHO RESPONDED WHEN ASKED 56 (84%) HAD ONE OR FEWER VEHICLES IN THEIR HOME WITH AN AVERAGE HOUSEHOLD SIZE OF 5.6 PERSONS. MOST RESPONDENTS EXPRESSED SUPPORT FOR SERVICE THAT IS MORE FREQUENT LONGER SERVICE HOURS AND ADDITIONAL STOPS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIESNONE.SCOPE 1: OPERATING FEDERAL FUNDS FFY 2020 SECTION 5311 TRIBAL TRANSIT FORMULA FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE GILA RIVER INDIAN COMMUNITY STATE OF ARIZONA IN THE AMOUNT OF $237776.LOCAL MATCH: NO LOCAL/TRIBAL SHARETOTAL PROJECT COST: $237776

NAVAJO TRANSIT SYSTEM (NTS) SUBMITS THIS GRANT APPLICATION FOR $945744 FY2021 TRIBAL FORMULA TRANSIT PROGRAM (TTP) FUNDS. START DATE WILL 08/17/2021 OR THE DATE OF GRANT EXECUTION AND THE PROPOSED END DATE WILL BE SEPTEMBER 30 2024. THE NAVAJO TRANSIT SYSTEM (NTS) WILL USE THESE TTP FUNDS TO FUND EXISTING TRIBAL TRANSIT SYSTEM OPERATIONS ($805244) AND CAPITAL PROJECT (PURCHASE SERVICE TRUCK ($100000) MISC SUPPORT EQUIPMENT ($30500) AND SHOP EQUIPMENT ($10000)).NAVAJO TRANSIT SYSTEM CURRENTLY OPERATES 16 BUS ROUTES ACROSS THE NAVAJO RESERVATION SERVING MOST MAJOR COMMUNITIES AND OPERATING ON MAJOR HIGHWAYS ON THE RESERVATION WITH PLANS TO EXPAND ITS ROUTE SERVICE. DUE TO THE VERY LARGE SIZE OF OUR SERVICE AREA WE EXCEED 700000 REVENUE MILES PER YEAR. THIS GRANT SHALL BE USED TO FUND OUR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO OUR CUSTOMER BASE. THE FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO PURCHASE A SERVICE TRUCK AS A NEW ASSET TO ASSIST WITH VEHICLE ISSUES/BREAKDOWNS. (2022 FORD F350 CREW CAB 4X4 DIESEL). DUE TO THE SERVICE AREA SIZE A SERVICE TRUCK IS NEEDED TO CARRY ALL NECESSARY SUPPLIES AND EQUIPMENT TO RESPOND TO VEHICLE MECHANICAL ISSUES AS QUICK AS POSSIBLE.THE NTS HAS A TRANSIT FACILITY IN FORT DEFIANCE AZ THAT WAS COMPLETED IN 2013 AND CONDUCTS ITS OPERATIONS OUT OF THIS FTA FUNDED FACILITY WITH ROUTES EXCEEDING 300 MILES PER DAY ONE WAY ACROSS THE NAVAJO RESERVATION. THE NTS IS A DEPARTMENT PROVIDING PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES UNDER THE NAVAJO NATION. THE NAVAJO NATION IS A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBE WITH A RESERVATION NEAR THE FOUR CORNERS REGION SPANNING ACROSS THREE STATES: ARIZONA UTAH AND NEW MEXICO. THE MAIN PART OF THE RESERVATION IS LOCATED IN NORTHEASTERN ARIZONA WITH PORTIONS IN SOUTHEASTERN UTAH AND NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO. THE NAVAJO RESERVATION IS OVER 27000 SQUARE MILES IN SIZE. THE ENORMOUS SIZE OF RESERVATION THAT IS THE SERVICE AREA FOR NTS PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE IS A DIFFICULTY IN TRYING TO PROVIDE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR MAJORITY OF ITS TRIBAL MEMBERS.THE AWARD OF THESE TTP FUNDS WILL GREATLY ASSIST THE NTS WITH CONTINUING TO PROVIDE QUALITY SERVICE TO VERY TRANSIT DEPENDENT COMMUNITIES.NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES APPLIED

THIS IS A FFY21 SECTION 5311-9B CRRSAA APPLICATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $933471 REPRESENTING 100% FEDERAL SHARE OF THE TOTAL ELIGIBLE AMOUNT. THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES CRSSAA FUNDING TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS. THIS GRANT APPLIES FOR $933471 IN CRRSAA FUNDING FOR THE NAVAJO NATION TO SUPPORT OPERATING COSTS OF THE RURAL AND INTERCITY TRANSIT PROVIDERS IDENTIFIED AS SUB-RECIPIENTS FOR THE PERIOD OF AWARD DATE THROUGH SEPTEMBER 30 2023.THE NTS IS PROVIDING PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES UNDER THE NAVAJO NATION - A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBE WITH A RESERVATION SPANNING OVER 27000 SQUARE MILES ACROSS THREE STATES: NORTHEASTERN ARIZONA SOUTHEASTERN UTAH AND NORTHWESTERN NEW MEXICO.THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES CRRSAA FUNDING TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS. THE NAVAJO TRANSIT SYSTEM INTENDS TO UTILIZE CRRSAA FUNDS FOR PAYROLL AND OPERATIONS OF PUBLIC TRANSIT. THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES A PROJECT FOR TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION AND ROUTE SERVICE OPERATIONS. NTS ADMINISTRATION SHALL CONTINUE TO MANAGE DAY-TO-DAY ADMINISTRATIVE MATTERS WHILE ADDRESSING CORONAVIRUS RELATED POLICY CHANGES BUSFARE/TICKETING PROCEDURES TRAINING MARKETING INSURANCE NEEDS AND PUBLIC EDUCATION. THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES $172315 IN FY2019 SECTION 5311 FUNDING TO BE USED FOR THE GENERAL OPERATING EXPENSES EQUIPMENT AND SUPPLIES RELATED TO TRIBAL TRANSIT SERVICES WHICH WILL HELP SUPPORT A NEW SHUTTLE SERVICE FROM THE COMMUNITY TO THE PHOENIX INDIAN MEDICAL CENTER (PIMC) IN PHOENIX. IN ADDITION TO SUPPORTING OUR EXISTING ROUTES THIS NEW ROUTE WILL SERVE THE COMMUNITY MEMBERS THAT UTILIZE PIMC FOR THEIR MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS DIALYSIS ETC. WE WILL ALSO USE THESE GRANT FUNDS TO PURCHASE AN ADDITIONAL VEHICLE FOR OUR FLEET. THE VAN THAT WILL BE PURCHASED IS A 2022 TRANSIT WORKS T150 WAGON. THE VEHICLE WILL BE SPECIFIED TO SEAT 8 PASSENGERS AND WILL BE EQUIPPED WITH A WHEELCHAIR LIFT. IT WILL BE GASOLINE POWERED. THIS VEHICLE WILL BE USED IN DEMAND RESPONSIVE TRANSIT SERVICE WITHIN THE SALT RIVER PIMA-MARICOPA INDIAN COMMUNITY AND THE SURROUNDING CITIES OF SCOTTSDALE MESA AND TEMPE. START DATE: 10/01/2021END DATE: 09/30/2024THE SALT RIVER PIMA-MARICOPA INDIAN COMMUNITY OPERATES THE SALT RIVER TRANSIT PROGRAM THROUGH ITS DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION. THE PROGRAM PROVIDES BOTH DEMAND RESPONSE AND FIXED ROUTE SERVICES IN WHICH TRANSIT PASSENGERS CALL AND SCHEDULE TRIPS TO SPECIFIC DESTINATIONS BOTH ON AND OFF THE COMMUNITY. THERE ARE CURRENTLY 6 ROUTES THAT PROVIDE DEMAND RESPONSE TRANSPORTATION AND ONE PROVIDING FIXED ROUTE SERVICE. PASSENGERS UTILIZE SALT RIVER TRANSIT FOR MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS EMPLOYMENT SCHOOL AS WELL AS SHOPPING AND LEISURE TRIPS. THE CURRENT ROUTES PROVIDE SERVICES TO SURROUNDING AREAS SUCH AS THE CITIES OF SCOTTSDALE MESA AND TEMPE. SERVICES ARE PROVIDED TO VARIOUS SCHOOLS INCLUDING SCOTTSDALE COMMUNITY COLLEGE LOCATED WITHIN THE COMMUNITY. ROUTES ALSO INCLUDE SERVICES TO VARIOUS SHOPPING PAVILIONS TWO AREA CASINOS AND ENTERTAINMENT VENUES. THE PROGRAM OPERATES FIVE (5) DAYS PER WEEK TWELVE (12) HOURS PER DAY AND CONSISTS OF NINE (9) VEHICLES AND TEN (10) EMPLOYEES.

NAVAJO TRANSIT SYSTEM (NTS) SUBMITS THIS GRANT APPLICATION FOR $930665 FY2018 TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM (TTP) FUNDS. START DATE WILL BE SET TO THE DATE OF GRANT AWARD AND THE PROPOSED END DATE WILL BE SEPTEMBER 30 2022. THE NAVAJO TRANSIT SYSTEM (NTS) WILL USE THESE TTP FUNDS TO FUND EXISTING TRIBAL TRANSIT SYSTEM OPERATIONS.THIS APPLICATION DOES NOT INCLUDE FUNDS FOR RESEARCH AND/OR DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES. INDIRECT COSTS WILL BE APPLIED TO THIS APPLICATION AND APPLY TO ONE OR MORE OF ITS ACTIVITIES CONTAINED WITHIN THE AWARD SCOPE OF WORK. NAVAJO TRANSIT SYSTEM CURRENTLY OPERATES 16 BUS ROUTES ACROSS THE NAVAJO RESERVATION SERVING MOST MAJOR COMMUNITIES AND OPERATING ON MAJOR HIGHWAYS ON THE RESERVATION. NTS ANNUAL RIDERSHIP OFTEN EXCEEDS 200000 RIDERS. DUE TO THE VERY LARGE SIZE OF OUR SERVICE AREA WE EXCEED 700000 REVENUE MILES PER YEAR. THIS GRANT SHALL BE USED TO FUND OUR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO OUR CUSTOMER BASE. THE NTS HAS A TRANSIT FACILITY IN FORT DEFIANCE AZ THAT WAS COMPLETED IN 2013 AND CONDUCTS ITS OPERATIONS OUT OF THIS FTA FUNDED FACILITY WITH ROUTES EXCEEDING 300 MILES PER DAY ONE WAY ACROSS THE NAVAJO RESERVATION. THE NTS IS A DEPARTMENT PROVIDING PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES UNDER THE NAVAJO NATION. THE NAVAJO NATION IS A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBE WITH A RESERVATION NEAR THE FOUR CORNERS REGION SPANNING ACROSS THREE STATES: ARIZONA UTAH AND NEW MEXICO. THE MAIN PART OF THE RESERVATION IS LOCATED IN NORTHEASTERN ARIZONA WITH PORTIONS IN SOUTHEASTERN UTAH AND NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO. THE NAVAJO RESERVATION IS OVER 27000 SQUARE MILES IN SIZE. THE ENORMOUS SIZE OF RESERVATION THAT IS THE SERVICE AREA FOR NTS PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE IS A DIFFICULTY IN TRYING TO PROVIDE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR MAJORITY OF ITS TRIBAL MEMBERS.THE AWARD OF THESE TTP FUNDS WILL GREATLY ASSIST THE NTS WITH CONTINUING TO PROVIDE QUALITY SERVICE TO VERY TRANSIT DEPENDENT COMMUNITIES.9/21/22 BUDGET REVISION: CURRENT GRANT EXPENDITURE RATE IS 57% AND NTS IS REQUESTING EXTENSION OF PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE FROM 9/30/22 TO 9/30/24.

THE HOPI TRIBE WILL USE $435700 IN FY 2017 AND $429446 IN FY 2018 TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM (TTP) FORMULA FUNDS TO ENHANCE AND TO ASSIST FUNDING PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION ON THE HOPI RESERVATION AND TO PROVIDE TRANSIT SERVICES TO SERVE THE GENERAL PUBLIC. THE TOTAL TTP FORMULA FUNDS REQUESTED IN THIS GRANT IS $865146. THIS PROJECT CONTAINS LAPSING FY 2017 FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $435700. HOPI SENOM TRANSIT PROVIDES THE HOPI RESERVATION AND SURROUNDING NON-TRIBAL AREAS WITH AFFORDABLE ACCESSIBLE AND RELIABLE RURAL TRANSPORTATION. THE HOPI TRIBE CURRENTLY OPERATES SERVICE IN AND AROUND THE HOPI RESERVATION IN ARIZONA. THE HOPI TRIBES SERVICE CONSISTS OF 5 ROUTES AND IS OPERATED 5 DAYS A WEEK (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY) COVERING A 12-13 HOUR SERVICE PERIOD. THE FY 2017/2018 TTP FORMULA FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION COSTS OPERATING AND MAINTENANCE COSTS OF EQUIPMENT AND FACILITIES TRAINING TRANSIT PLANNING ENHANCEMENT OF EXISTING SERVICES PURCHASE OF TRANSIT CAPITAL ITEMS AND OPERATING AND ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES INCLUDING SALARIES.INDIRECT COST RATE DETAILS: THE NEGOTIATED INDIRECT COST RATE OF 30.05% WILL BE APPLIED TO THIS AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $259977. THE IDC IS BASED ON BUDGET ESTIMATES FOR ALL PROGRAMS TO BE ADMINISTERED BY THE HOPI TRIBE DURING THE PERIOD JANUARY 1 2019 THROUGH DECEMBER 31 2019. THE RATE WAS NEGOTIATED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR INTERIOR BUSINESS CENTER AND THE HOPI TRIBE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE AUTHORITY CONTAINED IN APPLICABLE REGULATIONS.THE START DATE WILL BE SET TO THE DATE OF THE AWARD THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE END DATE IS DECEMBER 31 2021.

NAVAJO TRANSIT SYSTEM (NTS) SUBMITS THIS GRANT APPLICATION FOR $990191 IN LAPSING FY2017 TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM (TTP) FUNDS. START DATE WILL BE SET TO THE DATE OF GRANT AWARD AND THE PROPOSED END DATE WILL BE SEPTEMBER 30 2022. THE NAVAJO TRANSIT SYSTEM (NTS) WILL USE THESE TTP FUNDS TO FUND EXISTING TRIBAL TRANSIT SYSTEM OPERATIONS AND TO PURCHASE THREE REPLACEMENT BUSES. THIS APPLICATION DOES NOT INCLUDE FUNDS FOR RESEARCH AND/OR DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES. INDIRECT COSTS WILL BE APPLIED TO THIS APPLICATION AND APPLY TO ONE OR MORE OF ITS ACTIVITIES CONTAINED WITHIN THE AWARD SCOPE OF WORK. NAVAJO TRANSIT SYSTEM CURRENTLY OPERATES 16 BUS ROUTES ACROSS THE NAVAJO RESERVATION SERVING MOST MAJOR COMMUNITIES AND OPERATING ON MAJOR HIGHWAYS ON THE RESERVATION. NTS ANNUAL RIDERSHIP OFTEN EXCEEDS 200000 RIDERS. DUE TO THE VERY LARGE SIZE OF OUR SERVICE AREA WE EXCEED 700000 REVENUE MILES PER YEAR. THIS GRANT SHALL BE USED TO FUND OUR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO OUR CUSTOMER BASE. THE OTHER PART OF THIS GRANT SPECIFICALLY $525000 SHALL BE USED TO PURCHASE THREE 35-40 FOOT DIESEL OPERATED BUSES FOR USE ON OUR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION ROUTES. THESE NEW BUSES WILL REPLACE THE FOLLOWING FLEET: RVI ID# BUS 3059 2011 YEAR WITH MILEAGE OF 191068 BUS 3060 2011 YEAR WITH MILEAGE OF 151268 AND BUS 3049 2007 YEAR WITH MILEAGE 409500. THESE NEW BUSES WILL BE 35-40 FOOT CUTAWAYS UNDER USEFUL LIFE CATEGORY OF 5 YEARS/300000 MILES.THE NTS HAS A TRANSIT FACILITY IN FORT DEFIANCE AZ THAT WAS COMPLETED IN 2013 AND CONDUCTS ITS OPERATIONS OUT OF THIS FTA FUNDED FACILITY WITH ROUTES EXCEEDING 300 MILES PER DAY ONE WAY ACROSS THE NAVAJO RESERVATION. THE NTS IS A DEPARTMENT PROVIDING PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES UNDER THE NAVAJO NATION. THE NAVAJO NATION IS A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBE WITH A RESERVATION NEAR THE FOUR CORNERS REGION SPANNING ACROSS THREE STATES: ARIZONA UTAH AND NEW MEXICO. THE MAIN PART OF THE RESERVATION IS LOCATED IN NORTHEASTERN ARIZONA WITH PORTIONS IN SOUTHEASTERN UTAH AND NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO. THE NAVAJO RESERVATION IS OVER 27000 SQUARE MILES IN SIZE. THE ENORMOUS SIZE OF RESERVATION THAT IS THE SERVICE AREA FOR NTS PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE IS A DIFFICULTY IN TRYING TO PROVIDE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR MAJORITY OF ITS TRIBAL MEMBERS.THE AWARD OF THESE TTP FUNDS WILL GREATLY ASSIST THE NTS WITH CONTINUING TO PROVIDE QUALITY SERVICE TO VERY TRANSIT DEPENDENT COMMUNITIES.9/22/22 BUDGET REVISION TO EXTEND PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE END DATE FROM 9/30/22 TO 9/30/24. GRANT CURRENTLY HAS 94% EXPENDITURE RATE. THE REASON FOR THIS REQUEST FOR EXTENSION IS DUE TO ON-GOING PANDEMIC RELATED ISSUED LIMITED TRIBAL OPERATIONS AND DELAYS IN PROCESSING FY22 CERTIFICATIONS AND ASSURANCES IN TRAMS. A BUDGET AMENDMENT WILL BE FORTHCOMING TO REVISE SOME OF THE ALI SCOPES TO PREPARE FOR FINAL EXPENDITURES OF THIS GRANT.
