THE SALT RIVER PIMA-MARICOPA INDIAN COMMUNITY (SRPMIC) IS REQUESTING $179301 IN FY2017 AND $174374 IN FY2018 SECTION 511 - TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM FORMULA FUNDING FOR A TOTAL OF $353675.00.START DATE: 12/1/2018END DATE: 9/30/2021THE SALT RIVER PIMA-MARICOPA INDIAN COMMUNITY OPERATES THE SALT RIVER TRANSIT PROGRAM THROUGH ITS DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION. THE PROGRAM PROVIDES DEMAND/RESPONSE SERVICES IN WHICH TRANSIT PASSENGERS CALL AND SCHEDULE TRIPS TO SPECIFIC DESTINATIONS BOTH ON AND OFF THE RESERVATION. THERE ARE CURRENTLY 6 ROUTES THAT PROVIDE DEMAND/RESPONSE SERVICES AND IN 2018 SALT RIVER TRANSIT IS IMPLEMENTING ONE FIXED ROUTE AS A PILOT PROGRAM. PASSENGERS UTILIZE SALT RIVER TRANSIT FOR MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS EMPLOYMENT SCHOOL SHOPPING AND LEISURE. THE CURRENT ROUTES PROVIDE SERVICES TO SURROUNDING AREAS SUCH AS THE CITIES OF SCOTTSDALE MESA AND TEMPE. SERVICES ARE PROVIDED TO VARIOUS SCHOOLS INCLUDING SCOTTSDALE COMMUNITY COLLEGE LOCATED ON THE RESERVATION. ROUTES ALSO INCLUDE SERVICES TO VARIOUS SHOPPING PAVILIONS TWO AREA CASINOS AND ENTERTAINMENT VENUES. THE PROGRAM OPERATES FIVE (5) DAYS A WEEK TWELVE (12) HOURS PER DAY AND CONSISTS OF EIGHT (8) VEHICLES AND NINE (9) EMPLOYEES. IN FY 2018 SALT RIVER TRANSIT WAS AWARDED $50000 IN ARIZONA STATE TRANSIT FUNDS FOR PLANNING WHICH WILL ALLOW THE PROGRAM TO HIRE A CONSULTANT TO REVIEW THE CURRENT PROCESSES PROCEDURES AND ROUTES OPERATED WITHIN THE COMMUNITY. AT THE CONCLUSION OF THIS PLANNING PROCESS THE COMMUNITY ANTICIPATES RECEIVING A SET OF RECOMMENDATIONS FOR EFFICIENCIES IMPROVEMENTS AND POSSIBLE ROUTE CHANGES TO BETTER MEET THE TRANSIT NEEDS OF COMMUNITY PASSENGERS.IN ADDITION SALT RIVER TRANSIT IS REVIEWING VARIOUS ROUTING SOFTWARE WHICH WHEN IMPLEMENTED WILL PROVIDE ADMINISTRATIVE EFFICIENCIES IN TRANSIT ROUTING WHILE ENHANCING SERVICES TO TRANSIT PASSENGERS. TRANSIT PASSENGERS WILL HAVE THE USE OF AN APP TO SCHEDULE RIDES DETERMINE ESTIMATED TIMES OF ARRIVAL AND DEPARTURES AND ADDITIONAL DIGITAL FEATURES TO PROVIDE ADDED CONVENIENCE.CURRENTLY THE TRANSIT AND FLEET MANAGER OVERSEES BOTH SALT RIVER TRANSIT OPERATIONS AND FLEET SERVICES FOR ALL SRPMIC VEHICLES. AS THE TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM CONTINUES TO GROW AND CHANGE SRPMIC WOULD LIKE TO UTILIZE THE ABOVE MENTIONED FUNDS TO HIRE A SEPARATE TRANSIT MANAGER ALLOWING THE FLEET MANAGER TO FOCUS SOLELY ON FLEET SERVICES. A NEW TRANSIT MANAGER POSITION WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR OVERSEEING THE OVERALL DAY TO DAY OPERATIONS OF THE TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM INCLUDING EVALUATING THE RESULTS OF THE FIXED ROUTE PILOT PROJECT OVERSEEING THE CONSULTANT PLANNING PROCESS AND IMPLEMENTING RECOMMENDATIONS ASSIST IN THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE NEW ROUTING SOFTWARE AND ADMINISTERING ALL FUNDING SOURCES (GENERAL FUNDS AND GRANTS) FOR THE PROGRAM.A DEDICATED POSITION TO THE TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM WILL BE ABLE TO SOLELY FOCUS ON GRANT REQUIREMENTS REPORTING POLICIES AND PROCEDURES PROCESS IMPROVEMENT EVALUATING EFFICIENCIES EMPLOYEE MANAGEMENT TRANSIT FLEET MANAGEMENT AND WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE SUCCESS AND IMPROVEMENT OF THE SALT RIVER TRIBAL TRANSIT PROGRAM.THIS APPLICATION DOES NOT INCLUDE FUNDS FOR RESEARCH AND/OR DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES.THIS APPLICATION DOES NOT INCLUDE INDIRECT COSTS TO BE APPLIED TO THIS GRANT.

PUBLIC TRANSIT PASSENGERS:PASSENGERS WILL RECEIVE A SANITARY AND SAFE TRAVEL EXPERIENCE THROUGH ENHANCED QUALITY SERVICE FROM TRAINED DRIVERS NURSES ON SOME MEDICAL TRIPS AND IMPROVED SERVICE. PUBLIC TRANSIT AGENCIESAGENCIES WILL RECEIVE FACILITY INSPECTIONS AND ENHANCEMENTS. AGENCIES WILL ALSO RECEIVE ILLUMINOMETERS/TEST KITS SANITATION MISTERS AND SUPPLIES. THIS WILL ENSURE A MEASURABLE STANDARD OF CLEAN TO PROMOTE RIDERSHIP AND A SAFE WORK ENVIRONMENT. AGENCIES WILL ALSO RECEIVE CATALYTIC CONVERTER PROTECTORS AND ENHANCED SECURITY EQUIPMENT TO PROTECT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENTCOUNTIES THAT LACK SERVICES:NOT EVERY COUNTY IN ALABAMA HAS TRANSIT SERVICES. COALITIONS TO MEET WITH COUNTY OFFICIALS AND COMMUNITY LEADERS TO DEFINE THE PROCESS AND EVOKEPARTNERSHIPS TO CREATE SERVICES WHERE THERE ARE NONE.ALABAMA COMMUNITY COLLEGE SYSTEM ACCSACCS WILL RECEIVE FACILITY ENHANCEMENTS AS WELL AS EDUCATION AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THIS WILL BE A PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN SEVERAL SUBRECIPIENTS. THE UNIVERSITY OF ALABAMA HUNTSVILLE WILL BE THE LEAD ON THE PROJECT WITH DIRECT OVERSITE FROM THE ALABAMA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (ALDOT). SOME 5307 URBAN AND SEVERAL 5311 AGENCIES WILL ALSO BE INVOLVED WITH PERTINENT ISSUES WHEN RELEVANT.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE STATE OF ALABAMA AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS INTERCITY OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO ASSIST THE STATE AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS IN RECOVERING FROM COVID-19 DURING FY2022. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES FUEL ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE-YEAR PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ETC. IN ORDER TO CONTINUE TRANSIT INTERCITY OPERATIONS. FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED FOR STATE ADMINISTRATION ACTIVITIES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: CONTINUED SAFE AND EFFECTIVE INTERCITY OPERATION OF TRANSIT SERVICES FOR RURAL AREAS OF ALABAMA. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ALABAMA STATE TRANSIT AGENCIES AND CITIZENS IN THE RURAL AND NON-URBANIZED AREAS OF THE STATE. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE FOLLOWING TWO SUBRECIPIENTS AS PROVIDERS OF INTERCITY BUS OPERATIONS: GREYHOUND LINES AND WEST ALABAMA HEALTH SERVICES WILL RECEIVE ARP FUNDS FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE.
